9dceb9a63d5292cbfd2713fb2f774a1f18bd89e9.title: USN-2810-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
9dceb9a63d5292cbfd2713fb2f774a1f18bd89e9.body: It was discovered that the Kerberos kpasswd service incorrectly handledcertain UDP packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue tocause resource consumption, resulting in a denial of service. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2002-2443)

218d596fe02eadc2748676c9ec1ca82777d17cfd.title: USN-740-1: NSS vulnerability
218d596fe02eadc2748676c9ec1ca82777d17cfd.body: The MD5 algorithm is known not to be collision resistant. This updateblacklists the proof of concept rogue certificate authority as discussedin.

aa226ffa3a359fcf283265945f8868260b6a602b.title: USN-508-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
aa226ffa3a359fcf283265945f8868260b6a602b.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in the Moxa serial driver. Localattackers could execute arbitrary code and gain root privileges.(CVE-2005-0504)

3bf6b82838cdd4cbf7307a89b5700877a96675f3.title: USN-190-1: SNMP vulnerability
3bf6b82838cdd4cbf7307a89b5700877a96675f3.body: A remote Denial of Service has been discovered in the SMNP (SimpleNetwork Management Protocol) library. If a SNMP agent uses TCP socketsfor communication, a malicious SNMP server could exploit this to crashthe agent. Please note that by default SNMP uses UDP sockets.

b1cdeeefdfa541f7c50ca0a3baafda58ab82fa2c.title: USN-178-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b1cdeeefdfa541f7c50ca0a3baafda58ab82fa2c.body: Al Viro discovered a vulnerability in the raw_sendmsg() function. By calling this function with specially crafted arguments, a local attacker could either read kernel memory contents (leading to information disclosure) or manipulate the hardware state by reading certain IO ports. This vulnerability only affects Ubuntu 5.04.

76b8d5ec1263a53827471b565ce4b8961b3b0577.title: USN-182-1: X server vulnerability
76b8d5ec1263a53827471b565ce4b8961b3b0577.body: A local privilege escalation vulnerability has been discovered in thepixmap allocation handling of the X server. By allocating a hugepixmap, a local user could trigger an integer overflow that resultedin a memory allocation that was too small for the requested pixmap.This resulted in a buffer overflow which could eventually be exploitedto execute arbitrary code with full root privileges.

26e0e89745c450166815442fd63ca9a48b8be16e.title: USN-179-1: openssl weak default configuration
26e0e89745c450166815442fd63ca9a48b8be16e.body: The current default algorithm for creating "message digests"(electronic signatures) for certificates created by openssl is MD5.However, this algorithm is not deemed secure any more, and somepractical attacks have been demonstrated which could allow an attackerto forge certificates with a valid certification authority signatureeven if he does not know the secret CA signing key.Therefore all Ubuntu versions of openssl have now been changed to useSHA-1 by default. This is a more appropriate default algorithm forthe majority of use cases; however, if you still want to use MD5 asdefault, you can revert this change by changing the two instances of"default_md = sha1" to "default_md = md5" in /etc/ssl/openssl.cnf.A detailed explanation and further links can be found athttp://www.cits.rub.de/MD5Collisions/

c0aa8baca4a8885ddbe99d583d895b5c8c4b3a24.title: USN-216-1: GDK vulnerabilities
c0aa8baca4a8885ddbe99d583d895b5c8c4b3a24.body: Additionally, specially crafted XPM images could cause an endless loopin the image loader, which could be exploited to cause applicationstrying to open that image to hang. (CVE-2005-2975)

48e39669fd812213073ae1bf2585869620fe2fa4.title: USN-216-1: GDK vulnerabilities
48e39669fd812213073ae1bf2585869620fe2fa4.body: Two integer overflows have been discovered in the XPM image loader ofthe GDK pixbuf library. By tricking an user into opening a speciallycrafted XPM image with any Gnome desktop application that uses thislibrary, this could be exploited to execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user running the application.

935fb59132070ae7a9eba79fab11183b5478a714.title: USN-199-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
935fb59132070ae7a9eba79fab11183b5478a714.body: The HFS and HFS+ file system drivers did not properly verify that the file system that was attempted to be mounted really was HFS/HFS+. On machines which allow users to mount arbitrary removable devices as HFS or HFS+ with an /etc/fstab entry, this could be exploited to trigger a kernel crash.

7ae6f1eb555ce90aafbf0e83432a237ccfb74e1a.title: USN-336-1: binutils vulnerability
7ae6f1eb555ce90aafbf0e83432a237ccfb74e1a.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in gas (the GNU assembler). Bytricking an user or automated system (like a compile farm) intoassembling a specially crafted source file with gcc or gas, this couldbe exploited to execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

22d3c6caaec4e936a104c4574a0d38516fbb68f0.title: USN-456-1: net-snmp vulnerability
22d3c6caaec4e936a104c4574a0d38516fbb68f0.body: The SNMP service did not correctly handle TCP disconnects. Remotesubagents could cause a denial of service if they dropped a connectionat a specific time.

678b3150ab5db94becb3ed6265358d28ad4a1e12.title: USN-200-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
678b3150ab5db94becb3ed6265358d28ad4a1e12.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in the XBM image handler. By trickingan user into opening a specially crafted XBM image, an attacker couldexploit this to execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CAN-2005-2701)Mats Palmgren discovered a buffer overflow in the Unicode stringparser. Unicode strings that contained "zero-width non-joiner"characters caused a browser crash, which could possibly even exploitedto execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CAN-2005-2702)Georgi Guninski reported an integer overflow in the JavaScript engine.This could be exploited to run arbitrary code under some conditions.(CAN-2005-2705)Peter Zelezny discovered that URLs which are passed to Thunderbird on thecommand line are not correctly protected against interpretation by the shell.If Thunderbird is configured as the default handler for "mailto:" URLs, thiscould be exploited to execute arbitrary code with user privileges by trickingthe user into clicking on a specially crafted URL (for example, in an email orchat client). (CAN-2005-2968)This update also fixes some less critical issues which are describedat http://www.mozilla.org/security/announce/mfsa2005-58.html.(CAN-2005-2703, CAN-2005-2704, CAN-2005-2706, CAN-2005-2707)The "enigmail" plugin has been updated to work with the newThunderbird and Mozilla versions.

9f4524f203c6a36b39a0ec8a55ba844cc0a7fafd.title: USN-199-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9f4524f203c6a36b39a0ec8a55ba844cc0a7fafd.body: A Denial of Service vulnerability was discovered in thesys_set_mempolicy() function. By calling the function with a negativefirst argument, a local attacker could cause a kernel crash.(CAN-2005-3053)A race condition was discovered in the handling of shared memorymappings with CLONE_VM. A local attacker could exploit this to cause adeadlock (Denial of Service) by triggering a core dump while waitingfor a thread which had just performed an exec() system call.(CAN-2005-3106)A race condition was found in the handling of traced processes. Whenone thread was tracing another thread that shared the same memory map,a local attacker could trigger a deadlock (Denial of Service) byforcing a core dump when the traced thread was in the TASK_TRACEDstate. (CAN-2005-3107)A vulnerability has been found in the "ioremap" module. By performingcertain IO mapping operations, a local attacker could either readmemory pages he has not normally access to (information leak) or causea kernel crash (Denial of Service). This only affects the amd64platform. (CAN-2005-3108)The HFS and HFS+ file system drivers did not properly verify that thefile system that was attempted to be mounted really was HFS/HFS+. Onmachines which allow users to mount arbitrary removable devices as HFSor HFS+ with an /etc/fstab entry, this could be exploited to trigger akernel crash. (CAN-2005-3109)Steve Herrel discovered a race condition in the "ebtables" netfiltermodule. A remote attacker could exploit this by sending speciallycrafted packets that caused a value to be modified after it hadbeen read but before it had been locked. This eventually lead to akernel crash. This only affects multiprocessor machines (SMP).(CAN-2005-3110)Robert Derr discovered a memory leak in the system call auditing code.On a kernel which has the CONFIG_AUDITSYSCALL option enabled, thisleads to memory exhaustion and eventually a Denial of Service. A localattacker could also speed this up by excessively calling system calls.This only affects customized kernels built from the kernel sourcepackages. The standard Ubuntu kernel does not have theCONFIG_AUDITSYSCALL option enabled, and is therefore not affected bythis.(http://kernel.org/git/?p=linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux-2.6.git;a=commitdiff;h=829841146878e082613a49581ae252c071057c23)

0d169660db3d86c7f5fe47adcf17770ba66142e7.title: USN-302-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
0d169660db3d86c7f5fe47adcf17770ba66142e7.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the do_replace() function. Alocal user process with the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability could exploitthis to execute arbitrary commands with full root privileges.However, none of Ubuntu's supported packages use this capability withany non-root user, so this only affects you if you use some thirdparty software like the OpenVZ virtualization system. (CVE-2006-0038)

e3d046f5e9d95b241b5202d46ad4f401b4db098f.title: USN-249-1: xpdf/poppler/kpdf vulnerabilities
e3d046f5e9d95b241b5202d46ad4f401b4db098f.body: The splash image handler in xpdf did not check the validity ofcoordinates. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafted PDFfile, an attacker could exploit this to trigger a buffer overflowwhich could lead to arbitrary code execution with the privileges ofthe user.The poppler library and kpdf also contain xpdf code, and thus areaffected by the same vulnerability.

9529bec949d713af7556193c07699c0b5953e928.title: USN-250-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
9529bec949d713af7556193c07699c0b5953e928.body: Herbert Xu discovered a remote Denial of Service vulnerability in theICMP packet handler. In some situations a memory allocation wasreleased twice, which led to memory corruption. A remote attackercould exploit this to crash the machine.

d4a197b1cb22590da835e84b6bb47eccae287f37.title: USN-302-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d4a197b1cb22590da835e84b6bb47eccae287f37.body: On EMT64 CPUs, the kernel did not properly handle uncanonical returnaddresses. A local user could exploit this to trigger a kernel crash.(CVE-2006-0744)

723ccf2b499736d4365ac2b980867ebbb16974c9.title: USN-320-1: PHP vulnerabilities
723ccf2b499736d4365ac2b980867ebbb16974c9.body: The phpinfo() PHP function did not properly sanitize long strings. Aremote attacker could use this to perform cross-site scripting attacksagainst sites that have publicly-available PHP scripts that callphpinfo(). Please note that it is not recommended to publicly exposephpinfo(). (CVE-2006-0996)

f1b455995ddd24777a0d448a513adcb08051f33a.title: USN-302-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f1b455995ddd24777a0d448a513adcb08051f33a.body: Jan Beulich discovered an information leak in the handling ofregisters for the numeric coprocessor when running on AMD processors.This allowed processes to see the coprocessor execution state ofother processes, which could reveal sensitive data in the case ofcryptographic computations. (CVE-2006-1056)

b34b139f3b59232c362d3c20cd407c3c14e90193.title: USN-302-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b34b139f3b59232c362d3c20cd407c3c14e90193.body: Marcel Holtmann discovered that the sys_add_key() did not check thata new user key is added to a proper keyring. By attempting to add akey to a normal user key (which is not a keyring), a local attackercould exploit this to crash the kernel. (CVE-2006-1522)

9e7aeae760adf36ee9ea009f0cd7b8cde261a76e.title: USN-302-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9e7aeae760adf36ee9ea009f0cd7b8cde261a76e.body: The SCSI I/O driver did not correctly handle the VM_IO flag for memorymapped pages used for data transfer. A local user could exploit thisto cause a kernel crash. (CVE-2006-1528)

e0ff223fd53b70830a5affe4d11cec66cbf3fc0d.title: USN-302-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e0ff223fd53b70830a5affe4d11cec66cbf3fc0d.body: The SCTP driver did not properly verify certain parameters whenreceiving a HB-ACK chunk. By sending a specially crafted packet to anSCTP socket, a remote attacker could exploit this to trigger a bufferoverflow, which could lead to a crash or possibly even arbitrary codeexecution. (CVE-2006-1857)

595c603e372ef4f17728941770a27cd8dd2ae42d.title: USN-302-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
595c603e372ef4f17728941770a27cd8dd2ae42d.body: The sctp_walk_params() function in the SCTP driver incorrectly usedrounded values for bounds checking instead of the precise values. Bysending a specially crafted packet to an SCTP socket, a remoteattacker could exploit this to crash the kernel. (CVE-2006-1858)

e9df0eaa5cb12ba0f22b73931b7b811f30113dac.title: USN-320-1: PHP vulnerabilities
e9df0eaa5cb12ba0f22b73931b7b811f30113dac.body: The substr_compare() function did not sufficiently check the validityof the 'offset' argument. A script which passes untrusted user-definedvalues to this parameter could be exploited to crash the PHPinterpreter. (CVE-2006-1991)

5778c5ef8cc098d735dbc3481aa786e7402b090b.title: USN-313-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
5778c5ef8cc098d735dbc3481aa786e7402b090b.body: It was possible to embed Basic macros in documents in a way thatOpenOffice.org would not ask for confirmation about executing them. Bytricking a user into opening a malicious document, this could beexploited to run arbitrary Basic code (including local file access andmodification) with the user's privileges. (CVE-2006-2198)

aea793ae8239342fba1e53efffb101254910575f.title: USN-313-2: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
aea793ae8239342fba1e53efffb101254910575f.body: It was possible to embed Basic macros in documents in a way that OpenOffice.org would not ask for confirmation about executing them. By tricking a user into opening a malicious document, this could be exploited to run arbitrary Basic code (including local file access and modification) with the user's privileges. (CVE-2006-2198)

5153a78631f3b651e3d2269b05c7287c74f84b22.title: USN-309-1: libmms vulnerability
5153a78631f3b651e3d2269b05c7287c74f84b22.body: Several buffer overflows were found in libmms. By tricking a user intoopening a specially crafted remote multimedia stream with anapplication using libmms, a remote attacker could overwrite anarbitrary memory portion with zeros, thereby crashing the program.In Ubuntu 5.10, this affects the GStreamer MMS plugin(gstreamer0.8-mms). Other Ubuntu releases do not support this library.

47c7194be9afa96440dd0accf78af5e4b233758d.title: USN-315-1: libmms, xine-lib vulnerabilities
47c7194be9afa96440dd0accf78af5e4b233758d.body: Matthias Hopf discovered several buffer overflows in libmms. Bytricking a user into opening a specially crafted remote multimediastream with an application using libmms, a remote attacker couldexploit this to execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.The Xine library contains an embedded copy of libmms, and thus needsthe same security update.

a451331cfd165835cf2b605dc3465fb8c60eab26.title: USN-311-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a451331cfd165835cf2b605dc3465fb8c60eab26.body: A design flaw was discovered in the prctl(PR_SET_DUMPABLE, ...) systemcall, which allowed a local user to have core dumps created in adirectory he could not normally write to. This could be exploited todrain available disk space on system partitions, or, under somecircumstances, to execute arbitrary code with full root privileges.This flaw only affects Ubuntu 6.06 LTS. (CVE-2006-2451)

23001110ab407ee8d256b1fa3e2cc1fbdca18119.title: USN-361-1: Mozilla vulnerabilities
23001110ab407ee8d256b1fa3e2cc1fbdca18119.body: Various flaws have been reported that allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user into openinga malicious URL. (CVE-2006-2788, CVE-2006-3805, CVE-2006-3806,CVE-2006-3807, CVE-2006-3809, CVE-2006-3811, CVE-2006-4565,CVE-2006-4568, CVE-2006-4571)

4ea1ee1a7ebfe17f9ced5a31953b8dc940c825cb.title: USN-536-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
4ea1ee1a7ebfe17f9ced5a31953b8dc940c825cb.body: Flaws were discovered in the file upload form control. By trickinga user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could forcearbitrary files from the user's computer to be uploaded without theirconsent. (CVE-2006-2894, CVE-2007-3511)

dc5c7091383ba4e5feea5167d9c09619ad775c17.title: USN-331-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
dc5c7091383ba4e5feea5167d9c09619ad775c17.body: A Denial of service vulnerability was reported in iptables' SCTPconntrack module. On computers which use this iptables module, aremote attacker could expoit this to trigger a kernel crash.(CVE-2006-2934)

2bc602b89c328bee2c5e0007ce7b404b14419f93.title: USN-346-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
2bc602b89c328bee2c5e0007ce7b404b14419f93.body: A Denial of service vulnerability was reported in iptables' SCTPconntrack module. On computers which use this iptables module, aremote attacker could expoit this to trigger a kernel crash.(CVE-2006-2934)

848c7699662af540e868886a721bbe0d24bd91a0.title: USN-331-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
848c7699662af540e868886a721bbe0d24bd91a0.body: The ftdi_sio driver for serial USB ports did not limit the amount ofpending data to be written. A local user could exploit this to drainall available kernel memory and thus render the system unusable.(CVE-2006-2936)

9d3a7616ca2b78022855dfc09a57327ee3660854.title: USN-346-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9d3a7616ca2b78022855dfc09a57327ee3660854.body: The ftdi_sio driver for serial USB ports did not limit the amount ofpending data to be written. A local user could exploit this to drainall available kernel memory and thus render the system unusable.(CVE-2006-2936)

0f395680e34fd3bd74c99ee6b17b134fa91b7ffd.title: USN-353-1: openssl vulnerabilities
0f395680e34fd3bd74c99ee6b17b134fa91b7ffd.body: Dr. Henson of the OpenSSL core team and Open Network Securitydiscovered a mishandled error condition in the ASN.1 parser. Bysending specially crafted packet data, a remote attacker could exploitthis to trigger an infinite loop, which would render the serviceunusable and consume all available system memory. (CVE-2006-2937)

bb357213635dae5e80d0db217f625587d3537629.title: USN-353-1: openssl vulnerabilities
bb357213635dae5e80d0db217f625587d3537629.body: Certain types of public key could take disproportionate amounts oftime to process. The library now limits the maximum key exponent sizeto avoid Denial of Service attacks. (CVE-2006-2940)

75fa5e54b54d0240f0ee3849a58d5fcd40ba3f2a.title: USN-353-2: OpenSSL vulnerability
75fa5e54b54d0240f0ee3849a58d5fcd40ba3f2a.body: USN-353-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in OpenSSL. However, Mark JCox noticed that the applied patch for CVE-2006-2940 was flawed. Thisupdate corrects that patch.

1384f6fb691db98287f6312bb68d2ece987cb002.title: USN-320-1: PHP vulnerabilities
1384f6fb691db98287f6312bb68d2ece987cb002.body: This update also fixes various bugs which allowed local scriptsto bypass open_basedir and 'safe mode' restrictions by passing specialarguments to tempnam() (CVE-2006-1494, CVE-2006-2660), copy()(CVE-2006-1608), the curl module (CVE-2006-2563), or error_log()(CVE-2006-3011).

83159473aa1d257676881a53af1fc39bb9a347be.title: USN-334-1: krb5 vulnerabilities
83159473aa1d257676881a53af1fc39bb9a347be.body: Michael Calmer and Marcus Meissner discovered that several krb5 toolsdid not check the return values from setuid() system calls. On systemsthat have configured user process limits, it may be possible for anattacker to cause setuid() to fail via resource starvation. In thatsituation, the tools will not reduce their privilege levels, and willcontinue operation as the root user.By default, Ubuntu does not ship with user process limits.Please note that these packages are not officially supported by Ubuntu(they are in the 'universe' component of the archive).

8e894a8d08b879ab92ca0f968c177f9d3b2fd39b.title: USN-313-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
8e894a8d08b879ab92ca0f968c177f9d3b2fd39b.body: A buffer overflow has been found in the XML parser. By tricking a userinto opening a specially crafted XML file with OpenOffice.org, thiscould be exploited to execute arbitrary code with the user'sprivileges. (CVE-2006-3117)

de18a703711df537dff80c48d0a6009aaf3cc697.title: USN-313-2: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
de18a703711df537dff80c48d0a6009aaf3cc697.body: A buffer overflow has been found in the XML parser. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafted XML file with OpenOffice.org, this could be exploited to execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2006-3117)

690aeb5d56a25745bc75729f19923cb02d594afd.title: USN-335-1: heartbeat vulnerability
690aeb5d56a25745bc75729f19923cb02d594afd.body: Yan Rong Ge discovered that heartbeat did not sufficiently verify somepacket input data, which could lead to an out-of-boundary memoryaccess. A remote attacker could exploit this to crash the daemon(Denial of Service).

661d8fed743cef88edccaaa4557a5dffc8a8fb01.title: USN-330-1: tiff vulnerabilities
661d8fed743cef88edccaaa4557a5dffc8a8fb01.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the TIFF library did not sufficientlycheck handled images for validity. By tricking an user or an automatedsystem into processing a specially crafted TIFF image, an attackercould exploit these weaknesses to execute arbitrary code with thetarget application's privileges.This library is used in many client and server applications, thus youshould reboot your computer after the upgrade to ensure that allrunning programs use the new version of the library.

ecbb09edad26c84656e20c28a61aaa213637ed91.title: USN-324-1: freetype vulnerability
ecbb09edad26c84656e20c28a61aaa213637ed91.body: An integer overflow has been discovered in the FreeType library. Bytricking a user into installing and/or opening a specially craftedfont file, these could be exploited to execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of that user.

b2e8f65ab773df922547d3e82d0cc891573e4979.title: USN-341-1: libxfont vulnerability
b2e8f65ab773df922547d3e82d0cc891573e4979.body: An integer overflow has been discovered in X.org's font handlinglibrary. By using a specially crafted font file, this could beexploited to crash the X server or execute arbitrary code with rootprivileges.

0b4975708757ba78c41119fef7a5f2dec7f8d6b7.title: USN-318-1: libtunepimp vulnerability
0b4975708757ba78c41119fef7a5f2dec7f8d6b7.body: Kevin Kofler discovered several buffer overflows in the tag parser. Bytricking a user into opening a specially crafted tagged multimediafile (such as .ogg or .mp3 music) with an application that useslibtunepimp, this could be exploited to execute arbitrary code withthe user's privileges.This particularly affects the KDE applications 'Amarok' and 'Juk'.

7631eaff9635214b1c58a1e493ed0ab2b775018a.title: USN-353-1: openssl vulnerabilities
7631eaff9635214b1c58a1e493ed0ab2b775018a.body: Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry of the Google Security Team discovered abuffer overflow in the SSL_get_shared_ciphers() function. By sendingspecially crafted packets to applications that use this function (likeExim, MySQL, or the openssl command line tool), a remote attackercould exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the server'sprivileges. (CVE-2006-3738)

2083b6e95c75795c8e87674e1852be0c3b9cbc78.title: USN-340-1: imagemagick vulnerabilities
2083b6e95c75795c8e87674e1852be0c3b9cbc78.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered several buffer overflows in imagemagick's SunRaster and XCF (Gimp) image decoders. By tricking a user or automatedsystem into processing a specially crafted image, this could beexploited to execute arbitrary code with the users' privileges.

b6034a1f6bd6cbde2bed745fd0c6cf93cad6e928.title: USN-328-1: Apache vulnerability
b6034a1f6bd6cbde2bed745fd0c6cf93cad6e928.body: Mark Dowd discovered an off-by-one buffer overflow in the mod_rewritemodule's ldap scheme handling. On systems which activate"RewriteEngine on", a remote attacker could exploit certain rewriterules to crash Apache, or potentially even execute arbitrary code(this has not been verified)."RewriteEngine on" is disabled by default. Systems which have thisdirective disabled are not affected at all.

31ef34230166f952b7e20bfaa0885af3884a74d5.title: USN-350-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
31ef34230166f952b7e20bfaa0885af3884a74d5.body: Various flaws have been reported that allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user into openinga malicious email containing JavaScript. Please note that JavaScriptis disabled by default for emails, and it is not recommended to enableit. (CVE-2006-3113, CVE-2006-3802, CVE-2006-3803, CVE-2006-3805,CVE-2006-3806, CVE-2006-3807, CVE-2006-3809, CVE-2006-3810,CVE-2006-3811, CVE-2006-3812, CVE-2006-4253, CVE-2006-4565,CVE-2006-4566, CVE-2006-4571)

8eb2b2b1211856f4f054bc62907b9948880b1c28.title: USN-326-1: heartbeat vulnerability
8eb2b2b1211856f4f054bc62907b9948880b1c28.body: Yan Rong Ge discovered that heartbeat did not set proper permissionsfor an allocated shared memory segment. A local attacker could exploitthis to render the heartbeat service unavailable (Denial ofService).

8fe4e2420769a070ef48416d4ec4bf28dab156d7.title: USN-346-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8fe4e2420769a070ef48416d4ec4bf28dab156d7.body: The UDF file system does not handle extends larger than 1 GB, but didnot check for this restriction on truncating files. A local user couldexploit this to crash the kernel. (CVE-2006-4145)

375808978814aed7b47df516b38c4e97e71fa248.title: USN-356-1: gdb vulnerability
375808978814aed7b47df516b38c4e97e71fa248.body: Will Drewry, of the Google Security Team, discovered buffer overflowsin GDB's DWARF processing. This would allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user into usingGDB to load an executable that contained malicious debugginginformation.

c8a46d7094f4d70f3cc9d7d1b7e8f4073df453fe.title: USN-338-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
c8a46d7094f4d70f3cc9d7d1b7e8f4073df453fe.body: Dmitri Lenev discovered that arguments of setuid SQL functions wereevaluated in the security context of the functions' definer instead ofits caller. An authenticated user with the privilege to call such afunction could exploit this to execute arbitrary statements with theprivileges of the definer of that function. (CVE-2006-4227)

76a63aa874f519ee05da86e9823060f5ab56ea98.title: USN-351-1: firefox vulnerabilities
76a63aa874f519ee05da86e9823060f5ab56ea98.body: Various flaws have been reported that allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user into openinga malicious web page containing JavaScript. (CVE-2006-4253,CVE-2006-4565, CVE-2006-4566, CVE-2006-4568, CVE-2006-4569CVE-2006-4571)

0edafa450f9437a14c18bb84d59016c711a283be.title: USN-352-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
0edafa450f9437a14c18bb84d59016c711a283be.body: Various flaws have been reported that allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user into openinga malicious email containing JavaScript. Please note that JavaScriptis disabled by default for emails, and it is not recommended to enableit. (CVE-2006-4253, CVE-2006-4565, CVE-2006-4566, CVE-2006-4571)

c4514f0a8c4256e46174a034c4bcfeaf0b1921d4.title: USN-339-1: OpenSSL vulnerability
c4514f0a8c4256e46174a034c4bcfeaf0b1921d4.body: Philip Mackenzie, Marius Schilder, Jason Waddle and Ben Laurie ofGoogle Security discovered that the OpenSSL library did notsufficiently check the padding of PKCS #1 v1.5 signatures if theexponent of the public key is 3 (which is widely used for CAs). Thiscould be exploited to forge signatures without the need of the secretkey.

ea02ba263c31c6c1e28a1e93004f1e94e76a6e15.title: USN-350-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
ea02ba263c31c6c1e28a1e93004f1e94e76a6e15.body: The NSS library did not sufficiently check the padding of PKCS #1 v1.5signatures if the exponent of the public key is 3 (which is widelyused for CAs). This could be exploited to forge valid signatureswithout the need of the secret key. (CVE-2006-4340)

ceaee021978e51f7f1f1f655fa7cdcd86515c3d8.title: USN-351-1: firefox vulnerabilities
ceaee021978e51f7f1f1f655fa7cdcd86515c3d8.body: The NSS library did not sufficiently check the padding of PKCS #1 v1.5signatures if the exponent of the public key is 3 (which is widelyused for CAs). This could be exploited to forge valid signatureswithout the need of the secret key. (CVE-2006-4340)

9e935860be44942361c12dc7f716e96e93880609.title: USN-352-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
9e935860be44942361c12dc7f716e96e93880609.body: The NSS library did not sufficiently check the padding of PKCS #1 v1.5signatures if the exponent of the public key is 3 (which is widelyused for CAs). This could be exploited to forge valid signatureswithout the need of the secret key. (CVE-2006-4340)

f7b19045282f533da569a090f1136a3637991e6b.title: USN-361-1: Mozilla vulnerabilities
f7b19045282f533da569a090f1136a3637991e6b.body: The NSS library did not sufficiently check the padding of PKCS #1 v1.5signatures if the exponent of the public key is 3 (which is widelyused for CAs). This could be exploited to forge valid signatureswithout the need of the secret key. (CVE-2006-4340)

f294dedbef1c73e6a48ef968f3bf5130c39337ac.title: USN-353-1: openssl vulnerabilities
f294dedbef1c73e6a48ef968f3bf5130c39337ac.body: Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry of the Google Security Team reportedthat the get_server_hello() function did not sufficiently check theclient's session certificate. This could be exploited to crash clientsby remote attackers sending specially crafted SSL responses.(CVE-2006-4343)

0036d93a7fd2599220cfa64b9613eac6643382c6.title: USN-342-1: PHP vulnerabilities
0036d93a7fd2599220cfa64b9613eac6643382c6.body: On 64 bit systems the str_repeat() and wordwrap() functions did notproperly check buffer boundaries. Depending on the application, thiscould potentially be exploited to execute arbitrary code with theapplications' privileges. This only affects the amd64 and sparcplatforms. (CVE-2006-4482)

3733d92e44b0011be1cbce7131ea6e1bf89f8985.title: USN-362-1: PHP vulnerabilities
3733d92e44b0011be1cbce7131ea6e1bf89f8985.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the PHP memory allocationhandling. On 64-bit platforms, the "memory_limit" setting was notenforced correctly. A remote attacker could exploit this to cause aDenial of Service attack through memory exhaustion. (CVE-2006-4486)

b824906597a5faddcc2b363338ca3e92f0dcdb27.title: USN-391-1: libgsf vulnerability
b824906597a5faddcc2b363338ca3e92f0dcdb27.body: A heap overflow was discovered in the OLE processing code in libgsf. Ifa user were tricked into opening a specially crafted OLE document, anattacker could execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

b9c87bbf755903396e4bc360fa3299f1beddcdde.title: USN-494-1: Gimp vulnerability
b9c87bbf755903396e4bc360fa3299f1beddcdde.body: Sean Larsson discovered multiple integer overflows in Gimp. By trickinga user into opening a specially crafted DICOM, PNM, PSD, PSP, RAS, XBM,or XWD image, a remote attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrarycode with the user's privileges.

45e86dadef7f184aa123c16de8676f6d35e16b77.title: USN-347-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
45e86dadef7f184aa123c16de8676f6d35e16b77.body: Sridhar Samudrala discovered a local Denial of Service vulnerabilityin the handling of SCTP sockets. By opening such a socket with aspecial SO_LINGER value, a local attacker could exploit this to crashthe kernel. (CVE-2006-4535)

4dca53fc3b766006411c2ae6f8523325c5721ffd.title: USN-395-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4dca53fc3b766006411c2ae6f8523325c5721ffd.body: Mark Dowd discovered that the netfilter iptables module did notcorrecly handle fragmented packets. By sending specially craftedpackets, a remote attacker could exploit this to bypass firewallrules. This has only be fixed for Ubuntu 6.10; the corresponding fixfor Ubuntu 5.10 and 6.06 will follow soon. (CVE-2006-4572)

9821fe9ee4895fc2478ae7df3f654b113bb24411.title: USN-416-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9821fe9ee4895fc2478ae7df3f654b113bb24411.body: Mark Dowd discovered that the netfilter iptables module did notcorrecly handle fragmented IPv6 packets. By sending specially craftedpackets, a remote attacker could exploit this to bypass firewallrules. This has has already been fixed for Ubuntu 6.10 in USN-395-1;this is the corresponding fix for Ubuntu 6.06.(CVE-2006-4572)

2239a1bd765aa5b1c2927e700ce922a4360482e4.title: USN-368-1: Qt vulnerability
2239a1bd765aa5b1c2927e700ce922a4360482e4.body: An integer overflow was discovered in Qt's image loader. By processinga specially crafted image with an application that uses this library(like Konqueror), a remote attacker could exploit this to executearbitrary code with the application's privileges.

e683f770bea8d735cdef1cc071d7300e7fbffec2.title: USN-362-1: PHP vulnerabilities
e683f770bea8d735cdef1cc071d7300e7fbffec2.body: Stefan Esser discovered that the ecalloc() function in the Zend enginedid not check for integer overflows. This particularly affected theunserialize() function. In applications which unserialize untrusteduser-defined data, this could be exploited to execute arbitrary codewith the application's privileges. (CVE-2006-4812)

071037a02896f2fa1994c657879e447e01aaf6d7.title: USN-416-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
071037a02896f2fa1994c657879e447e01aaf6d7.body: Doug Chapman discovered an improper lock handling in the mincore()function. A local attacker could exploit this to cause an eternal hangin the kernel, rendering the machine unusable. (CVE-2006-4814)

36085808b6e5a9e0876af03e41de992a25dcc4a3.title: USN-355-1: openssh vulnerabilities
36085808b6e5a9e0876af03e41de992a25dcc4a3.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the SSH daemon did not properly handleauthentication packets with duplicated blocks. By sending speciallycrafted packets, a remote attacker could exploit this to cause the sshdaemon to drain all available CPU resources until the login grace timeexpired. (CVE-2006-4924)

14c76ed9fe6914181668e8062ee91dcf75ab10c0.title: USN-372-1: imagemagick vulnerability
14c76ed9fe6914181668e8062ee91dcf75ab10c0.body: M. Joonas Pihlaja discovered that ImageMagick did not sufficientlyverify the validity of PALM and DCM images. When processing aspecially crafted image with an application that uses imagemagick,this could be exploited to execute arbitrary code with theapplication's privileges.

0c95fbfd1267afd266908f5355ad94faf555e375.title: USN-422-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
0c95fbfd1267afd266908f5355ad94faf555e375.body: Vladimir Nadvornik discovered that the fix for CVE-2006-5456, releasedin USN-372-1, did not correctly solve the original flaw in PALM imagehandling. By tricking a user into processing a specially crafted imagewith an application that uses imagemagick, an attacker could executearbitrary code with the user's privileges.

59c9e827b7b8209052c899d2f066ee4044afb6e5.title: USN-371-1: Ruby vulnerability
59c9e827b7b8209052c899d2f066ee4044afb6e5.body: An error was found in Ruby's CGI library that did not correctly checkfor the end of multipart MIME requests. Using a crafted HTTP request, aremote user could cause a denial of service, where Ruby CGI applicationswould end up in a loop, monopolizing a CPU.

d050ba91ff72944c9b5f6dbff6d5e54c0e8510b6.title: USN-395-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d050ba91ff72944c9b5f6dbff6d5e54c0e8510b6.body: James Morris discovered that the ip6fl_get_n() function incorrectlyhandled flow labels. A local attacker could exploit this to crash thekernel. (CVE-2006-5619)

4efb7f96031c0e7202509d7e5175e8c87d885d1f.title: USN-416-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4efb7f96031c0e7202509d7e5175e8c87d885d1f.body: A race condition was found in the grow_buffers() function. By mountinga specially crafted ISO9660 or NTFS file system, a local attackercould exploit this to trigger an infinite loop in the kernel,rendering the machine unusable. (CVE-2006-5757)

dbb1c8890daeb89e1cc70e4c089c7ddde150d6b4.title: USN-384-1: OpenLDAP vulnerability
dbb1c8890daeb89e1cc70e4c089c7ddde150d6b4.body: Evgeny Legerov discovered that the OpenLDAP libraries did not correctlytruncate authcid names. This situation would trigger an assert andabort the program using the libraries. A remote attacker could sendspecially crafted bind requests that would lead to an LDAP server denialof service.

28876c399870dc3ae98247cf6479db7241d4615d.title: USN-383-1: libpng vulnerability
28876c399870dc3ae98247cf6479db7241d4615d.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that libpng did not correctly calculate thesize of sPLT structures when reading an image. By tricking a user or anautomated system into processing a specially crafted PNG file, anattacker could exploit this weakness to crash the application using thelibrary.

e3429c393c77bd8fd76c23762c04afd721efa011.title: USN-390-1: evince vulnerability
e3429c393c77bd8fd76c23762c04afd721efa011.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in the PostScript processor included inevince. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafted PS file, anattacker could crash evince or execute arbitrary code with the user'sprivileges.

f460a79cf1529751b4cf1a3c047dc2b37483ce10.title: USN-390-2: evince vulnerability
f460a79cf1529751b4cf1a3c047dc2b37483ce10.body: USN-390-1 fixed a vulnerability in evince. The original fix did notfully solve the problem, allowing for a denial of service in certainsituations.Original advisory details:A buffer overflow was discovered in the PostScript processor included in evince. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafted PS file, an attacker could crash evince or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

7dbbef85bb9e1939980bc3d600c73df7ff7b81eb.title: USN-390-3: evince-gtk vulnerability
7dbbef85bb9e1939980bc3d600c73df7ff7b81eb.body: USN-390-2 fixed vulnerabilities in evince. This update provides thecorresponding update for evince-gtk.Original advisory details:A buffer overflow was discovered in the PostScript processor included in evince. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafted PS file, an attacker could crash evince or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

85632434c9dddda5f75d10f3f731f37bb4599258.title: USN-405-1: fetchmail vulnerability
85632434c9dddda5f75d10f3f731f37bb4599258.body: It was discovered that fetchmail did not correctly require TLSnegotiation in certain situations. This would result in a user'sunencrypted password being sent across the network.If fetchmail has been configured to use the "sslproto tls1","sslcertck", or "sslfingerprint" options with a server that does notcorrectly support TLS negotiation, this update may cause fetchmail to(correctly) abort authentication.

968cb9891593317d244308ab4192c9ad1d528052.title: USN-406-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerability
968cb9891593317d244308ab4192c9ad1d528052.body: An integer overflow was discovered in OpenOffice.org's handling of WMFfiles. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted WMFfile, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

c36ba76943bd7cd4b1327fd85952dccb76b87246.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c36ba76943bd7cd4b1327fd85952dccb76b87246.body: The minix filesystem did not properly validate certain filesystemvalues. If a local attacker could trick the system into attemptingto mount a corrupted minix filesystem, the kernel could be made tohang for long periods of time, resulting in a denial of service.This was only vulnerable in Ubuntu 7.04 and 7.10. (CVE-2006-6058)

f23346a78e58500309723c9eb78f20aad4d5fc5a.title: USN-558-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f23346a78e58500309723c9eb78f20aad4d5fc5a.body: The minix filesystem did not properly validate certain filesystem values.If a local attacker could trick the system into attempting to mount acorrupted minix filesystem, the kernel could be made to hang for longperiods of time, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2006-6058)

f6cf30ea9e161711045b3717250852a7f785bcfc.title: USN-578-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f6cf30ea9e161711045b3717250852a7f785bcfc.body: The minix filesystem did not properly validate certain filesystemvalues. If a local attacker could trick the system into attemptingto mount a corrupted minix filesystem, the kernel could be made tohang for long periods of time, resulting in a denial of service.(CVE-2006-6058)

9f13bd93db9369ad6d111d8daf4d79f56851f6d1.title: USN-416-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9f13bd93db9369ad6d111d8daf4d79f56851f6d1.body: Marcel Holtman discovered several buffer overflows in the Bluetoothdriver. By sending Bluetooth packets with specially crafted CAPImessages, a remote attacker could exploit these to crash the kernel.(CVE-2006-6106)

1da60c8957b84d549eaa3b14a59a2230e818b5c9.title: USN-394-1: Ruby vulnerability
1da60c8957b84d549eaa3b14a59a2230e818b5c9.body: An error was found in Ruby's CGI library that did not correctly quotethe boundary of multipart MIME requests. Using a crafted HTTP request,a remote user could cause a denial of service, where Ruby CGIapplications would end up in a loop, monopolizing a CPU.

4b612c6af7e19d88b664a5427c10899262374433.title: USN-398-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
4b612c6af7e19d88b664a5427c10899262374433.body: Various flaws have been reported that allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user into openinga malicious web page containing JavaScript or SVG. (CVE-2006-6497,CVE-2006-6498, CVE-2006-6499, CVE-2006-6501, CVE-2006-6502,CVE-2006-6504)

d1d90923134f1f56494b8d3f1a9b44013afe418e.title: USN-398-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
d1d90923134f1f56494b8d3f1a9b44013afe418e.body: Various flaws have been reported that allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user into openinga malicious web page containing JavaScript or SVG. (CVE-2006-6497,CVE-2006-6498, CVE-2006-6499, CVE-2006-6501, CVE-2006-6502,CVE-2006-6504)

8c84a11bb6feb2d570fdbb171c4d84b6024272d5.title: USN-400-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
8c84a11bb6feb2d570fdbb171c4d84b6024272d5.body: Various flaws have been reported that allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges or bypass internal XSS protectionsby tricking the user into opening a malicious email containingJavaScript. Please note that JavaScript is disabled by default foremails, and it is not recommended to enable it. (CVE-2006-6497,CVE-2006-6498, CVE-2006-6499, CVE-2006-6501, CVE-2006-6502,CVE-2006-6503)

4c135bb4b82025180eae2ab35c68df989cd2869b.title: USN-578-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4c135bb4b82025180eae2ab35c68df989cd2869b.body: Alexander Schulze discovered that the skge driver does not properlyuse the spin_lock and spin_unlock functions. Remote attackers couldexploit this by sending a flood of network traffic and cause a denialof service (crash). (CVE-2006-7229)

883b0fcdd8f36674ca92986568f508a7ed40caf4.title: USN-588-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
883b0fcdd8f36674ca92986568f508a7ed40caf4.body: Masaaki Hirose discovered that MySQL could be made to dereferencea NULL pointer. An authenticated user could cause a denial of service(application crash) via an EXPLAIN SELECT FROM on the INFORMATION_SCHEMAtable. This issue only affects Ubuntu 6.06 and 6.10. (CVE-2006-7232)

faacdff221cda6e50783f928fdd62672ab6ad2f2.title: USN-437-1: libwpd vulnerability
faacdff221cda6e50783f928fdd62672ab6ad2f2.body: Sean Larsson of iDefense Labs discovered that libwpd was vulnerable tointeger overflows. If a user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted WordPerfect document with an application that used libwpd, anattacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

7451d21dc20a0aeb3a936fbaf05d919f4284b997.title: USN-486-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7451d21dc20a0aeb3a936fbaf05d919f4284b997.body: The Omnikey CardMan 4040 driver (cm4040_cs) did not limit the size ofbuffers passed to read() and write(). A local attacker could exploitthis to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges. (CVE-2007-0005)

bff72d79ceb67e99f955b7d8659f106704c777c3.title: USN-489-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
bff72d79ceb67e99f955b7d8659f106704c777c3.body: The Omnikey CardMan 4040 driver (cm4040_cs) did not limit the size ofbuffers passed to read() and write(). A local attacker could exploitthis to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges. (CVE-2007-0005)

6f4ff84aaa455c154a683b02ef2a7274225a7dfd.title: USN-428-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
6f4ff84aaa455c154a683b02ef2a7274225a7dfd.body: The SSLv2 protocol support in the NSS library did not sufficientlycheck the validity of public keys presented with a SSL certificate. Amalicious SSL web site using SSLv2 could potentially exploit this toexecute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2007-0008)

cbba044263aa73bb62d7515f5c57946a476c5d70.title: USN-431-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
cbba044263aa73bb62d7515f5c57946a476c5d70.body: The SSLv2 protocol support in the NSS library did not sufficientlycheck the validity of public keys presented with a SSL certificate. Amalicious SSL web site using SSLv2 could potentially exploit this toexecute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2007-0008)

48222f660af7c29c42e2dbd9ebbf958ce621da18.title: USN-428-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
48222f660af7c29c42e2dbd9ebbf958ce621da18.body: The SSLv2 protocol support in the NSS library did not sufficientlyverify the validity of client master keys presented in an SSL clientcertificate. A remote attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrarycode in a server application that uses the NSS library.(CVE-2007-0009)

6c5237f48946e280e7527f22ce4608581012160e.title: USN-431-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
6c5237f48946e280e7527f22ce4608581012160e.body: The SSLv2 protocol support in the NSS library did not sufficientlyverify the validity of client master keys presented in an SSL clientcertificate. A remote attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrarycode in a server application that uses the NSS library. (CVE-2007-0009)

cf6fd6bfc290ac0a262abf7c98b4b73e92c49379.title: USN-543-1: VMWare vulnerabilities
cf6fd6bfc290ac0a262abf7c98b4b73e92c49379.body: Neel Mehta and Ryan Smith discovered that the VMWare Player DHCP serverdid not correctly handle certain packet structures. Remote attackerscould send specially crafted packets and gain root privileges.(CVE-2007-0061, CVE-2007-0062, CVE-2007-0063)

b340462e287b92510e2c12079de1da9262325e6b.title: USN-410-1: poppler vulnerability
b340462e287b92510e2c12079de1da9262325e6b.body: The poppler PDF loader library did not limit the recursion depth ofthe page model tree. By tricking a user into opening a speciallycrafter PDF file, this could be exploited to trigger an infinite loopand eventually crash an application that uses this library.kpdf in Ubuntu 5.10, and KOffice in all Ubuntu releases contains acopy of this code and thus is affected as well.

121af42fcbad7040057be12c82e7964708d8c215.title: USN-410-2: teTeX vulnerability
121af42fcbad7040057be12c82e7964708d8c215.body: USN-410-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the poppler PDF loader library. Thisupdate provides the corresponding updates for a copy of this code intetex-bin in Ubuntu 5.10. Versions of tetex-bin after Ubuntu 5.10 usepoppler directly and do not need a separate update.Original advisory details:The poppler PDF loader library did not limit the recursion depth of the page model tree. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafter PDF file, this could be exploited to trigger an infinite loop and eventually crash an application that uses this library.

07b920fe4b449214698c7cc38a587174d9048188.title: USN-407-1: libgtop2 vulnerability
07b920fe4b449214698c7cc38a587174d9048188.body: Liu Qishuai discovered a buffer overflow in the /proc parsing routinesin libgtop. By creating and running a process in a specially craftedlong path and tricking an user into running gnome-system-monitor, anattacker could exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the user'sprivileges.

dcc9eec18982a9a23f7f4233a0667aebda98be5e.title: USN-444-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
dcc9eec18982a9a23f7f4233a0667aebda98be5e.body: A stack overflow was discovered in OpenOffice.org's StarCalc parser. Ifa user were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remoteattacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges.(CVE-2007-0238)

cf4cd4358ae597846b8b8dbdae996766ebf79ca1.title: USN-482-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerability
cf4cd4358ae597846b8b8dbdae996766ebf79ca1.body: John Heasman discovered that OpenOffice did not correctly validate thesizes of tags in RTF documents. If a user were tricked into opening aspecially crafted document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrarycode with user privileges.

45ceced70bf1fbcfe9aabe801a764cb2c69e0d51.title: USN-414-1: Squid vulnerabilities
45ceced70bf1fbcfe9aabe801a764cb2c69e0d51.body: David Duncan Ross Palmer and Henrik Nordstrom discovered that squidincorrectly handled special characters in FTP URLs. Remote users withaccess to squid could crash the server leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2007-0247)

da750e102ce6110ca9ec3b2920c9f3c2465faa78.title: USN-473-1: libgd2 vulnerabilities
da750e102ce6110ca9ec3b2920c9f3c2465faa78.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in libgd2's font renderer. By trickingan application using libgd2 into rendering a specially crafted stringwith a JIS encoded font, a remote attacker could read heap memory orcrash the application, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2007-0455)

9dbb1c74c35e1c9d4e7e5bd4acee0cc3ffae7a57.title: USN-420-1: KDE library vulnerability
9dbb1c74c35e1c9d4e7e5bd4acee0cc3ffae7a57.body: Jose Avila III and Robert Tasarz discovered that the KDE HTML librarydid not correctly parse HTML comments inside the "title" tag. Bytricking a Konqueror user into visiting a malicious website, an attackercould bypass cross-site scripting protections.

f4ab89863aa0d1a85156bb250628493aab16a920.title: USN-451-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f4ab89863aa0d1a85156bb250628493aab16a920.body: The kernel NFS code did not correctly validate NFSACL2 ACCESS requests.If a system was serving NFS mounts, a remote attacker could send aspecially crafted packet, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2007-0772)

a3b117b2809c8bafadbc250e80c42b2e09ac340e.title: USN-428-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a3b117b2809c8bafadbc250e80c42b2e09ac340e.body: Various flaws have been reported that could allow an attacker toexecute arbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user intoopening a malicious web page. (CVE-2007-0775, CVE-2007-0776,CVE-2007-0777, CVE-2007-1092)

35d00d86fc7925c614a039ef28da8d23ebcd6af1.title: USN-431-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
35d00d86fc7925c614a039ef28da8d23ebcd6af1.body: Various flaws have been reported that could allow an attacker to executearbitrary code with user privileges by tricking the user into opening amalicious web page. (CVE-2007-0775, CVE-2007-0776, CVE-2007-0777)

154f30f0a1cffd6cbe4c6fc7c32a14c6e3224533.title: USN-428-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
154f30f0a1cffd6cbe4c6fc7c32a14c6e3224533.body: Two web pages could collide in the disk cache with the result thatdepending on order loaded the end of the longer document could beappended to the shorter when the shorter one was reloaded from thecache. It is possible a determined hacker could construct a targetedattack to steal some sensitive data from a particular web page. Thepotential victim would have to be already logged into the targetedservice (or be fooled into doing so) and then visit the malicioussite. (CVE-2007-0778)

1e052f3299d16101b29b2dcc27a9e474f79170aa.title: USN-428-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
1e052f3299d16101b29b2dcc27a9e474f79170aa.body: Several flaws have been found that could be used to perform Cross-sitescripting attacks. A malicious web site could exploit these to modifythe contents or steal confidential data (such as passwords) from otheropened web pages. (CVE-2006-6077, CVE-2007-0780, CVE-2007-0800,CVE-2007-0981, CVE-2007-0995, CVE-2007-0996)

7973850301734c10989d3fd315ce5efcb5d57d85.title: USN-424-1: PHP vulnerabilities
7973850301734c10989d3fd315ce5efcb5d57d85.body: Multiple buffer overflows have been discovered in various PHP modules.If a PHP application processes untrusted data with functions of thesession or zip module, or various string functions, a remote attackercould exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the privileges ofthe web server. (CVE-2007-0906)

b369020aa23840262549d322e1779646e8ada8c9.title: USN-424-2: PHP regression
b369020aa23840262549d322e1779646e8ada8c9.body: Multiple buffer overflows have been discovered in various PHP modules. If a PHP application processes untrusted data with functions of the session or zip module, or various string functions, a remote attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the web server. (CVE-2007-0906)

ba66bdda7d0d8fdbbbad71450fc5177079b51ae3.title: USN-424-1: PHP vulnerabilities
ba66bdda7d0d8fdbbbad71450fc5177079b51ae3.body: The wddx unserialization handler did not correctly check for somebuffer boundaries and had an uninitialized variable. By unserializinguntrusted data, this could be exploited to expose memory regions thatwere not meant to be accessible. Depending on the PHP application thiscould lead to disclosure of potentially sensitive information.(CVE-2007-0908)

d6a81b71cfbddb1b330680b92d4a21915b9cdcd3.title: USN-424-2: PHP regression
d6a81b71cfbddb1b330680b92d4a21915b9cdcd3.body: The wddx unserialization handler did not correctly check for some buffer boundaries and had an uninitialized variable. By unserializing untrusted data, this could be exploited to expose memory regions that were not meant to be accessible. Depending on the PHP application this could lead to disclosure of potentially sensitive information. (CVE-2007-0908)

3c58adbaf2fbb914891abfb8cf73cc40cca81e20.title: USN-449-1: krb5 vulnerabilities
3c58adbaf2fbb914891abfb8cf73cc40cca81e20.body: The krb5 syslog library did not correctly verify the size of logmessages. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted message andexecute arbitrary code with root privileges. (CVE-2007-0957)

d2755a9e6a8ddaa0b28d996ca10af45c4e82c0fa.title: USN-424-1: PHP vulnerabilities
d2755a9e6a8ddaa0b28d996ca10af45c4e82c0fa.body: When unserializing untrusted data on 64-bit platforms thezend_hash_init() function could be forced to enter an infinite loop,consuming CPU resources, for a limited length of time, until thescript timeout alarm aborts the script. (CVE-2007-0988)

452dd8b731cac98d3405de5722e2006631fee928.title: USN-424-2: PHP regression
452dd8b731cac98d3405de5722e2006631fee928.body: When unserializing untrusted data on 64-bit platforms the zend_hash_init() function could be forced to enter an infinite loop, consuming CPU resources, for a limited length of time, until the script timeout alarm aborts the script. (CVE-2007-0988)

f3662c1d436e5d6a261dc8edf6079b7fd2928942.title: USN-429-1: tcpdump vulnerability
f3662c1d436e5d6a261dc8edf6079b7fd2928942.body: Moritz Jodeit discovered that tcpdump had an overflow in the 802.11packet parser. Remote attackers could send specially crafted packets,crashing tcpdump, possibly leading to a denial of service.

d6cc71b4050bd5e12026ed0cd6fa7e33e62be49d.title: USN-433-1: Xine vulnerability
d6cc71b4050bd5e12026ed0cd6fa7e33e62be49d.body: Moritz Jodeit discovered that the DMO loader of Xine did not correctlyvalidate the size of an allocated buffer. By tricking a user intoopening a specially crafted media file, an attacker could executearbitrary code with the user's privileges.

aca16275a30d7d0f2c9ce74b246588a61877e1c8.title: USN-549-2: PHP regression
aca16275a30d7d0f2c9ce74b246588a61877e1c8.body: Stefan Esser discovered that deeply nested arrays could be made to fill stack space. A remote attacker could exploit this to cause a crash or monopolize CPU resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2007-1285, CVE-2007-4670)

317e02c3fd158964f025b7b9ebdf1f87ca720d46.title: USN-447-1: KDE library vulnerabilities
317e02c3fd158964f025b7b9ebdf1f87ca720d46.body: It was discovered that Konqueror did not correctly handle iframes fromJavaScript. If a user were tricked into visiting a malicious website,Konqueror could crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2007-1308)

469d9f4116aef7c255e323226ce92eb22a5208f5.title: USN-488-1: mod_perl vulnerability
469d9f4116aef7c255e323226ce92eb22a5208f5.body: Alex Solovey discovered that mod_perl did not correctly validate certainregular expression matches. A remote attacker could send a speciallycrafted request to a web application using mod_perl, causing the webserver to monopolize CPU resources. This could lead to a remote denialof service.

d24824c48dae68dfe4d8e060fd4c817012019656.title: USN-448-1: X.org vulnerabilities
d24824c48dae68dfe4d8e060fd4c817012019656.body: Greg MacManus of iDefense Labs discovered that the BDF font handlingcode in Xorg and FreeType did not correctly verify the size of allocatedmemory. If a user were tricked into using a specially crafted font, aremote attacker could execute arbitrary code with root privileges.(CVE-2007-1351, CVE-2007-1352)

f27051769b68a30f10a4efe4b8fd6947a6de3047.title: USN-468-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
f27051769b68a30f10a4efe4b8fd6947a6de3047.body: Nicolas Derouet discovered flaws in cookie handling. By tricking a userinto opening a malicious web page, an attacker could force the browser toconsume large quantities of disk or memory while processing long cookiepaths. (CVE-2007-1362)

61522f883695a8e29fba7e1b98af63ed73d8ba47.title: USN-464-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
61522f883695a8e29fba7e1b98af63ed73d8ba47.body: Gabriel Campana discovered that the do_ipv6_setsockopt() function didnot sufficiently verifiy option values for IPV6_RTHDR. A localattacker could exploit this to trigger a kernel crash. (CVE-2007-1388)

923f0d5c87661f29cb2159941e62f7f2615a184c.title: USN-439-1: file vulnerability
923f0d5c87661f29cb2159941e62f7f2615a184c.body: Jean-Sebastien Guay-Leroux discovered that "file" did not correctlycheck the size of allocated heap memory. If a user were tricked intoexamining a specially crafted file with the "file" utility, a remoteattacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

0586aee2745767d752ff6d9b5c4bf11212603fd7.title: USN-443-1: Firefox vulnerability
0586aee2745767d752ff6d9b5c4bf11212603fd7.body: A flaw was discovered in how Firefox handled PASV FTP responses. If auser were tricked into visiting a malicious FTP server, a remoteattacker could perform a port-scan of machines within the user'snetwork, leading to private information disclosure.

62dd8f36ef4d8492693aa2cf02ef17127fa0bde1.title: USN-447-1: KDE library vulnerabilities
62dd8f36ef4d8492693aa2cf02ef17127fa0bde1.body: A flaw was discovered in how Konqueror handled PASV FTP responses. If auser were tricked into visiting a malicious FTP server, a remoteattacker could perform a port-scan of machines within the user'snetwork, leading to private information disclosure. (CVE-2007-1564)

eaf863c1d1e906cb4dced10b18ca2c7a3a570021.title: USN-464-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
eaf863c1d1e906cb4dced10b18ca2c7a3a570021.body: Masayuki Nakagawa discovered an error in the flowlabel handling ofIPv6 network sockets. A local attacker could exploit this to crashthe kernel. (CVE-2007-1592)

0b6ee0560337648fd323159de685e900fa9c088e.title: USN-453-1: X.org vulnerability
0b6ee0560337648fd323159de685e900fa9c088e.body: Multiple integer overflows were found in the XGetPixel function oflibx11. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted XWDimage, remote attackers could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges.

3e6b5a28a43aae5fc66ac521227512bdae2a057b.title: USN-453-2: rdesktop regression
3e6b5a28a43aae5fc66ac521227512bdae2a057b.body: USN-453-1 provided an updated libx11 package to fix a securityvulnerability. This triggered an error in rdesktop so that it crashedon startup. This update fixes the problem.

1d27d11003a11228140452fadb537a015ef0034d.title: USN-481-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
1d27d11003a11228140452fadb537a015ef0034d.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in ImageMagick's handling of DCM andWXD image files. By tricking a user into processing a specially craftedimage with an application that uses imagemagick, an attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

76ccf5b9478e8bbc3acc3d32bea607f32471c8b7.title: USN-474-1: xscreensaver vulnerability
76ccf5b9478e8bbc3acc3d32bea607f32471c8b7.body: It was discovered that xscreensaver did not correctly validate thereturn values from network authentication systems such as LDAP or NIS.A local attacker could bypass a locked screen if they were able tointerrupt network connectivity.

d5109fb29e92b3372c40cb16d95c4cf217f08112.title: USN-486-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d5109fb29e92b3372c40cb16d95c4cf217f08112.body: A flaw was discovered in the handling of netlink messages. Localattackers could cause infinite recursion leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2007-1861)

e3c1af70dfc9de82ace1fa42f27cec11c6f9c023.title: USN-489-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e3c1af70dfc9de82ace1fa42f27cec11c6f9c023.body: A flaw was discovered in the handling of netlink messages. Localattackers could cause infinite recursion leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2007-1861)

bd1b33702fc34ec80499aa44f16bae0a0934b196.title: USN-485-1: PHP vulnerabilities
bd1b33702fc34ec80499aa44f16bae0a0934b196.body: It was discovered that the PHP xmlrpc extension did not correctly checkheap memory allocation sizes. A remote attacker could send a speciallycrafted request to a PHP application using xmlrpc and execute arbitrarycode as the Apache user. (CVE-2007-1864)

8aa25c19413a6e12c78d6001951c5f414f458bfc.title: USN-461-1: Quagga vulnerability
8aa25c19413a6e12c78d6001951c5f414f458bfc.body: It was discovered that Quagga did not correctly verify lengthinformation sent from configured peers. Remote malicious peers couldsend a specially crafted UPDATE message which would cause bgpd to abort,leading to a denial of service.

5aa5d61e70a75a9bad9ac584aba69c2b0e74088f.title: USN-585-1: Python vulnerabilities
5aa5d61e70a75a9bad9ac584aba69c2b0e74088f.body: Piotr Engelking discovered that strxfrm in Python was not correctlycalculating the size of the destination buffer. This could lead to smallinformation leaks, which might be used by attackers to gain additionalknowledge about the state of a running Python script. (CVE-2007-2052)

195a7237072ab05ea282b26e4d47bd49776f3ebe.title: USN-454-1: PostgreSQL vulnerability
195a7237072ab05ea282b26e4d47bd49776f3ebe.body: PostgreSQL did not handle the "search_path" configuration option in asecure way for functions declared as "SECURITY DEFINER".Previously, an attacker could override functions and operators used bythe security definer function to execute arbitrary SQL commands withthe privileges of the user who created the security definer function.The updated version does not search the temporary table schema forfunctions and operators any more.Similarly, an attacker could put forged tables into the temporarytable schema to trick the security definer function into usingattacker defined data for processing. This was possible because thetemporary schema was always implicitly searched first before all otherentries in "search_path". The updated version now supports explicitplacement of the temporary schema. Please see the HTML documentationor the manual page for "CREATE FUNCTION" for details and an examplehow to write security definer functions in a secure way.

7e99cc8790c2cb764b7324579c4afcb70899526a.title: USN-464-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7e99cc8790c2cb764b7324579c4afcb70899526a.body: The IPv4 and DECnet network protocol handlers incorrectly declaredan array variable so that it became smaller than intended. By sendingcrafted packets over a netlink socket, a local attacker could exploitthis to crash the kernel. (CVE-2007-2172)

733fa7883fae2ddcb33c8e38ad000480aaa5b51d.title: USN-536-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
733fa7883fae2ddcb33c8e38ad000480aaa5b51d.body: Stefano Di Paola discovered that Thunderbird did not correctly requestDigest Authentications. A malicious web site could exploit this toinject arbitrary HTTP headers or perform session splitting attacksagainst proxies. (CVE-2007-2292)

3d654a34e16f0bc4ea7b8f3382aa45216afbc958.title: USN-467-1: Gimp vulnerability
3d654a34e16f0bc4ea7b8f3382aa45216afbc958.body: It was discovered that Gimp did not correctly handle RAS image formatcolor tables. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafted RASfile with Gimp, an attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrary codewith the user's privileges.

1a7c44a7b1f4c0bf9f61bbc5f10eabb67663e64f.title: USN-460-1: Samba vulnerabilities
1a7c44a7b1f4c0bf9f61bbc5f10eabb67663e64f.body: Brian Schafer discovered that Samba did not handle NDR parsingcorrectly. A remote attacker could send specially crafted MS-RPCrequests that could overwrite heap memory and execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2007-2446)

3154cbdb869a95359973b9c5ad700b674375074c.title: USN-462-1: PHP vulnerabilities
3154cbdb869a95359973b9c5ad700b674375074c.body: A flaw was discovered in the FTP command handler in PHP. Commands werenot correctly filtered for control characters. An attacker could issuearbitrary FTP commands using specially crafted arguments. (CVE-2007-2509)

0903ecf899a6358eb955ea47f21fb655f5ddeb5e.title: USN-462-1: PHP vulnerabilities
0903ecf899a6358eb955ea47f21fb655f5ddeb5e.body: Ilia Alshanetsky discovered a buffer overflow in the SOAP request handlerin PHP. Remote attackers could send a specially crafted SOAP requestand execute arbitrary code with web server privileges. (CVE-2007-2510)

da0baf77f268564bf72cf7abcbef12139f9864cc.title: USN-652-1: LittleCMS vulnerability
da0baf77f268564bf72cf7abcbef12139f9864cc.body: Chris Evans discovered that certain ICC operations in lcms were notcorrectly bounds-checked. If a user or automated system were trickedinto processing an image with malicious ICC tags, a remote attacker couldcrash applications linked against liblcms1, leading to a denial of service,or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

b4f640a3587b9c4f2ab81ed88e29310bfa3da27e.title: USN-477-1: krb5 vulnerabilities
b4f640a3587b9c4f2ab81ed88e29310bfa3da27e.body: It was discovered that the kadmind service could be made to overflow itsstack. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request andexecute arbitrary code with root privileges. (CVE-2007-2798)

c846975e12dd16a398033cb7bec583083923da6a.title: USN-439-2: file vulnerability
c846975e12dd16a398033cb7bec583083923da6a.body: USN-439-1 fixed a vulnerability in file. The original fix did notfully solve the problem. This update provides a more complete solution.Original advisory details:Jean-Sebastien Guay-Leroux discovered that "file" did not correctly check the size of allocated heap memory. If a user were tricked into examining a specially crafted file with the "file" utility, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

e4ab34702fd511c2a39b9148d8bf8c8a8510ad0e.title: USN-479-1: MadWifi vulnerabilities
e4ab34702fd511c2a39b9148d8bf8c8a8510ad0e.body: A flaw was discovered in the MadWifi driver's ioctl handling. A localattacker could read kernel memory, or crash the system, leading to adenial of service. (CVE-2007-2831)

b1efa8c59bd95dc6833892387d04e8e7d8363b08.title: USN-524-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerability
b1efa8c59bd95dc6833892387d04e8e7d8363b08.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the TIFF handling code in OpenOffice.If a user were tricked into loading a malicious TIFF image, a remote attackercould execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

c1453f0d59b86af2b38944d5fddf1433a0ed1ea5.title: USN-468-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
c1453f0d59b86af2b38944d5fddf1433a0ed1ea5.body: Various flaws were discovered in the layout and JavaScript engines.By tricking a user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2007-2867,CVE-2007-2868)

c493d16f4286c573e8d0dfc366f89a1a1151f745.title: USN-469-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
c493d16f4286c573e8d0dfc366f89a1a1151f745.body: Various flaws were discovered in the layout and JavaScript engines. Bytricking a user into opening a malicious email, an attacker could executearbitrary code with the user's privileges. Please note that JavaScriptis disabled by default for emails, and it is not recommended to enableit. (CVE-2007-2867, CVE-2007-2868)

4f8a5aec2a9c9462b344faa2a9a7a760d30048ef.title: USN-549-2: PHP regression
4f8a5aec2a9c9462b344faa2a9a7a760d30048ef.body: Gerhard Wagner discovered that the chunk_split function did not correctly handle long strings. A remote attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrary code with application privileges. (CVE-2007-2872, CVE-2007-4660, CVE-2007-4661)

36708f8df8bc92a4c4cb9095cde1ecc797b83ab2.title: USN-486-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
36708f8df8bc92a4c4cb9095cde1ecc797b83ab2.body: An integer underflow was discovered in the cpuset filesystem. If mounted,local attackers could obtain kernel memory using large file offsetswhile reading the tasks file. This could disclose sensitive data.(CVE-2007-2875)

9fabbcd5720263731b176d4f58c06695bf67eaa9.title: USN-489-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9fabbcd5720263731b176d4f58c06695bf67eaa9.body: An integer underflow was discovered in the cpuset filesystem. If mounted,local attackers could obtain kernel memory using large file offsetswhile reading the tasks file. This could disclose sensitive data.(CVE-2007-2875)

80fb8b86fa98551bcd511512e71cf59cac842aaa.title: USN-510-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
80fb8b86fa98551bcd511512e71cf59cac842aaa.body: An integer underflow was discovered in the cpuset filesystem. If mounted,local attackers could obtain kernel memory using large file offsets whilereading the tasks file. This could disclose sensitive data. (CVE-2007-2875)

5c8fc6467a8906adb3edcff35d6dc5c9f2f8b54a.title: USN-510-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5c8fc6467a8906adb3edcff35d6dc5c9f2f8b54a.body: A flaw in the sysfs_readdir function allowed a local user to cause adenial of service by dereferencing a NULL pointer. (CVE-2007-3104)

dd0167482aafcb1d0e77e9ab46d318391c9fff52.title: USN-508-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
dd0167482aafcb1d0e77e9ab46d318391c9fff52.body: A flaw in the sysfs_readdir function allowed a local user to cause adenial of service by dereferencing a NULL pointer. (CVE-2007-3104)

e34577823f5451376d88f7ba077be6d421fd87f8.title: USN-509-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e34577823f5451376d88f7ba077be6d421fd87f8.body: A flaw in the sysfs_readdir function allowed a local user to cause adenial of service by dereferencing a NULL pointer. (CVE-2007-3104)

29e8e26dd1e71cf487b9082834f4326c5ba19d3c.title: USN-510-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
29e8e26dd1e71cf487b9082834f4326c5ba19d3c.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in the random number generator. Inenvironments with granular assignment of root privileges, a local attackercould gain additional privileges. (CVE-2007-3105)

d6d98ad2a5360de1b2da2dc8e406c754a41cb365.title: USN-508-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d6d98ad2a5360de1b2da2dc8e406c754a41cb365.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in the random number generator. Inenvironments with granular assignment of root privileges, a local attackercould gain additional privileges. (CVE-2007-3105)

de92f3fd6bd2d045c63e413b1657493257b871ca.title: USN-509-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
de92f3fd6bd2d045c63e413b1657493257b871ca.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in the random number generator. Inenvironments with granular assignment of root privileges, a local attackercould gain additional privileges. (CVE-2007-3105)

037e25282a47ce4da6661f197f04ff9babf4871b.title: USN-498-1: libvorbis vulnerabilities
037e25282a47ce4da6661f197f04ff9babf4871b.body: David Thiel discovered that libvorbis did not correctly verify the sizeof certain headers, and did not correctly clean up a broken stream.If a user were tricked into processing a specially crafted Vorbis stream,a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

d011da76a02fc12dcde06d297084087c8af016d7.title: USN-490-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d011da76a02fc12dcde06d297084087c8af016d7.body: Ronald van den Heetkamp discovered that filename URLs including an encodednull byte could confuse the extension matching code. By tricking a userinto opening a malicious web page, an attacker could execute arbitraryhelper programs. (CVE-2007-3285)

416348734593112f24aa0a8f519dd4bab6885328.title: USN-476-1: redhat-cluster-suite vulnerability
416348734593112f24aa0a8f519dd4bab6885328.body: Fabio Massimo Di Nitto discovered that cman did not correctly validatethe size of client messages. A local user could send a specially craftedmessage and execute arbitrary code with cluster manager privileges orcrash the manager, leading to a denial of service.

2dff683f39347b6db4f51d57f0175fc4fbbb27db.title: USN-496-1: koffice vulnerability
2dff683f39347b6db4f51d57f0175fc4fbbb27db.body: Derek Noonburg discovered an integer overflow in the Xpdf functionStreamPredictor::StreamPredictor(). By importing a specially craftedPDF file into KWord, this could be exploited to run arbitrary codewith the user's privileges.

0ade7b19ed3509d3f0174563d9e673dd1a4f8ba6.title: USN-496-2: poppler vulnerability
0ade7b19ed3509d3f0174563d9e673dd1a4f8ba6.body: USN-496-1 fixed a vulnerability in koffice. This update provides thecorresponding updates for poppler, the library used for PDF handling inGnome.Original advisory details:Derek Noonburg discovered an integer overflow in the Xpdf function StreamPredictor::StreamPredictor(). By importing a specially crafted PDF file into KWord, this could be exploited to run arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

cfbfd0bdb3897a381c780c549053b934edf9c2a3.title: USN-510-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
cfbfd0bdb3897a381c780c549053b934edf9c2a3.body: Zhongling Wen discovered that the h323 conntrack handler did not correctlyhandle certain bitfields. A remote attacker could send a specially craftedpacket and cause a denial of service. (CVE-2007-3642)

138f2fe55bf3853f5f427baac1dd0072aec98d28.title: USN-490-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
138f2fe55bf3853f5f427baac1dd0072aec98d28.body: Michal Zalewski discovered flaws in the same-origin handling of cached"wyciwyg://" documents. A malicious web site could exploit this tomodify the contents, or steal confidential data (such as passwords),of other web pages. (CVE-2007-3656)

dd8d9df7d7c8d6fe34cc0a99831a2a616c0b83e9.title: USN-503-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
dd8d9df7d7c8d6fe34cc0a99831a2a616c0b83e9.body: Jesper Johansson discovered that spaces and double-quotes werenot correctly handled when launching external programs. In rareconfigurations, after tricking a user into opening a malicious email,an attacker could execute helpers with arbitrary arguments with theuser's privileges. (CVE-2007-3670, CVE-2007-3845)

423128b0246c7714c172b882952d56124688dd1b.title: USN-518-1: linux-source-2.6.15, linux-source-2.6.17, linux-source-2.6.20 vulnerabilities
423128b0246c7714c172b882952d56124688dd1b.body: Evan Teran discovered that the Linux kernel ptrace routines did notcorrectly handle certain requests robustly. Local attackers could exploitthis to crash the system, causing a denial of service. (CVE-2007-3731)

4614f9362e7b828d920943883f4419aee5c4aa28.title: USN-518-1: linux-source-2.6.15, linux-source-2.6.17, linux-source-2.6.20 vulnerabilities
4614f9362e7b828d920943883f4419aee5c4aa28.body: It was discovered that hugetlb kernels on PowerPC systems did not preventthe stack from colliding with reserved kernel memory. Local attackerscould exploit this and crash the system, causing a denial of service.(CVE-2007-3739)

b4c73005b58905d0b7c5c1324ce359ecd2802be9.title: USN-518-1: linux-source-2.6.15, linux-source-2.6.17, linux-source-2.6.20 vulnerabilities
b4c73005b58905d0b7c5c1324ce359ecd2802be9.body: It was discovered that certain CIFS filesystem actions did not honorthe umask of a process. Local attackers could exploit this to gainadditional privileges. (CVE-2007-3740)

8a3d817c74fca12354dda2dcacffdd5a51b5dc2b.title: USN-492-1: tcpdump vulnerability
8a3d817c74fca12354dda2dcacffdd5a51b5dc2b.body: A flaw was discovered in the BGP dissector of tcpdump. Remoteattackers could send specially crafted packets and execute arbitrarycode with user privileges.

32225973abaa1dd2ae21d41e174b27c8531e960f.title: USN-549-2: PHP regression
32225973abaa1dd2ae21d41e174b27c8531e960f.body: It was discovered that certain characters in session cookies were not handled correctly. A remote attacker could injection values which could lead to altered application behavior, potentially gaining additional privileges. (CVE-2007-3799)

df005c59f6863e541aded0d7139c6bb4bd0ed8b1.title: USN-510-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
df005c59f6863e541aded0d7139c6bb4bd0ed8b1.body: The Direct Rendering Manager for the i915 driver could be made to writeto arbitrary memory locations. An attacker with access to a running X11session could send a specially crafted buffer and gain root privileges.(CVE-2007-3851)

ea6f95aa5ea8038477c78ff59a3dbbee66e6a7b7.title: USN-509-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
ea6f95aa5ea8038477c78ff59a3dbbee66e6a7b7.body: The Direct Rendering Manager for the i915 driver could be made to writeto arbitrary memory locations. An attacker with access to a running X11session could send a specially crafted buffer and gain root privileges.(CVE-2007-3851)

0df19ee949f2bb0fe7affefea0c583eff90c7482.title: USN-526-1: debian-goodies vulnerability
0df19ee949f2bb0fe7affefea0c583eff90c7482.body: Thomas de Grenier de Latour discovered that the checkrestart program includedin debian-goodies did not correctly handle shell meta-characters. A localattacker could exploit this to gain the privileges of the user runningcheckrestart.

4f9aee356fd8659373c44843b77bfa1d8e1c9a60.title: USN-557-1: GD library vulnerability
4f9aee356fd8659373c44843b77bfa1d8e1c9a60.body: Mattias Bengtsson and Philip Olausson discovered that the GDlibrary did not properly perform bounds checking when creatingimages. An attacker could send specially crafted input toapplications linked against libgd2 and cause a denial of serviceor possibly execute arbitrary code.

6a81b829d6310fcbd54af6619e24f5ab9d8e820e.title: USN-549-2: PHP regression
6a81b829d6310fcbd54af6619e24f5ab9d8e820e.body: It was discovered that the wordwrap function did not correctly check lengths. Remote attackers could exploit this to cause a crash or monopolize CPU resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2007-3998)

f7dbc63c7ad55adb43a726d45b17aedcc3e2bb08.title: USN-511-1: Kerberos vulnerability
f7dbc63c7ad55adb43a726d45b17aedcc3e2bb08.body: It was discovered that the libraries handling RPCSEC_GSS did not correctlyvalidate the size of certain packet structures. An unauthenticated remoteuser could send a specially crafted request and execute arbitrary codewith root privileges.

8987239792a707e94bc41d19895c963f22ce942a.title: USN-515-1: t1lib vulnerability
8987239792a707e94bc41d19895c963f22ce942a.body: It was discovered that t1lib does not properly perform bounds checkingwhich can result in a buffer overflow vulnerability. An attacker couldsend specially crafted input to applications linked against t1lib whichcould result in a DoS or arbitrary code execution.

aef7e0dbd8fd13d39342390f0becb171dbf8e2e3.title: USN-513-1: Qt vulnerability
aef7e0dbd8fd13d39342390f0becb171dbf8e2e3.body: Dirk Mueller discovered that UTF8 strings could be made to cause a smallbuffer overflow. A remote attacker could exploit this by sending speciallycrafted strings to applications that use the Qt3 library for UTF8 processing,potentially leading to arbitrary code execution with user privileges, or adenial of service.
