90a703e9e080cb69d23850611fccc7b092985c39.title: USN-575-1: Apache vulnerabilities
90a703e9e080cb69d23850611fccc7b092985c39.body: It was discovered that mod_autoindex did not force a character set,which could result in browsers becoming vulnerable to cross-sitescripting attacks when processing the output. (CVE-2007-4465)

e6b52e17957f267e47f1ea3eb4f1c39ed8bf4911.title: USN-709-1: tar vulnerability
e6b52e17957f267e47f1ea3eb4f1c39ed8bf4911.body: Dmitry V. Levin discovered a buffer overflow in tar. If a user or automatedsystem were tricked into opening a specially crafted tar file, an attackercould crash tar or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking the program.

5606e357859203a5228c965cd0daafbba0497a22.title: USN-650-1: cpio vulnerability
5606e357859203a5228c965cd0daafbba0497a22.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in cpio. If a user were tricked intoopening a crafted cpio archive, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice via application crash, or possibly execute code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2007-4476)

c547259b8587b129da0557498b693c6da23d3262.title: USN-543-1: VMWare vulnerabilities
c547259b8587b129da0557498b693c6da23d3262.body: Rafal Wojtczvk discovered multiple memory corruption issues in VMWarePlayer. Attackers with administrative privileges in a guest operatingsystem could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode on the host operating system. (CVE-2007-4496, CVE-2007-4497)

5a66ce72b84a0304c3bbb7306de8b802158e557b.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5a66ce72b84a0304c3bbb7306de8b802158e557b.body: The Linux kernel did not properly validate the hop-by-hop IPv6extended header. Remote attackers could send a crafted IPv6 packetand cause a denial of service via kernel panic. This was onlyvulnerable in Ubuntu 7.04. (CVE-2007-4567)

08d5e192a47ee1621aad54238aad8d25c5897abc.title: USN-517-1: kdm vulnerability
08d5e192a47ee1621aad54238aad8d25c5897abc.body: It was discovered that KDM would allow logins without password checksunder certain circumstances. If autologin was configured, and "shutdownwith password" enabled, a local user could exploit the problem and gainroot privileges.

d8003bf027954c87e2af01b21f892ac23adca410.title: USN-544-2: Samba regression
d8003bf027954c87e2af01b21f892ac23adca410.body: USN-544-1 fixed two vulnerabilities in Samba. Fixes for CVE-2007-5398are unchanged, but the upstream changes for CVE-2007-4572 introduced aregression in all releases which caused Linux smbfs mounts to fail.Additionally, Dapper and Edgy included an incomplete patch which causedconfigurations using NetBIOS to fail. A proper fix for these regressionsdoes not exist at this time, and so the patch addressing CVE-2007-4572has been removed. This vulnerability is believed to be an unexploitabledenial of service, but a future update will address this issue. Weapologize for the inconvenience.

239e9bf7ebdaca4fcf7e73a9533d8eddc832ed67.title: USN-617-1: Samba vulnerabilities
239e9bf7ebdaca4fcf7e73a9533d8eddc832ed67.body: Samba developers discovered that nmbd could be made to overruna buffer during the processing of GETDC logon server requests.When samba is configured as a Primary or Backup Domain Controller,a remote attacker could send malicious logon requests and possiblycause a denial of service. (CVE-2007-4572)

1a8160606678fbe266d67d6c0365d5013f15ec1b.title: USN-518-1: linux-source-2.6.15, linux-source-2.6.17, linux-source-2.6.20 vulnerabilities
1a8160606678fbe266d67d6c0365d5013f15ec1b.body: Wojciech Purczynski discovered that the Linux kernel ia32 syscallemulation in x86_64 kernels did not correctly clear the high bits ofregisters. Local attackers could exploit this to gain root privileges.(CVE-2007-4573)

cbe8f9ea6b8b8c4234cabfa49def72a8030fa378.title: USN-609-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
cbe8f9ea6b8b8c4234cabfa49def72a8030fa378.body: It was discovered that arbitrary Java methods were not filtered out whenopening databases in OpenOffice.org. If a user were tricked into runninga specially crafted query, a remote attacker could execute arbitraryJava with user privileges. (CVE-2007-4575)

1b2b71f0ad38ea6d7b0f2e009742049a2a9e04f6.title: USN-507-1: tcp-wrappers vulnerability
1b2b71f0ad38ea6d7b0f2e009742049a2a9e04f6.body: It was discovered that the TCP wrapper library was incorrectly allowingconnections to services that did not specify server-side connectiondetails. Remote attackers could connect to services that had beenconfigured to block such connections. This only affected Ubuntu Feisty.

33552a7eeedd3656a3e05650b1f678793061e89d.title: USN-540-1: flac vulnerability
33552a7eeedd3656a3e05650b1f678793061e89d.body: Sean de Regge discovered that flac did not properly perform boundschecking in many situations. An attacker could send a specially craftedFLAC audio file and execute arbitrary code as the user or cause a denialof service in flac or applications that link against flac.

a8c52ddfa2932b609e9592adfabbc1158a202682.title: USN-549-2: PHP regression
a8c52ddfa2932b609e9592adfabbc1158a202682.body: Integer overflows were discovered in the strspn and strcspn functions. Attackers could exploit this to read arbitrary areas of memory, possibly gaining access to sensitive information. (CVE-2007-4657)

2ff8cf1a4814fbb022b0f904000c66f622dfd1a7.title: USN-549-2: PHP regression
2ff8cf1a4814fbb022b0f904000c66f622dfd1a7.body: It was discovered that the php_openssl_make_REQ function did not correctly check buffer lengths. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted message and execute arbitrary code with application privileges. (CVE-2007-4662)

b92d3cd927ba15a694e28a96bfa008ef340df71d.title: USN-514-1: X.org vulnerability
b92d3cd927ba15a694e28a96bfa008ef340df71d.body: Aaron Plattner discovered that the Composite extension did not correctlycalculate the size of buffers when copying between different bit depths.An authenticated user could exploit this to execute arbitrary code withroot privileges.

455bdd5793c25f628d3007845b4f04158b3f5c17.title: USN-511-2: Kerberos vulnerability
455bdd5793c25f628d3007845b4f04158b3f5c17.body: USN-511-1 fixed vulnerabilities in krb5 and librpcsecgss. The fixes wereincomplete, and only reduced the scope of the vulnerability, without fullysolving it. This update fixes the problem.Original advisory details:It was discovered that the libraries handling RPCSEC_GSS did not correctly validate the size of certain packet structures. An unauthenticated remote user could send a specially crafted request and execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

a5b12522247e9cee3a5091a05a213bc2ed570dc7.title: USN-566-1: OpenSSH vulnerability
a5b12522247e9cee3a5091a05a213bc2ed570dc7.body: Jan Pechanec discovered that ssh would forward trusted X11 cookies whenuntrusted cookie generation failed. This could lead to unintended privilegesbeing forwarded to a remote host.

e8896e93dc6b0e1878e2e480b4df92ee03f2ecb5.title: USN-591-1: libicu vulnerabilities
e8896e93dc6b0e1878e2e480b4df92ee03f2ecb5.body: Will Drewry discovered that libicu did not properly handle '\0' whenprocessing regular expressions. If an application linked against libicuprocessed a crafted regular expression, an attacker could executearbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2007-4770)

cd66ca06efd49e3bd8031bfb5384f8b8a916ead1.title: USN-591-1: libicu vulnerabilities
cd66ca06efd49e3bd8031bfb5384f8b8a916ead1.body: Will Drewry discovered that libicu did not properly limit itsbacktracking stack size. If an application linked against libicuprocessed a crafted regular expression, an attacker could cause a denialof service via resource exhaustion. (CVE-2007-4771)

c962510347518a9ebbbf6dd98454c5593d0aef51.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
c962510347518a9ebbbf6dd98454c5593d0aef51.body: It was discovered that PHP did not properly check the length of thestring parameter to the fnmatch function. An attacker could cause adenial of service in the PHP interpreter if a script passed untrustedinput to the fnmatch function. (CVE-2007-4782)

ef56e4a08f86c16a2316afbf08ff6a694f0fe97e.title: USN-700-1: Perl vulnerabilities
ef56e4a08f86c16a2316afbf08ff6a694f0fe97e.body: Jonathan Smith discovered that the Archive::Tar Perl module did notcorrectly handle symlinks when extracting archives. If a user orautomated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted tar file,a remote attacker could over-write arbitrary files. (CVE-2007-4829)

6224e432888f86db70c6c85cfa59a9f948f2d7c7.title: USN-700-2: Perl regression
6224e432888f86db70c6c85cfa59a9f948f2d7c7.body: Jonathan Smith discovered that the Archive::Tar Perl module did not correctly handle symlinks when extracting archives. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted tar file, a remote attacker could over-write arbitrary files. (CVE-2007-4829)

489bf6d02c84c2484ad508ed21e274dd4328b70d.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
489bf6d02c84c2484ad508ed21e274dd4328b70d.body: The JFFS2 filesystem with ACL support enabled did not properly storepermissions during inode creation and ACL setting. Local users couldpossibly access restricted files after a remount. This was onlyvulnerable in Ubuntu 7.04 and 7.10. (CVE-2007-4849)

499e1ca5cde1a5ed94fc591396cb17b9ef8f85a7.title: USN-558-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
499e1ca5cde1a5ed94fc591396cb17b9ef8f85a7.body: Permissions were not correctly stored on JFFS2 ACLs. For systems usingACLs on JFFS2, a local attacker may gain access to private files.(CVE-2007-4849)

1dd37450dc74635dd51e8826914b03d1e6ed45f5.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
1dd37450dc74635dd51e8826914b03d1e6ed45f5.body: Maksymilian Arciemowicz discovered a flaw in the cURL library thatallowed safe_mode and open_basedir restrictions to be bypassed. If aPHP application were tricked into processing a bad file:// request,an attacker could read arbitrary files. (CVE-2007-4850)

7bd41b7e7a17f4902cae85bac96e6968c96bb281.title: USN-561-1: pwlib vulnerability
7bd41b7e7a17f4902cae85bac96e6968c96bb281.body: Jose Miguel Esparza discovered that pwlib did not correctly handle largestring lengths. A remote attacker could send specially crafted packets toapplications linked against pwlib (e.g. Ekiga) causing them to crash, leadingto a denial of service.

5f60e6c2136503176b226aee3c8aadcd1d2ac8fe.title: USN-562-1: opal vulnerability
5f60e6c2136503176b226aee3c8aadcd1d2ac8fe.body: Jose Miguel Esparza discovered that certain SIP headers were not correctlyvalidated. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted packet toan application linked against opal (e.g. Ekiga) causing it to crash, leadingto a denial of service.

ce555b9c3bc0d4568a2d7d10e53564ca600c9f17.title: USN-585-1: Python vulnerabilities
ce555b9c3bc0d4568a2d7d10e53564ca600c9f17.body: A flaw was discovered in the Python imageop module. If a script usingthe module could be tricked into processing a specially crafted set ofarguments, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code, or cause theapplication to crash. (CVE-2007-4965)

41ebfd43dc90665bb6f0734ce1e03576183d819f.title: USN-525-1: libsndfile vulnerability
41ebfd43dc90665bb6f0734ce1e03576183d819f.body: Robert Buchholz discovered that libsndfile did not correctly validate thesize of its memory buffers. If a user were tricked into playing a speciallycrafted FLAC file, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges.

d62f42f370545118bd3591757b6f3808c564a9b2.title: USN-523-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
d62f42f370545118bd3591757b6f3808c564a9b2.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in the image decoders of ImageMagick.If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a maliciousDCM, DIB, XBM, XCF, or XWD image, a remote attacker could execute arbitrarycode with user privileges.

67caa66b75b58ecf7914287a73d083d036f46fc1.title: USN-527-1: xen-3.0 vulnerability
67caa66b75b58ecf7914287a73d083d036f46fc1.body: Joris van Rantwijk discovered that the Xen host did not correctly validatethe contents of a Xen guests's grug.conf file. Xen guest root users couldexploit this to run arbitrary commands on the host when the guest systemwas rebooted.

047830f2cf4f53f4ca7707c01398b6c84adf911c.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
047830f2cf4f53f4ca7707c01398b6c84adf911c.body: Chris Evans discovered an issue with certain drivers that use theieee80211_rx function. Remote attackers could send a crafted 802.11frame and cause a denial of service via crash. This was onlyvulnerable in Ubuntu 7.04 and 7.10. (CVE-2007-4997)

9c8d95edad9de32cc0ad5854292fb86985bc9a8c.title: USN-558-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9c8d95edad9de32cc0ad5854292fb86985bc9a8c.body: Chris Evans discovered that the 802.11 network stack did not correctlyhandle certain QOS frames. A remote attacker on the local wireless networkcould send specially crafted packets that would panic the kernel, resultingin a denial of service. (CVE-2007-4997)

2f4bc490dc87864b501696138b1ac73cd19389e0.title: USN-578-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
2f4bc490dc87864b501696138b1ac73cd19389e0.body: Chris Evans discovered an issue with certain drivers that use theieee80211_rx function. Remote attackers could send a crafted 802.11frame and cause a denial of service via crash. (CVE-2007-4997)

ea9453675cbfce61ae2c5799b60b668c9f67684e.title: USN-548-1: Pidgin vulnerability
ea9453675cbfce61ae2c5799b60b668c9f67684e.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not correctly handle certain loggingevents. A remote attacker could send specially crafted messages and causethe application to crash, leading to a denial of service.

425ab7e839fef3149a868f7d56650c7c8234f55e.title: USN-575-1: Apache vulnerabilities
425ab7e839fef3149a868f7d56650c7c8234f55e.body: It was discovered that mod_imap/mod_imagemap did not force acharacter set, which could result in browsers becoming vulnerableto cross-site scripting attacks when processing the output. Bydefault, mod_imap/mod_imagemap is disabled in Ubuntu. (CVE-2007-5000)

04e2f8a40c494e86b2e7f1f1e3098a7a9a7b857c.title: USN-519-1: elinks vulnerability
04e2f8a40c494e86b2e7f1f1e3098a7a9a7b857c.body: Kalle Olavi Niemitalo discovered that if elinks makes a POST requestto an HTTPS URL through a proxy, information may be sent in clear-textbetween elinks and the proxy. Attackers with access to the networkcould steal sensitive information (such as passwords).

225da2a6e01275bc7dec95e87ae2fb9201a2121e.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
225da2a6e01275bc7dec95e87ae2fb9201a2121e.body: Alex Smith discovered an issue with the pwc driver for certain webcamdevices. A local user with physical access to the system could removethe device while a userspace application had it open and cause the USBsubsystem to block. This was only vulnerable in Ubuntu 7.04.(CVE-2007-5093)

346440e5194650e3229437b9b4e4d7511fd39827.title: USN-558-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
346440e5194650e3229437b9b4e4d7511fd39827.body: The Philips USB Webcam driver did not correctly handle disconnects.If a local attacker tricked another user into disconnecting a webcamunsafely, the kernel could hang or consume CPU resources, leading toa denial of service. (CVE-2007-5093)

cd862cbd6496f065507ecd696a5bdb73c3905eef.title: USN-578-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
cd862cbd6496f065507ecd696a5bdb73c3905eef.body: Alex Smith discovered an issue with the pwc driver for certain webcamdevices. A local user with physical access to the system could removethe device while a userspace application had it open and cause the USBsubsystem to block. (CVE-2007-5093)

f8328a272c90078fdad3de96f0eca274d702031e.title: USN-552-1: Perl vulnerability
f8328a272c90078fdad3de96f0eca274d702031e.body: It was discovered that Perl's regular expression library did not correctlyhandle certain UTF sequences. If a user or automated system were trickedinto running a specially crafted regular expression, a remote attackercould crash the application or possibly execute arbitrary code withuser privileges.

1ffb4087fa2f0b83666af899d3983a70ce671f69.title: USN-529-1: Tk vulnerability
1ffb4087fa2f0b83666af899d3983a70ce671f69.body: It was discovered that Tk could be made to overrun a buffer when loadingcertain images. If a user were tricked into opening a specially craftedGIF image, remote attackers could cause a denial of service or executearbitrary code with user privileges.

856a787e2a069d27c58ca852cc0b821f132b050c.title: USN-596-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
856a787e2a069d27c58ca852cc0b821f132b050c.body: Chris Clark discovered that Ruby's HTTPS module did not check forcommonName mismatches early enough during SSL negotiation. If a remoteattacker were able to perform man-in-the-middle attacks, this flaw couldbe exploited to view sensitive information in HTTPS requests coming fromRuby applications. (CVE-2007-5162)

edd7401c14b9cd67ebc246be1552bb381120c2ac.title: USN-553-1: Mono vulnerability
edd7401c14b9cd67ebc246be1552bb381120c2ac.body: It was discovered that Mono did not correctly bounds check certain BigIntegeractions. Remote attackers could exploit this to crash a Mono application orpossibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

03f052daa30a55b162b01ef22a41808ee3c1aa6d.title: USN-532-1: nagios-plugins vulnerability
03f052daa30a55b162b01ef22a41808ee3c1aa6d.body: Nobuhiro Ban discovered that check_http in nagios-plugins didnot properly sanitize its input when following redirectionrequests. A malicious remote web server could cause a denialof service or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user.(CVE-2007-5198)

bce1281c51811cfb7d0a0cbd4d7a7d0d59d3c19b.title: USN-538-1: libpng vulnerabilities
bce1281c51811cfb7d0a0cbd4d7a7d0d59d3c19b.body: It was discovered that libpng did not properly perform bounds checkingand comparisons in certain operations. An attacker could send a speciallycrafted PNG image and cause a denial of service in applications linkedagainst libpng.

3b3fa9b7f4490def353643d377eabe1ac4589786.title: USN-536-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
3b3fa9b7f4490def353643d377eabe1ac4589786.body: Georgi Guninski discovered that Thunderbird would allow file-system basedweb pages to access additional files. By tricking a user into openinga malicious web page from a gnome-vfs location, an attacker could stealarbitrary files from the user's computer. (CVE-2007-5337)

917e5c4be20118bdd81fe026884e6c5ed7c824db.title: USN-536-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
917e5c4be20118bdd81fe026884e6c5ed7c824db.body: It was discovered that the XPCNativeWrappers were not safe incertain situations. By tricking a user into opening a malicious webpage, an attacker could run arbitrary JavaScript with the user'sprivileges. (CVE-2007-5338)

79a8b36317de143a7b40bbef4e168b92e72e5840.title: USN-536-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
79a8b36317de143a7b40bbef4e168b92e72e5840.body: Various flaws were discovered in the layout and JavaScript engines. Bytricking a user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2007-5339,CVE-2007-5340)

c2b89743d5a07239aea3a12fabb338bc29e7a7b7.title: USN-531-1: dhcp vulnerability
c2b89743d5a07239aea3a12fabb338bc29e7a7b7.body: Nahuel Riva and Gerardo Richarte discovered that the DHCP server did notcorrectly handle certain client options. A remote attacker could sendmalicious DHCP replies to the server and execute arbitrary code.

39998b77d5d3992e329e91ad3e251f3cf7b9f398.title: USN-531-2: dhcp vulnerability
39998b77d5d3992e329e91ad3e251f3cf7b9f398.body: USN-531-1 fixed vulnerabilities in dhcp. The fixes were incomplete,and only reduced the scope of the vulnerability, without fully solvingit. This update fixes the problem.Original advisory details:Nahuel Riva and Gerardo Richarte discovered that the DHCP server did not correctly handle certain client options. A remote attacker could send malicious DHCP replies to the server and execute arbitrary code.

c531af585b5d6a53532da3f09fcaae8f639d8cc3.title: USN-542-1: poppler vulnerabilities
c531af585b5d6a53532da3f09fcaae8f639d8cc3.body: Secunia Research discovered several vulnerabilities in poppler. If auser were tricked into loading a specially crafted PDF file, a remoteattacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode with the user's privileges in applications linked against poppler.

6c9b28581b114a1b9a030b2e381f5b66d8e180ca.title: USN-542-2: KOffice vulnerabilities
6c9b28581b114a1b9a030b2e381f5b66d8e180ca.body: USN-542-1 fixed a vulnerability in poppler. This update provides thecorresponding updates for KWord, part of KOffice.Original advisory details:Secunia Research discovered several vulnerabilities in poppler. If a user were tricked into loading a specially crafted PDF file, a remote attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges in applications linked against poppler.

d9866c28b7b1a66e14fe5d1343dc765cb005fcbd.title: USN-545-1: link-grammar vulnerability
d9866c28b7b1a66e14fe5d1343dc765cb005fcbd.body: Alin Rad Pop discovered that AbiWord's Link Grammar parser did notcorrectly handle overly-long words. If a user were tricked into openinga specially crafted document, AbiWord, or other applications using LinkGrammar, could be made to crash.

c30418ac9e4ec5a15b222fbe42000dc134f8939a.title: USN-555-1: e2fsprogs vulnerability
c30418ac9e4ec5a15b222fbe42000dc134f8939a.body: Rafal Wojtczuk discovered multiple integer overflows in e2fsprogs. If auser or automated system were tricked into fscking a malicious ext2/ext3filesystem, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with the user'sprivileges.

ae5600ab04e87ab73071fa7167d4261b575bd1fb.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
ae5600ab04e87ab73071fa7167d4261b575bd1fb.body: It was discovered that the Xen hypervisor block driver did not correctlyvalidate requests. A user with root privileges in a guest OS could make amalicious IO request with a large number of blocks that would crash thehost OS, leading to a denial of service. This only affected Ubuntu 7.10.(CVE-2007-5498)

dda9c6c2613cb390a6bdb53f7d1474c451705e28.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
dda9c6c2613cb390a6bdb53f7d1474c451705e28.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel could dereference a NULLpointer when processing certain IPv4 TCP packets. A remote attackercould send a crafted TCP ACK response and cause a denial of servicevia crash. This was only vulnerable in Ubuntu 7.10. (CVE-2007-5501)

42dba179837983d43e3477c74921457a5341f753.title: USN-558-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
42dba179837983d43e3477c74921457a5341f753.body: Ilpo Järvinen discovered that it might be possible for the TCP stackto panic the kernel when receiving a crafted ACK response. Only Ubuntu7.10 contained the vulnerable code, and it is believed not to havebeen exploitable. (CVE-2007-5501)

9f8a170d90c9fec011d7d3dd179b29ffdd136a26.title: USN-551-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
9f8a170d90c9fec011d7d3dd179b29ffdd136a26.body: Thomas Sesselmann discovered that the OpenLDAP slapd serverdid not properly handle certain modify requests. A remoteattacker could send malicious modify requests to the serverand cause a denial of service. (CVE-2007-5707)

d2371b3c76f993c9a9bb04da788aede75a8b0cfb.title: USN-551-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
d2371b3c76f993c9a9bb04da788aede75a8b0cfb.body: Toby Blake discovered that slapd did not properly terminatean array while running as a proxy-caching server. A remoteattacker may be able to send crafted search requests to theserver and cause a denial of service. This issue only affectsUbuntu 7.04 and 7.10. (CVE-2007-5708)

40dfefb7e47f965d0ea4b7dc5d33c0cac136ab32.title: USN-609-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
40dfefb7e47f965d0ea4b7dc5d33c0cac136ab32.body: Multiple memory overflow flaws were discovered in OpenOffice.org'shandling of Quattro Pro, EMF, and OLE files. If a user were trickedinto opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker might beable to execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2007-5745,CVE-2007-5746, CVE-2007-5747, CVE-2008-0320)

94a6939a8aab7f5892dc2bfa6b5f80769ab7d0c3.title: USN-596-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
94a6939a8aab7f5892dc2bfa6b5f80769ab7d0c3.body: It was discovered that Ruby's FTPTLS, telnets, and IMAPS modulesdid not check the commonName when performing SSL certificate checks.If a remote attacker were able to perform man-in-the-middle attacks,this flaw could be exploited to eavesdrop on encrypted communicationsfrom Ruby applications using these protocols. (CVE-2007-5770)

58882e4557790689ee24254a9721f783cf5e9592.title: USN-564-1: Net-SNMP vulnerability
58882e4557790689ee24254a9721f783cf5e9592.body: Bill Trost discovered that snmpd did not properly limit GETBULKrequests. A remote attacker could specify a large number ofmax-repetitions and cause a denial of service via resourceexhaustion.

75c3c0f2e3bf07ee4525ace0ebbe8a2d8fb3bda0.title: USN-563-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
75c3c0f2e3bf07ee4525ace0ebbe8a2d8fb3bda0.body: Wei Wang discovered that the SNMP discovery backend did notcorrectly calculate the length of strings. If a user were tricked intoscanning for printers, a remote attacker could send a specially craftedpacket and possibly execute arbitrary code.Elias Pipping discovered that temporary files were not handled safelyin certain situations when converting PDF to PS. A local attacker couldcause a denial of service.

6792bd8f57dfaafc739d55dcce407d7f6ed25c51.title: USN-549-2: PHP regression
6792bd8f57dfaafc739d55dcce407d7f6ed25c51.body: It was discovered that the output_add_rewrite_var fucntion would sometimes leak session id information to forms targeting remote URLs. Malicious remote sites could use this information to gain access to a PHP application user's login credentials. (CVE-2007-5899)

7ad3066ebe5b0134f7a461bb6a11ca92fdb18fdd.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
7ad3066ebe5b0134f7a461bb6a11ca92fdb18fdd.body: It was discovered that the output_add_rewrite_var function wouldsometimes leak session id information to forms targeting remote URLs.Malicious remote sites could use this information to gain access to aPHP application user's login credentials. This issue only affectsUbuntu 8.04 LTS. (CVE-2007-5899)

1e4dc748edaeb263cab0f6f6bbaa05effba5c634.title: USN-924-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
1e4dc748edaeb263cab0f6f6bbaa05effba5c634.body: It was discovered that Kerberos did not correctly free memory inthe GSSAPI library. If a remote attacker were able to manipulate anapplication using GSSAPI carefully, the service could crash, leading toa denial of service. (Ubuntu 8.10 was not affected.) (CVE-2007-5901,CVE-2007-5971)

ad86cd607add0d9a46575ff77c070aa4c2c484b8.title: USN-924-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
ad86cd607add0d9a46575ff77c070aa4c2c484b8.body: It was discovered that Kerberos did not correctly free memory in theGSSAPI and kdb libraries. If a remote attacker were able to manipulatean application using these libraries carefully, the service could crash,leading to a denial of service. (Only Ubuntu 8.04 LTS was affected.)(CVE-2007-5902, CVE-2007-5972)

27f69f82421509b13305cd35b61d40af56888ba1.title: USN-940-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
27f69f82421509b13305cd35b61d40af56888ba1.body: It was discovered that Kerberos did not correctly free memory in theGSSAPI and kdb libraries. If a remote attacker were able to manipulatean application using these libraries carefully, the service couldcrash, leading to a denial of service. (Only Ubuntu 6.06 LTS wasaffected.) (CVE-2007-5902, CVE-2007-5971, CVE-2007-5972)

c6d11ab7f2cb170d15808cc0f5d680afa69bdc0a.title: USN-618-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c6d11ab7f2cb170d15808cc0f5d680afa69bdc0a.body: Multiple buffer overflows were discovered in the handling of CIFSfilesystems. A malicious CIFS server could cause a client system crashor possibly execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges. (CVE-2007-5904)

69a096de6c30e2904bf01fd4942fd85d6e94f5f3.title: USN-1397-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
69a096de6c30e2904bf01fd4942fd85d6e94f5f3.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in MySQL and this update includesnew upstream MySQL versions to fix these issues.MySQL has been updated to 5.1.61 in Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 10.10,Ubuntu 11.04 and Ubuntu 11.10. Ubuntu 8.04 LTS has been updated toMySQL 5.0.95.In addition to security fixes, the updated packages contain bug fixes, newfeatures, and possibly incompatible changes.Please see the following for more information:http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/news-5-1-x.htmlhttp://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/news-5-0-x.htmlhttp://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpujan2012-366304.html

c45ff4a4b3ed05ee8ba312a052d6691bd38de788.title: USN-546-2: Firefox regression
c45ff4a4b3ed05ee8ba312a052d6691bd38de788.body: It was discovered that Firefox incorrectly associated redirected sites as the origin of "jar:" contents. A malicious web site could exploit this to modify or steal confidential data (such as passwords) from other web sites. (CVE-2007-5947)

df83e09ad2771bf316007c50d188b84b1b74654f.title: USN-546-2: Firefox regression
df83e09ad2771bf316007c50d188b84b1b74654f.body: Gregory Fleischer discovered that it was possible to use JavaScript to manipulate Firefox's Referer header. A malicious web site could exploit this to conduct cross-site request forgeries against sites that relied only on Referer headers for protection from such attacks. (CVE-2007-5960)

2ec82b05b94104b51eedbc429e2bf5e85f33b173.title: USN-579-1: Qt vulnerability
2ec82b05b94104b51eedbc429e2bf5e85f33b173.body: It was discovered that QSslSocket did not properly verify SSLcertificates. A remote attacker may be able to trick applicationsusing QSslSocket into accepting invalid SSL certificates.

d6f8edc8e2200ec417ea5ec439f8e2aa21d6dece.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d6f8edc8e2200ec417ea5ec439f8e2aa21d6dece.body: Warren Togami discovered that the hrtimer subsystem did not properlycheck for large relative timeouts. A local user could exploit this andcause a denial of service via soft lockup. (CVE-2007-5966)

afb1e706fc5167340c3cd5e577b36fab9f3378c4.title: USN-556-1: Samba vulnerability
afb1e706fc5167340c3cd5e577b36fab9f3378c4.body: Alin Rad Pop discovered that Samba did not correctly check the sizeof reply packets to mailslot requests. If a server was configuredwith domain logon enabled, an unauthenticated remote attacker could senda specially crafted domain logon packet and execute arbitrary code orcrash the Samba service. By default, domain logon is disabled in Ubuntu.

c77fd4329c18e629d655a0cc0650c0fbcebfb9a8.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c77fd4329c18e629d655a0cc0650c0fbcebfb9a8.body: Venustech AD-LAB discovered a buffer overflow in the isdn netsubsystem. This issue is exploitable by local users via crafted inputto the isdn_ioctl function. (CVE-2007-6063)

d5edb4b1319b13a33cc3b4f8c45a960c1936ef14.title: USN-578-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d5edb4b1319b13a33cc3b4f8c45a960c1936ef14.body: Venustech AD-LAB discovered a buffer overflow in the isdn netsubsystem. This issue is exploitable by local users via crafted inputto the isdn_ioctl function. (CVE-2007-6063)

dd7e05807d250b209a6c12d2a17e64f9ee354704.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
dd7e05807d250b209a6c12d2a17e64f9ee354704.body: It was discovered that the isdn subsystem did not properly check forNULL termination when performing ioctl handling. A local user couldexploit this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2007-6151)

0c1ad086aeed9ad25edeba62a7f801198fa3ae53.title: USN-578-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
0c1ad086aeed9ad25edeba62a7f801198fa3ae53.body: It was discovered that the isdn subsystem did not properly check forNULL termination when performing ioctl handling. A local user couldexploit this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2007-6151)

a3d367c56d8739f998f641ab7d787e8a5ef84379.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
a3d367c56d8739f998f641ab7d787e8a5ef84379.body: It was discovered that Apache did not sanitize the method specifier header froman HTTP request when it is returned in an error message, which could result inbrowsers becoming vulnerable to cross-site scripting attacks when processing theoutput. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked intoviewing server output during a crafted server request, a remote attacker couldexploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data (such aspasswords), within the same domain. This issue only affected Ubuntu 6.06 LTS and7.10. (CVE-2007-6203)

80300704c53425f1840cc280634673e16d7abcf2.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
80300704c53425f1840cc280634673e16d7abcf2.body: Blake Frantz discovered that when a root process overwrote an existingcore file, the resulting core file retained the previous core file'sownership. Local users could exploit this to gain access to sensitiveinformation. (CVE-2007-6206)

9979edff8d2450b70ea0607e3294b831fa3c90d6.title: USN-578-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9979edff8d2450b70ea0607e3294b831fa3c90d6.body: Blake Frantz discovered that when a root process overwrote an existingcore file, the resulting core file retained the previous core file'sownership. Local users could exploit this to gain access to sensitiveinformation. (CVE-2007-6206)

0d4fab6654ca3ea7668a9b03115881c28f39ee36.title: USN-565-1: Squid vulnerability
0d4fab6654ca3ea7668a9b03115881c28f39ee36.body: It was discovered that Squid did not always clean up cache memorycorrectly. A remote attacker could manipulate cache update replies andcause Squid to use all available memory, leading to a denial of service.

193774f0a96e6d0c766cae40611ed87c23340485.title: USN-654-1: libexif vulnerabilities
193774f0a96e6d0c766cae40611ed87c23340485.body: Meder Kydyraliev discovered that libexif did not correctly handle certainEXIF headers. If a user or automated system were tricked into processinga specially crafted image, a remote attacker could cause the applicationlinked against libexif to crash, leading to a denial of service, orpossibly executing arbitrary code with user privileges.

4bac6856a97a21150aec458242776ff9eb3a2bb5.title: USN-655-1: exiv2 vulnerabilities
4bac6856a97a21150aec458242776ff9eb3a2bb5.body: Meder Kydyraliev discovered that exiv2 did not correctly handle certainEXIF headers. If a user or automated system were tricked into processinga specially crafted image, a remote attacker could cause the applicationlinked against libexiv2 to crash, leading to a denial of service, orpossibly executing arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2007-6353)

5651404e4e8a58d63dcd0bd28258feb45ac95295.title: USN-575-1: Apache vulnerabilities
5651404e4e8a58d63dcd0bd28258feb45ac95295.body: It was discovered that mod_status when status pages were available,allowed for cross-site scripting attacks. By default, mod_status isdisabled in Ubuntu. (CVE-2007-6388)

a1712ee3759e9d0647378a6836102a5a6dd0cf04.title: USN-574-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a1712ee3759e9d0647378a6836102a5a6dd0cf04.body: Hugh Dickins discovered the when using the tmpfs filesystem, underrare circumstances, a kernel page may be improperly cleared. A localuser may be able to exploit this and read sensitive kernel data orcause a denial of service via crash. (CVE-2007-6417)

7750a77fa8c3a8bc7cf4110a2b504cf96644aa50.title: USN-578-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7750a77fa8c3a8bc7cf4110a2b504cf96644aa50.body: Hugh Dickins discovered the when using the tmpfs filesystem, underrare circumstances, a kernel page may be improperly cleared. A localuser may be able to exploit this and read sensitive kernel data orcause a denial of service via crash. (CVE-2007-6417)

3a93b1ebdd5fbbfefafabd4dd849f615e5e25bd2.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
3a93b1ebdd5fbbfefafabd4dd849f615e5e25bd2.body: It was discovered that Apache was vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery(CSRF) in the mod_proxy_balancer balancer manager. If an Apache administratorwere tricked into clicking a link on a specially crafted web page, an attackercould trigger commands that could modify the balancer manager configuration.This issue only affected Ubuntu 7.10 and 8.04 LTS. (CVE-2007-6420)

d8b08388e64b797b4d0af707ea4945170d3f6037.title: USN-575-1: Apache vulnerabilities
d8b08388e64b797b4d0af707ea4945170d3f6037.body: It was discovered that mod_proxy_balancer did not sanitize its input,which could result in browsers becoming vulnerable to cross-sitescripting attacks when processing the output. By default,mod_proxy_balancer is disabled in Ubuntu. This was only vulnerablein Ubuntu 7.04 and 7.10. (CVE-2007-6421)

de5d5235933bc18e986c1c0e837442c7ae6baebb.title: USN-575-1: Apache vulnerabilities
de5d5235933bc18e986c1c0e837442c7ae6baebb.body: It was discovered that mod_proxy_balancer could be made todereference a NULL pointer. A remote attacker could send a craftedrequest and cause a denial of service via application crash. Bydefault, mod_proxy_balancer is disabled in Ubuntu. This was onlyvulnerable in Ubuntu 7.04 and 7.10. (CVE-2007-6422)

56b2114c2c6c54479c98a041137d7d789f0818c5.title: USN-567-1: Dovecot vulnerability
56b2114c2c6c54479c98a041137d7d789f0818c5.body: It was discovered that in very rare configurations using LDAP, Dovecot mayreuse cached connections for users with the same password. As a result,a user may be able to login as another if the connection is reused.The default Ubuntu configuration of Dovecot was not vulnerable.

5e1230a29362a1416748ec57683ec771493d36cb.title: USN-580-1: libcdio vulnerability
5e1230a29362a1416748ec57683ec771493d36cb.body: Devon Miller discovered that the iso-info and cd-info tools did notproperly perform bounds checking. If a user were tricked into usingthese tools with a crafted iso image, an attacker could cause adenial of service (core dump) and possibly execute arbitrary code.

c46865e59392510a1ce4506ecbafa859b96d57bc.title: USN-618-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c46865e59392510a1ce4506ecbafa859b96d57bc.body: It was discovered that PowerPC kernels did not correctly handle reportingcertain system details. By requesting a specific set of information,a local attacker could cause a system crash resulting in a denialof service. (CVE-2007-6694)

879fff2ec36fcbc6b1d653bb7211f890ecd36a59.title: USN-595-1: SDL_image vulnerabilities
879fff2ec36fcbc6b1d653bb7211f890ecd36a59.body: Michael Skladnikiewicz discovered that SDL_image did not correctly loadGIF images. If a user or automated system were tricked into processinga specially crafted GIF, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary codeor cause a crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2007-6697)

445d6f692feafe171dd8f544a4a897f48caeb5e3.title: USN-584-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
445d6f692feafe171dd8f544a4a897f48caeb5e3.body: Jonathan Clarke discovered that the OpenLDAP slapd server did notproperly handle modify requests when using the Berkeley DB backendand specifying the NOOP control. An authenticated user with modifypermissions could send a crafted modify request and cause a denialof service via application crash. Ubuntu 7.10 is not affected bythis issue. (CVE-2007-6698)

df734f0050873f0d9f5bb1a8e0d5218ef9e0d27e.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
df734f0050873f0d9f5bb1a8e0d5218ef9e0d27e.body: Johannes Bauer discovered that the 64bit kernel did not correctly handlehrtimer updates. A local attacker could request a large expiration valueand cause the system to hang, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2007-6712)

b4f429f9ed4bbd0c0155de7539619b7f3152ead6.title: USN-1821-1: telepathy-idle vulnerability
b4f429f9ed4bbd0c0155de7539619b7f3152ead6.body: It was discovered that telepathy-idle did not perform any servercertificate validation when using SSL connections. If a remote attackerwere able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could beexploited to alter or compromise confidential information.

d57db4a529e770ecc9cbc515d4d5257b43e65c07.title: USN-575-1: Apache vulnerabilities
d57db4a529e770ecc9cbc515d4d5257b43e65c07.body: It was discovered that mod_proxy_ftp did not force a character set,which could result in browsers becoming vulnerable to cross-sitescripting attacks when processing the output. By default,mod_proxy_ftp is disabled in Ubuntu. (CVE-2008-0005)

b6bd900be4112f0654778480957f269ba7ea482b.title: USN-618-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b6bd900be4112f0654778480957f269ba7ea482b.body: It was discovered that some device driver fault handlers did notcorrectly verify memory ranges. A local attacker could exploit thisto access sensitive kernel memory, possibly leading to a loss of privacy.(CVE-2008-0007)

3b10f9829f055ce2351183651c7cfe9d00a0d960.title: USN-573-1: PulseAudio vulnerability
3b10f9829f055ce2351183651c7cfe9d00a0d960.body: It was discovered that PulseAudio did not properly drop privilegeswhen running as a daemon. Local users may be able to exploit thisand gain privileges. The default Ubuntu configuration is notaffected.

5e225713c08f8755f4cf50b65e452daaa88e486a.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
5e225713c08f8755f4cf50b65e452daaa88e486a.body: Justin Schuh, Tom Cross and Peter Williams discovered errors in the Firefox URL parsing routines. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted hyperlink, an attacker could overflow a stack buffer and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-0016)

133a314b757ba98b9ad48a13733986d4aefcf494.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
133a314b757ba98b9ad48a13733986d4aefcf494.body: Justin Schuh, Tom Cross and Peter Williams discovered errors in theFirefox URL parsing routines. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted hyperlink, an attacker could overflow a stack buffer andexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-0016)

a77343a5c245d58067b263bc4fb6213a147907af.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
a77343a5c245d58067b263bc4fb6213a147907af.body: Justin Schuh discovered a flaw in Firefox's mime-type parsing. If auser were tricked into opening a malicious website, an attacker couldsend a crafted header in the HTTP index response, causing a browsercrash and execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-0017)

3ff07aa0e13931df03ceec519359f99b3296de36.title: USN-598-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
3ff07aa0e13931df03ceec519359f99b3296de36.body: It was discovered that the CUPS administration interface contained a heap-based overflow flaw. A local attacker, and a remote attacker if printersharing is enabled, could send a malicious request and possibly executearbitrary code as the non-root user in Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, 6.10, and 7.04.In Ubuntu 7.10, attackers would be isolated by the AppArmor CUPS profile.(CVE-2008-0047)

5618a35476cfdb6946794c9f0b6bfb70299df600.title: USN-598-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
5618a35476cfdb6946794c9f0b6bfb70299df600.body: It was discovered that the hpgl filter in CUPS did not properly validateits input when parsing parameters. If a crafted HP-GL/2 file were printed,an attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code as the non-root userin Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, 6.10, and 7.04. In Ubuntu 7.10, attackers would beisolated by the AppArmor CUPS profile. (CVE-2008-0053)

ae681f0b1552f9eebe3f20220e9d165efd22d886.title: USN-587-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
ae681f0b1552f9eebe3f20220e9d165efd22d886.body: It was discovered that krb5 did not correctly handle certain krb4requests. An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit this flawby sending a specially crafted traffic, which could expose sensitiveinformation, cause a crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-0062,CVE-2008-0063)

bde0451b6163454d2073ef6f433a9ce3db690a39.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
bde0451b6163454d2073ef6f433a9ce3db690a39.body: Alin Rad Pop discovered an array index vulnerability in the SDPparser. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening amalicious RTSP stream, a remote attacker may be able to executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2008-0073)

03b9cc4d4716e520da9c4b9c5011313544bfb605.title: USN-612-1: OpenSSL vulnerability
03b9cc4d4716e520da9c4b9c5011313544bfb605.body: We consider this an extremely serious vulnerability, and urge allusers to act immediately to secure their systems. (CVE-2008-0166)

5dbf67c72318dba49f911ec854da3f7f685fe2ff.title: USN-612-2: OpenSSH vulnerability
5dbf67c72318dba49f911ec854da3f7f685fe2ff.body: A weakness has been discovered in the random number generator usedby OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu systems. As a result of thisweakness, certain encryption keys are much more common than theyshould be, such that an attacker could guess the key through abrute-force attack given minimal knowledge of the system. Thisparticularly affects the use of encryption keys in OpenSSH.This vulnerability only affects operating systems which (likeUbuntu) are based on Debian. However, other systems can beindirectly affected if weak keys are imported into them.We consider this an extremely serious vulnerability, and urge allusers to act immediately to secure their systems.

13b9068bfb4861ca36c4aa9309d1238ac028842f.title: USN-612-3: OpenVPN vulnerability
13b9068bfb4861ca36c4aa9309d1238ac028842f.body: A weakness has been discovered in the random number generator usedby OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu systems. As a result of thisweakness, certain encryption keys are much more common than theyshould be, such that an attacker could guess the key through abrute-force attack given minimal knowledge of the system. Thisparticularly affects the use of shared encryption keys and SSL/TLScertificates in OpenVPN.This vulnerability only affects operating systems which (likeUbuntu) are based on Debian. However, other systems can beindirectly affected if weak keys are imported into them.We consider this an extremely serious vulnerability, and urge allusers to act immediately to secure their systems.

e9f404e82271c61f50b19120afbc370cd41c24bd.title: USN-612-4: ssl-cert vulnerability
e9f404e82271c61f50b19120afbc370cd41c24bd.body: We consider this an extremely serious vulnerability, and urge all users to act immediately to secure their systems. (CVE-2008-0166)

5d8fc7c6b7a0c223aacbc4745132692422da2d92.title: USN-612-7: OpenSSH update
5d8fc7c6b7a0c223aacbc4745132692422da2d92.body: USN-612-2 introduced protections for OpenSSH, related to the OpenSSLvulnerabilities addressed by USN-612-1. This update provides thecorresponding updates for OpenSSH in Ubuntu 6.06 LTS. While the OpenSSLin Ubuntu 6.06 is not vulnerable, this update will block weak keysgenerated on systems that may have been affected themselves.Original advisory details:A weakness has been discovered in the random number generator used by OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu systems. As a result of this weakness, certain encryption keys are much more common than they should be, such that an attacker could guess the key through a brute-force attack given minimal knowledge of the system. This particularly affects the use of encryption keys in OpenSSH, OpenVPN and SSL certificates.

718ddaaefb61a491b7e9b37248528b62345abb45.title: USN-570-1: boost vulnerabilities
718ddaaefb61a491b7e9b37248528b62345abb45.body: Will Drewry and Tavis Ormandy discovered that the boost librarydid not properly perform input validation on regular expressions.An attacker could send a specially crafted regular expression toan application linked against boost and cause a denial of servicevia application crash.

e9fe4da1660f174079271cdae1342c9739fd75f6.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
e9fe4da1660f174079271cdae1342c9739fd75f6.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered that xine-lib did not properly checkbuffer sizes in the RTSP header-handling code. If xine-lib opened anRTSP stream with crafted SDP attributes, a remote attacker may beable to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-0225, CVE-2008-0238)

0da691e1338077a155e9a82a5c749b5cde927eba.title: USN-588-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
0da691e1338077a155e9a82a5c749b5cde927eba.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered that yaSSL as included in MySQL did notproperly validate its input. A remote attacker could send craftedrequests and cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 6.06 in the default installation.(CVE-2008-0226, CVE-2008-0227)

4f1b534e764f45852d91999f4ec532ba20a351f9.title: USN-572-1: apt-listchanges vulnerability
4f1b534e764f45852d91999f4ec532ba20a351f9.body: Felipe Sateler discovered that apt-listchanges did not use safe paths whenimporting additional Python libraries. A local attacker could exploitthis and execute arbitrary commands as the user running apt-listchanges.

87e6632869134622f999975759cd57bf25cebf6d.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
87e6632869134622f999975759cd57bf25cebf6d.body: It was discovered that Thunderbird did not properly set the size of abuffer when parsing an external-body MIME-type. If a user were to opena specially crafted email, an attacker could cause a denial of servicevia application crash or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user.(CVE-2008-0304)

75dafa74c72bd97473d26eb24b0f7bc068a871ff.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
75dafa74c72bd97473d26eb24b0f7bc068a871ff.body: It was discovered that Thunderbird did not properly set the size of a buffer when parsing an external-body MIME-type. If a user were to open a specially crafted email, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user. (CVE-2008-0304)

4700dbb1a3a9733c8b2a22fddf08ed17763426d9.title: USN-599-1: Ghostscript vulnerability
4700dbb1a3a9733c8b2a22fddf08ed17763426d9.body: Chris Evans discovered that Ghostscript contained a buffer overflow inits color space handling code. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a crafted Postscript file, an attacker could causea denial of service or execute arbitrary code with privileges of theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2008-0411)

f2c722a8fadf232e9e07495feb78901b2421e939.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
f2c722a8fadf232e9e07495feb78901b2421e939.body: Various flaws were discovered in the browser and JavaScript engine.By tricking a user into opening a malicious web page, an attackercould execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

407de9e8ca4a4856578322c4a881b2a1ca0f583f.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
407de9e8ca4a4856578322c4a881b2a1ca0f583f.body: Various flaws were discovered in Thunderbird and its JavaScriptengine. By tricking a user into opening a malicious message, anattacker could execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

af334a9a4cd5f6de31c4ac2b09729f2a62ffef57.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
af334a9a4cd5f6de31c4ac2b09729f2a62ffef57.body: Various flaws were discovered in Thunderbird and its JavaScript engine. By tricking a user into opening a malicious message, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0412, CVE-2008-0413)

a41717efe442c3b56ec5d92c1a923c8af0c9f0a9.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a41717efe442c3b56ec5d92c1a923c8af0c9f0a9.body: Flaws were discovered in the file upload form control. A maliciouswebsite could force arbitrary files from the user's computer to beuploaded without consent. (CVE-2008-0414)

72b550d1f1f050f4c3a12c29eb864bd983182fd7.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
72b550d1f1f050f4c3a12c29eb864bd983182fd7.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. By trickinga user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could escalateprivileges within the browser, perform cross-site scripting attacksand/or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0415)

0070d658b80c03e4120aadaef9ed25eaf929dc64.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
0070d658b80c03e4120aadaef9ed25eaf929dc64.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. By trickinga user into opening a malicious message, an attacker could escalateprivileges within Thunderbird, perform cross-site scripting attacksand/or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0415)

cc4d6688f4838303bbe9c5cbd1a253d30840b62c.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
cc4d6688f4838303bbe9c5cbd1a253d30840b62c.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. By tricking a user into opening a malicious message, an attacker could escalate privileges within Thunderbird, perform cross-site scripting attacks and/or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0415)

c0918acaab3a92731f4dba9d288d60fa56526674.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
c0918acaab3a92731f4dba9d288d60fa56526674.body: Alexey Proskuryakov, Yosuke Hasegawa and Simon Montagu discovered flawsin Firefox's character encoding handling. If a user were tricked intoopening a malicious web page, an attacker could perform cross-sitescripting attacks. (CVE-2008-0416)

0e74efb4d1ec1420ab3c3dc82eccce4296ec8437.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
0e74efb4d1ec1420ab3c3dc82eccce4296ec8437.body: Justin Dolske discovered a flaw in the password saving mechanism. Bytricking a user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker couldcorrupt the user's stored passwords. (CVE-2008-0417)

920b80b2e313fe5eb1514de2d42e752a3c37b55b.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
920b80b2e313fe5eb1514de2d42e752a3c37b55b.body: Gerry Eisenhaur discovered that the chrome URI scheme did not properlyguard against directory traversal. Under certain circumstances, anattacker may be able to load files or steal session data. Ubuntu isnot vulnerable in the default installation. (CVE-2008-0418)

10e2970378a2b5ed7d01ce6b138c6e618a6f125e.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
10e2970378a2b5ed7d01ce6b138c6e618a6f125e.body: Gerry Eisenhaur discovered that the chrome URI scheme did not properlyguard against directory traversal. Under certain circumstances, anattacker may be able to load files or steal session data. Ubuntu is notvulnerable in the default installation. (CVE-2008-0418)

1911cbd17f1461555c9804976587cc58d08efcfc.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
1911cbd17f1461555c9804976587cc58d08efcfc.body: Gerry Eisenhaur discovered that the chrome URI scheme did not properly guard against directory traversal. Under certain circumstances, an attacker may be able to load files or steal session data. Ubuntu is not vulnerable in the default installation. (CVE-2008-0418)

55215b65025c729de62eee2f40b512ea48d6f150.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
55215b65025c729de62eee2f40b512ea48d6f150.body: David Bloom discovered flaws in the way images are treated by thebrowser. A malicious website could exploit this to steal the user'shistory information, crash the browser and/or possibly executearbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-0419)

1b9d0842f5b7c6186e6bb90942060f299f679642.title: USN-582-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
1b9d0842f5b7c6186e6bb90942060f299f679642.body: Flaws were discovered in the BMP decoder. By tricking a user intoopening a specially crafted BMP file, an attacker could obtainsensitive information. (CVE-2008-0420)

84787f68034f738d2136a4f85540bfcf844a9894.title: USN-582-2: Thunderbird regression
84787f68034f738d2136a4f85540bfcf844a9894.body: Flaws were discovered in the BMP decoder. By tricking a user into opening a specially crafted BMP file, an attacker could obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2008-0420)

15b94093d63e6e743219fc96e47288fe2c5ccf8b.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
15b94093d63e6e743219fc96e47288fe2c5ccf8b.body: Damian Frizza and Alfredo Ortega discovered that xine-lib did notproperly validate FLAC tags. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a crafted FLAC file, a remote attacker may beable to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-0486)

7357ef37ff65cc4abea45c37688f46ea81d09b94.title: USN-595-1: SDL_image vulnerabilities
7357ef37ff65cc4abea45c37688f46ea81d09b94.body: David Raulo discovered that SDL_image did not correctly load ILBM images.If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a speciallycrafted ILBM, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code or causea crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-0544)

9c5e1f5a740a83eb4ea7a06e5fea56e9d617d8ee.title: USN-664-1: Tk vulnerability
9c5e1f5a740a83eb4ea7a06e5fea56e9d617d8ee.body: It was discovered that Tk could be made to overrun a buffer when loadingcertain images. If a user were tricked into opening a specially craftedGIF image, remote attackers could cause a denial of service or executearbitrary code with user privileges.

6ca3deea3165f1d01193e81b81f10e83f5084127.title: USN-665-1: Netpbm vulnerability
6ca3deea3165f1d01193e81b81f10e83f5084127.body: It was discovered that Netpbm could be made to overrun a buffer when loadingcertain images. If a user were tricked into opening a specially craftedGIF image, remote attackers could cause a denial of service or executearbitrary code with user privileges.

e98658c00f92e4a193b06087e74a8595b757d7ec.title: USN-586-1: mailman vulnerability
e98658c00f92e4a193b06087e74a8595b757d7ec.body: Multiple cross-site scripting flaws were discovered in mailman.A malicious list administrator could exploit this to execute arbitraryJavaScript, potentially stealing user credentials.

49fd3a7fbc473c1d2f71888e0754f2c25e7488bb.title: USN-576-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
49fd3a7fbc473c1d2f71888e0754f2c25e7488bb.body: Martin Straka discovered flaws in stylesheet handling after a 302redirect. By tricking a user into opening a malicious web page, anattacker could obtain sensitive URL parameters. (CVE-2008-0593)

145b0ed3f6ef300de4d90ea7719bd80dc32f19ed.title: USN-653-1: D-Bus vulnerabilities
145b0ed3f6ef300de4d90ea7719bd80dc32f19ed.body: Havoc Pennington discovered that the D-Bus daemon did not correctlyvalidate certain security policies. If a local user sent a speciallycrafted D-Bus request, they could bypass security policies that had a"send_interface" defined. (CVE-2008-0595)

677490e59c196de4809596ce3f492b543a3c640f.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
677490e59c196de4809596ce3f492b543a3c640f.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the ia32 emulation under 64bit kernels didnot fully clear uninitialized data. A local attacker could read privatekernel memory, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2008-0598)

6a767200639038088715bd2d4be3f9bbb1c71eb5.title: USN-577-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
6a767200639038088715bd2d4be3f9bbb1c71eb5.body: Wojciech Purczynski discovered that the vmsplice system call didnot properly perform verification of user-memory pointers. A localattacker could exploit this to overwrite arbitrary kernel memoryand gain root privileges. (CVE-2008-0600)

b25e8bc7e0fe5b8614e23bd668d3cffca11676fd.title: USN-584-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
b25e8bc7e0fe5b8614e23bd668d3cffca11676fd.body: Jonathan Clarke discovered that the OpenLDAP slapd server did notproperly handle modify requests when using the Berkeley DB backendand specifying the NOOP control. An authenticated user with modifypermissions could send a crafted modify request and cause a denialof service via application crash. Ubuntu 7.10 is not affected bythis issue. (CVE-2007-6698)Ralf Haferkamp discovered that the OpenLDAP slapd server did notproperly handle modrdn requests when using the Berkeley DB backendand specifying the NOOP control. An authenticated user with modrdnpermissions could send a crafted modrdn request and possibly cause adenial of service via application crash. (CVE-2007-6698)

526975035907523f8b57df813c474a59cd91e1c6.title: USN-604-1: Gnumeric vulnerability
526975035907523f8b57df813c474a59cd91e1c6.body: Thilo Pfennig and Morten Welinder discovered that the XLS spreadsheethandling code in Gnumeric did not correctly calculate needed memory sizes.If a user or automated system were tricked into loading a specially craftedXLS document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges.

1c1adc79d740ed0aa1c199a1773a247f9d258983.title: USN-598-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
1c1adc79d740ed0aa1c199a1773a247f9d258983.body: It was discovered that CUPS had a flaw in its managing of remote sharedprinters via IPP. A remote attacker could send a crafted UDP packet andcause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code as thenon-root user in Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, 6.10, and 7.04. In Ubuntu 7.10,attackers would be isolated by the AppArmor CUPS profile. (CVE-2008-0882)

2964ab0883c1bd534ce749d9629f6743db5e4571.title: USN-589-1: unzip vulnerability
2964ab0883c1bd534ce749d9629f6743db5e4571.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that unzip did not correctly clean up pointers.If a user or automated service was tricked into processing a speciallycrafted ZIP archive, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code withuser privileges.

107f83b95db4a8091fdb524ab0b9498f13c3241d.title: USN-620-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
107f83b95db4a8091fdb524ab0b9498f13c3241d.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL was vulnerable to a double-freewhen using TLS server extensions. A remote attacker could send acrafted packet and cause a denial of service via application crashin applications linked against OpenSSL. Ubuntu 8.04 LTS does notcompile TLS server extensions by default. (CVE-2008-0891)

f97831742b7593c8c789ff2c2713594c6a540972.title: USN-587-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
f97831742b7593c8c789ff2c2713594c6a540972.body: A flaw was discovered in the kadmind service's handling of filedescriptors. An unauthenticated remote attacker could send speciallycrafted requests that would cause a crash, resulting in a denial ofservice. Only systems with configurations allowing large numbers ofopen file descriptors were vulnerable. (CVE-2008-0947)

40d8afd35377892de6ce771433c6a7eccbfa4597.title: USN-685-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
40d8afd35377892de6ce771433c6a7eccbfa4597.body: Wes Hardaker discovered that the SNMP service did not correctly validateHMAC authentication requests. An unauthenticated remote attackercould send specially crafted SNMPv3 traffic with a valid usernameand gain access to the user's views without a valid authenticationpassphrase. (CVE-2008-0960)

b18d4ba7a8f0b95b7771478ccef1cb66916936c9.title: USN-747-1: ICU vulnerability
b18d4ba7a8f0b95b7771478ccef1cb66916936c9.body: It was discovered that libicu did not correctly handle certain invalidencoded data. If a user or automated system were tricked into processingspecially crafted data with applications linked against libicu, certaincontent filters could be bypassed.

c4604cd1aa5abdb0a136ac2efbcd9d3d4a4f70c9.title: USN-681-1: ImageMagick vulnerability
c4604cd1aa5abdb0a136ac2efbcd9d3d4a4f70c9.body: It was discovered that ImageMagick did not correctly handle certainmalformed XCF images. If a user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted image with an application that uses ImageMagick, an attackercould cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code withthe user's privileges.

76d76a848bea27b740fe2ad336d68058c694ce39.title: USN-617-2: Samba regression
76d76a848bea27b740fe2ad336d68058c694ce39.body: Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research discovered that Samba did not properly perform bounds checking when parsing SMB replies. A remote attacker could send crafted SMB packets and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-1105)

fce5a5236f936657f4c019c192b64af6e3de020f.title: USN-617-1: Samba vulnerabilities
fce5a5236f936657f4c019c192b64af6e3de020f.body: Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research discovered that Samba did notproperly perform bounds checking when parsing SMB replies. A remoteattacker could send crafted SMB packets and execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2008-1105)

a84ddbcbb4d321cee94b88ec0ec308ee0d334e25.title: USN-615-1: Evolution vulnerabilities
a84ddbcbb4d321cee94b88ec0ec308ee0d334e25.body: Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research discovered that Evolution did notproperly validate timezone data when processing iCalendar attachments.If a user disabled the ITip Formatter plugin and viewed a craftediCalendar attachment, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute code with user privileges. Note that the ITipFormatter plugin is enabled by default in Ubuntu. (CVE-2008-1108)

88b5cb6bd01c9fe2c233886f0f2770f94bf3535a.title: USN-615-1: Evolution vulnerabilities
88b5cb6bd01c9fe2c233886f0f2770f94bf3535a.body: Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research discovered that Evolution did notproperly validate the DESCRIPTION field when processing iCalendarattachments. If a user were tricked into accepting a craftediCalendar attachment and replied to it from the calendar window, anattacker code cause a denial of service or execute code with userprivileges. (CVE-2008-1109)

e3893565af18a1ba67eb153b93c73fc67a61d36d.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
e3893565af18a1ba67eb153b93c73fc67a61d36d.body: It was discovered that the ASF demuxer in xine-lib did not properlycheck the length if the ASF header. If a user or automated systemwere tricked into opening a crafted ASF file, a remote attackercould cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary codewith the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-1110)

9d5d0237cd626fa9853ccce6cfb2ed23f2927b29.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
9d5d0237cd626fa9853ccce6cfb2ed23f2927b29.body: It was discovered that the Matroska demuxer in xine-lib did notproperly verify frame sizes. If xine-lib opened a crafted ASF file,a remote attacker could cause a denial of service or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2008-1161)

2ea78f21a45c8a332401c72348c138aa7f54f5c1.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
2ea78f21a45c8a332401c72348c138aa7f54f5c1.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. By trickinga user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could escalateprivileges within the browser, perform cross-site scripting attacksand/or execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-1233, CVE-2008-1234, CVE-2008-1235)

7999b43601e5e8a3b1e909cc8df0e3788f2b72c1.title: USN-605-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
7999b43601e5e8a3b1e909cc8df0e3788f2b72c1.body: Various flaws were discovered in the JavaScript engine. If a user hadJavaScript enabled and were tricked into opening a malicious email,an attacker could escalate privileges within Thunderbird, performcross-site scripting attacks and/or execute arbitrary code with theuser's privileges. (CVE-2008-1233, CVE-2008-1234, CVE-2008-1235)

09ec8a0a317724e7885c8fb211e7b4d5efc86524.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
09ec8a0a317724e7885c8fb211e7b4d5efc86524.body: Several problems were discovered in Firefox which could lead to crashesand memory corruption. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciousweb page, an attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code with theuser's privileges. (CVE-2008-1236, CVE-2008-1237)

7b5a8e4ca90ed68b823c16ae3d507effe73c4f25.title: USN-605-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
7b5a8e4ca90ed68b823c16ae3d507effe73c4f25.body: Several problems were discovered in Thunderbird which could lead tocrashes and memory corruption. If a user had JavaScript enabled andwere tricked into opening a malicious email, an attacker may be ableto execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-1236,CVE-2008-1237)

289c966534519d1f9fea1fcad583ccac4e5f17dc.title: USN-592-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
289c966534519d1f9fea1fcad583ccac4e5f17dc.body: Gregory Fleischer discovered Firefox did not properly process HTTPReferrer headers when they were sent with with requests to URLscontaining Basic Authentication credentials with empty usernames. Anattacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site requestforgery attacks. (CVE-2008-1238)

1e24079fcadfddc9a739a001354922143736bf98.title: USN-618-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
1e24079fcadfddc9a739a001354922143736bf98.body: It was discovered that CPU resource limits could be bypassed.A malicious local user could exploit this to avoid administrativelyimposed resource limits. (CVE-2008-1294)

7349b66fb51cab3b51847eb282fca246db14d6c7.title: USN-598-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
7349b66fb51cab3b51847eb282fca246db14d6c7.body: It was discovered that CUPS did not properly perform bounds checking inits GIF decoding routines. If a crafted GIF file were printed, an attackercould possibly execute arbitrary code as the non-root user in Ubuntu 6.06LTS, 6.10, and 7.04. In Ubuntu 7.10, attackers would be isolated by theAppArmor CUPS profile. (CVE-2008-1373)

c15270fc79d43096d39cbabc27c9b166ebdc58d7.title: USN-616-1: X.org vulnerabilities
c15270fc79d43096d39cbabc27c9b166ebdc58d7.body: Multiple flaws were found in the RENDER, RECORD, and Securityextensions of X.org which did not correctly validate function arguments.An authenticated attacker could send specially crafted requests and gainroot privileges or crash X. (CVE-2008-1377, CVE-2008-2360, CVE-2008-2361,CVE-2008-2362)

20b30769d84a9f33600bc83a735e1da183c5bff0.title: USN-616-1: X.org vulnerabilities
20b30769d84a9f33600bc83a735e1da183c5bff0.body: It was discovered that the MIT-SHM extension of X.org did not correctlyvalidate the location of memory during an image copy. An authenticatedattacker could exploit this to read arbitrary memory locations within X,exposing sensitive information. (CVE-2008-1379)

5b8c269eb7e0bded32c61b41d882a15425034082.title: USN-602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
5b8c269eb7e0bded32c61b41d882a15425034082.body: Flaws were discovered in Firefox which could lead to crashes duringJavaScript garbage collection. If a user were tricked into opening amalicious web page, an attacker may be able to crash the browser orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-1380)

88c0a2db372b74e514b2d3715c287376acb81c5f.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
88c0a2db372b74e514b2d3715c287376acb81c5f.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the php_sprintf_appendstringfunction. Attackers could exploit this to cause a denial of service.(CVE-2008-1384)

72e016d3356b91041cf9cbeda36f80f4282583b6.title: USN-682-1: libvorbis vulnerabilities
72e016d3356b91041cf9cbeda36f80f4282583b6.body: It was discovered that libvorbis did not correctly handle certain malformedsound files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted soundfile with an application that uses libvorbis, an attacker could executearbitrary code with the user's privileges.

4a67f68fc7999207e3f5ac6ac0a7efaf3fd6a3e6.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
4a67f68fc7999207e3f5ac6ac0a7efaf3fd6a3e6.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered multiple integer overflows in xine-lib. Ifa user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted FLV,MOV, RM, MVE, MKV or CAK file, a remote attacker may be able toexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-1482)

a64963865736934550e8adadc9e6ae185b289ef0.title: USN-601-1: Squid vulnerability
a64963865736934550e8adadc9e6ae185b289ef0.body: It was discovered that Squid did not perform proper bounds checking whenprocessing cache update replies. A remote authenticated user may be ableto trigger an assertion error and cause a denial of service. Thisvulnerability is due to an incorrect upstream fix for CVE-2007-6239.(CVE-2008-1612)

013a222a33f0f0714d5362f9d2ba34f3b2727c45.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
013a222a33f0f0714d5362f9d2ba34f3b2727c45.body: Jan Kratochvil discovered that PTRACE did not correctly handle certaincalls when running under 64bit kernels. A local attacker could exploit thisto crash the system, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-1615)

83ff7ab4ad08d7bf8eb22550345625ad93ea9a68.title: USN-649-1: OpenSSH vulnerabilities
83ff7ab4ad08d7bf8eb22550345625ad93ea9a68.body: It was discovered that the ForceCommand directive could be bypassed.If a local user created a malicious ~/.ssh/rc file, they could executearbitrary commands as their user id. This only affected Ubuntu 7.10.(CVE-2008-1657)

7fd89531934292ab57d1c0ed3d477d7b9b2b5030.title: USN-618-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7fd89531934292ab57d1c0ed3d477d7b9b2b5030.body: On SMP systems, a race condition existed in fcntl(). Local attackerscould perform malicious locks, causing system crashes and leading toa denial of service. (CVE-2008-1669)

49d594c7517cc499551f8bda60ecb8796b5722d1.title: USN-620-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
49d594c7517cc499551f8bda60ecb8796b5722d1.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL could dereference a NULL pointer.If a user or automated system were tricked into connecting to amalicious server with particular cipher suites, a remote attackercould cause a denial of service via application crash.(CVE-2008-1672)

eace64c9d4be13b912d2ea1c9c16a82ff936df1a.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
eace64c9d4be13b912d2ea1c9c16a82ff936df1a.body: Wei Wang discovered that the ASN.1 decoding routines in CIFS and SNMP NATdid not correctly handle certain length values. Remote attackers couldexploit this to execute arbitrary code or crash the system. (CVE-2008-1673)

2536e1de866c1aaff72dbd7164128775b6fb6ddc.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
2536e1de866c1aaff72dbd7164128775b6fb6ddc.body: It was discovered that Apache had a memory leak when using mod_ssl withcompression. A remote attacker could exploit this to exhaust server memory,leading to a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 7.10.(CVE-2008-1678)

79ea287e1fb61c934fbaa8608ba3f2c75f5a634b.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
79ea287e1fb61c934fbaa8608ba3f2c75f5a634b.body: It was discovered that there were new integer overflows in the imageopmodule. If an attacker were able to trick a Python application intoprocessing a specially crafted image, they could execute arbitrary codewith user privileges. (CVE-2008-1679)

f6702ae68303a40aafd7527eb01269446ae8071d.title: USN-611-1: Speex vulnerability
f6702ae68303a40aafd7527eb01269446ae8071d.body: It was discovered that Speex did not properly validate its input whenprocessing Speex file headers. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a specially crafted Speex file, an attacker couldcreate a denial of service in applications linked against Speex orpossibly execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.

57b40eff08d02c60b371ea6fedbda583c8e0339c.title: USN-611-2: vorbis-tools vulnerability
57b40eff08d02c60b371ea6fedbda583c8e0339c.body: USN-611-1 fixed a vulnerability in Speex. This update provides thecorresponding update for ogg123, part of vorbis-tools.Original advisory details:It was discovered that Speex did not properly validate its input when processing Speex file headers. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted Speex file, an attacker could create a denial of service in applications linked against Speex or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.

9268c7b9bfbff0813b2de888b7d10fa0b35167b5.title: USN-611-3: GStreamer Good Plugins vulnerability
9268c7b9bfbff0813b2de888b7d10fa0b35167b5.body: USN-611-1 fixed a vulnerability in Speex. This update provides thecorresponding update for GStreamer Good Plugins.Original advisory details:It was discovered that Speex did not properly validate its input when processing Speex file headers. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted Speex file, an attacker could create a denial of service in applications linked against Speex or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.

7ec6291107770505b27320b08110140cd29b0753.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
7ec6291107770505b27320b08110140cd29b0753.body: It was discovered that xine-lib did not properly validate its inputwhen processing Speex file headers. If a user or automated systemwere tricked into opening a specially crafted Speex file, anattacker could create a denial of service or possibly executearbitrary code as the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-1686)

bc8e0b907a7635525ef35126d17b86fc93df0899.title: USN-603-1: poppler vulnerability
bc8e0b907a7635525ef35126d17b86fc93df0899.body: It was discovered that the poppler PDF library did not correctly handlecertain malformed embedded fonts. If a user or an automated system weretricked into opening a malicious PDF, a remote attacker could executearbitrary code with user privileges.

78e44bdf891dcf087f944d6c9b516417e6d008f1.title: USN-603-2: KOffice vulnerability
78e44bdf891dcf087f944d6c9b516417e6d008f1.body: USN-603-1 fixed vulnerabilities in poppler. This update provides thecorresponding updates for KWord, part of KOffice.Original advisory details:It was discovered that the poppler PDF library did not correctly handle certain malformed embedded fonts. If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a malicious PDF, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

7dbd45ea585c9f600525dc43a9afc52498ac39f4.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
7dbd45ea585c9f600525dc43a9afc52498ac39f4.body: Justin Ferguson discovered that the zlib module did not correctlyhandle certain archives. If an attacker were able to trick a Pythonapplication into processing a specially crafted archive file, they couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-1721)

5c5c93efe4e674cb68fe49387491e9bdba98ab8b.title: USN-606-1: CUPS vulnerability
5c5c93efe4e674cb68fe49387491e9bdba98ab8b.body: Thomas Pollet discovered that CUPS did not properly validate the size ofPNG images. A local attacker, and a remote attacker if printer sharingis enabled, could send a crafted file and cause a denial of service orpossibly execute arbitrary code as the non-root user in Ubuntu 6.06 LTSand 7.04. In Ubuntu 7.10, attackers would be isolated by the AppArmorCUPS profile. (CVE-2008-1722)

c22621923715636d8e1d6d4b6c837fdec548ecfe.title: USN-633-1: libxslt vulnerabilities
c22621923715636d8e1d6d4b6c837fdec548ecfe.body: It was discovered that long transformation matches in libxslt couldoverflow. If an attacker were able to make an application linked againstlibxslt process malicious XSL style sheet input, they could executearbitrary code with user privileges or cause the application to crash,leading to a denial of serivce. (CVE-2008-1767)

92c2ba0295b5fca4f8ddc85da05403624cbb87c9.title: USN-646-1: rdesktop vulnerabilities
92c2ba0295b5fca4f8ddc85da05403624cbb87c9.body: It was discovered that rdesktop did not properly validate the lengthof packet headers when processing RDP requests. If a user were trickedinto connecting to a malicious server, an attacker could cause adenial of service or possible execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user. (CVE-2008-1801)

3b485ed77b753dafcb9d73d7379df482a3e38b62.title: USN-646-1: rdesktop vulnerabilities
3b485ed77b753dafcb9d73d7379df482a3e38b62.body: Multiple buffer overflows were discovered in rdesktop when processingRDP redirect requests. If a user were tricked into connecting to amalicious server, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossible execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user.(CVE-2008-1802)

363252ee0a4f4393e57e42b570a90aeaa4e212f0.title: USN-646-1: rdesktop vulnerabilities
363252ee0a4f4393e57e42b570a90aeaa4e212f0.body: It was discovered that rdesktop did not properly validate the lengthof packet headers when processing RDP requests. If a user were trickedinto connecting to a malicious server, an attacker could cause adenial of service or possible execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user. (CVE-2008-1801)Multiple buffer overflows were discovered in rdesktop when processingRDP redirect requests. If a user were tricked into connecting to amalicious server, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossible execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user.(CVE-2008-1802)It was discovered that rdesktop performed a signed integer comparisonwhen reallocating dynamic buffers which could result in a heap-basedoverflow. If a user were tricked into connecting to a maliciousserver, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibleexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user.(CVE-2008-1802)

1491682f6a47489e80b781af66901d784e949af7.title: USN-643-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
1491682f6a47489e80b781af66901d784e949af7.body: Multiple flaws were discovered in the PFB and TTF font handling codein freetype.
