If a user were tricked into using a specially craftedfont file, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges or cause the application linked against freetype to crash,leading to a denial of service.

0b18b9ed06eae87663b72da2f823d7147b1c52a2.title: USN-635-1: xine-lib vulnerabilities
0b18b9ed06eae87663b72da2f823d7147b1c52a2.body: Guido Landi discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in xine-libwhen processing NSF files. If xine-lib opened a specially craftedNSF file with a long NSF title, an attacker could create a denial ofservice or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-1878)

4c9f9d0ebe69213e37842ae3587508d9c04f05b5.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
4c9f9d0ebe69213e37842ae3587508d9c04f05b5.body: Justin Ferguson discovered that certain string manipulations in Pythoncould be made to overflow. If an attacker were able to pass a speciallycrafted string through the PyString_FromStringAndSize function, theycould execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-1887)

f445b6b0bcdf7998a1626ff52e58649dd1d11f06.title: USN-700-1: Perl vulnerabilities
f445b6b0bcdf7998a1626ff52e58649dd1d11f06.body: Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry discovered that Perl did not correctlyhandle certain utf8 characters in regular expressions. If a user orautomated system were tricked into using a specially crafted expression,a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denialof service. Ubuntu 8.10 was not affected by this issue. (CVE-2008-1927)

0ac4586ed07ae9205046c338032c2ada240b5486.title: USN-700-2: Perl regression
0ac4586ed07ae9205046c338032c2ada240b5486.body: Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry discovered that Perl did not correctly handle certain utf8 characters in regular expressions. If a user or automated system were tricked into using a specially crafted expression, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service. Ubuntu 8.10 was not affected by this issue. (CVE-2008-1927)

9cd83178561c97fd335a7e84c8e2e9efbf7c6d7a.title: USN-613-1: GnuTLS vulnerabilities
9cd83178561c97fd335a7e84c8e2e9efbf7c6d7a.body: Multiple flaws were discovered in the connection handling of GnuTLS.A remote attacker could exploit this to crash applications linkedagainst GnuTLS, or possibly execute arbitrary code with permissions ofthe application's user.

f4e5f1c633247448437cbec7acf3883cb789c06b.title: USN-776-1: KVM vulnerabilities
f4e5f1c633247448437cbec7acf3883cb789c06b.body: Avi Kivity discovered that KVM did not correctly handle certain diskformats. A local attacker could attach a malicious partition thatwould allow the guest VM to read files on the VM host. (CVE-2008-1945,CVE-2008-2004)

6c6c5e763d5c1bfd414f565a21031898ba33b242.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
6c6c5e763d5c1bfd414f565a21031898ba33b242.body: Andrei Nigmatulin discovered stack-based overflows in the FastCGI SAPIof PHP. An attacker may be able to leverage this issue to performattacks against PHP applications. (CVE-2008-2050)

8c96776e83139c0f2c5b493f89ce884faf676a68.title: USN-671-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
8c96776e83139c0f2c5b493f89ce884faf676a68.body: It was discovered that MySQL could be made to overwrite existing tablefiles in the data directory. An authenticated user could use theDATA DIRECTORY and INDEX DIRECTORY options to possibly bypass privilegechecks. This update alters table creation behaviour by disallowing theuse of the MySQL data directory in DATA DIRECTORY and INDEX DIRECTORYoptions. (CVE-2008-2079, CVE-2008-4097 and CVE-2008-4098)

c34a1e29b56f6c1b2e03ccaeee56a122ad66db8b.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
c34a1e29b56f6c1b2e03ccaeee56a122ad66db8b.body: It was discovered that the GENERATE_SEED macro produced a predictableseed under certain circumstances. Attackers may by able to easilypredict the results of the rand and mt_rand functions.(CVE-2008-2107, CVE-2008-2108)

aa3fda1d0f0c8eb9ee240c8e7492f5cb9acdde17.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
aa3fda1d0f0c8eb9ee240c8e7492f5cb9acdde17.body: Paul Marks discovered that the SIT interfaces did not correctly manageallocated memory. A remote attacker could exploit this to fill allavailable memory, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2136)

8454be416de84f559ccefdc99e92f6bb468b066b.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8454be416de84f559ccefdc99e92f6bb468b066b.body: David Miller and Jan Lieskovsky discovered that the Sparc kernel did notcorrectly range-check memory regions allocated with mmap. A local attackercould exploit this to crash the system, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-2137)

35fd39e4f6c94ff096ca1554ffb6c2da2d416215.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
35fd39e4f6c94ff096ca1554ffb6c2da2d416215.body: The sys_utimensat system call did not correctly check file permissions incertain situations. A local attacker could exploit this to modify the filetimes of arbitrary files which could lead to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-2148)

01eec967dd1c3379cfc7b3ab29136ff0348b2268.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
01eec967dd1c3379cfc7b3ab29136ff0348b2268.body: It was discovered that in certain conditions, Apache did not specify a defaultcharacter set when returning certain error messages containing UTF-7 encodeddata, which could result in browsers becoming vulnerable to cross-site scriptingattacks when processing the output. This issue only affected Ubuntu 6.06 LTS and7.10. (CVE-2008-2168)

50c41fa1efa50aa8e405e4155f8a975f34bfe484.title: USN-677-2: OpenOffice.org Internationalization update
50c41fa1efa50aa8e405e4155f8a975f34bfe484.body: Multiple memory overflow flaws were discovered in OpenOffice.org's handling of WMF and EMF files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker might be able to execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-2237, CVE-2008-2238)

7c972ce9531a75c9240c04603b1df8e3b502bd58.title: USN-677-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
7c972ce9531a75c9240c04603b1df8e3b502bd58.body: Multiple memory overflow flaws were discovered in OpenOffice.org's handling ofWMF and EMF files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafteddocument, a remote attacker might be able to execute arbitrary code with userprivileges. (CVE-2008-2237, CVE-2008-2238)

f6accf8450a3c91e73c4f8260966e50dcbb552a8.title: USN-612-5: OpenSSH update
f6accf8450a3c91e73c4f8260966e50dcbb552a8.body: Matt Zimmerman discovered that entries in ~/.ssh/authorized_keyswith options (such as "no-port-forwarding" or forced commands) wereignored by the new ssh-vulnkey tool introduced in OpenSSH (seeUSN-612-2). This could cause some compromised keys not to belisted in ssh-vulnkey's output.This update also adds more information to ssh-vulnkey's manual page.Original advisory details:A weakness has been discovered in the random number generator used by OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu systems. As a result of this weakness, certain encryption keys are much more common than they should be, such that an attacker could guess the key through a brute-force attack given minimal knowledge of the system. This particularly affects the use of encryption keys in OpenSSH, OpenVPN and SSL certificates.

5807c3e3f5b1adc7bd6754b3a600033f1d26299b.title: USN-685-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
5807c3e3f5b1adc7bd6754b3a600033f1d26299b.body: John Kortink discovered that the Net-SNMP Perl module did not correctlycheck the size of returned values. If a user or automated system weretricked into querying a malicious SNMP server, the application usingthe Perl module could be made to crash, leading to a denial of service.This did not affect Ubuntu 8.10. (CVE-2008-2292)

0550b6bcd886dcd666ccd6b30e59163988d5b7f5.title: USN-632-1: Python vulnerabilities
0550b6bcd886dcd666ccd6b30e59163988d5b7f5.body: Multiple integer overflows were discovered in Python's core and modulesincluding hashlib, binascii, pickle, md5, stringobject, unicodeobject,bufferobject, longobject, tupleobject, stropmodule, gcmodule, andmmapmodule. If an attacker were able to exploit these flaws they couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges or cause Python applicationsto crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2315, CVE-2008-2316,CVE-2008-3142, CVE-2008-3143, CVE-2008-3144).

9ed354cbeab7cb218b2c7da7af998075fab38c75.title: USN-639-1: tiff vulnerability
9ed354cbeab7cb218b2c7da7af998075fab38c75.body: Drew Yao discovered that the TIFF library did not correctly validate LZWcompressed TIFF images. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a malicious image, a remote attacker could execute arbitrarycode or cause an application linked against libtiff to crash, leadingto a denial of service.

e47952ae3f6a262b3257eff5221781b90e23ce3a.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e47952ae3f6a262b3257eff5221781b90e23ce3a.body: Brandon Edwards discovered that the DCCP system in the kernel did notcorrectly check feature lengths. A remote attacker could exploit this toexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-2358)

094a7b90cfe3591028bb5808d5a2c89fe2007ce2.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
094a7b90cfe3591028bb5808d5a2c89fe2007ce2.body: It was discovered that when configured as a proxy server, Apache did not limitthe number of forwarded interim responses. A malicious remote server could senda large number of interim responses and cause a denial of service via memoryexhaustion. (CVE-2008-2364)

384989a212389cdebed816eec1ed913c963b2ae3.title: USN-624-1: PCRE vulnerability
384989a212389cdebed816eec1ed913c963b2ae3.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the PCRE library did not correctly handlecertain in-pattern options. An attacker could cause applications linkedagainst pcre3 to crash, leading to a denial of service.

6e2c4eca9bd70c90a4d5ba5945ca194fd556fe1a.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
6e2c4eca9bd70c90a4d5ba5945ca194fd556fe1a.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the PCRE library did not correctlyhandle certain in-pattern options. An attacker could cause PHPapplications using pcre to crash, leading to a denial of service.USN-624-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the pcre3 library. This updateprovides the corresponding update for PHP. (CVE-2008-2371)

3f69a7d1f3d0ef16ac51fab682394fb2f4765cca.title: USN-624-2: Erlang vulnerability
3f69a7d1f3d0ef16ac51fab682394fb2f4765cca.body: USN-624-1 fixed a vulnerability in PCRE. This update provides thecorresponding update for Erlang.Original advisory details:Tavis Ormandy discovered that the PCRE library did not correctly handle certain in-pattern options. An attacker could cause applications linked against pcre3 to crash, leading to a denial of service.

958b8fc7bd24df962e0c06dcb00135bb9f262d36.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
958b8fc7bd24df962e0c06dcb00135bb9f262d36.body: It was discovered that the disabling of the ZERO_PAGE optimization couldlead to large memory consumption. A local attacker could exploit this toallocate all available memory, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-2372)

056152297bf21cdc0283753199d35b961df99276.title: USN-776-1: KVM vulnerabilities
056152297bf21cdc0283753199d35b961df99276.body: Alfredo Ortega discovered that KVM's VNC protocol handler did notcorrectly validate certain messages. A remote attacker could sendspecially crafted VNC messages that would cause KVM to consume CPUresources, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2382)

4213d8fafc5651f22a170ed93b071e7cc225f766.title: USN-697-1: Imlib2 vulnerability
4213d8fafc5651f22a170ed93b071e7cc225f766.body: It was discovered that Imlib2 did not correctly handle certain malformed XPMand PNG images. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted imagewith an application that uses Imlib2, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice and possibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

7dedc0f4d3b53019b83905f87f12ad971990aa51.title: USN-621-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
7dedc0f4d3b53019b83905f87f12ad971990aa51.body: Drew Yao discovered several vulnerabilities in Ruby which lead to integeroverflows. If a user or automated system were tricked into running amalicious script, an attacker could cause a denial of service or executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2008-2662, CVE-2008-2663, CVE-2008-2725, CVE-2008-2726)

72803dea3b149df7e762e303d7b698a6126aa8cb.title: USN-621-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
72803dea3b149df7e762e303d7b698a6126aa8cb.body: Drew Yao discovered that Ruby did not sanitize its input when using ALLOCA.If a user or automated system were tricked into running a malicious script,an attacker could cause a denial of service via memory corruption.(CVE-2008-2664)

43c0689de92d053548ef78bd665901d80dec890f.title: USN-655-1: exiv2 vulnerabilities
43c0689de92d053548ef78bd665901d80dec890f.body: Joakim Bildrulle discovered that exiv2 did not correctly handle Nikonlens EXIF information. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a specially crafted image, a remote attacker could cause theapplication linked against libexiv2 to crash, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2008-2696)

11bf9963c8c504ac7ac47ffc7020d8eb5d350112.title: USN-712-1: Vim vulnerabilities
11bf9963c8c504ac7ac47ffc7020d8eb5d350112.body: Jan Minar discovered that Vim did not properly sanitize inputs before invokingthe execute or system functions inside Vim scripts. If a user were trickedinto running Vim scripts with a specially crafted input, an attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2008-2712)

ef53fb07e009fd134d620f25b8db443a623b3ba2.title: USN-648-1: nasm vulnerability
ef53fb07e009fd134d620f25b8db443a623b3ba2.body: Philipp Thomas discovered that the ppscan function of nasm containedan off-by-one error. If a user or automated system were tricked intoassembling a specially crafted ASM file, a remote attacker could executearbitrary commands with user privileges.

bebaa4ef143cf073a91373971930a08416df0a36.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
bebaa4ef143cf073a91373971930a08416df0a36.body: The copy_to_user routine in the kernel did not correctly clear memorydestination addresses when running on 64bit kernels. A local attacker couldexploit this to gain access to sensitive kernel memory, leading to a lossof privacy. (CVE-2008-2729)

1ee299f55f187b4c60d70f9d0fdf410cab80e3d8.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
1ee299f55f187b4c60d70f9d0fdf410cab80e3d8.body: The PPP over L2TP routines in the kernel did not correctly handle certainmessages. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted packet thatcould crash the system or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-2750)

9a73034d2058e2dee78291beb064e2304ec61f49.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
9a73034d2058e2dee78291beb064e2304ec61f49.body: A flaw was discovered in the browser engine. A variable could be madeto overflow causing Thunderbird to crash. If a user enable Javascriptand was tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker couldcause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-2785)

eb15c8f6e92d695fe1f38fda1a433ea9d6aee219.title: USN-623-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
eb15c8f6e92d695fe1f38fda1a433ea9d6aee219.body: A flaw was discovered in the browser engine. A variable could be made tooverflow causing the browser to crash. If a user were tricked into openinga malicious web page, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2008-2785)

d479f0c72920a0a4db57a569e127c851c98dc2ef.title: USN-626-2: Devhelp, Epiphany, Midbrowser and Yelp update
d479f0c72920a0a4db57a569e127c851c98dc2ef.body: A flaw was discovered in the browser engine. A variable could be made to overflow causing the browser to crash. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-2785)

e5aa587e213d1e13ada2585a940af43870054793.title: USN-626-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
e5aa587e213d1e13ada2585a940af43870054793.body: A flaw was discovered in the browser engine. A variable could be made tooverflow causing the browser to crash. If a user were tricked into openinga malicious web page, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2008-2785)

60c56caa4d517985ad7697e200079b6e82112e3c.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
60c56caa4d517985ad7697e200079b6e82112e3c.body: Various flaws were discovered in the browser engine. By trickinga user into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could causea denial of service via application crash, or possibly executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-2798, CVE-2008-2799)

699b5c10a03e297965500866ce4f725da778bbab.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
699b5c10a03e297965500866ce4f725da778bbab.body: Various flaws were discovered in the browser engine. If a user hadJavascript enabled and were tricked into opening a malicious webpage, an attacker could cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2008-2798, CVE-2008-2799)

916b43474edcfa3516abac5563fb6a43e4f78351.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
916b43474edcfa3516abac5563fb6a43e4f78351.body: Several problems were discovered in the JavaScript engine. If auser were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attackercould perform cross-site scripting attacks. (CVE-2008-2800)

52e9534fbde00f25328d34604e68d2c4a37ee70a.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
52e9534fbde00f25328d34604e68d2c4a37ee70a.body: Collin Jackson discovered various flaws in the JavaScript enginewhich allowed JavaScript to be injected into signed JAR files. Ifa user were tricked into opening malicious web content, anattacker may be able to execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof a different website or link content within the JAR file to anattacker-controlled JavaScript file. (CVE-2008-2801)

d79879881dea50d9fd78e8422a4c1a333992bbca.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d79879881dea50d9fd78e8422a4c1a333992bbca.body: It was discovered that Firefox would allow non-privileged XULdocuments to load chrome scripts from the fastload file. Thiscould allow an attacker to execute arbitrary JavaScript code withchrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2802)

6a685cc49c902ca12ec0be7f19fb713e742666b6.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
6a685cc49c902ca12ec0be7f19fb713e742666b6.body: It was discovered that Thunderbird would allow non-privileged XULdocuments to load chrome scripts from the fastload file if Javascriptwas enabled. This could allow an attacker to execute arbitraryJavascript code with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2802)

6878e14a74d891751869112e133acd0f0cc26724.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
6878e14a74d891751869112e133acd0f0cc26724.body: A flaw was discovered in Firefox that allowed overwriting trustedobjects via mozIJSSubScriptLoader.loadSubScript(). If a user weretricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-2803)

f12fa96da552cd37d2da781c52a78edf5e683feb.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
f12fa96da552cd37d2da781c52a78edf5e683feb.body: A flaw was discovered in Thunderbird that allowed overwriting trustedobjects via mozIJSSubScriptLoader.loadSubScript(). If a user hadJavascript enabled and was tricked into opening a malicious web page,an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2008-2803)

24053167da16a5d537210810590c3798a271e71a.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
24053167da16a5d537210810590c3798a271e71a.body: Claudio Santambrogio discovered a vulnerability in Firefox whichcould lead to stealing of arbitrary files. If a user were trickedinto opening malicious content, an attacker could force the browserinto uploading local files to the remote server. (CVE-2008-2805)

9662fd3df670316bdb0bbc6b1e88a42337797e63.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
9662fd3df670316bdb0bbc6b1e88a42337797e63.body: Gregory Fleischer discovered a flaw in Java LiveConnect. An attackercould exploit this to bypass the same-origin policy and createarbitrary socket connections to other domains. (CVE-2008-2806)

1a761d26f8ae28445ae7bab45c0b6079e1bd6e07.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
1a761d26f8ae28445ae7bab45c0b6079e1bd6e07.body: Daniel Glazman found that an improperly encoded .properties filein an add-on can result in uninitialized memory being used. Ifa user were tricked into installing a malicious add-on, thebrowser may be able to see data from other programs.(CVE-2008-2807)

8a46ae2f5ed95a08e60e1734865736eebc563a9e.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
8a46ae2f5ed95a08e60e1734865736eebc563a9e.body: Daniel Glazman found that an improperly encoded .properties file inan add-on can result in uninitialized memory being used. If a userwere tricked into installing a malicious add-on, Thunderbird may beable to see data from other programs. (CVE-2008-2807)

059e09163e7b86426398bff0f15d8823a615cacf.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
059e09163e7b86426398bff0f15d8823a615cacf.body: Masahiro Yamada discovered that Firefox did not properly sanitizefile URLs in directory listings, resulting in files from directorylistings being opened in unintended ways or not being able to beopened by the browser at all. (CVE-2008-2808)

2707c645ec2977a2098a10ca7b20823e1c786323.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
2707c645ec2977a2098a10ca7b20823e1c786323.body: John G. Myers discovered a weakness in the trust model used byFirefox regarding alternate names on self-signed certificates. Ifa user were tricked into accepting a certificate containingalternate name entries, an attacker could impersonate anotherserver. (CVE-2008-2809)

30b45a9d43545f55efb66d0c135ccc45451cfc30.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
30b45a9d43545f55efb66d0c135ccc45451cfc30.body: John G. Myers discovered a weakness in the trust model used byThunderbird regarding alternate names on self-signed certificates.If a user were tricked into accepting a certificate containingalternate name entries, an attacker could impersonate anotherserver. (CVE-2008-2809)

0100864299b8092282b028a11d98aabef1a7baa6.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
0100864299b8092282b028a11d98aabef1a7baa6.body: A flaw was discovered in the way Firefox opened URL files. If a userwere tricked into opening a bookmark to a malicious web page, thepage could potentially read from local files on the user's computer.(CVE-2008-2810)

838f3616527001d85534dcdbbff17bf7c52fe974.title: USN-619-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
838f3616527001d85534dcdbbff17bf7c52fe974.body: A vulnerability was discovered in the block reflow code of Firefox.This vulnerability could be used by an attacker to cause a denial ofservice via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-2811)

171c263790d0e43386be0e2ca5e2c352492151bd.title: USN-629-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
171c263790d0e43386be0e2ca5e2c352492151bd.body: A vulnerability was discovered in the block reflow code ofThunderbird. If a user enabled Javascript, this vulnerability couldbe used by an attacker to cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-2811)

784edf71b7b195e71e5e3a72a1d46205b1c8cd09.title: USN-625-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
784edf71b7b195e71e5e3a72a1d46205b1c8cd09.body: Gabriel Campana discovered that SCTP routines did not correctly check forlarge addresses. A local user could exploit this to allocate all availablememory, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2826)

feb7b9af85463336eb50b995346c1ecfdf618be1.title: USN-628-1: PHP vulnerabilities
feb7b9af85463336eb50b995346c1ecfdf618be1.body: It was discovered that php_imap used obsolete API calls. If a PHPapplication were tricked into processing a malicious IMAP request,an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute codewith application privileges. (CVE-2008-2829)

4c163b4bfded911fd01f840c390368f94b466d58.title: USN-675-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
4c163b4bfded911fd01f840c390368f94b466d58.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not properly handle certain malformedmessages in the MSN protocol handler. A remote attacker could send a speciallycrafted message and possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.(CVE-2008-2927)

8f4536e7f3834f4ed56b2f97884e0273ffd0e9f4.title: USN-675-2: Gaim vulnerability
8f4536e7f3834f4ed56b2f97884e0273ffd0e9f4.body: It was discovered that Gaim did not properly handle certain malformedmessages in the MSN protocol handler. A remote attacker could send a speciallycrafted message and possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.(CVE-2008-2927)

05d57c5649c5927ef4e31cf278c80814fa4272bd.title: USN-626-2: Devhelp, Epiphany, Midbrowser and Yelp update
05d57c5649c5927ef4e31cf278c80814fa4272bd.body: Billy Rios discovered that Firefox and xulrunner, as used by browsers such as Epiphany, did not properly perform URI splitting with pipe symbols when passed a command-line URI. If Firefox or xulrunner were passed a malicious URL, an attacker may be able to execute local content with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2933)

99a21e38902c6fb9b5c2261e9e54387f700c7cef.title: USN-623-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
99a21e38902c6fb9b5c2261e9e54387f700c7cef.body: Billy Rios discovered that Firefox did not properly perform URI splittingwith pipe symbols when passed a command-line URI. If Firefox were passeda malicious URL, an attacker may be able to execute local content withchrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2933)

75e1bad74d4c67835e1b4171267750f9b2f5e72a.title: USN-626-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
75e1bad74d4c67835e1b4171267750f9b2f5e72a.body: Billy Rios discovered that Firefox and xulrunner, as used by browserssuch as Epiphany, did not properly perform URI splitting with pipesymbols when passed a command-line URI. If Firefox or xulrunner werepassed a malicious URL, an attacker may be able to execute localcontent with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2933)

aa6aebf4f407a00d5f16f774ebffc1565f8e4de9.title: USN-626-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
aa6aebf4f407a00d5f16f774ebffc1565f8e4de9.body: A flaw was discovered in the browser engine. A variable could be made tooverflow causing the browser to crash. If a user were tricked into openinga malicious web page, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2008-2785)Billy Rios discovered that Firefox and xulrunner, as used by browserssuch as Epiphany, did not properly perform URI splitting with pipesymbols when passed a command-line URI. If Firefox or xulrunner werepassed a malicious URL, an attacker may be able to execute localcontent with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-2933)

fec641c96b8e8630d58ae5f69c75964c0220dec1.title: USN-633-1: libxslt vulnerabilities
fec641c96b8e8630d58ae5f69c75964c0220dec1.body: Chris Evans discovered that the RC4 processing code in libxslt did notcorrectly handle corrupted key information. If a remote attacker wereable to make an application linked against libxslt process maliciousXML input, they could crash the application, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2008-2935)

761ae7241420d9f1daf23b975fe40964c25464f7.title: USN-731-1: Apache vulnerabilities
761ae7241420d9f1daf23b975fe40964c25464f7.body: It was discovered that mod_proxy_ftp did not sanitize wildcard pathnames whenthey are returned in directory listings, which could result in browsers becomingvulnerable to cross-site scripting attacks when processing the output.(CVE-2008-2939)

46bc86646dddc5c73799c8dc911d0c929cc17d7e.title: USN-674-1: HPLIP vulnerabilities
46bc86646dddc5c73799c8dc911d0c929cc17d7e.body: It was discovered that the hpssd tool of hplip did not validateprivileges in the alert-mailing function. A local attacker couldexploit this to gain privileges and send e-mail messages from theaccount of the hplip user. This update alters hplip behaviour bypreventing users from setting alerts and by moving alert configurationto a root-controlled /etc/hp/alerts.conf file. (CVE-2008-2940)

46d7210b8cf724d386055370a240c02aa90c319c.title: USN-674-2: HPLIP vulnerabilities
46d7210b8cf724d386055370a240c02aa90c319c.body: It was discovered that the hpssd tool of hplip did not validate privileges in the alert-mailing function. A local attacker could exploit this to gain privileges and send e-mail messages from the account of the hplip user. This update alters hplip behaviour by preventing users from setting alerts and by moving alert configuration to a root-controlled /etc/hp/alerts.conf file. (CVE-2008-2940)

5012c0de735951185b083347e4e0ccb7eb29a252.title: USN-674-1: HPLIP vulnerabilities
5012c0de735951185b083347e4e0ccb7eb29a252.body: It was discovered that the hpssd tool of hplip did not correctlyhandle certain commands. A local attacker could use a speciallycrafted packet to crash hpssd, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-2941)

bdc9637eaddac4b120ddaaa102aca162e8fa147c.title: USN-674-2: HPLIP vulnerabilities
bdc9637eaddac4b120ddaaa102aca162e8fa147c.body: It was discovered that the hpssd tool of hplip did not correctly handle certain commands. A local attacker could use a specially crafted packet to crash hpssd, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2941)

d3153a9986387f589d3a987a7fa69a260e416773.title: USN-631-1: poppler vulnerability
d3153a9986387f589d3a987a7fa69a260e416773.body: Felipe Andres Manzano discovered that poppler did not correctly initializecertain page widgets. If a user were tricked into viewing a maliciousPDF file, a remote attacker could exploit this to crash applicationslinked against poppler, leading to a denial of service.

f73c4dc6320aa58107815b6847fab87ccf22f4cd.title: USN-634-1: OpenLDAP vulnerability
f73c4dc6320aa58107815b6847fab87ccf22f4cd.body: Cameron Hotchkies discovered that OpenLDAP did not correctly handlecertain ASN.1 BER data. A remote attacker could send a specially craftedpacket and crash slapd, leading to a denial of service.

c0ee5e5574a00716d92c9485bfaec4bbfb407a79.title: USN-675-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
c0ee5e5574a00716d92c9485bfaec4bbfb407a79.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not properly handle file transfers containinga long filename and special characters in the MSN protocol handler. A remoteattacker could send a specially crafted filename in a file transfer requestand cause Pidgin to crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-2955)

12b37e4b6aeddbedded845c3879c144ce4a7c00d.title: USN-675-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
12b37e4b6aeddbedded845c3879c144ce4a7c00d.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not impose resource limitations in the UPnPservice. A remote attacker could cause Pidgin to download arbitrary filesand cause a denial of service from memory or disk space exhaustion.(CVE-2008-2957)

12de9b2b4ea6fe6b67e8019fbce3961fd162c8c6.title: USN-630-1: ffmpeg vulnerability
12de9b2b4ea6fe6b67e8019fbce3961fd162c8c6.body: It was discovered that ffmpeg did not correctly handle STR filedemuxing. If a user were tricked into processing a malicious STR file,a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges viaapplications linked against ffmpeg.

8ab016b8f83c912bfe19a9a014c475eaee095076.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8ab016b8f83c912bfe19a9a014c475eaee095076.body: It was discovered that the Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) didnot correctly validate its arguments. If DCCP was in use, a remote attackercould send specially crafted network traffic and cause a system crash,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-3276)

772b2bee694656a30f4ca5f7427d52e59c0c2062.title: USN-640-1: libxml2 vulnerability
772b2bee694656a30f4ca5f7427d52e59c0c2062.body: Andreas Solberg discovered that libxml2 did not handle recursive entitiessafely. If an application linked against libxml2 were made to processa specially crafted XML document, a remote attacker could exhaust thesystem's CPU resources, leading to a denial of service.

5e0342e829d8aa46691bca2ec6f4dee2d8ebf352.title: USN-742-1: JasPer vulnerabilities
5e0342e829d8aa46691bca2ec6f4dee2d8ebf352.body: It was discovered that JasPer did not correctly handle memory allocationwhen parsing certain malformed JPEG2000 images. If a user were tricked intoopening a specially crafted image with an application that uses libjasper,an attacker could cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrarycode with the user's privileges. (CVE-2008-3520)

8b1753f761512540bec7d4418c8a049bde69ced0.title: USN-742-1: JasPer vulnerabilities
8b1753f761512540bec7d4418c8a049bde69ced0.body: It was discovered that JasPer did not correctly handle certain formattingoperations. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted imagewith an application that uses libjasper, an attacker could cause a denialof service and possibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.(CVE-2008-3522)

b136dad704b507657f5df59add4c3b5f49b509f4.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b136dad704b507657f5df59add4c3b5f49b509f4.body: It was discovered that the SBNI WAN driver did not correctly check for theNET_ADMIN capability. A malicious local root user lacking CAP_NET_ADMINwould be able to change the WAN device configuration, leading to a denialof service. (CVE-2008-3525)

16aac4fff6c65164863997b3e7857c39eaa3e271.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
16aac4fff6c65164863997b3e7857c39eaa3e271.body: It was discovered that the Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) didnot correctly validate the key length in the SCTP_AUTH_KEY option. If SCTPis in use, a remote attacker could send specially crafted network trafficthat would crash the system, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-3526)

a9c2212da60c391baf32544c0ac4e6dbc5e82ba1.title: USN-662-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a9c2212da60c391baf32544c0ac4e6dbc5e82ba1.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel could be made to hang temporarilywhen mounting corrupted ext2/3 filesystems. If a user were tricked intomounting a specially crafted filesystem, a remote attacker could causesystem hangs, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-3528)

0cfe12c66816e5c5cb207e057ee80208b650ad77.title: USN-815-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
0cfe12c66816e5c5cb207e057ee80208b650ad77.body: It was discovered that libxml2 did not correctly handle long entity names. If a user were tricked into processing a specially crafted XML document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges or cause the application linked against libxml2 to crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-3529)

12b5890f43cf0b4b1182b7ab922ce39c8afb13d9.title: USN-675-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
12b5890f43cf0b4b1182b7ab922ce39c8afb13d9.body: It was discovered that Pidgin did not validate SSL certificates when using asecure connection. If a remote attacker were able to perform aman-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to view sensitiveinformation. This update alters Pidgin behaviour by asking users to confirmthe validity of a certificate upon initial login. (CVE-2008-3532)

1928d0dcd43d3e32a9cb3375c6e948e042f21cf9.title: USN-723-1: Git vulnerabilities
1928d0dcd43d3e32a9cb3375c6e948e042f21cf9.body: It was discovered that Git did not properly handle long file paths. If a userwere tricked into performing commands on a specially crafted Git repository, anattacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2008-3546)

379320d9a68dc1903e24045dfeaefcd8414eea9b.title: USN-676-1: WebKit vulnerability
379320d9a68dc1903e24045dfeaefcd8414eea9b.body: It was discovered that WebKit did not properly handle Cascading Style Sheets(CSS) import statements. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciouswebsite, an attacker could cause a browser crash and possibly executearbitrary code with user privileges.

d7e77cdca8ca70f569bbde9c4c64c7f397617990.title: USN-641-1: Racoon vulnerabilities
d7e77cdca8ca70f569bbde9c4c64c7f397617990.body: It was discovered that there were multiple ways to leak memory during theIKE negotiation when handling certain packets. If a remoteattacker sent repeated malicious requests, the "racoon" key exchangeserver could allocate large amounts of memory, possibly leading to adenial of service.

51e2776d2c6527bc30a586463315917e4b9d1c42.title: USN-686-1: AWStats vulnerability
51e2776d2c6527bc30a586463315917e4b9d1c42.body: Morgan Todd discovered that AWStats did not correctly strip quotes fromcertain parameters, allowing for an XSS attack when running as a CGI.If a user was tricked by a remote attacker into following a speciallycrafted URL, the user's authentication information could be exposed forthe domain where AWStats was hosted.

d8372ade222b16895745c4349b5637234a0f2aee.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d8372ade222b16895745c4349b5637234a0f2aee.body: It was discovered the the i915 video driver did not correctly validatememory addresses. A local attacker could exploit this to remap memorythat could cause a system crash, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-3831)

bf02d535c02aea11b9bcf699b62153f35263fe7a.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
bf02d535c02aea11b9bcf699b62153f35263fe7a.body: It was discovered the the i915 video driver did not correctly validatememory addresses. A local attacker could exploit this to remap memory thatcould cause a system crash, leading to a denial of service. This issue didnot affect Ubuntu 6.06 and was previous fixed for Ubuntu 7.10 and 8.04 inUSN-659-1. Ubuntu 8.10 has now been corrected as well. (CVE-2008-3831)

052f35885d72273f1af09a9a3965495d84a4ea32.title: USN-653-1: D-Bus vulnerabilities
052f35885d72273f1af09a9a3965495d84a4ea32.body: It was discovered that the D-Bus library did not correctly validatecertain corrupted signatures. If a local user sent a specially craftedD-Bus request, they could crash applications linked against the D-Buslibrary, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-3834)

782b232104421b9991f2210375e9e2810a58d68a.title: USN-647-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
782b232104421b9991f2210375e9e2810a58d68a.body: It was discovered that the same-origin check in Thunderbird couldbe bypassed. If a user had JavaScript enabled and were tricked intoopening a malicious website, an attacker may be able to executeJavaScript in the context of a different website. (CVE-2008-3835)

ee9b295041f9f0cebd34060f62ec7c864b92ddad.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
ee9b295041f9f0cebd34060f62ec7c864b92ddad.body: It was discovered that the same-origin check in Firefox could bebypassed. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious website,an attacker may be able to execute JavaScript in the context of adifferent website. (CVE-2008-3835)

51a082c7e0f83d10550a3ee5e11617d731754372.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
51a082c7e0f83d10550a3ee5e11617d731754372.body: It was discovered that the same-origin check in Firefox could be bypassed. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious website, an attacker may be able to execute JavaScript in the context of a different website. (CVE-2008-3835)

e2746edea1280a3cf1a4d40ce88e4a924b80a0fe.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
e2746edea1280a3cf1a4d40ce88e4a924b80a0fe.body: Several problems were discovered in the JavaScript engine. Thiscould allow an attacker to execute scripts from page content withchrome privileges. (CVE-2008-3836)

d1810fca37a952671ff814b957508214efe7d093.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
d1810fca37a952671ff814b957508214efe7d093.body: Several problems were discovered in the JavaScript engine. This could allow an attacker to execute scripts from page content with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-3836)

c59397119901b3d87e8ebc8d7c5e801e41596774.title: USN-660-1: enscript vulnerability
c59397119901b3d87e8ebc8d7c5e801e41596774.body: Ulf Härnhammar discovered multiple stack overflows in enscript's handling ofspecial escape arguments. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a malicious file with the "-e" option enabled, a remote attackercould execute arbitrary code or cause enscript to crash, possibly leadingto a denial of service.

681390a011237485ff89e6e201f8f407364e4e32.title: USN-642-1: Postfix vulnerability
681390a011237485ff89e6e201f8f407364e4e32.body: Wietse Venema discovered that Postfix leaked internal file descriptorswhen executing non-Postfix commands. A local attacker could exploitthis to cause Postfix to run out of descriptors, leading to a denialof service.

d411dff374d21aba90b7201deb9631c1dd0fbcb6.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d411dff374d21aba90b7201deb9631c1dd0fbcb6.body: Johann Dahm and David Richter discovered that NFSv4 did not correctlyhandle certain file ACLs. If NFSv4 is in use, a local attacker could createa malicious ACL that could cause a system crash, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2008-3915)

4ae770577b5d03ff602fa551d5c51bf92688357f.title: USN-647-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
4ae770577b5d03ff602fa551d5c51bf92688357f.body: Several problems were discovered in the browser engine ofThunderbird. If a user had JavaScript enabled, this could allow anattacker to execute code with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-4058,CVE-2008-4059, CVE-2008-4060)

83fa9e969a79d3de6168e84a746b8a4678936e58.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
83fa9e969a79d3de6168e84a746b8a4678936e58.body: Several problems were discovered in the browser engine. This could allow an attacker to execute code with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-4058, CVE-2008-4059, CVE-2008-4060)

d6953552c0032d890e19daf524ca5e279c502102.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
d6953552c0032d890e19daf524ca5e279c502102.body: Several problems were discovered in the browser engine. This couldallow an attacker to execute code with chrome privileges.(CVE-2008-4058, CVE-2008-4059, CVE-2008-4060)

b9512d6c71dc29006dee509a7d7f64540b9bc2f5.title: USN-647-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
b9512d6c71dc29006dee509a7d7f64540b9bc2f5.body: Drew Yao, David Maciejak and other Mozilla developers found severalproblems in the browser engine of Thunderbird. If a user hadJavaScript enabled and were tricked into opening a malicious webpage, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-4061, CVE-2008-4062, CVE-2008-4063, CVE-2008-4064)

f43648bb13bd4f65592eeb4bc2822fbbbcef61a2.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
f43648bb13bd4f65592eeb4bc2822fbbbcef61a2.body: Drew Yao, David Maciejak and other Mozilla developers found severalproblems in the browser engine of Firefox. If a user were trickedinto opening a malicious web page, an attacker could cause a denialof service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-4061, CVE-2008-4062,CVE-2008-4063, CVE-2008-4064)

495fbddd26af830799bff7f3879ec8da81aca498.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
495fbddd26af830799bff7f3879ec8da81aca498.body: Drew Yao, David Maciejak and other Mozilla developers found several problems in the browser engine of Firefox. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-4061, CVE-2008-4062, CVE-2008-4063, CVE-2008-4064)

21d3df65d353b9805e5fcd87fc996946d8190fe3.title: USN-647-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
21d3df65d353b9805e5fcd87fc996946d8190fe3.body: Dave Reed discovered a flaw in the JavaScript parsing code whenprocessing certain BOM characters. An attacker could exploit thisto bypass script filters and perform cross-site scripting attacksif a user had JavaScript enabled. (CVE-2008-4065)

92f5b12567beb89eca5dc969dd2e6d58717e8db4.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
92f5b12567beb89eca5dc969dd2e6d58717e8db4.body: Dave Reed discovered a flaw in the JavaScript parsing code when processing certain BOM characters. An attacker could exploit this to bypass script filters and perform cross-site scripting attacks. (CVE-2008-4065)

e540071ea72a310d547d38195619b6016b2f8ded.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
e540071ea72a310d547d38195619b6016b2f8ded.body: Dave Reed discovered a flaw in the JavaScript parsing code whenprocessing certain BOM characters. An attacker could exploit thisto bypass script filters and perform cross-site scripting attacks.(CVE-2008-4065)

b0f9b13cfd4885d314415adac445333529c5ca32.title: USN-647-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
b0f9b13cfd4885d314415adac445333529c5ca32.body: Gareth Heyes discovered a flaw in the HTML parser of Thunderbird. Ifa user had JavaScript enabled and were tricked into opening amalicious web page, an attacker could bypass script filtering andperform cross-site scripting attacks. (CVE-2008-4066)

e0e97b3d8b1ecbfe6df2eeb705462545482fd149.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
e0e97b3d8b1ecbfe6df2eeb705462545482fd149.body: Gareth Heyes discovered a flaw in the HTML parser of Firefox. If auser were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attackercould bypass script filtering and perform cross-site scriptingattacks. (CVE-2008-4066)

f19015e0594b3eace250e0e162ff2db1c0d8b035.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
f19015e0594b3eace250e0e162ff2db1c0d8b035.body: Gareth Heyes discovered a flaw in the HTML parser of Firefox. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could bypass script filtering and perform cross-site scripting attacks. (CVE-2008-4066)

fbc7b8068f9911734d291a790ef1d4a3f776802f.title: USN-647-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
fbc7b8068f9911734d291a790ef1d4a3f776802f.body: Boris Zbarsky and Georgi Guninski independently discovered flaws inthe resource: protocol. An attacker could exploit this to performdirectory traversal, read information about the system, and promptthe user to save information in a file. (CVE-2008-4067,CVE-2008-4068)

2aae2c3319d6ca3aee1ab2640db07684d0f61767.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
2aae2c3319d6ca3aee1ab2640db07684d0f61767.body: Boris Zbarsky and Georgi Guninski independently discovered flaws inthe resource: protocol. An attacker could exploit this to performdirectory traversal, read information about the system, and promptthe user to save information in a file. (CVE-2008-4067,CVE-2008-4068)

d35a72d98fb09a75d0e30a36f690dfc4c0dff730.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
d35a72d98fb09a75d0e30a36f690dfc4c0dff730.body: Boris Zbarsky and Georgi Guninski independently discovered flaws in the resource: protocol. An attacker could exploit this to perform directory traversal, read information about the system, and prompt the user to save information in a file. (CVE-2008-4067, CVE-2008-4068)

4a18f5a9bb6bd663a6998f3225cf74c6394cbf2b.title: USN-645-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
4a18f5a9bb6bd663a6998f3225cf74c6394cbf2b.body: Billy Hoffman discovered a problem in the XBM decoder. If a user weretricked into opening a malicious web page or XBM file, an attackermay be able to cause a denial of service via application crash.(CVE-2008-4069)

ead17cf3b4cae2f69769563a827b66690b749c74.title: USN-645-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
ead17cf3b4cae2f69769563a827b66690b749c74.body: Billy Hoffman discovered a problem in the XBM decoder. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious web page or XBM file, an attacker may be able to cause a denial of service via application crash. (CVE-2008-4069)

2f8aa2cf1a333a040587379117122348296fd4ea.title: USN-647-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
2f8aa2cf1a333a040587379117122348296fd4ea.body: Georgi Guninski discovered that Thunderbird improperly handledcancelled newsgroup messages. If a user opened a crafted newsgroupmessage, an attacker could cause a buffer overrun and potentiallyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2008-4070)

0c656f473c3abe42db0323549d78f1b6b5290be5.title: USN-712-1: Vim vulnerabilities
0c656f473c3abe42db0323549d78f1b6b5290be5.body: Ben Schmidt discovered that Vim did not properly escape characters whenperforming keyword or tag lookups. If a user were tricked into running speciallycrafted commands, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-4101)

e5a70dd7d349bea53fbca2898d1d704f51e0b6cb.title: USN-649-1: OpenSSH vulnerabilities
e5a70dd7d349bea53fbca2898d1d704f51e0b6cb.body: USN-355-1 fixed vulnerabilities in OpenSSH. It was discovered that thefixes for this issue were incomplete. A remote attacker could attemptmultiple logins, filling all available connection slots, leading to adenial of service. This only affected Ubuntu 6.06 and 7.04.(CVE-2008-4109)

84c9b57cfe9b00f087f85fc67e46fb8ee7637614.title: USN-659-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
84c9b57cfe9b00f087f85fc67e46fb8ee7637614.body: It was discovered that SCTP did not correctly validate its userspacearguments. A local attacker could call certain sctp_* functions withmalicious options and cause a system crash, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-3792, CVE-2008-4113, CVE-2008-4445)

f59a2b56ff7869c73d3e67fea6d50a171eb729a8.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f59a2b56ff7869c73d3e67fea6d50a171eb729a8.body: David Watson discovered that the kernel did not correctly strip permissionswhen creating files in setgid directories. A local user could exploit thisto gain additional group privileges. This issue only affected Ubuntu 6.06.(CVE-2008-4210)

fac9523483c4c2b7e43a94dcbdda440b6675b0df.title: USN-673-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
fac9523483c4c2b7e43a94dcbdda440b6675b0df.body: Drew Yao discovered that libxml2 did not correctly handle certain corruptXML documents. If a user or automated system were tricked into processinga malicious XML document, a remote attacker could cause applicationslinked against libxml2 to enter an infinite loop, leading to a denialof service. (CVE-2008-4225)

f734f38f72e6498202165fde14e76caeb9bca8ae.title: USN-673-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
f734f38f72e6498202165fde14e76caeb9bca8ae.body: Drew Yao discovered that libxml2 did not correctly handle large memoryallocations. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing avery large XML document, a remote attacker could cause applications linkedagainst libxml2 to crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-4226)

c385fc2bf7148c06578c416b6ac0bda90c19b228.title: USN-685-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
c385fc2bf7148c06578c416b6ac0bda90c19b228.body: It was discovered that the SNMP service did not correctly handle largeGETBULK requests. If an unauthenticated remote attacker sent a speciallycrafted request, the SNMP service could be made to crash, leading to adenial of service. (CVE-2008-4309)

c59e82f9955c4ce63d52d69d30856ed8c794edd4.title: USN-680-1: Samba vulnerability
c59e82f9955c4ce63d52d69d30856ed8c794edd4.body: It was discovered that Samba did not properly perform bounds checkingin certain operations. A remote attacker could possibly exploit this toread arbitrary memory contents of the smb process, which could containsensitive infomation or possibly have other impacts, such as a denial ofservice.

8f702a3bafa46ec8b8836386e3938e58085fde6c.title: USN-738-1: GLib vulnerability
8f702a3bafa46ec8b8836386e3938e58085fde6c.body: Diego Petteno discovered that the Base64 encoding functions in GLib did notproperly handle large strings. If a user or automated system were trickedinto processing a crafted Base64 string, an attacker could possibly executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

5239ee670ca66040135ef26c72f408cdd25a7bbc.title: USN-662-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5239ee670ca66040135ef26c72f408cdd25a7bbc.body: Anders Kaseorg discovered that ndiswrapper did not correctly handle longESSIDs. For a system using ndiswrapper, a physically near-by attackercould generate specially crafted wireless network traffic and executearbitrary code with root privileges. (CVE-2008-4395)

ae224500b5ad4e700ba7b91d4d742a55bd88c300.title: USN-662-2: Ubuntu kernel modules vulnerability
ae224500b5ad4e700ba7b91d4d742a55bd88c300.body: Anders Kaseorg discovered that ndiswrapper did not correctly handle long ESSIDs. For a system using ndiswrapper, a physically near-by attacker could generate specially crafted wireless network traffic and execute arbitrary code with root privileges. (CVE-2008-4395)

8b5b6f6efc86e9eabb511aa0ddf2ac66ef0d4c36.title: USN-897-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
8b5b6f6efc86e9eabb511aa0ddf2ac66ef0d4c36.body: It was discovered that MySQL contained a cross-site scripting vulnerabilityin the command-line client when the --html option is enabled. An attackercould place arbitrary web script or html in a database cell, which wouldthen get placed in the html document output by the command-line tool. Thisissue only affected Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, 8.04 LTS, 8.10 and 9.04.(CVE-2008-4456)

03133174f99e2db01088c981d3fdb9a8e0a083e2.title: USN-776-1: KVM vulnerabilities
03133174f99e2db01088c981d3fdb9a8e0a083e2.body: Jan Niehusmann discovered that KVM's Cirrus VGA implementation over VNCdid not correctly handle certain bitblt operations. A local attackercould exploit this flaw to potentially execute arbitrary code on the VMhost or crash KVM, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-4539)

3c558950358dd9965423e5e90d638ce28e93f126.title: USN-687-1: nfs-utils vulnerability
3c558950358dd9965423e5e90d638ce28e93f126.body: It was discovered that nfs-utils did not properly enforce netgrouprestrictions when using TCP Wrappers. Remote attackers could bypass thenetgroup restrictions enabled by the administrator and possibly gainaccess to sensitive information.

54d2d9298084cdb485ad00e2879e65db44a24a04.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
54d2d9298084cdb485ad00e2879e65db44a24a04.body: Olaf Kirch and Miklos Szeredi discovered that the Linux kernel didnot correctly reject the "append" flag when handling file splicerequests. A local attacker could bypass append mode and make changes toarbitrary locations in a file. This issue only affected Ubuntu 7.10 and8.04. (CVE-2008-4554)

a328ce96b2a4cf965db5f5dc3643d40eee68f5e1.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a328ce96b2a4cf965db5f5dc3643d40eee68f5e1.body: It was discovered that the SCTP stack did not correctly handle INIT-ACK. Aremote user could exploit this by sending specially crafted SCTP trafficwhich would trigger a crash in the system, leading to a denial of service.This issue did not affect Ubuntu 8.10. (CVE-2008-4576)

ce15a435c73ff4b546b8ec0ac45b9bbc5e98cff0.title: USN-838-1: Dovecot vulnerabilities
ce15a435c73ff4b546b8ec0ac45b9bbc5e98cff0.body: It was discovered that the ACL plugin in Dovecot would incorrectly handlenegative access rights. An attacker could exploit this flaw to access theDovecot server, bypassing the intended access restrictions. This onlyaffected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS. (CVE-2008-4577)

ca860277af0c4bf9a7b34862cf5b486f1f1d1f59.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
ca860277af0c4bf9a7b34862cf5b486f1f1d1f59.body: Liu Die Yu discovered an information disclosure vulnerability in Firefoxwhen using saved .url shortcut files. If a user were tricked intodownloading a crafted .url file and a crafted HTML file, an attackercould steal information from the user's cache. (CVE-2008-4582)

0f3314b114ef6c7b68826a946d27b2ddeeb0e5f6.title: USN-734-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
0f3314b114ef6c7b68826a946d27b2ddeeb0e5f6.body: It was discovered that FFmpeg did not correctly handle certain malformedOgg Media (OGM) files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted OggMedia file, an attacker could cause the application using FFmpeg to crash,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-4610)

f996da33e1f7f2d1f7af25d24312d1eb5772aa0c.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f996da33e1f7f2d1f7af25d24312d1eb5772aa0c.body: It was discovered that the SCTP stack did not correctly handle bad packetlengths. A remote user could exploit this by sending specially crafted SCTPtraffic which would trigger a crash in the system, leading to a denial ofservice. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 8.10. (CVE-2008-4618)

a90e88e2f815677a802305de17c654608139ced5.title: USN-692-1: Gadu vulnerability
a90e88e2f815677a802305de17c654608139ced5.body: It was discovered that the Gadu library, used by some Instant Messagingclients, did not correctly verify certain packet sizes from the server.If a user connected to a malicious server, clients using Gadu could bemade to crash, leading to a denial of service.

260f14f8d8c3c56f47f3ffaa6ae5ff13b08901bd.title: USN-734-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
260f14f8d8c3c56f47f3ffaa6ae5ff13b08901bd.body: It was discovered that FFmpeg did not correctly handle certain parameterswhen creating DTS streams. If a user were tricked into processing certaincommands, an attacker could cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 8.10. (CVE-2008-4866)

83683c1f84ef8d555287502f7a3abca41abd7d95.title: USN-734-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
83683c1f84ef8d555287502f7a3abca41abd7d95.body: It was discovered that FFmpeg did not correctly handle certain malformedDTS Coherent Acoustics (DCA) files. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted DCA file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program. (CVE-2008-4867)

428bdb13c096307bc730716df2ef0379fa4d89b0.title: USN-666-1: Dovecot vulnerability
428bdb13c096307bc730716df2ef0379fa4d89b0.body: It was discovered that certain email headers were not correctly handledby Dovecot. If a remote attacker sent a specially crafted email to auser with a mailbox managed by Dovecot, that user's mailbox would becomeinaccessible through Dovecot, leading to a denial of service.

763aa06f23cb1a122a633d5c09a20e9c3a475d5f.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
763aa06f23cb1a122a633d5c09a20e9c3a475d5f.body: Eric Sesterhenn discovered multiple flaws in the HFS+ filesystem. If alocal user or automated system were tricked into mounting a malicious HFS+filesystem, the system could crash, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-4933, CVE-2008-4934, CVE-2008-5025)

a14ff9466378d4ea39ee6ca79dadc0db9c3c5437.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
a14ff9466378d4ea39ee6ca79dadc0db9c3c5437.body: Georgi Guninski, Michal Zalewsk and Chris Evans discovered that thesame-origin check in Firefox could be bypassed. If a user were trickedinto opening a malicious website, an attacker could obtain privateinformation from data stored in the images, or discover informationabout software on the user's computer. This issue only affects Firefox 2.(CVE-2008-5012)

0d0ed273169ae56d90bb2f321a692c39b4ef7c34.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
0d0ed273169ae56d90bb2f321a692c39b4ef7c34.body: It was discovered that Firefox did not properly check if the Flashmodule was properly unloaded. By tricking a user into opening a craftedSWF file, an attacker could cause Firefox to crash and possibly executearbitrary code with user privileges. This issue only affects Firefox 2.(CVE-2008-5013)

532e46486c4ce09f55f45222bfa6bdde9c4009d2.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
532e46486c4ce09f55f45222bfa6bdde9c4009d2.body: Jesse Ruderman discovered that Firefox did not properly guard locks onnon-native objects. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciouswebsite, an attacker could cause a browser crash and possibly executearbitrary code with user privileges. This issue only affects Firefox 2.(CVE-2008-5014)

10b78668b7f5e0f88372d2bb509e187e66fe7742.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
10b78668b7f5e0f88372d2bb509e187e66fe7742.body: Luke Bryan discovered that Firefox sometimes opened file URIs withchrome privileges. If a user saved malicious code locally, then openedthe file in the same tab as a privileged document, an attacker couldrun arbitrary JavaScript code with chrome privileges. This issue onlyaffects Firefox 3.0. (CVE-2008-5015)

2663646dc1c8653b53dfa5d96fc640bacf67a0bb.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
2663646dc1c8653b53dfa5d96fc640bacf67a0bb.body: Several problems were discovered in the browser, layout and JavaScriptengines. These problems could allow an attacker to crash the browserand possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.(CVE-2008-5016, CVE-2008-5017, CVE-2008-5018)

a5dabf0427f121a6619e3e1803f91023b6645e66.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
a5dabf0427f121a6619e3e1803f91023b6645e66.body: David Bloom discovered that the same-origin check in Firefox could bebypassed by utilizing the session restore feature. An attacker couldexploit this to run JavaScript in the context of another site orexecute arbitrary JavaScript code with chrome privileges.(CVE-2008-5019)

f0f78467c3b97d3b9a229fc48d726f905c63a356.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
f0f78467c3b97d3b9a229fc48d726f905c63a356.body: A flaw was discovered in Firefox's DOM constructing code. If a userwere tricked into opening a malicious website, an attacker couldcause the browser to crash and potentially execute arbitrary code withuser privileges. (CVE-2008-5021)

c70bacf08a01c7144e6b82b6674562ba0d51f65a.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
c70bacf08a01c7144e6b82b6674562ba0d51f65a.body: It was discovered that the same-origin check in Firefox could bebypassed. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious website, anattacker could execute JavaScript in the context of a different website.(CVE-2008-5022)

b533837eaf0d3f6a719319f4d1a3fb83c395fae7.title: USN-667-1: Firefox and xulrunner vulnerabilities
b533837eaf0d3f6a719319f4d1a3fb83c395fae7.body: Collin Jackson discovered various flaws in Firefox when processingstylesheets which allowed JavaScript to be injected into signed JARfiles. If a user were tricked into opening malicious web content, anattacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of thesigned JAR or of a different website. (CVE-2008-5023)

d1f90c4f1bedb374e5f080550779dad87a2048cc.title: USN-698-1: Nagios vulnerability
d1f90c4f1bedb374e5f080550779dad87a2048cc.body: It was discovered that Nagios did not properly parse commands submitted usingthe web interface. An authenticated user could use a custom form or a browseraddon to bypass security restrictions and submit unauthorized commands.

04f81be0533716c91245a0afb0583b10ce964c88.title: USN-698-3: Nagios vulnerabilities
04f81be0533716c91245a0afb0583b10ce964c88.body: It was discovered that Nagios did not properly parse commands submitted usingthe web interface. An authenticated user could use a custom form or a browseraddon to bypass security restrictions and submit unauthorized commands.(CVE-2008-5027)

efad05f2984c8ed2aab6d8c8fae3518ef80e293c.title: USN-698-3: Nagios vulnerabilities
efad05f2984c8ed2aab6d8c8fae3518ef80e293c.body: It was discovered that Nagios was vulnerable to a Cross-site request forgery(CSRF) vulnerability. If an authenticated nagios user were tricked intoclicking a link on a specially crafted web page, an attacker could triggercommands to be processed by Nagios and execute arbitrary programs. Thisupdate alters Nagios behaviour by disabling submission of CMD_CHANGE commands.(CVE-2008-5028)

e41b72bcfbe6e29b8c43bd178ddf30b831f50182.title: USN-679-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e41b72bcfbe6e29b8c43bd178ddf30b831f50182.body: It was discovered that the driver for simple i2c audio interfaces did notcorrectly validate certain function pointers. A local user could exploitthis to gain root privileges or crash the system, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2008-5033)

938e57dd01561b6a1310be843dd2478fca717269.title: USN-672-1: ClamAV vulnerability
938e57dd01561b6a1310be843dd2478fca717269.body: Moritz Jodeit discovered that ClamAV did not correctly handle certainstrings when examining a VBA project. If a remote attacker tricked ClamAVinto processing a malicious VBA file, ClamAV would crash, leading to adenial of service.

8b3a90f46df46e2944226560a1cc8b7585461332.title: USN-715-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8b3a90f46df46e2944226560a1cc8b7585461332.body: Hugo Dias discovered that the ATM subsystem did not correctly managesocket counts. A local attacker could exploit this to cause a system hang,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-5079)

87ef8cf634d15bd2e06685c3955962555e134962.title: USN-696-1: Avahi vulnerabilities
87ef8cf634d15bd2e06685c3955962555e134962.body: Hugo Dias discovered that Avahi did not properly verify its input whenprocessing mDNS packets. A remote attacker could send a crafted mDNS packetand cause a denial of service (assertion failure). (CVE-2008-5081)

4e26d531783801a5791ae4c02dcd6c2e24d9d4ec.title: USN-683-1: Imlib2 vulnerability
4e26d531783801a5791ae4c02dcd6c2e24d9d4ec.body: It was discovered that Imlib2 did not correctly handle certain malformedXPM images. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted imagewith an application that uses Imlib2, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice and possibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

57a4e3355c7983d1567139fcd7f2237c8717410a.title: USN-715-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
57a4e3355c7983d1567139fcd7f2237c8717410a.body: Dann Frazier discovered that in certain situations sendmsg did notcorrectly release allocated memory. A local attacker could exploitthis to force the system to run out of free memory, leading to a denialof service. (CVE-2008-5300)

c1ac28d1388d155dbb83cdbe5b24fc3504e43a4c.title: USN-838-1: Dovecot vulnerabilities
c1ac28d1388d155dbb83cdbe5b24fc3504e43a4c.body: It was discovered that the ManageSieve service in Dovecot incorrectlyhandled ".." in script names. A remote attacker could exploit this to readand modify arbitrary sieve files on the server. This only affected Ubuntu8.10. (CVE-2008-5301)

6c6e1255e27b528d47d53ce9ea71173d2421f67d.title: USN-684-1: ClamAV vulnerability
6c6e1255e27b528d47d53ce9ea71173d2421f67d.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered that ClamAV did not handle recursive JPEGinformation. If a remote attacker sent a specially crafted JPEG file,ClamAV would crash, leading to a denial of service.

9f087e23bff8d667a58244b1aa5a07e1ca8b3def.title: USN-715-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9f087e23bff8d667a58244b1aa5a07e1ca8b3def.body: Helge Deller discovered that PA-RISC stack unwinding was not handledcorrectly. A local attacker could exploit this to crash the system,leading do a denial of service. This did not affect official Ubuntukernels, but was fixed in the source for anyone performing HPPA kernelbuilds. (CVE-2008-5395)

d8500717b571088ba5382124e399ba2ca4924ca6.title: USN-690-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
d8500717b571088ba5382124e399ba2ca4924ca6.body: Several flaws were discovered in the browser engine. These problems could allowan attacker to crash the browser and possibly execute arbitrary code with userprivileges. (CVE-2008-5500)

10b18fa1e50cc51c3fdee4d88191b1bd3a60d4a9.title: USN-701-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
10b18fa1e50cc51c3fdee4d88191b1bd3a60d4a9.body: Several flaws were discovered in the browser engine. If a user had Javascriptenabled, these problems could allow an attacker to crash Thunderbird andpossibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-5500)

1956b6bc81b7ab30678226c0f6f76410318ccef7.title: USN-701-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
1956b6bc81b7ab30678226c0f6f76410318ccef7.body: Several flaws were discovered in the browser engine. If a user had Javascriptenabled, these problems could allow an attacker to crash Thunderbird andpossibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2008-5500)

5f9d2fe55c0e8c3489813a832f461a6664ccd618.title: USN-690-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
5f9d2fe55c0e8c3489813a832f461a6664ccd618.body: Several problems were discovered in the JavaScript engine. An attacker couldexploit feed preview vulnerabilities to execute scripts from page content withchrome privileges. (CVE-2008-5504)

18c8fc99fcacad7fa53fc155d1f26263c897011c.title: USN-690-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
18c8fc99fcacad7fa53fc155d1f26263c897011c.body: Marius Schilder discovered that Firefox did not properly handle redirects toan outside domain when an XMLHttpRequest was made to a same-origin resource.It's possible that sensitive information could be revealed in theXMLHttpRequest response. (CVE-2008-5506)

b4a2890167c7e0bac53048e248ce716ce81a0f3f.title: USN-701-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
b4a2890167c7e0bac53048e248ce716ce81a0f3f.body: Marius Schilder discovered that Thunderbird did not properly handle redirectsto an outside domain when an XMLHttpRequest was made to a same-origin resource.When Javascript is enabled, it's possible that sensitive information could berevealed in the XMLHttpRequest response. (CVE-2008-5506)

51a1fab71fde0b8f41c01fcb684de672e7ca8e8b.title: USN-701-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
51a1fab71fde0b8f41c01fcb684de672e7ca8e8b.body: Marius Schilder discovered that Thunderbird did not properly handle redirectsto an outside domain when an XMLHttpRequest was made to a same-origin resource.When Javascript is enabled, it's possible that sensitive information could berevealed in the XMLHttpRequest response. (CVE-2008-5506)

b92175b55a3f194e73f5e4dbbe6f250c698f217e.title: USN-690-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
b92175b55a3f194e73f5e4dbbe6f250c698f217e.body: Chris Evans discovered that Firefox did not properly protect a user's data whenaccessing a same-domain Javascript URL that is redirected to an unparsableJavascript off-site resource. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciouswebsite, an attacker may be able to steal a limited amount of private data.(CVE-2008-5507)

33e65bf7ff71915c21a263b26b06589415b1bf92.title: USN-701-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
33e65bf7ff71915c21a263b26b06589415b1bf92.body: Chris Evans discovered that Thunderbird did not properly protect a user's datawhen accessing a same-domain Javascript URL that is redirected to an unparsableJavascript off-site resource. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciouswebsite and had Javascript enabled, an attacker may be able to steal a limitedamount of private data. (CVE-2008-5507)

061cb0128d5537cee8d432507168592d60ff4d9d.title: USN-701-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
061cb0128d5537cee8d432507168592d60ff4d9d.body: Chris Evans discovered that Thunderbird did not properly protect a user's datawhen accessing a same-domain Javascript URL that is redirected to an unparsableJavascript off-site resource. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciouswebsite and had Javascript enabled, an attacker may be able to steal a limitedamount of private data. (CVE-2008-5507)

c1104ad03c45d8169714c882a2653f665e353672.title: USN-690-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
c1104ad03c45d8169714c882a2653f665e353672.body: Chip Salzenberg, Justin Schuh, Tom Cross, and Peter William discovered Firefoxdid not properly parse URLs when processing certain control characters.(CVE-2008-5508)

2a67420f031c1f97240897b7708a5c3839fc5cae.title: USN-701-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
2a67420f031c1f97240897b7708a5c3839fc5cae.body: Chip Salzenberg, Justin Schuh, Tom Cross, and Peter William discoveredThunderbird did not properly parse URLs when processing certain controlcharacters. (CVE-2008-5508)

49f5f7b28b19fb8f2d71266de38a768cd2c38093.title: USN-701-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
49f5f7b28b19fb8f2d71266de38a768cd2c38093.body: Chip Salzenberg, Justin Schuh, Tom Cross, and Peter William discoveredThunderbird did not properly parse URLs when processing certain controlcharacters. (CVE-2008-5508)

5117945f05caf59afea77f73972a71f5f6096f06.title: USN-690-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
5117945f05caf59afea77f73972a71f5f6096f06.body: Several flaws were discovered in the Javascript engine. If a user were trickedinto opening a malicious website, an attacker could exploit this to executearbitrary Javascript code within the context of another website or with chromeprivileges. (CVE-2008-5511, CVE-2008-5512)

9e9e1eb00be9d1477809182a4daf6d77fe3e95f7.title: USN-701-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
9e9e1eb00be9d1477809182a4daf6d77fe3e95f7.body: Several flaws were discovered in the Javascript engine. If a user were trickedinto opening a malicious website and had Javascript enabled, an attacker couldexploit this to execute arbitrary Javascript code within the context of anotherwebsite or with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-5511, CVE-2008-5512)

9a4bcb4f15f5850a6639a0875a72eb178c5435cd.title: USN-701-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
9a4bcb4f15f5850a6639a0875a72eb178c5435cd.body: Several flaws were discovered in the Javascript engine. If a user were trickedinto opening a malicious website and had Javascript enabled, an attacker couldexploit this to execute arbitrary Javascript code within the context of anotherwebsite or with chrome privileges. (CVE-2008-5511, CVE-2008-5512)

113a28141cac6aece863e8a106e5b6f8ba3b7eab.title: USN-690-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
113a28141cac6aece863e8a106e5b6f8ba3b7eab.body: Flaws were discovered in the session-restore feature of Firefox. If a user weretricked into opening a malicious website, an attacker could exploit this toperform cross-site scripting attacks or execute arbitrary Javascript code withchrome privileges. (CVE-2008-5513)

8962cd46a59aa37ac5866566fa9cc696be3ef2c0.title: USN-723-1: Git vulnerabilities
8962cd46a59aa37ac5866566fa9cc696be3ef2c0.body: It was discovered that the Git web interface (gitweb) did not correctly handleshell metacharacters when processing certain commands. A remote attacker couldsend specially crafted commands to the Git server and execute arbitrary codewith the privileges of the Git web server. This issue only applied to Ubuntu7.10 and 8.04 LTS. (CVE-2008-5516, CVE-2008-5517)

035100cc0e4a234da8249de4520e9aed5df5e8f4.title: USN-715-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
035100cc0e4a234da8249de4520e9aed5df5e8f4.body: It was discovered that the ATA subsystem did not correctly set timeouts. Alocal attacker could exploit this to cause a system hang, leading to adenial of service. (CVE-2008-5700)

910d3b95aa3fe54d639ce8b6a4fd77e02e5f01bd.title: USN-715-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
910d3b95aa3fe54d639ce8b6a4fd77e02e5f01bd.body: It was discovered that the ib700 watchdog timer did not correctly checkbuffer sizes. A local attacker could send a specially crafted ioctlto the device to cause a system crash, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2008-5702)

2160df3c6ca1938688e5493ad0a68a1223688f87.title: USN-776-1: KVM vulnerabilities
2160df3c6ca1938688e5493ad0a68a1223688f87.body: It was discovered that KVM's VNC password checks did not use the correctlength. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause KVM to crash,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2008-5714)

ae6a1422d3db7f10b1218c35a3be0cd9ef41467d.title: USN-761-2: PHP vulnerabilities
ae6a1422d3db7f10b1218c35a3be0cd9ef41467d.body: It was discovered that PHP did not sanitize certain error messages when display_errors is enabled, which could result in browsers becoming vulnerable to cross-site scripting attacks when processing the output. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data (such as passwords), within the same domain. (CVE-2008-5814)

a0f80b7a6c771f5526e4be51fd3e9cea275d7ffa.title: USN-912-1: Audio File Library vulnerability
a0f80b7a6c771f5526e4be51fd3e9cea275d7ffa.body: It was discovered that Audio File Library contained a heap-based bufferoverflow. If a user or automated system processed a crafted WAV file, anattacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. The default compiler options for Ubuntu should reduce thisvulnerability to a denial of service.

7b67f4a077178e042084a7cdbd4a9c05dfc596eb.title: USN-711-1: KTorrent vulnerabilities
7b67f4a077178e042084a7cdbd4a9c05dfc596eb.body: It was discovered that KTorrent did not properly restrict access when using theweb interface plugin. A remote attacker could use a crafted http request andupload arbitrary torrent files to trigger the start of downloads and seeding.(CVE-2008-5905)

b3e9ec10ddbd5214d45d0e475d2c913a2a73cc72.title: USN-711-1: KTorrent vulnerabilities
b3e9ec10ddbd5214d45d0e475d2c913a2a73cc72.body: It was discovered that KTorrent did not properly handle certain parameters whenusing the web interface plugin. A remote attacker could use crafted httprequests to execute arbitrary PHP code. (CVE-2008-5906)

cbcf7c16a58a68691db9953cd0e0e811e2967645.title: USN-723-1: Git vulnerabilities
cbcf7c16a58a68691db9953cd0e0e811e2967645.body: It was discovered that the Git web interface (gitweb) did not properly restrictthe diff.external configuration parameter. A local attacker could exploit thisissue and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the Git web server.This issue only applied to Ubuntu 8.04 LTS and 8.10. (CVE-2008-5916)

a905ca6a00f6af4097c032d8b29f2035cc38ee83.title: USN-751-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a905ca6a00f6af4097c032d8b29f2035cc38ee83.body: Sparc syscalls did not correctly check mmap regions. A local attackercould cause a system panic, leading to a denial of service. Ubuntu 8.10was not affected. (CVE-2008-6107)

1aa4cd4456bf2d0cd151542666111cf381f94d35.title: USN-875-1: Red Hat Cluster Suite vulnerabilities
1aa4cd4456bf2d0cd151542666111cf381f94d35.body: It was discovered that CMAN did not properly handle malformed configurationfiles. An attacker could cause a denial of service (via CPU consumption andmemory corruption) in a node if the attacker were able to modify thecluster configuration for the node. (CVE-2008-6560)

d511371b5aac0718d2215e994f4e62c309459844.title: USN-754-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
d511371b5aac0718d2215e994f4e62c309459844.body: It was discovered that ClamAV did not properly validate Portable Executable(PE) files. A remote attacker could send a crafted PE file and cause adenial of service (divide by zero). (CVE-2008-6680)

8c1ef0c38ad2fe4aaeb269332dd1f5dba1e9b57a.title: USN-663-1: system-tools-backends regression
8c1ef0c38ad2fe4aaeb269332dd1f5dba1e9b57a.body: It was discovered that passwords changed (or new users created) via the"Users and Groups" tool were created with 3DES hashing. This reduced thesecurity of stored user passwords, and was a regression from the correctMD5 hashing. This update fixes the problem; future password changeswill correct the hashing used. We apologize for the inconvenience.

fa66c232af812ba27fd6a8b1d540bc0158bb4017.title: USN-1029-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
fa66c232af812ba27fd6a8b1d540bc0158bb4017.body: It was discovered that an old bug workaround in the SSL/TLSserver code allowed an attacker to modify the stored session cacheciphersuite. An attacker could possibly take advantage of this toforce the use of a disabled cipher. This vulnerability only affectsthe versions of OpenSSL in Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, andUbuntu 9.10. (CVE-2008-7270)

5eea098a48b255072bc7d93c8e462ce468dd221a.title: USN-786-1: apr-util vulnerabilities
5eea098a48b255072bc7d93c8e462ce468dd221a.body: Matthew Palmer discovered an underflow flaw in apr-util. An attacker couldcause a denial of service via application crash in Apache using a craftedSVNMasterURI directive, .htaccess file, or when using mod_apreq2.Applications using libapreq2 are also affected. (CVE-2009-0023)

24f23ded8557a66401636fbe991273af556edd38.title: USN-787-1: Apache vulnerabilities
24f23ded8557a66401636fbe991273af556edd38.body: Matthew Palmer discovered an underflow flaw in apr-util as included inApache.
