18c6d0eac1705fa8d2e279a5317afd0e4e7a675a.body: Akira Fujita discovered that the Ext4 "move extents" ioctl did notcorrectly check permissions. A local attacker could exploit this tooverwrite arbitrary files on the system, leading to root privilegeescalation. (CVE-2009-4131)

9bf8d517a9cebd69d23b968267bea086880dd89b.title: USN-881-1: Kerberos vulnerability
9bf8d517a9cebd69d23b968267bea086880dd89b.body: It was discovered that Kerberos did not correctly handle invalid AESblocks. An unauthenticated remote attacker could send specially craftedtraffic that would crash the KDC service, leading to a denial of service,or possibly execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

34ffed737102793fc46a1fbd38930e9dd399d549.title: USN-961-1: Ghostscript vulnerabilities
34ffed737102793fc46a1fbd38930e9dd399d549.body: David Srbecky discovered that Ghostscript incorrectly handled debuglogging. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a craftedPDF file, an attacker could cause a denial of service or execute arbitrarycode with privileges of the user invoking the program. This issue onlyaffected Ubuntu 9.04 and Ubuntu 9.10. The default compiler options foraffected releases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial of service.(CVE-2009-4270)

d4f347fe5d5620fc83dbb606565bdc350deeefce.title: USN-884-1: OpenSSL vulnerability
d4f347fe5d5620fc83dbb606565bdc350deeefce.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL did not correctly free unused memory incertain situations. A remote attacker could trigger this flaw in servicesthat used SSL, causing the service to use all available system memory,leading to a denial of service.

a41296d5063c4327e27b6aa19ac10c7cd90748f1.title: USN-897-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
a41296d5063c4327e27b6aa19ac10c7cd90748f1.body: It was discovered that MySQL contained a buffer overflow when parsingssl certificates. A remote attacker could send crafted requests and cause adenial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue did notaffect Ubuntu 6.06 LTS and the default compiler options for affectedreleases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial of service. In thedefault installation, attackers would also be isolated by the AppArmorMySQL profile. (CVE-2009-4484)

4ec102aaeb4f9dea83f12f2639dfff4e377deb48.title: USN-931-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
4ec102aaeb4f9dea83f12f2639dfff4e377deb48.body: It was discovered that FFmpeg contained multiple security issues whenhandling certain multimedia files. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted multimedia file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program.

b4affa123a7b96efe1703f62c968b0afdec68e49.title: USN-941-1: MoinMoin vulnerability
b4affa123a7b96efe1703f62c968b0afdec68e49.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin incorrectly handled hierarchical accesscontrol lists. Users could bypass intended access controls under certaincircumstances.

8841f9442c9392e05a4eb4e27b6c7aec2570dd90.title: USN-944-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
8841f9442c9392e05a4eb4e27b6c7aec2570dd90.body: Maksymilian Arciemowicz discovered that the GNU C library did notcorrectly handle integer overflows in the strfmon function. If a useror automated system were tricked into processing a specially craftedformat string, a remote attacker could crash applications, leading toa denial of service. (Ubuntu 10.04 was not affected.) (CVE-2008-1391)Jeff Layton and Dan Rosenberg discovered that the GNU C library did notcorrectly handle newlines in the mntent family of functions. If a localattacker were able to inject newlines into a mount entry through othervulnerable mount helpers, they could disrupt the system or possibly gainroot privileges. (CVE-2010-0296)Dan Rosenberg discovered that the GNU C library did not correctly validatecertain ELF program headers. If a user or automated system were trickedinto verifying a specially crafted ELF program, a remote attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2010-0830)

632eb44ff19bc8ebf2e0bd3a81673196cfee063f.title: USN-961-1: Ghostscript vulnerabilities
632eb44ff19bc8ebf2e0bd3a81673196cfee063f.body: It was discovered that Ghostscript incorrectly handled certain malformedfiles. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a craftedPostscript or PDF file, an attacker could cause a denial of service orexecute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking the program.This issue only affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS and Ubuntu 9.04. (CVE-2009-4897)

aafbe21e8e966f4a2eafd49879dd6ed13b2428ed.title: USN-1042-1: PHP vulnerabilities
aafbe21e8e966f4a2eafd49879dd6ed13b2428ed.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow in the XML UTF-8 decodingcode could allow an attacker to bypass cross-site scripting (XSS)protections. This issue only affected Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, Ubuntu 8.04 LTS,and Ubuntu 9.10. (CVE-2009-5016)

05a712625ab3d324024c7c65e20d5aa7b94d468a.title: USN-1120-1: tiff vulnerability
05a712625ab3d324024c7c65e20d5aa7b94d468a.body: It was discovered that the TIFF library incorrectly handled certain JPEGdata. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted TIFF image, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code withuser privileges, or crash the application, leading to a denial of service.

4d7ff986cbf51f65b8901a50bbdc81ee833f9b6c.title: USN-889-1: gzip vulnerabilities
4d7ff986cbf51f65b8901a50bbdc81ee833f9b6c.body: Aki Helin discovered that gzip incorrectly handled certain malformedfiles compressed with the Lempel–Ziv–Welch (LZW) algorithm. If a user orautomated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted gzip file,an attacker could cause gzip to crash or possibly execute arbitrary codewith the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-0001)

4c606226a7eb34ba70a792e6c8ff36f7be3df037.title: USN-888-1: Bind vulnerabilities
4c606226a7eb34ba70a792e6c8ff36f7be3df037.body: It was discovered that Bind would incorrectly cache bogus NXDOMAINresponses. When DNSSEC validation is in use, a remote attacker couldexploit this to cause a denial of service, and possibly poison DNS caches.(CVE-2010-0097)

ca66538bc684e75dda47e4cd5287c0fb60c5d266.title: USN-903-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
ca66538bc684e75dda47e4cd5287c0fb60c5d266.body: It was discovered that OpenOffice did not correctly handle certainVBA macros correctly. If a user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted document, an attacker could execute arbitrary macro commands,bypassing security controls. (CVE-2010-0136)

c1711d157d7ea21628c6b0a65e66e8dc6f849f26.title: USN-895-1: Firefox 3.0 and Xulrunner 1.9 vulnerabilities
c1711d157d7ea21628c6b0a65e66e8dc6f849f26.body: Orlando Barrera II discovered a flaw in the Web Workers implementation ofFirefox. If a user were tricked into posting to a malicious website, anattacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary codewith the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-0160)

10d1ea8d21db53949ca10d9b3d6ca689fc4f8cde.title: USN-896-1: Firefox 3.5 and Xulrunner 1.9.1 vulnerabilities
10d1ea8d21db53949ca10d9b3d6ca689fc4f8cde.body: Orlando Barrera II discovered a flaw in the Web Workers implementation ofFirefox. If a user were tricked into posting to a malicious website, anattacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary codewith the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-0160)

23599748125380ee33d0fef36ea715c70a1bad09.title: USN-895-1: Firefox 3.0 and Xulrunner 1.9 vulnerabilities
23599748125380ee33d0fef36ea715c70a1bad09.body: Georgi Guninski discovered that the same-origin check in Firefox could bebypassed by utilizing a crafted SVG image. If a user were tricked intoviewing a malicious website, an attacker could exploit this to read datafrom other domains. (CVE-2010-0162)

54571527ee7e948f4160431843b48b407877f8fb.title: USN-896-1: Firefox 3.5 and Xulrunner 1.9.1 vulnerabilities
54571527ee7e948f4160431843b48b407877f8fb.body: Georgi Guninski discovered that the same-origin check in Firefox could bebypassed by utilizing a crafted SVG image. If a user were tricked intoviewing a malicious website, an attacker could exploit this to read datafrom other domains. (CVE-2010-0162)

f00778ece5c476ed918b10e3a66b1e56ad3e6341.title: USN-921-1: Firefox 3.5 and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
f00778ece5c476ed918b10e3a66b1e56ad3e6341.body: It was discovered that Firefox could be made to access previously freedmemory. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remoteattacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary codewith the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-0175,CVE-2010-0176, CVE-2010-0177)

090009d280a80baf55135b165e5c746b1dc463f2.title: USN-921-1: Firefox 3.5 and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
090009d280a80baf55135b165e5c746b1dc463f2.body: Paul Stone discovered that Firefox could be made to change a mouse clickinto a drag and drop event. If the user could be tricked into performingthis action twice on a crafted website, an attacker could executearbitrary JavaScript with chrome privileges. (CVE-2010-0178)

d468e39cba524e2418d185a0da250ed8de63853a.title: USN-921-1: Firefox 3.5 and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
d468e39cba524e2418d185a0da250ed8de63853a.body: It was discovered that the XMLHttpRequestSpy module as used by the Firebugadd-on could be used to escalate privileges within the browser. If the userhad the Firebug add-on installed and were tricked into viewing a maliciouswebsite, an attacker could potentially run arbitrary JavaScript.(CVE-2010-0179)

af398dee3bfcdce3480f160f37a19a369c86c6b8.title: USN-921-1: Firefox 3.5 and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
af398dee3bfcdce3480f160f37a19a369c86c6b8.body: Henry Sudhof discovered that an image tag could be used as a redirect toa mailto: URL to launch an external mail handler. (CVE-2010-0181)

2ac3244adb2fbc7aea6108c68ebf7cc3a0c339e4.title: USN-921-1: Firefox 3.5 and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
2ac3244adb2fbc7aea6108c68ebf7cc3a0c339e4.body: Wladimir Palant discovered that Firefox did not always perform securitychecks on XML content. An attacker could exploit this to bypass securitypolicies to load certain resources. (CVE-2010-0182)

d5fd63eef29c6ab4be00b279cb0ea2520a2e213d.title: USN-902-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
d5fd63eef29c6ab4be00b279cb0ea2520a2e213d.body: Fabian Yamaguchi discovered that Pidgin incorrectly validated all fields ofan incoming message in the MSN protocol handler. A remote attacker couldsend a specially crafted message and cause Pidgin to crash, leading to adenial of service. (CVE-2010-0277)

0751b947578b11943f0a64b597e0466617b49f13.title: USN-916-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
0751b947578b11943f0a64b597e0466617b49f13.body: Emmanuel Bouillon discovered that Kerberos did not correctly handlecertain message types. An unauthenticated remote attacker could sendspecially crafted traffic to cause the KDC to crash, leading to a denialof service. (CVE-2010-0283)

dc4de11b6363b033013603550e04772002cc613d.title: USN-944-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
dc4de11b6363b033013603550e04772002cc613d.body: Jeff Layton and Dan Rosenberg discovered that the GNU C library did notcorrectly handle newlines in the mntent family of functions. If a localattacker were able to inject newlines into a mount entry through othervulnerable mount helpers, they could disrupt the system or possibly gainroot privileges. (CVE-2010-0296)

787f700175f2580e6213683aabe4561d2b6584b9.title: USN-906-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
787f700175f2580e6213683aabe4561d2b6584b9.body: Ronald Volgers discovered that the CUPS lppasswd tool could be made to loadlocalized message strings from arbitrary files by setting an environmentvariable. A local attacker could exploit this with a format-stringvulnerability leading to a root privilege escalation. The default compileroptions for Ubuntu 8.10, 9.04 and 9.10 should reduce this vulnerability toa denial of service. (CVE-2010-0393)

f72e72db5981bc7b7ac72137945224549b1793fb.title: USN-949-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerability
f72e72db5981bc7b7ac72137945224549b1793fb.body: Marc Schoenefeld discovered that OpenOffice.org would run document macrosfrom the macro browser, even when macros were disabled. If a user weretricked into opening a specially crafted document and examining a macro,a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

6a254f025d77b327585920be63c8be859750de1e.title: USN-986-3: dpkg vulnerability
6a254f025d77b327585920be63c8be859750de1e.body: USN-986-1 fixed vulnerabilities in bzip2. dpkg statically links against libbz2and needed to be rebuilt to use the updated libbz2.Original advisory details:An integer overflow was discovered in bzip2. If a user or automated system were tricked into decompressing a crafted bz2 file, an attacker could cause bzip2 or any application linked against libbz2 to crash or possibly execute code as the user running the program.

738ca94df22fff0d246f6157bb73b490a61d79a2.title: USN-986-2: ClamAV vulnerability
738ca94df22fff0d246f6157bb73b490a61d79a2.body: USN-986-1 fixed a vulnerability in bzip2. This update provides thecorresponding update for ClamAV.Original advisory details:An integer overflow was discovered in bzip2. If a user or automated system were tricked into decompressing a crafted bz2 file, an attacker could cause bzip2 or any application linked against libbz2 to crash or possibly execute code as the user running the program.

7e051ee9bca4ba4b24d6a2f139c91905ae4e755c.title: USN-986-1: bzip2 vulnerability
7e051ee9bca4ba4b24d6a2f139c91905ae4e755c.body: An integer overflow was discovered in bzip2. If a user or automated systemwere tricked into decompressing a crafted bz2 file, an attacker could causebzip2 or any application linked against libbz2 to crash or possibly executecode as the user running the program.

a1fe96732a4732d2071f2d647833018755c392c8.title: USN-914-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a1fe96732a4732d2071f2d647833018755c392c8.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that the Linux kernel did not correctlyhandle netlink connector messages. A local attacker could exploit thisto consume kernel memory, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-0410)

4ff9c172540da2bbd708bb8dd8cfdc92651ab0f7.title: USN-902-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
4ff9c172540da2bbd708bb8dd8cfdc92651ab0f7.body: Sadrul Habib Chowdhury discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled certainnicknames in Finch group chat rooms. A remote attacker could use aspecially crafted nickname and cause Pidgin to crash, leading to a denialof service. (CVE-2010-0420)

da370e7da66196d4926b886afedb7858782d76ea.title: USN-902-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
da370e7da66196d4926b886afedb7858782d76ea.body: Antti Hayrynen discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled large numbers ofsmileys. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted message and causePidgin to become unresponsive, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2010-0423)

cab5a548d98992c17ac0e3f9f691614985f8bd60.title: USN-905-1: sudo vulnerabilities
cab5a548d98992c17ac0e3f9f691614985f8bd60.body: It was discovered that sudo did not properly validate the path for the'sudoedit' pseudo-command. A local attacker could exploit this to executearbitrary code as root if sudo was configured to allow the attacker to usesudoedit. The sudoedit pseudo-command is not used in the defaultinstallation of Ubuntu. (CVE-2010-0426)

e9fd76b3ecaeed939a41dc8f7bab53386960e1e7.title: USN-905-1: sudo vulnerabilities
e9fd76b3ecaeed939a41dc8f7bab53386960e1e7.body: It was discovered that sudo did not reset group permissions when the'runas_default' configuration option was used. A local attacker couldexploit this to escalate group privileges if sudo was configured to allowthe attacker to run commands under the runas_default account. Therunas_default configuration option is not used in the default installationof Ubuntu. This issue affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, 8.10 and 9.04.(CVE-2010-0427)

189a11f9222a9f5224ae61a01a9e23528b932fc7.title: USN-933-1: PostgreSQL vulnerability
189a11f9222a9f5224ae61a01a9e23528b932fc7.body: It was discovered that PostgreSQL did not properly sanitize its input whenusing substring() with a SELECT statement. A remote authenticated attackercould exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash.

3ebdcbb8da8374c4bd216784102c4983076ad1b0.title: USN-2456-1: GNU cpio vulnerabilities
3ebdcbb8da8374c4bd216784102c4983076ad1b0.body: Jakob Lell discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in the rmt_read__function of GNU cpio's rmt client functionality. An attackercontrolling a remote rmt server could use this to cause a denial ofservice or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affectedUbuntu 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-0624)

60fcf1975356e58c89fe5a4a3e70edf859ccabef.title: USN-924-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
60fcf1975356e58c89fe5a4a3e70edf859ccabef.body: Sol Jerome discovered that the Kerberos kadmind service did not correctlyfree memory. An unauthenticated remote attacker could send speciallycrafted traffic to crash the kadmind process, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2010-0629)

10e40c146dd47a3017de6af37b2c9f19b2d572be.title: USN-1158-1: curl vulnerabilities
10e40c146dd47a3017de6af37b2c9f19b2d572be.body: Wesley Miaw discovered that when zlib is enabled, libcurl does notproperly restrict the amount of callback data sent to an applicationthat requests automatic decompression. This might allow an attacker tocause a denial of service via an application crash or possibly executearbitrary code with the privilege of the application. This issue onlyaffected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS and Ubuntu 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-0734)

9332583a4654d7be369b92793377ddb2de7fb789.title: USN-937-1: TeX Live vulnerabilities
9332583a4654d7be369b92793377ddb2de7fb789.body: Marc Schoenefeld, Karel Šrot and Ludwig Nussel discovered that TeX Liveincorrectly handled certain malformed dvi files. If a user or automatedsystem were tricked into processing a specially crafted dvi file, anattacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2010-0739, CVE-2010-1440)

1c50577cd4bd307a533808e060b2adb66d1f7054.title: USN-919-1: Emacs vulnerability
1c50577cd4bd307a533808e060b2adb66d1f7054.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that the email helper in Emacs did not correctlycheck file permissions. A local attacker could perform a symlink raceto read or append to another user's mailbox if it was stored under agroup-writable group-"mail" directory.

c3723fd020e71920c5f77823de451ca4644cd8eb.title: USN-922-1: libnss-db vulnerability
c3723fd020e71920c5f77823de451ca4644cd8eb.body: Stephane Chazelas discovered that libnss-db did not correctly set up adatabase environment. A local attacker could exploit this to read thefirst line of arbitrary files, leading to a loss of privacy and possiblyprivilege escalation.

6b4119365e8c6fdb5376f65df4b021c5cad979ed.title: USN-937-1: TeX Live vulnerabilities
6b4119365e8c6fdb5376f65df4b021c5cad979ed.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that TeX Live incorrectly handled certainmalformed dvi files. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a specially crafted dvi file, an attacker could cause a denialof service via application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code withthe privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-0827)

a9d34fdeca6925ff2450eb9da1d170614d69ebd2.title: USN-925-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
a9d34fdeca6925ff2450eb9da1d170614d69ebd2.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin did not properly sanitize its input whenprocessing Despam actions, resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS)vulnerabilities. If a privileged wiki user were tricked into performingthe Despam action on a page with a crafted title, a remote attacker couldexploit this to execute JavaScript code. (CVE-2010-0828)

3be0878f73f537808fe387f9c408fac4382f362b.title: USN-936-1: dvipng vulnerability
3be0878f73f537808fe387f9c408fac4382f362b.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that dvipng incorrectly handled certain malformeddvi files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing aspecially crafted dvi file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program.

a3349bffaeb02478e517c5dd61bd90a1f8c28270.title: USN-944-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
a3349bffaeb02478e517c5dd61bd90a1f8c28270.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that the GNU C library did not correctly validatecertain ELF program headers. If a user or automated system were trickedinto verifying a specially crafted ELF program, a remote attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2010-0830)

726a22d325da19f5a574448a614bf84a6f238b7c.title: USN-964-1: Likewise Open vulnerability
726a22d325da19f5a574448a614bf84a6f238b7c.body: Matt Weatherford discovered that Likewise Open did not correctly checkpassword expiration for the local-provider account. A local attacker couldexploit this to log into a system they would otherwise not have access to.

3fad819b4c85888ac1e53b29165047fdca5e09bb.title: USN-968-1: Dell Latitude 2110 vulnerability
3fad819b4c85888ac1e53b29165047fdca5e09bb.body: It was discovered that the Ubuntu image shipped on some Dell Latitude2110 systems was accidentally configured to allow unauthenticated packageinstallations. A remote attacker intercepting network communications ora malicious archive mirror server could exploit this to trick the userinto installing unsigned packages, resulting in arbitrary code executionwith root privileges.

f2b99507577be1c441aa8b29b7f67a521dd491e4.title: USN-938-1: KDENetwork vulnerabilities
f2b99507577be1c441aa8b29b7f67a521dd491e4.body: It was discovered that KGet did not properly perform input validation whenprocessing metalink files. If a user were tricked into opening a craftedmetalink file, a remote attacker could overwrite files via directorytraversal, which could eventually lead to arbitrary code execution.(CVE-2010-1000)

f50c05c7cdd7b7e6940321a85b13b86133a260a6.title: USN-930-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
f50c05c7cdd7b7e6940321a85b13b86133a260a6.body: If was discovered that Firefox could be made to access freed memory. If auser were tricked into viewing a malicious site, a remote attacker couldcause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program. This issue only affectedUbuntu 8.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-1121)

1ec9139a833c8ccc0138a78e197b8b4c83454f75.title: USN-930-2: apturl, Epiphany, gecko-sharp, gnome-python-extras, liferea, rhythmbox, totem, ubufox, yelp update
1ec9139a833c8ccc0138a78e197b8b4c83454f75.body: If was discovered that Firefox could be made to access freed memory. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious site, a remote attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-1121)

2c710987bd4e6c4fbdb8e014d69c5e5d5958d1a0.title: USN-930-2: apturl, Epiphany, gecko-sharp, gnome-python-extras, liferea, rhythmbox, totem, ubufox, yelp update
2c710987bd4e6c4fbdb8e014d69c5e5d5958d1a0.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that the focus behavior of Firefox could be subverted. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious site, a remote attacker could use this to capture keystrokes. (CVE-2010-1125)

35cb832ba8bb944fdc820069628f27649a4cc0cf.title: USN-930-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
35cb832ba8bb944fdc820069628f27649a4cc0cf.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that the focus behavior of Firefox could besubverted. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious site, a remoteattacker could use this to capture keystrokes. (CVE-2010-1125)

359956fd644d71b61593193f32f48202a86eceae.title: USN-929-1: irssi vulnerabilities
359956fd644d71b61593193f32f48202a86eceae.body: It was discovered that irssi did not perform certificate host validationwhen using SSL connections. An attacker could exploit this to perform a manin the middle attack to view sensitive information or alter encryptedcommunications. (CVE-2010-1155)

63c54089d39929e562ed04301d9f673bf8c51246.title: USN-928-1: Sudo vulnerability
63c54089d39929e562ed04301d9f673bf8c51246.body: Valerio Costamagna discovered that sudo did not properly validate the pathfor the 'sudoedit' pseudo-command when the PATH contained only a dot ('.').If secure_path and ignore_dot were disabled, a local attacker could exploitthis to execute arbitrary code as root if sudo was configured to allow theattacker to use sudoedit. By default, secure_path is used and the sudoeditpseudo-command is not used in Ubuntu. This is a different but related issueto CVE-2010-0426.

15ca16ecabbdc00745cf1949a8b105c10941b8c6.title: USN-939-1: X.org vulnerabilities
15ca16ecabbdc00745cf1949a8b105c10941b8c6.body: It was discovered that the X.org server did not correctly handlecertain calculations. A remote attacker could exploit this tocrash the X.org session or possibly run arbitrary code with rootprivileges. (CVE-2010-1166)

6435598f24c6764a400787ac2edb5183edc0ac6b.title: USN-930-2: apturl, Epiphany, gecko-sharp, gnome-python-extras, liferea, rhythmbox, totem, ubufox, yelp update
6435598f24c6764a400787ac2edb5183edc0ac6b.body: An integer overflow was discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious site, an attacker could overflow a buffer and cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-1196)

808a5e1788adef3218d9a46210d46aa137f4cc48.title: USN-930-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
808a5e1788adef3218d9a46210d46aa137f4cc48.body: An integer overflow was discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked intoviewing a malicious site, an attacker could overflow a buffer and cause adenial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges ofthe user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-1196)

5819e560f3815add1a4f3751b8e6f3d4e4e08d20.title: USN-930-2: apturl, Epiphany, gecko-sharp, gnome-python-extras, liferea, rhythmbox, totem, ubufox, yelp update
5819e560f3815add1a4f3751b8e6f3d4e4e08d20.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered that the 'Content-Disposition: attachment' HTTP header was ignored when 'Content-Type: multipart' was also present. Under certain circumstances, this could potentially lead to cross-site scripting attacks. (CVE-2010-1197)

a094e038cccf9b0f86a78b22b2951db113bbf8b5.title: USN-930-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
a094e038cccf9b0f86a78b22b2951db113bbf8b5.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered that the 'Content-Disposition: attachment'HTTP header was ignored when 'Content-Type: multipart' was also present.Under certain circumstances, this could potentially lead to cross-sitescripting attacks. (CVE-2010-1197)

bc4f6df38f34a31881a1b731b6affc4143b18846.title: USN-930-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
bc4f6df38f34a31881a1b731b6affc4143b18846.body: A flaw was discovered in the way plugin instances interacted. An attackercould potentially exploit this and use one plugin to access freed memory from asecond plugin to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2010-1198)

ca60369e2a45c1cca415ecefe2fa3b971bdd6d07.title: USN-930-2: apturl, Epiphany, gecko-sharp, gnome-python-extras, liferea, rhythmbox, totem, ubufox, yelp update
ca60369e2a45c1cca415ecefe2fa3b971bdd6d07.body: A flaw was discovered in the way plugin instances interacted. An attacker could potentially exploit this and use one plugin to access freed memory from a second plugin to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-1198)

dd80fd332937a431901dca10b3e7e0c0f6d478c7.title: USN-930-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
dd80fd332937a431901dca10b3e7e0c0f6d478c7.body: Martin Barbella discovered an integer overflow in an XSLT node sortingroutine. An attacker could exploit this to overflow a buffer and cause adenial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges ofthe user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-1199)

22dafd612ff75534e63c8d87000cd521026562c0.title: USN-930-2: apturl, Epiphany, gecko-sharp, gnome-python-extras, liferea, rhythmbox, totem, ubufox, yelp update
22dafd612ff75534e63c8d87000cd521026562c0.body: Martin Barbella discovered an integer overflow in an XSLT node sorting routine. An attacker could exploit this to overflow a buffer and cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-1199)

8f10367361d6d4a936d14c306e957e6fff1cc186.title: USN-925-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
8f10367361d6d4a936d14c306e957e6fff1cc186.body: It was discovered that the TextCha protection in MoinMoin could be bypassedby submitting a crafted form request. This issue only affected Ubuntu 8.10.(CVE-2010-1238)

4e25f9e63cfd2f828208d1b26cbca92b55b09164.title: USN-926-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
4e25f9e63cfd2f828208d1b26cbca92b55b09164.body: It was discovered that ClamAV did not properly verify its input whenprocessing CAB files. A remote attacker could send a specially craftedCAB file and cause a denial of service via application crash.(CVE-2010-1311)

ee3481e428e09b85fbc15d04bb92ae1255014dd5.title: USN-940-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
ee3481e428e09b85fbc15d04bb92ae1255014dd5.body: Joel Johnson, Brian Almeida, and Shawn Emery discovered that Kerberosdid not correctly verify certain packet structures. An unauthenticatedremote attacker could send specially crafted traffic to cause the KDC orkadmind services to crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-1320,CVE-2010-1321)

4e597e1215d0eaf99c8d75b772a505b274038ff8.title: USN-940-2: Kerberos vulnerability
4e597e1215d0eaf99c8d75b772a505b274038ff8.body: Joel Johnson, Brian Almeida, and Shawn Emery discovered that Kerberos did not correctly verify certain packet structures. An unauthenticated remote attacker could send specially crafted traffic to cause the KDC or kadmind services to crash, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-1320, CVE-2010-1321)

9260dfe8ce6bbf8edf211285ad146a2b2e05cbc5.title: USN-999-1: Kerberos vulnerability
9260dfe8ce6bbf8edf211285ad146a2b2e05cbc5.body: Mike Roszkowski discovered that the Kerberos KDC did not correctlyvalidate the contents of certain messages. If an authenticated remoteattacker sent specially crafted TGS requests, the KDC service would crash,leading to a denial of service.

f02e52210e311fc22a75bb853b1ef9da1e0d6565.title: USN-1030-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
f02e52210e311fc22a75bb853b1ef9da1e0d6565.body: It was discovered that Kerberos did not properly determine theacceptability of certain checksums. A remote attacker could use certainchecksums to alter the prompt message, modify a response to a KeyDistribution Center (KDC) or forge a KRB-SAFE message. (CVE-2010-1323)

29e99f96a97a3ae7ad8d6e1499aa3fe199c5cbc1.title: USN-1030-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
29e99f96a97a3ae7ad8d6e1499aa3fe199c5cbc1.body: It was discovered that Kerberos did not properly determine theacceptability of certain checksums. A remote attacker could use certainchecksums to forge GSS tokens or gain privileges. This issue only affectedUbuntu 9.10, 10.04 LTS and 10.10. (CVE-2010-1324)

41c28d275c3cad00d0334f4dd97fa5ba305f1b00.title: USN-954-1: tiff vulnerabilities
41c28d275c3cad00d0334f4dd97fa5ba305f1b00.body: Kevin Finisterre discovered that the TIFF library did not correctly handlecertain image structures. If a user or automated system were trickedinto opening a specially crafted TIFF image, a remote attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with user privileges, or crash the application,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-1411)

b300badc9070c67bbe5893d7f74d0ac692e420bd.title: USN-938-1: KDENetwork vulnerabilities
b300badc9070c67bbe5893d7f74d0ac692e420bd.body: It was discovered that KGet would not always wait for user confirmationwhen downloading metalink files. If a user selected a file to downloadbut did not confirm or cancel the download, KGet would proceed with thedownload, overwriting any file with the same name. This issue onlyaffected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-1511)

d73e2ca50b180e3ccf6c66be6530532ac30637d0.title: USN-1021-1: Apache vulnerabilities
d73e2ca50b180e3ccf6c66be6530532ac30637d0.body: It was discovered that Apache did not properly handle memory whendestroying APR buckets. A remote attacker could exploit this with craftedrequests and cause a denial of service via memory exhaustion. This issueaffected Ubuntu 6.06 LTS and 10.10. (CVE-2010-1623)

678ca694b92243f72fee75310632ff212a6892ca.title: USN-1022-1: APR-util vulnerability
678ca694b92243f72fee75310632ff212a6892ca.body: It was discovered that APR-util did not properly handle memory whendestroying APR buckets. An attacker could exploit this and cause a denialof service via memory exhaustion.

114ea56337c21c76c73922451e84d909df584a9d.title: USN-1014-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
114ea56337c21c76c73922451e84d909df584a9d.body: Pierre Noguès discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled malformed SLPmessages in the MSN protocol handler. A remote attacker could send aspecially crafted message and cause Pidgin to crash, leading to a denialof service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, 9.10 and 10.04 LTS.(CVE-2010-1624)

62a5bbc601a75935f3982c8432bdb20ed5cee6a7.title: USN-961-1: Ghostscript vulnerabilities
62a5bbc601a75935f3982c8432bdb20ed5cee6a7.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that Ghostscript incorrectly handled certainrecursive Postscript files. If a user or automated system were tricked intoopening a crafted Postscript file, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice or execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2010-1628)

d331781690acb56ea3df93f774b819e326e5333b.title: USN-1596-1: Python 2.6 vulnerabilities
d331781690acb56ea3df93f774b819e326e5333b.body: It was discovered that the audioop module did not correctly perform inputvalidation. If a user or automatated system were tricked into opening acrafted audio file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash. (CVE-2010-1634, CVE-2010-2089)

07ace996ddfe31247b272c5b373c164adaf7e920.title: USN-1613-2: Python 2.4 vulnerabilities
07ace996ddfe31247b272c5b373c164adaf7e920.body: It was discovered that the audioop module did not correctly perform input validation. If a user or automatated system were tricked into opening a crafted audio file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash. (CVE-2010-1634, CVE-2010-2089)

842df4e7b60dc3bdc149a520185e740f082ea496.title: USN-1613-1: Python 2.5 vulnerabilities
842df4e7b60dc3bdc149a520185e740f082ea496.body: It was discovered that the audioop module did not correctly perform inputvalidation. If a user or automatated system were tricked into opening acrafted audio file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash. (CVE-2010-1634, CVE-2010-2089)

47e667d29d39992fdf12391d34f081c4e0b93eec.title: USN-1616-1: Python 3.1 vulnerabilities
47e667d29d39992fdf12391d34f081c4e0b93eec.body: It was discovered that the audioop module did not correctly perform inputvalidation. If a user or automatated system were tricked into opening acrafted audio file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash. These issues only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS.(CVE-2010-1634, CVE-2010-2089)

21584b26239c9dc7d7fd50103bf8a6e149614ab0.title: USN-1038-1: dpkg vulnerability
21584b26239c9dc7d7fd50103bf8a6e149614ab0.body: Jakub Wilk and Raphael Hertzog discovered that dpkg-source did notcorrectly handle certain paths and symlinks when unpacking source-formatversion 3.0 packages. If a user or an automated system were tricked intounpacking a specially crafted source package, a remote attacker couldmodify files outside the target unpack directory, leading to a denialof service or potentially gaining access to the system.

6ae94a1256f78144f4bc3fe4e64749210df74b69.title: USN-972-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
6ae94a1256f78144f4bc3fe4e64749210df74b69.body: It was discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certain malformedfont files. If a user were tricked into using a specially crafted fontfile, a remote attacker could cause FreeType to crash or possibly executearbitrary code with user privileges.

329dda0a98b3a59eab9c0e73ffcb38310a5633dd.title: USN-961-1: Ghostscript vulnerabilities
329dda0a98b3a59eab9c0e73ffcb38310a5633dd.body: Rodrigo Rubira Branco and Dan Rosenberg discovered that Ghostscriptincorrectly handled certain malformed Postscript files. If a user orautomated system were tricked into opening a crafted Postscript file, anattacker could cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code withprivileges of the user invoking the program. This issue only affectedUbuntu 8.04 LTS, 9.04 and 9.10. (CVE-2010-1869)

1f6178435a497e6b79517be80d40f067ef570766.title: USN-951-1: Samba vulnerability
1f6178435a497e6b79517be80d40f067ef570766.body: Jun Mao discovered that Samba did not correctly validate SMB1 packetcontents. An unauthenticated remote attacker could send specially craftednetwork traffic that could execute arbitrary code as the root user.

281429bc2dba95445fb688bc4e748cd890c49e43.title: USN-954-1: tiff vulnerabilities
281429bc2dba95445fb688bc4e748cd890c49e43.body: Dan Rosenberg and Sauli Pahlman discovered multiple flaws in the TIFFlibrary. If a user or automated system were into opening a speciallycrafted TIFF image, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary codewith user privileges, or crash the application, leading to a denialof service. (Only Ubuntu 10.04 LTS was affected.) (CVE-2010-2065,CVE-2010-2067)

3ddfc07370d42c6dd99ad3a6494de19db8ae6434.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3ddfc07370d42c6dd99ad3a6494de19db8ae6434.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that the swapexit xfs ioctl did not correctlycheck file permissions. A local attacker could exploit this to read fromwrite-only files, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-2226)

e1b06738ab6e70bde1872027ca9be1a77e4c1cd7.title: USN-1008-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
e1b06738ab6e70bde1872027ca9be1a77e4c1cd7.body: It was discovered that libvirt would probe disk backing stores withoutconsulting the defined format for the disk. A privileged attacker in theguest could exploit this to read arbitrary files on the host. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS. By default, guests are confined by anAppArmor profile which provided partial protection against this flaw.(CVE-2010-2237, CVE-2010-2238)

8ed44449d019f101d55358babc2d991fb7407ab7.title: USN-1008-3: libvirt update
8ed44449d019f101d55358babc2d991fb7407ab7.body: It was discovered that libvirt would probe disk backing stores without consulting the defined format for the disk. A privileged attacker in the guest could exploit this to read arbitrary files on the host. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS. By default, guests are confined by an AppArmor profile which provided partial protection against this flaw. (CVE-2010-2237, CVE-2010-2238)

37c9d4251a4e4eddeaec15323ba952c58db87991.title: USN-1008-2: Virtinst update
37c9d4251a4e4eddeaec15323ba952c58db87991.body: It was discovered that libvirt would probe disk backing stores without consulting the defined format for the disk. A privileged attacker in the guest could exploit this to read arbitrary files on the host. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS. By default, guests are confined by an AppArmor profile which provided partial protection against this flaw. (CVE-2010-2237, CVE-2010-2238)

30cfac1ccbc67ec2ecbf01f27f5e2ef3fb2d44ab.title: USN-1008-2: Virtinst update
30cfac1ccbc67ec2ecbf01f27f5e2ef3fb2d44ab.body: It was discovered that libvirt would create new VMs without setting a backing store format. A privileged attacker in the guest could exploit this to read arbitrary files on the host. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 8.04 LTS. In Ubuntu 9.10 and later guests are confined by an AppArmor profile which provided partial protection against this flaw. (CVE-2010-2239)

7ff9f1a17ebe0c5ba3b9c28a74bcc0632a0714d2.title: USN-1008-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
7ff9f1a17ebe0c5ba3b9c28a74bcc0632a0714d2.body: It was discovered that libvirt would create new VMs without setting abacking store format. A privileged attacker in the guest could exploit thisto read arbitrary files on the host. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 8.04LTS. In Ubuntu 9.10 and later guests are confined by an AppArmor profilewhich provided partial protection against this flaw. (CVE-2010-2239)

e99700b6f78bccf728a816aa11d049b238471f08.title: USN-1008-3: libvirt update
e99700b6f78bccf728a816aa11d049b238471f08.body: It was discovered that libvirt would create new VMs without setting a backing store format. A privileged attacker in the guest could exploit this to read arbitrary files on the host. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 8.04 LTS. In Ubuntu 9.10 and later guests are confined by an AppArmor profile which provided partial protection against this flaw. (CVE-2010-2239)

95dd565f45562cd734f17bd9a003c8d71936d329.title: USN-1008-3: libvirt update
95dd565f45562cd734f17bd9a003c8d71936d329.body: Jeremy Nickurak discovered that libvirt created iptables rules with too lenient mappings of source ports. A privileged attacker in the guest could bypass intended restrictions to access privileged resources on the host. (CVE-2010-2242)

136260588f22f17f50fcd787daf2c19614be4e62.title: USN-1008-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
136260588f22f17f50fcd787daf2c19614be4e62.body: Jeremy Nickurak discovered that libvirt created iptables rules with toolenient mappings of source ports. A privileged attacker in the guest couldbypass intended restrictions to access privileged resources on the host.(CVE-2010-2242)

bcc9670dc52a7a01d8d986744888d3d911499413.title: USN-1008-2: Virtinst update
bcc9670dc52a7a01d8d986744888d3d911499413.body: Jeremy Nickurak discovered that libvirt created iptables rules with too lenient mappings of source ports. A privileged attacker in the guest could bypass intended restrictions to access privileged resources on the host. (CVE-2010-2242)

9dde39928a8ca748b73476bedb0546b12d5ba875.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9dde39928a8ca748b73476bedb0546b12d5ba875.body: Suresh Jayaraman discovered that CIFS did not correctly validate certainresponse packats. A remote attacker could send specially crafted trafficthat would crash the system, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2010-2248)

c8ca98a16798cb7fbad47e84c7ff5a4cd3356ad2.title: USN-981-1: libwww-perl vulnerability
c8ca98a16798cb7fbad47e84c7ff5a4cd3356ad2.body: It was discovered that libwww-perl incorrectly filtered filenames suggestedby Content-Disposition headers. If a user were tricked into downloading afile from a malicious site, a remote attacker could overwrite hidden filesin the user's directory.

544a03322a88726f5f1c51066971fe611fd8cf93.title: USN-1026-1: Python Paste vulnerability
544a03322a88726f5f1c51066971fe611fd8cf93.body: It was discovered that Python Paste did not properly sanitize certainstrings, resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. Withcross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewingserver output during a crafted server request, a remote attacker couldexploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, withinthe same domain.

a7e76e1c58aac7b85eba0af0e0e489def19563b4.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a7e76e1c58aac7b85eba0af0e0e489def19563b4.body: Ben Hutchings discovered that the ethtool interface did not correctly checkcertain sizes. A local attacker could perform malicious ioctl calls thatcould crash the system, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-2478,CVE-2010-3084)

73cecddee12ea0e3658958dce1b36eb796085fc8.title: USN-980-1: bogofilter vulnerability
73cecddee12ea0e3658958dce1b36eb796085fc8.body: Julius Plenz discovered that bogofilter incorrectly handled certainmalformed encodings. By sending a specially crafted email, a remoteattacker could exploit this and cause bogofilter to crash, resulting in adenial of service.

80b0f062a45e765c48c4e1b97c5264e6c5ec6041.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
80b0f062a45e765c48c4e1b97c5264e6c5ec6041.body: James Chapman discovered that L2TP did not correctly evaluate checksumcapabilities. If an attacker could make malicious routing changes, theycould crash the system, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-2495)

9a1eff68c9dad47124a313fd7e77231f1ba0c9e3.title: USN-963-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
9a1eff68c9dad47124a313fd7e77231f1ba0c9e3.body: Robert Święcki discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certainmalformed font files. If a user were tricked into using a specially craftedfont file, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges.

45a72aa813566215a4c4b0e1ee325296293f7996.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
45a72aa813566215a4c4b0e1ee325296293f7996.body: Neil Brown discovered that NFSv4 did not correctly check certain writerequests. A remote attacker could send specially crafted traffic that couldcrash the system or possibly gain root privileges. (CVE-2010-2521)

5cb05721b5e48f1a9f78f9661730fbd1e4e92bbd.title: USN-1001-1: LVM2 vulnerability
5cb05721b5e48f1a9f78f9661730fbd1e4e92bbd.body: The cluster logical volume manager daemon (clvmd) in LVM2 did not correctlyvalidate credentials. A local user could use this flaw to manipulatelogical volumes without root privileges and cause a denial of service inthe cluster.

cf039628504968e8df6a8b75c7333bd21defd76d.title: USN-1041-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
cf039628504968e8df6a8b75c7333bd21defd76d.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that the btrfs filesystem did not correctlyvalidate permissions when using the clone function. A local attacker couldoverwrite the contents of file handles that were opened for append-only, orpotentially read arbitrary contents, leading to a loss of privacy.(CVE-2010-2537, CVE-2010-2538)

eff8071ff895d0a1822648fa230c40d1c107083f.title: USN-979-1: okular vulnerability
eff8071ff895d0a1822648fa230c40d1c107083f.body: Stefan Cornelius of Secunia Research discovered a boundary error duringRLE decompression in the "TranscribePalmImageToJPEG()" function ingenerators/plucker/inplug/image.cpp of okular when processing imagesembedded in PDB files, which can be exploited to cause a heap-basedbuffer overflow. (CVE-2010-2575)

4659bdf42e73a343125f4a88e73e5dcd50313137.title: USN-1035-1: Evince vulnerabilities
4659bdf42e73a343125f4a88e73e5dcd50313137.body: Jon Larimer discovered that Evince's font parsers incorrectly handledcertain buffer lengths when rendering a DVI file. By tricking a user intoopening or previewing a DVI file that uses a specially crafted font file,an attacker could crash evince or execute arbitrary code with the user'sprivileges.In the default installation of Ubuntu 9.10 and later, attackers would beisolated by the Evince AppArmor profile.

3f18dd58049d74d967e1ba385998dacf7c37337a.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3f18dd58049d74d967e1ba385998dacf7c37337a.body: Bob Peterson discovered that GFS2 rename operations did not correctlyvalidate certain sizes. A local attacker could exploit this to crash thesystem, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-2798)

47c43e23d44be014e3eb455f797e21ce23ce40f9.title: USN-1642-1: Lynx vulnerabilities
47c43e23d44be014e3eb455f797e21ce23ce40f9.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in Lynx. If a userwere tricked into opening a specially crafted page, a remote attacker couldcause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly executearbitrary code as the user invoking the program. This issue only affectedUbuntu 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-2810)

e2012c0e9d0d08a7ce33e753dfd05a3d85683873.title: USN-1056-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
e2012c0e9d0d08a7ce33e753dfd05a3d85683873.body: Charlie Miller discovered several heap overflows in PPT processing. Ifa user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially craftedPPT document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges. Ubuntu 10.10 was not affected. (CVE-2010-2935, CVE-2010-2936)

de3073524797546a418f23136d88a406a229434c.title: USN-1003-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
de3073524797546a418f23136d88a406a229434c.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled certain private keyswith an invalid prime. A remote attacker could trigger this flaw inservices that used SSL to cause a denial of service or possibly executearbitrary code with application privileges. The default compiler optionsfor affected releases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2010-2939)

2969417dbb53255a310be51284346f04f9a137cf.title: USN-1012-1: CUPS vulnerability
2969417dbb53255a310be51284346f04f9a137cf.body: Emmanuel Bouillon discovered that CUPS did not properly handle certainInternet Printing Protocol (IPP) packets. A remote attacker could use thisflaw to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. Inthe default installation in Ubuntu 8.04 LTS and later, attackers would beisolated by the CUPS AppArmor profile.

edf54cd5139b7cd29f128610f8f2910adc277f5f.title: USN-1041-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
edf54cd5139b7cd29f128610f8f2910adc277f5f.body: Dave Chinner discovered that the XFS filesystem did not correctly orderinode lookups when exported by NFS. A remote attacker could exploit this toread or write disk blocks that had changed file assignment or had becomeunlinked, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-2943)

1a7446d8762dd564214db662a7e1668839b7f055.title: USN-1057-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
1a7446d8762dd564214db662a7e1668839b7f055.body: Dave Chinner discovered that the XFS filesystem did not correctly orderinode lookups when exported by NFS. A remote attacker could exploit this toread or write disk blocks that had changed file assignment or had becomeunlinked, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-2943)

e4b242fa9ecea37b093d38d3fb41997fe8318406.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e4b242fa9ecea37b093d38d3fb41997fe8318406.body: Sergey Vlasov discovered that JFS did not correctly handle certain extendedattributes. A local attacker could bypass namespace access rules, leadingto a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-2946)

8d7da1bb2d1f7c8fede14f8d9ce56ef7107a11be.title: USN-1027-1: Quagga vulnerabilities
8d7da1bb2d1f7c8fede14f8d9ce56ef7107a11be.body: It was discovered that Quagga incorrectly handled certain Outbound RouteFiltering (ORF) records. A remote authenticated attacker could use thisflaw to cause a denial of service or potentially execute arbitrary code.The default compiler options for Ubuntu 8.04 LTS and later should reducethe vulnerability to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-2948)

b8899e758ee4067960ace7ca79f79d6aa02f0592.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b8899e758ee4067960ace7ca79f79d6aa02f0592.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the IRDA subsystem did not correctly shutdown. A local attacker could exploit this to cause the system to crash orpossibly gain root privileges. (CVE-2010-2954)

d69fee91d10f6693ddd027791fecccf986c697d3.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d69fee91d10f6693ddd027791fecccf986c697d3.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the session keyring did not correctly checkfor its parent. On systems without a default session keyring, a localattacker could exploit this to crash the system, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2010-2960)

78ffbc9312f6190d8231fe3c0b768fa765db24ee.title: USN-1041-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
78ffbc9312f6190d8231fe3c0b768fa765db24ee.body: Kees Cook discovered that the Intel i915 graphics driver did not correctlyvalidate memory regions. A local attacker with access to the video cardcould read and write arbitrary kernel memory to gain root privileges.(CVE-2010-2962)

93baf06310b809a43b1495ca98e04f6e3fb61792.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
93baf06310b809a43b1495ca98e04f6e3fb61792.body: Kees Cook discovered that the V4L1 32bit compat interface did not correctlyvalidate certain parameters. A local attacker on a 64bit system with accessto a video device could exploit this to gain root privileges.(CVE-2010-2963)

1f39db1a4f829dccaa48cb2c054c113cfdde4aec.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
1f39db1a4f829dccaa48cb2c054c113cfdde4aec.body: Toshiyuki Okajima discovered that ext4 did not correctly check certainparameters. A local attacker could exploit this to crash the system oroverwrite the last block of large files. (CVE-2010-3015)

15e528a6bbe24222c66991b47dfddf3228e0f5d7.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
15e528a6bbe24222c66991b47dfddf3228e0f5d7.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the AIO subsystem did not correctly validatecertain parameters. A local attacker could exploit this to crash the systemor possibly gain root privileges. (CVE-2010-3067)

436eaa8e88d610dd8e83a7ce80f14fc70c37718b.title: USN-987-1: Samba vulnerability
436eaa8e88d610dd8e83a7ce80f14fc70c37718b.body: Andrew Bartlett discovered that Samba did not correctly validate thelength when parsing SIDs. A remote attacker could send a specially craftedrequest to the server and cause a denial of service, or possibly executearbitrary code with the privileges of the Samba service (smbd).The default compiler options for Ubuntu 8.04 LTS and newer should reducethe vulnerability to a denial of service.

97c5653917abffb381cfa117ae8eb13de973b0c7.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
97c5653917abffb381cfa117ae8eb13de973b0c7.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that certain XFS ioctls leaked kernel stackcontents. A local attacker could exploit this to read portions of kernelmemory, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-3078)

c885cfd0130a94ab6053daf096b0d3acf4c2b87e.title: USN-1041-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c885cfd0130a94ab6053daf096b0d3acf4c2b87e.body: Robert Swiecki discovered that ftrace did not correctly handle mutexes. Alocal attacker could exploit this to crash the kernel, leading to a denialof service. (CVE-2010-3079)

b7b92a5c9ac4dc3db83762ce0c4a952b4855eb38.title: USN-1004-1: Django vulnerability
b7b92a5c9ac4dc3db83762ce0c4a952b4855eb38.body: It was discovered that Django did not properly sanitize the cookie valuewhen applying CSRF protections resulting in a cross-site scripting (XSS)vulnerability. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user weretricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, aremote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or stealconfidential data, within the same domain.

e242ce51218094a5a74e3729e9506caf6f2c13fe.title: USN-1069-1: Mailman vulnerabilities
e242ce51218094a5a74e3729e9506caf6f2c13fe.body: It was discovered that Mailman did not properly sanitize certain fields,resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. With cross-sitescripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing serveroutput during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploitthis to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the samedomain.

c9106056fec5c401a3243cc67f37ca734eb3e368.title: USN-1007-1: NSS vulnerabilities
c9106056fec5c401a3243cc67f37ca734eb3e368.body: Richard Moore discovered that NSS would sometimes incorrectly match an SSLcertificate which had a Common Name that used a wildcard followed by a partialIP address. While it is very unlikely that a Certificate Authority would issuesuch a certificate, if an attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middleattack, this flaw could be exploited to view sensitive information.(CVE-2010-3170)

f73e1811abfa75f92c2e2b4ed113c308e6981e3d.title: USN-1007-1: NSS vulnerabilities
f73e1811abfa75f92c2e2b4ed113c308e6981e3d.body: Nelson Bolyard discovered a weakness in the Diffie-Hellman Ephemeral mode(DHE) key exchange implementation which allowed servers to use a too smallkey length. (CVE-2010-3173)

2346f582129c963caa702c66abedf0247d422058.title: USN-997-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
2346f582129c963caa702c66abedf0247d422058.body: Robert Swiecki discovered that Firefox did not properly validate GopherURLs. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted file via Gopher, anattacker could possibly run arbitrary JavaScript. (CVE-2010-3177)

44609be48ea5159119403a4ab06428d2843af166.title: USN-997-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
44609be48ea5159119403a4ab06428d2843af166.body: Eduardo Vela Nava discovered that Firefox could be made to violate thesame-origin policy by using modal calls with JavaScript. An attacker couldexploit this to steal information from another site. (CVE-2010-3178)

1203dd38c5af2fd3d89f0bfb4cb023f83a2fc40c.title: USN-998-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
1203dd38c5af2fd3d89f0bfb4cb023f83a2fc40c.body: Eduardo Vela Nava discovered that Thunderbird could be made to violate thesame-origin policy by using modal calls with JavaScript. If JavaScript wereenabled, an attacker could exploit this to steal information from anothersite. (CVE-2010-3178)

663db62ea05990c7dc25cab7377e64940603727f.title: USN-998-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
663db62ea05990c7dc25cab7377e64940603727f.body: Alexander Miller, Sergey Glazunov, and others discovered several flaws inthe JavaScript engine. If JavaScript were enabled, an attacker couldexploit this to crash Thunderbird or possibly run arbitrary code as theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2010-3179, CVE-2010-3180, CVE-2010-3183)

7920901dbdb0c18f9b70ef0af08c6ad580edb47b.title: USN-997-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
7920901dbdb0c18f9b70ef0af08c6ad580edb47b.body: Alexander Miller, Sergey Glazunov, and others discovered several flaws inthe JavaScript engine. An attacker could exploit this to crash the browseror possibly run arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.(CVE-2010-3179, CVE-2010-3180, CVE-2010-3183)

9edb6172e370c3413e86c2c4b097866f87226eb3.title: USN-1041-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9edb6172e370c3413e86c2c4b097866f87226eb3.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that several network ioctls did not clear kernelmemory correctly. A local user could exploit this to read kernel stackmemory, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-3296, CVE-2010-3297,CVE-2010-3298)

9ca1edb876cfc3912043722d93fad614544e0bee.title: USN-1041-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9ca1edb876cfc3912043722d93fad614544e0bee.body: Ben Hawkes discovered that the Linux kernel did not correctly filterregisters on 64bit kernels when performing 32bit system calls. On a 64bitsystem, a local attacker could manipulate 32bit system calls to gain rootprivileges. (CVE-2010-3301)

076690afe7cb84c2ce184999a74695a87c58648a.title: USN-1059-1: Dovecot vulnerabilities
076690afe7cb84c2ce184999a74695a87c58648a.body: It was discovered that the ACL plugin in Dovecot would incorrectlypropagate ACLs to new mailboxes. A remote authenticated user could possiblyread new mailboxes that were created with the wrong ACL. (CVE-2010-3304)

313806993df5ba7d180d3a0dcc5fe7011e42481f.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
313806993df5ba7d180d3a0dcc5fe7011e42481f.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that the ROSE driver did not correctly checkparameters. A local attacker with access to a ROSE network device couldexploit this to crash the system or possibly gain root privileges.(CVE-2010-3310)

7f0b24ebe74262c1c3af9403158e6d38ddd4bbe9.title: USN-1013-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
7f0b24ebe74262c1c3af9403158e6d38ddd4bbe9.body: Marc Schoenefeld discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certainmalformed font files. If a user were tricked into using a specially craftedfont file, a remote attacker could cause FreeType to crash or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with user privileges. This issue only affectedUbuntu 6.06 LTS, 8.04 LTS, 9.10 and 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-3311)

d27b3b82945f08a2813822ad2af540278c585061.title: USN-1104-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
d27b3b82945f08a2813822ad2af540278c585061.body: Cesar Bernardini and Felipe Andres Manzano discovered that FFmpegincorrectly handled certain malformed flic files. If a user were trickedinto opening a crafted flic file, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice via application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program. This issue only affectedUbuntu 8.04 LTS, 9.10 and 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-3429)

08402259b52b24eaf4cb63235c46acf8cd14026b.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
08402259b52b24eaf4cb63235c46acf8cd14026b.body: Thomas Dreibholz discovered that SCTP did not correctly handle appendingpacket chunks. A remote attacker could send specially crafted traffic tocrash the system, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-3432)

93408a9a9675277ca59c866a69ec04d0e8e77935.title: USN-1002-1: PostgreSQL vulnerability
93408a9a9675277ca59c866a69ec04d0e8e77935.body: It was discovered that PostgreSQL did not properly enforce permissionswithin sessions when PL/Perl and PL/Tcl functions or operators wereredefined. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to executearbitrary code with permissions of a different user, possibly leading toprivilege escalation.

38d2f97c1a97a261bb51b330480404534671b0be.title: USN-1002-2: PostgreSQL vulnerability
38d2f97c1a97a261bb51b330480404534671b0be.body: USN-1002-1 fixed vulnerabilities in PostgreSQL. This update provides thecorresponding update for Ubuntu 10.10.Original advisory details:It was discovered that PostgreSQL did not properly enforce permissions within sessions when PL/Perl and PL/Tcl functions or operators were redefined. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrary code with permissions of a different user, possibly leading to privilege escalation.

7af0c306b57d4761486c8992f47efdb318f3105f.title: USN-1042-1: PHP vulnerabilities
7af0c306b57d4761486c8992f47efdb318f3105f.body: It was discovered that attackers might be able to bypass open_basedir()restrictions by passing a specially crafted filename. (CVE-2010-3436)

aab2b56c2638ebfd0a2910e4f92d021b31970a8a.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
aab2b56c2638ebfd0a2910e4f92d021b31970a8a.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that the CD driver did not correctly checkparameters. A local attacker could exploit this to read arbitrary kernelmemory, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-3437)

f09832b834764687622543898fd304d8d74ba24e.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f09832b834764687622543898fd304d8d74ba24e.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that the Sound subsystem did not correctlyvalidate parameters. A local attacker could exploit this to crash thesystem, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2010-3442)

421d7e91224b28dab40de9b5ba874edc7a500941.title: USN-991-1: quassel vulnerability
421d7e91224b28dab40de9b5ba874edc7a500941.body: Jima discovered that quassel would respond to a single privmsgcontaining multiple CTCP requests with multiple NOTICEs, possiblyresulting in a denial of service against the IRC connection.

f3d9f275e47ea8dd32fb1222aa08440efa907e76.title: USN-1056-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
f3d9f275e47ea8dd32fb1222aa08440efa907e76.body: Marc Schoenefeld discovered that directory traversal was not correctlyhandled in XSLT, OXT, JAR, or ZIP files. If a user or automated systemwere tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remote attackeroverwrite arbitrary files, possibly leading to arbitrary code executionwith user privileges. (CVE-2010-3450)

461a678b55885fa69fecd67fb589d5c243ef3eda.title: USN-1056-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
461a678b55885fa69fecd67fb589d5c243ef3eda.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered multiple heap overflows in RTF and DOCprocessing. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening aspecially crafted RTF or DOC document, a remote attacker could executearbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2010-3451, CVE-2010-3452,CVE-2010-3453, CVE-2010-3454)

0417bb3ae48a21f0da991470bc8d5d58b7cf73c7.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
0417bb3ae48a21f0da991470bc8d5d58b7cf73c7.body: Eric Dumazet discovered that many network functions could leak kernel stackcontents. A local attacker could exploit this to read portions of kernelmemory, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-2942, CVE-2010-3477)

f8b6c10daa478fc6eaf60350d1d6af2ab6712c00.title: USN-1025-1: Bind vulnerabilities
f8b6c10daa478fc6eaf60350d1d6af2ab6712c00.body: It was discovered that Bind would incorrectly allow a ncache entry and arrsig for the same type. A remote attacker could exploit this to causeBind to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2010-3613)

8894f3af57d3c1625131b77b96689aa855a3702f.title: USN-1025-1: Bind vulnerabilities
8894f3af57d3c1625131b77b96689aa855a3702f.body: It was discovered that Bind would incorrectly mark zone data as insecurewhen the zone is undergoing a key algorithm rollover. (CVE-2010-3614)

1f245e16a9577776305dfa22aae500be0cb47bd8.title: USN-1017-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
1f245e16a9577776305dfa22aae500be0cb47bd8.body: It was discovered that MySQL incorrectly handled joins involving a tablewith a unique SET column. An authenticated user could exploit this to makeMySQL crash, causing a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu6.06 LTS, 8.04 LTS, 9.10 and 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-3677)

3feceeb66097c789e32d259030e483b13379ef0e.title: USN-1017-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
3feceeb66097c789e32d259030e483b13379ef0e.body: It was discovered that MySQL incorrectly handled NULL arguments to IN() orCASE operations. An authenticated user could exploit this to make MySQLcrash, causing a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 9.10and 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-3678)

c8171ea928aa38fa26c14b71c7bdbaddd7a99d7f.title: USN-1017-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
c8171ea928aa38fa26c14b71c7bdbaddd7a99d7f.body: It was discovered that MySQL incorrectly handled malformed arguments to theBINLOG statement. An authenticated user could exploit this to make MySQLcrash, causing a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 9.10and 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-3679)

714353fa0a2833be451b412decab64c2f0a65b9d.title: USN-1056-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
714353fa0a2833be451b412decab64c2f0a65b9d.body: Dmitri Gribenko discovered that OpenOffice.org did not correctlyhandle LD_LIBRARY_PATH in various tools. If a local attackertricked a user or automated system into using OpenOffice.org from anattacker-controlled directory, they could execute arbitrary code withuser privileges. (CVE-2010-3689)

db9cf1936bbe25f2c951d35ece2ad0a4648746f1.title: USN-1005-1: poppler vulnerabilities
db9cf1936bbe25f2c951d35ece2ad0a4648746f1.body: It was discovered that poppler contained multiple security issues whenparsing malformed PDF documents. If a user or automated system were trickedinto opening a crafted PDF file, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice or execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking theprogram.

fa429fd61fc9bda5ccc0ac8a7827c55b70975ae1.title: USN-1059-1: Dovecot vulnerabilities
fa429fd61fc9bda5ccc0ac8a7827c55b70975ae1.body: It was discovered that the ACL plugin in Dovecot would incorrectly mergeACLs in certain circumstances. A remote authenticated user could possiblybypass intended access restrictions and gain access to mailboxes.(CVE-2010-3706, CVE-2010-3707)

bdcad482e08dbc8208f9238d6e2e0ba54270a63e.title: USN-1042-1: PHP vulnerabilities
bdcad482e08dbc8208f9238d6e2e0ba54270a63e.body: Maksymilian Arciemowicz discovered that a NULL pointer derefence in theZIP archive handling code could allow an attacker to cause a denialof service through a specially crafted ZIP archive. This issue onlyaffected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, Ubuntu 9.10, Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, and Ubuntu10.10. (CVE-2010-3709)

09a7909da7352036a9b8260b2d712c5480576465.title: USN-1042-1: PHP vulnerabilities
09a7909da7352036a9b8260b2d712c5480576465.body: It was discovered that a stack consumption vulnerability in thefilter_var() PHP function when in FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL mode, couldallow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, Ubuntu 9.10, Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, andUbuntu 10.10. (CVE-2010-3710)

793fb7cad523840cbf307aee9993827545028de3.title: USN-1014-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
793fb7cad523840cbf307aee9993827545028de3.body: Daniel Atallah discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled the return codeof the Base64 decoding function. A remote attacker could send a speciallycrafted message and cause Pidgin to crash, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2010-3711)

07a717e0b00806284153d71588d552aa3e65b167.title: USN-1011-3: Xulrunner vulnerability
07a717e0b00806284153d71588d552aa3e65b167.body: USN-1011-1 fixed a vulnerability in Firefox. This update provides thecorresponding update for Xulrunner.Original advisory details:Morten Krakvik discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in Firefox. If a user were tricked into navigating to a malicious site, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.

de769b572a332813893162ecc4499401e681757c.title: USN-1011-1: Firefox vulnerability
de769b572a332813893162ecc4499401e681757c.body: Morten Krakvik discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in Firefox. If auser were tricked into navigating to a malicious site, an attacker couldcause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code as the userinvoking the program.

655d50d0bffef358c15296041832885e079ac18c.title: USN-1011-2: Thunderbird vulnerability
655d50d0bffef358c15296041832885e079ac18c.body: USN-1011-1 fixed a vulnerability in Firefox. This update provides thecorresponding update for Thunderbird.Original advisory details:Morten Krakvik discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in Firefox. If a user were tricked into navigating to a malicious site, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.

c754014924352ffdb59b38b7ffce4d1a8a8fc414.title: USN-1019-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
c754014924352ffdb59b38b7ffce4d1a8a8fc414.body: Several problems were discovered in the JavaScript engine. If a user weretricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could exploit this tocrash the browser or possibly run arbitrary code as the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2010-3766, CVE-2010-3767, CVE-2010-3773)

969ce019b046528142a6533362230f9e5ad359b2.title: USN-1019-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
969ce019b046528142a6533362230f9e5ad359b2.body: Marc Schoenefeld and Christoph Diehl discovered several problems whenhandling downloadable fonts. The new OTS font sanitizing library was addedto mitigate these issues. (CVE-2010-3768)

f099029a9ecbe6cafa420db7c5d0aa9e4ede32f2.title: USN-1020-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
f099029a9ecbe6cafa420db7c5d0aa9e4ede32f2.body: Marc Schoenefeld and Christoph Diehl discovered several problems whenhandling downloadable fonts. The new OTS font sanitizing library was addedto mitigate these issues. (CVE-2010-3768)

0a5836f7763971d8f53a9849611be77debf4e956.title: USN-1019-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
0a5836f7763971d8f53a9849611be77debf4e956.body: Yosuke Hasegawa and Masatoshi Kimura discovered that several characterencodings would have some characters converted to angle brackets. Anattacker could utilize this to perform cross-site scripting attacks.(CVE-2010-3770)

6631f3a4a59e588ecc14722cef395a72e4facd14.title: USN-1019-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
6631f3a4a59e588ecc14722cef395a72e4facd14.body: It was discovered that Firefox did not properly handle <div> elementswhen processing a XUL tree. If a user were tricked into opening a maliciousweb page, an attacker could exploit this to crash the browser or possiblyrun arbitrary code as the user invoking the program. (CVE-2010-3772)

542c70013b179bc600192a6c5a436082d1bfee72.title: USN-1019-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
542c70013b179bc600192a6c5a436082d1bfee72.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that Firefox did not always properly handledisplaying pages from network or certificate errors. An attacker couldexploit this to spoof the location bar, such as in a phishing attack.(CVE-2010-3774)

45b58dd999c4c70d81f2fa6d94e742fa3eef2447.title: USN-1019-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
45b58dd999c4c70d81f2fa6d94e742fa3eef2447.body: Jesse Ruderman, Andreas Gal, Nils, Brian Hackett, and Igor Bukanovdiscovered several memory issues in the browser engine. An attacker couldexploit these to crash the browser or possibly run arbitrary code as theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2010-3776, CVE-2010-3777, CVE-2010-3778)

71e60466c71e74c64e5e6c872da307c2fceb5935.title: USN-1020-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
71e60466c71e74c64e5e6c872da307c2fceb5935.body: Jesse Ruderman, Andreas Gal, Nils, Brian Hackett, and Igor Bukanovdiscovered several memory issues in the browser engine. An attacker couldexploit these to crash THunderbird or possibly run arbitrary code as theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2010-3776, CVE-2010-3777, CVE-2010-3778)

8490fa7bb95ea625629b1224a05898e3c174226f.title: USN-1059-1: Dovecot vulnerabilities
8490fa7bb95ea625629b1224a05898e3c174226f.body: It was discovered that the ACL plugin in Dovecot would incorrectly grantthe admin permission to owners of certain mailboxes. A remote authenticateduser could possibly bypass intended access restrictions and gain access tomailboxes. (CVE-2010-3779)

4048473cf3112f054248cd6846d6323b9e3a0adb.title: USN-1013-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
4048473cf3112f054248cd6846d6323b9e3a0adb.body: Chris Evans discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certainmalformed TrueType font files. If a user were tricked into using aspecially crafted TrueType file, a remote attacker could cause FreeType tocrash or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, 9.10, 10.04 LTS and 10.10. (CVE-2010-3814)

5500eba6a5f8cd9962d5a8ad9ae593fa2edd1049.title: USN-1017-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
5500eba6a5f8cd9962d5a8ad9ae593fa2edd1049.body: It was discovered that MySQL incorrectly handled propagation duringevaluation of arguments to extreme-value functions. An authenticated usercould exploit this to make MySQL crash, causing a denial of service. Thisissue only affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, 9.10, 10.04 LTS and 10.10.(CVE-2010-3833)

1a522cf61eef7449c1089801701dab23289b5ecc.title: USN-1017-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
1a522cf61eef7449c1089801701dab23289b5ecc.body: It was discovered that MySQL incorrectly handled certain user-variableassignment expressions that are evaluated in a logical expression context.An authenticated user could exploit this to make MySQL crash, causing adenial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, 9.10,10.04 LTS and 10.10. (CVE-2010-3835)

1581270b4eee865324fd98e690b322f3efd3f645.title: USN-1017-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
1581270b4eee865324fd98e690b322f3efd3f645.body: It was discovered that MySQL incorrectly handled pre-evaluation of LIKEpredicates during view preparation. An authenticated user could exploitthis to make MySQL crash, causing a denial of service. (CVE-2010-3836)

6b83f23f67ba06f4dcfbe76e7fea2c3c0947a4fb.title: USN-1017-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
6b83f23f67ba06f4dcfbe76e7fea2c3c0947a4fb.body: It was discovered that MySQL incorrectly handled using GROUP_CONCAT() andWITH ROLLUP together. An authenticated user could exploit this to makeMySQL crash, causing a denial of service. (CVE-2010-3837)

760c430c1acc8af9173dce2cf9af1f4438e28c2e.title: USN-1023-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
760c430c1acc8af9173dce2cf9af1f4438e28c2e.body: Nelson Elhage discovered several problems with the Acorn Econet protocoldriver. A local user could cause a denial of service via a NULL pointerdereference, escalate privileges by overflowing the kernel stack, andassign Econet addresses to arbitrary interfaces. (CVE-2010-3848,CVE-2010-3849, CVE-2010-3850)

7aa28b04455634cc985325bb0125fff9f4383131.title: USN-1013-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
7aa28b04455634cc985325bb0125fff9f4383131.body: It was discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certain malformedTrueType font files. If a user were tricked into using a specially craftedTrueType file, a remote attacker could cause FreeType to crash or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2010-3855)

d0f2ab82d112423f75dbd736c4225e747feebe37.title: USN-1009-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
d0f2ab82d112423f75dbd736c4225e747feebe37.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered multiple flaws in the GNU C Library's handlingof the LD_AUDIT environment variable when running a privileged binary. Alocal attacker could exploit this to gain root privileges. (CVE-2010-3847,CVE-2010-3856)

d6cb2c88c4a3e8527db613c34b30e18f2302ddd7.title: USN-1024-1: OpenJDK vulnerability
d6cb2c88c4a3e8527db613c34b30e18f2302ddd7.body: It was discovered that certain system property information was beingleaked, which could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information.

45b9e943ac748a6b5e68ae4a7a4f5ae397110ccc.title: USN-1041-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
45b9e943ac748a6b5e68ae4a7a4f5ae397110ccc.body: Kees Cook discovered that the ethtool interface did not correctly clearkernel memory. A local attacker could read kernel heap memory, leading to aloss of privacy. (CVE-2010-3861)

1ccfd3c3e1d1ccad8ad787543986a5c507c75d83.title: USN-1042-1: PHP vulnerabilities
1ccfd3c3e1d1ccad8ad787543986a5c507c75d83.body: It was discovered that the XML UTF-8 decoding code did not properlyhandle non-shortest form UTF-8 encoding and ill-formed subsequencesin UTF-8 data, which could allow an attacker to bypass cross-sitescripting (XSS) protections. (CVE-2010-3870)

f342cbc43dbed0386d8b141489e64de4dfcb2c1a.title: USN-1000-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f342cbc43dbed0386d8b141489e64de4dfcb2c1a.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that the RDS network protocol did not correctlycheck certain parameters. A local attacker could exploit this gain rootprivileges. (CVE-2010-3904)

defee73d3a3cc31f42439626fb2a945a8803b5c3.title: USN-1033-1: Eucalyptus vulnerability
defee73d3a3cc31f42439626fb2a945a8803b5c3.body: It was discovered that Eucalyptus did not verify password resets fromthe Admin UI correctly. An unauthenticated remote attacker could issuepassword reset requests to gain admin privileges in the Eucalyptusenvironment.

e2ca8514703659a0f3ad1a19a61c4a8fb2674674.title: USN-1104-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
e2ca8514703659a0f3ad1a19a61c4a8fb2674674.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain malformedwmv files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted wmv file, anattacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. This issue only affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, 9.10 and 10.04 LTS.(CVE-2010-3908)

fa1fd12bea7de526b718eae912b18c7262079bc5.title: USN-1016-1: libxml2 vulnerability
fa1fd12bea7de526b718eae912b18c7262079bc5.body: Bui Quang Minh discovered that libxml2 did not properly process XPathnamespaces and attributes. If an application using libxml2 opened aspecially crafted XML file, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute code as the user invoking the program.

fe1285f2dc7242d9da2233e0d2d114c03be5784c.title: USN-1058-1: PostgreSQL vulnerability
fe1285f2dc7242d9da2233e0d2d114c03be5784c.body: Geoff Keating reported that a buffer overflow exists in the intarraymodule's input function for the query_int type. This could allow anattacker to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode as the postgres user.

cf0e42c5d750143b9d240507ce7801460b2fd5a9.title: USN-1030-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
cf0e42c5d750143b9d240507ce7801460b2fd5a9.body: It was discovered that Kerberos did not reject RC4 key-derivationchecksums. An authenticated remote user could use this issue to forgeAD-SIGNEDPATH or AD-KDC-ISSUED signatures and possibly gain privileges.This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS and 10.10. (CVE-2010-4020)

22bbbe68932b2e3e9c6597aca3809217a39b06a7.title: USN-1030-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
22bbbe68932b2e3e9c6597aca3809217a39b06a7.body: It was discovered that Kerberos did not properly restrict the use of TGTcredentials for armoring TGS requests. A remote authenticated user coulduse this flaw to impersonate a client. This issue only affected Ubuntu9.10. (CVE-2010-4021)

3de318b6fc649f0a1ce1366add06669073bd22b2.title: USN-1041-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
