3de318b6fc649f0a1ce1366add06669073bd22b2.body: Kees Cook and Vasiliy Kulikov discovered that the shm interface did notclear kernel memory correctly. A local attacker could exploit this to readkernel stack memory, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-4072)

ae50f6024acd1f06a9371a6168c2e4790e2706d4.title: USN-1057-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
ae50f6024acd1f06a9371a6168c2e4790e2706d4.body: Kees Cook and Vasiliy Kulikov discovered that the shm interface did notclear kernel memory correctly. A local attacker could exploit this to readkernel stack memory, leading to a loss of privacy. (CVE-2010-4072)

90103981ea5e019f1de09e5d46d6d3caa752515b.title: USN-1042-1: PHP vulnerabilities
90103981ea5e019f1de09e5d46d6d3caa752515b.body: It was discovered that the mb_strcut function in the Libmbfllibrary within PHP could allow an attacker to read arbitrary memorywithin the application process. This issue only affected Ubuntu10.10. (CVE-2010-4156)

38de8a41437d58e7ad33754b2066d641ed44cc18.title: USN-1048-1: Tomcat vulnerability
38de8a41437d58e7ad33754b2066d641ed44cc18.body: It was discovered that Tomcat did not properly escape certain parameters inthe Manager application which could result in browsers becoming vulnerableto cross-site scripting attacks when processing the output. With cross-sitescripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing serveroutput during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploitthis to modify the contents, or steal confidential data (such aspasswords), within the same domain.

b4f0710816726fe2d316a98063d1fd1315bb10ef.title: USN-1056-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
b4f0710816726fe2d316a98063d1fd1315bb10ef.body: Marc Schoenefeld discovered that OpenOffice.org did not correctly processPNG images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening aspecially crafted document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrarycode with user privileges. (CVE-2010-4253)

951863bcd45285bf5fe8142137e306fd95d095a0.title: USN-1031-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
951863bcd45285bf5fe8142137e306fd95d095a0.body: It was discovered that an off-by-one error in the icon_cb functionin pe_icons.c in libclamav could allow an attacker to corruptmemory, causing clamav to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2010-4261)

919dde1495d101f6c4154b4ee1122f68bf615894.title: USN-1051-1: HPLIP vulnerability
919dde1495d101f6c4154b4ee1122f68bf615894.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that HPLIP incorrectly handled certain longSNMP responses. A remote attacker could send malicious SNMP replies tocertain HPLIP tools and cause them to crash or possibly execute arbitrarycode.

606e18c0772db5154df76a44377a0ab60bf66d32.title: USN-1032-1: Exim vulnerability
606e18c0772db5154df76a44377a0ab60bf66d32.body: Sergey Kononenko and Eugene Bujak discovered that Exim did not correctlytruncate string expansions. A remote attacker could send specially craftedemail traffic to run arbitrary code as the Exim user, which could alsolead to root privileges.

93df3e53c424b03decddbb51db66548531d7759e.title: USN-1060-1: Exim vulnerabilities
93df3e53c424b03decddbb51db66548531d7759e.body: It was discovered that Exim contained a design flaw in the way it processedalternate configuration files. An attacker that obtained privileges of the"Debian-exim" user could use an alternate configuration file to obtainroot privileges. (CVE-2010-4345)

bfb81a2130eeb2222544a473967b179d1a355739.title: USN-1052-1: OpenJDK vulnerability
bfb81a2130eeb2222544a473967b179d1a355739.body: It was discovered that the JNLP SecurityManager in IcedTea for JavaOpenJDK in some instances failed to properly apply the intendedscurity policy in its checkPermission method. This could allow anattacker execute code with privileges that should have been prevented.(CVE-2010-4351)

90bf8ee9b6532715c4cf28cad048ecd8770cbccb.title: USN-1055-1: OpenJDK vulnerabilities
90bf8ee9b6532715c4cf28cad048ecd8770cbccb.body: It was discovered that the JNLP SecurityManager in IcedTea for Java OpenJDK in some instances failed to properly apply the intended scurity policy in its checkPermission method. This could allow an attacker to execute code with privileges that should have been prevented. (CVE-2010-4351)

e4094a84b8ec01e53919df05bd59ae78611f2adb.title: USN-1044-1: D-Bus vulnerability
e4094a84b8ec01e53919df05bd59ae78611f2adb.body: Remi Denis-Courmont discovered that D-Bus did not properly validate thenumber of nested variants when validating D-Bus messages. A local attackercould exploit this to cause a denial of service.

f66a7b0f91600dcb91471d48b1a705038827eed5.title: USN-1047-1: AWStats vulnerability
f66a7b0f91600dcb91471d48b1a705038827eed5.body: It was discovered that AWStats did not correctly filter the LoadPluginconfiguration option. A local attacker on a shared system could use thisto inject arbitrary code into AWStats.

478b98719a379fcd78ae216328395ecd15a9fdbe.title: USN-1042-1: PHP vulnerabilities
478b98719a379fcd78ae216328395ecd15a9fdbe.body: Maksymilian Arciemowicz discovered that an integer overflow in theNumberFormatter::getSymbol function could allow an attacker to causea denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS andUbuntu 10.10. (CVE-2010-4409)

2e9f3ed8eb1858e1ab352d90d656fa1cb23757b8.title: USN-1087-1: libvpx vulnerability
2e9f3ed8eb1858e1ab352d90d656fa1cb23757b8.body: Chris Evans discovered that libvpx did not properly perform boundschecking. If an application using libvpx opened a specially crafted WebMfile, an attacker could cause a denial of service.

8e99429e783c1b930140524742d5684b0411391b.title: USN-1040-1: Django vulnerabilities
8e99429e783c1b930140524742d5684b0411391b.body: Adam Baldwin discovered that Django did not properly validate query stringlookups. This could be exploited to provide an information leak to anattacker with admin privilieges. (CVE-2010-4534)

abf6661bad03edfddb4798f04af17ee6f53a2ce7.title: USN-1040-1: Django vulnerabilities
abf6661bad03edfddb4798f04af17ee6f53a2ce7.body: Paul McMillan discovered that Django did not validate the length of thetoken used when generating a password reset. An attacker could exploitthis to cause a denial of service via resource exhaustion. (CVE-2010-4535)

322e0821601459d92e307ae76cb3e2d3b1dcabd0.title: USN-1053-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
322e0821601459d92e307ae76cb3e2d3b1dcabd0.body: It was discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module for Apacheincorrectly handled the walk function. Remote authenticated users could usethis flaw to cause the service to crash, leading to a denial of service.(CVE-2010-4539)

078e70c30b0a391bae7b1ab8b9ef341578b28d6c.title: USN-1056-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerabilities
078e70c30b0a391bae7b1ab8b9ef341578b28d6c.body: It was discovered that OpenOffice.org did not correctly process TGAimages. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening aspecially crafted document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrarycode with user privileges. (CVE-2010-4643)

e71be63eb55306e9abd918fe3686464ac3171752.title: USN-1053-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
e71be63eb55306e9abd918fe3686464ac3171752.body: It was discovered that Subversion incorrectly handled certain memoryoperations. Remote authenticated users could use this flaw to consume largequantities of memory and cause the service to crash, leading to a denial ofservice. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 9.10, 10.04 LTS, and 10.10.(CVE-2010-4644)

8e469522082f32ef8a8e43b5f580046ab7b7e337.title: USN-1042-1: PHP vulnerabilities
8e469522082f32ef8a8e43b5f580046ab7b7e337.body: Rick Regan discovered that when handing PHP textual representationsof the largest subnormal double-precision floating-point number,the zend_strtod function could go into an infinite loop on 32bitx86 processors, allowing an attacker to cause a denial of service.(CVE-2010-4645)

3b33457e5963c32fd7a0de67240af4dfb013406f.title: USN-1146-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3b33457e5963c32fd7a0de67240af4dfb013406f.body: Kees Cook discovered that the IOWarrior USB device driver did not correctlycheck certain size fields. A local attacker with physical access could plugin a specially crafted USB device to crash the system or potentially gainroot privileges. (CVE-2010-4656)

9a010e662f0a48a471206922ea9a4e66f8377277.title: USN-1416-1: tiff vulnerabilities
9a010e662f0a48a471206922ea9a4e66f8377277.body: It was discovered that the tiffdump utility incorrectly handled directorydata structures with many directory entries. If a user or automated systemwere tricked into opening a specially crafted TIFF image, a remote attackercould crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with user privileges. This issue only applied toUbuntu 8.04 LTS, Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 10.10 and Ubuntu 11.04.(CVE-2010-4665)

83fbdbd4a75c299a763a5e471d5e6a184df3b8f2.title: USN-1104-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
83fbdbd4a75c299a763a5e471d5e6a184df3b8f2.body: It was discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain malformed oggfiles. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted ogg file, an attackercould cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2010-4704)

ca27b6bda7d7fc8683a95c67c863f8f20c900691.title: USN-1504-1: Qt vulnerabilities
ca27b6bda7d7fc8683a95c67c863f8f20c900691.body: It was discovered that Qt did not properly handle wildcard domain names orIP addresses in the Common Name field of X.509 certificates. An attackercould exploit this to perform a man in the middle attack to view sensitiveinformation or alter encrypted communications. This issue only affectedUbuntu 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2010-5076)

4e1684547db6beeeb1447e362ca69c7f6f3f194a.title: USN-1046-1: Sudo vulnerability
4e1684547db6beeeb1447e362ca69c7f6f3f194a.body: Alexander Kurtz discovered that sudo would not prompt for a password whena group was specified in the Runas_Spec. A local attacker could exploitthis to execute arbitrary code as the specified group if sudo wasconfigured to allow the attacker to use a program as this group. The groupRunas_Spec is not used in the default installation of Ubuntu.

43c9feb00f359088af3cae320e13b2002ff107fe.title: USN-1063-1: QEMU vulnerability
43c9feb00f359088af3cae320e13b2002ff107fe.body: Neil Wilson discovered that if VNC passwords were blank in QEMUconfigurations, access to VNC sessions was allowed without a passwordinstead of being disabled. A remote attacker could connect to runningVNC sessions of QEMU and directly control the system. By default, QEMUdoes not start VNC sessions.

eab62f63a190f2ff5f2d452a1c1d880a87f757a8.title: USN-1064-1: OpenSSL vulnerability
eab62f63a190f2ff5f2d452a1c1d880a87f757a8.body: Neel Mehta discovered that incorrectly formatted ClientHello handshakemessages could cause OpenSSL to parse past the end of the message.This could allow a remote attacker to cause a crash and denial ofservice by triggering invalid memory accesses.

12095f07e6365c0976cfeb5e00d5d0e2822b4c3e.title: USN-1060-1: Exim vulnerabilities
12095f07e6365c0976cfeb5e00d5d0e2822b4c3e.body: It was discovered that Exim incorrectly handled certain return values whenhandling logging. An attacker that obtained privileges of the "Debian-exim"user could use this flaw to obtain root privileges. (CVE-2011-0017)

9cac718d369a48cd797aab48bf4af5088fbe808f.title: USN-1055-1: OpenJDK vulnerabilities
9cac718d369a48cd797aab48bf4af5088fbe808f.body: It was discovered that IcedTea for Java did not properly verifysignatures when handling multiply signed or partially signed JAR files,allowing an attacker to cause code to execute that appeared to comefrom a verified source. (CVE-2011-0025)

5c1cd0cf911f4af0221fc2116c86200aaf159905.title: USN-1149-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
5c1cd0cf911f4af0221fc2116c86200aaf159905.body: Multiple use-after-free vulnerabilities were discovered. An attacker couldpotentially use these to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking Firefox. (CVE-2011-0083, CVE-2011-0085, CVE-2011-2363)

a72a33a878f1614d41c4c9ed92b95d14e741d9f8.title: USN-1088-1: Kerberos vulnerability
a72a33a878f1614d41c4c9ed92b95d14e741d9f8.body: Cameron Meadors discovered that the MIT Kerberos 5 Key DistributionCenter (KDC) daemon is vulnerable to a double-free condition ifthe Public Key Cryptography for Initial Authentication (PKINIT)capability is enabled. This could allow a remote attacker to causea denial of service.

7dcfc89cc7b56807114aeb0ad6c56446640aa80c.title: USN-1070-1: Bind vulnerability
7dcfc89cc7b56807114aeb0ad6c56446640aa80c.body: It was discovered that Bind incorrectly handled IXFR transfers and dynamicupdates while under heavy load when used as an authoritative server. Aremote attacker could use this flaw to cause Bind to stop responding,resulting in a denial of service.

d0268a2f3e0df345a966413e4dee86eea6b978e3.title: USN-1146-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d0268a2f3e0df345a966413e4dee86eea6b978e3.body: Goldwyn Rodrigues discovered that the OCFS2 filesystem did not correctlyclear memory when writing certain file holes. A local attacker couldexploit this to read uninitialized data from the disk, leading to a loss ofprivacy. (CVE-2011-0463)

83fc98f9020e121de8732f793e432bbf0360ba91.title: USN-1107-1: x11-xserver-utils vulnerability
83fc98f9020e121de8732f793e432bbf0360ba91.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that the xrdb utility incorrectly filteredcrafted hostnames. An attacker could use this flaw with a maliciousDHCP server or with a remote xdmcp login and execute arbitrary code,resulting in root privilege escalation.

3df63745899c3cc98fa8de4181d6c1aed796ee9d.title: USN-1365-1: Puppet vulnerability
3df63745899c3cc98fa8de4181d6c1aed796ee9d.body: It was discovered that Puppet would allow remote ralsh under certaincircumstances. An attacker on an authenticated puppet node could exploitthis to view or manipulate resources on other Puppet nodes.

f665748b9984ac54cbf8a1cdaee125fde94f708c.title: USN-1066-1: Django vulnerabilities
f665748b9984ac54cbf8a1cdaee125fde94f708c.body: It was discovered that Django did not properly validate HTTP requests thatcontain an X-Requested-With header. An attacker could exploit thisvulnerability to perform cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks.(CVE-2011-0696)

3b8e1656ef9700f9fc12dec7d3aadc42e27df94d.title: USN-1066-1: Django vulnerabilities
3b8e1656ef9700f9fc12dec7d3aadc42e27df94d.body: It was discovered that Django did not properly sanitize its input whenperforming file uploads, resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS)vulnerabilities. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user weretricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, aremote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or stealconfidential data, within the same domain. (CVE-2011-0697)

d187e58a14c31aeda6af29456c426eec556e010d.title: USN-1075-1: Samba vulnerability
d187e58a14c31aeda6af29456c426eec556e010d.body: Volker Lendecke discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain filedescriptors. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request tothe server and cause Samba to crash or hang, resulting in a denial ofservice.

24180fd64cdc60d6519a6a9d0de0f7ca77e5a0bf.title: USN-1065-1: shadow vulnerability
24180fd64cdc60d6519a6a9d0de0f7ca77e5a0bf.body: Kees Cook discovered that some shadow utilities did not correctly validateuser input. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to inject newlines intothe /etc/passwd file. If the system was configured to use NIS, this couldlead to existing NIS groups or users gaining or losing access to the system,resulting in a denial of service or unauthorized access.

29ab4f0f592576970c2aa6c151cc6d42d01acd8a.title: USN-1104-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
29ab4f0f592576970c2aa6c151cc6d42d01acd8a.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain malformedRealMedia files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted RealMediafile, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 8.04 LTS, 9.10 and 10.04 LTS.(CVE-2011-0722)

82c83451102d6d437daeb630657d97986962af9f.title: USN-1104-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
82c83451102d6d437daeb630657d97986962af9f.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain malformedVC1 files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted VC1 file, anattacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2011-0723)

8de40b09fc03aa64f48fd0864704b9f9dadb859f.title: USN-1061-1: iTALC vulnerability
8de40b09fc03aa64f48fd0864704b9f9dadb859f.body: Stéphane Graber discovered that the iTALC private keys shipped with theEdubuntu Live DVD were not correctly regenerated once Edubuntu wasinstalled. If an iTALC client was installed with the vulnerable keys, aremote attacker could gain control of the system. Only systems using keysfrom the Edubuntu Live DVD were affected.

abec176ef04f7d22dda7b9ec336d20e06b86b2f7.title: USN-1068-1: Aptdaemon vulnerability
abec176ef04f7d22dda7b9ec336d20e06b86b2f7.body: Sergey Nizovtsev discovered that Aptdaemon incorrectly filtered certainarguments when using its D-Bus interface. A local attacker could use thisflaw to bypass security restrictions and view sensitive information byreading arbitrary files.

1cbb3ac245347d4ed242666b3c4d87d1ac082a6d.title: USN-1115-1: language-selector vulnerability
1cbb3ac245347d4ed242666b3c4d87d1ac082a6d.body: Romain Perier discovered that the language-selector D-Bus backend did notcorrectly check for Policy Kit authorizations. A local attacker could exploitthis to inject shell commands into the system-wide locale configuration file,leading to root privilege escalation.

ed4708ae003d404afbd85b800f9c0c8281a3287b.title: USN-1137-1: Eucalyptus vulnerability
ed4708ae003d404afbd85b800f9c0c8281a3287b.body: Juraj Somorovsky, Jorg Schwenk, Meiko Jensen and Xiaofeng Lou discoveredthat Eucalyptus did not properly validate SOAP requests. An unauthenticatedremote attacker could exploit this to submit arbitrary commands to theEucalyptus SOAP interface in the context of an authenticated user.

f9805e445d67ba06ab6d59a17957e86214a968a8.title: USN-1316-1: t1lib vulnerability
f9805e445d67ba06ab6d59a17957e86214a968a8.body: Jonathan Brossard discovered that t1lib did not correctly handle certainmalformed font files. If a user were tricked into using a specially craftedfont file, a remote attacker could cause t1lib to crash or possibly executearbitrary code with user privileges.

b6ab7bc6541fcbf81bc3a2b1791128113cee7c1a.title: USN-1128-1: Vino vulnerabilities
b6ab7bc6541fcbf81bc3a2b1791128113cee7c1a.body: Kevin Chen discovered that Vino incorrectly handled certain clientframebuffer requests. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause Vinoto crash, leading to a denial of service.

1e522be5526ed1a1a54209a239284cdcc76b6b85.title: USN-1108-1: DHCP vulnerability
1e522be5526ed1a1a54209a239284cdcc76b6b85.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that the dhclient utility incorrectly filteredcrafted responses. An attacker could use this flaw with a malicious DHCPserver to execute arbitrary code, resulting in root privilege escalation.

1bddb151f24482a2cd3580d1e8fad3477cf22005.title: USN-1067-1: Telepathy Gabble vulnerability
1bddb151f24482a2cd3580d1e8fad3477cf22005.body: It was discovered that Gabble did not verify the from field of googlejingleinfo updates. This could allow a remote attacker to perform manin the middle attacks (MITM) on streamed media.

9bbfbc0ebb5b74abbda41d86ce52ffdb6375896f.title: USN-1084-1: avahi vulnerability
9bbfbc0ebb5b74abbda41d86ce52ffdb6375896f.body: It was discovered that Avahi incorrectly handled empty UDP packets. Aremote attacker could send a specially-crafted packet and cause Avahi tohang, resulting in a denial of service.

95c97539b9179e58dc0914986b90fc9329a97330.title: USN-1076-1: ClamAV vulnerability
95c97539b9179e58dc0914986b90fc9329a97330.body: It was discovered that the Microsoft Office processing code in libclamavimproperly handled certain Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) data. Thiscould allow a remote attacker to craft a document that could crash clamavor possibly execute arbitrary code.In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by theClamAV AppArmor profile.

39503c8ee799dd786da8d12b65d143e593c79708.title: USN-1596-1: Python 2.6 vulnerabilities
39503c8ee799dd786da8d12b65d143e593c79708.body: It was discovered that the CGIHTTPServer module did not properly performinput validation on certain HTTP GET requests. A remote attacker couldpotentially obtain access to CGI script source files. (CVE-2011-1015)

94022fcf8f5663334183fddeda2af83073018490.title: USN-1613-2: Python 2.4 vulnerabilities
94022fcf8f5663334183fddeda2af83073018490.body: It was discovered that the CGIHTTPServer module did not properly perform input validation on certain HTTP GET requests. A remote attacker could potentially obtain access to CGI script source files. (CVE-2011-1015)

5477efdd0d7defc0ac9ff2075e58f7e7b1fa98e1.title: USN-1613-1: Python 2.5 vulnerabilities
5477efdd0d7defc0ac9ff2075e58f7e7b1fa98e1.body: It was discovered that the CGIHTTPServer module did not properly performinput validation on certain HTTP GET requests. A remote attacker couldpotentially obtain access to CGI script source files. (CVE-2011-1015)

c3090ea4f03ef161c7ea657bf18a4d44cb4dddac.title: USN-1146-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c3090ea4f03ef161c7ea657bf18a4d44cb4dddac.body: Timo Warns discovered that the LDM disk partition handling code did notcorrectly handle certain values. By inserting a specially crafted diskdevice, a local attacker could exploit this to gain root privileges.(CVE-2011-1017)

800998c8b879172762d9fc725fa39492ceed527f.title: USN-1078-1: Logwatch vulnerability
800998c8b879172762d9fc725fa39492ceed527f.body: Dominik George discovered that logwatch did not properly sanitizelog file names that were passed to the shell as part of a command.If a remote attacker were able to generate specially crafted filenames(for example, via Samba logging), they could execute arbitrary codewith root privileges.

1676f4742181d190965e12ba41680bedcfdf8c88.title: USN-1100-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
1676f4742181d190965e12ba41680bedcfdf8c88.body: It was discovered that OpenLDAP did not properly check forwardedauthentication failures when using a slave server and chain overlay. IfOpenLDAP were configured in this manner, an attacker could bypassauthentication checks by sending an invalid password to a slave server.(CVE-2011-1024)

b2f63ed029a14722743ef419b18174444b57e681.title: USN-1100-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
b2f63ed029a14722743ef419b18174444b57e681.body: It was discovered that OpenLDAP did not properly perform authenticationchecks to the rootdn when using the back-ndb backend. An attacker couldexploit this to access the directory by sending an arbitrary password.Ubuntu does not ship OpenLDAP with back-ndb support by default. This issuedid not affect Ubuntu 8.04 LTS. (CVE-2011-1025)

0b9fe1298bda89788209ba87ab09a10ed292c632.title: USN-1604-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
0b9fe1298bda89788209ba87ab09a10ed292c632.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin did not properly sanitize certain input,resulting in a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability. With cross-sitescripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing serveroutput during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploitthis to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the samedomain. (CVE-2011-1058)

06fabe98f6304f95ff2b47e9aa528edfc8647199.title: USN-1100-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
06fabe98f6304f95ff2b47e9aa528edfc8647199.body: It was discovered that OpenLDAP did not properly validate modrdn requests.An unauthenticated remote user could use this to cause a denial of servicevia application crash. (CVE-2011-1081)

32aa4ba80234cafbbcc2bfda99ebee9b94b79425.title: USN-1110-1: KDE-Libs vulnerabilities
32aa4ba80234cafbbcc2bfda99ebee9b94b79425.body: It was discovered that KDE KSSL did not properly verify X.509 certificateswhen the certificate was issued for an IP address. An attacker couldexploit this to perform a man in the middle attack to view sensitiveinformation or alter encrypted communications. (CVE-2011-1094)

127bfc202b14150ac86964a0af0155a4ed1ef2e0.title: USN-1094-1: Libvirt vulnerability
127bfc202b14150ac86964a0af0155a4ed1ef2e0.body: Petr Matousek discovered that libvirt did not always honor read-onlyconnections. An attacker who is authorized to connect to the libvirt daemoncould exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash.

7ed8ee92847d2aa32b5207b206f85287e112d46d.title: USN-1102-1: tiff vulnerability
7ed8ee92847d2aa32b5207b206f85287e112d46d.body: Martin Barbella discovered that the thunder (aka ThunderScan) decoder inthe TIFF library incorrectly handled an unexpected BitsPerSample value. Ifa user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially craftedTIFF image, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with userprivileges, or crash the application, leading to a denial of service.

7526a4952ef76e2e39565995c0fbf4f03f621875.title: USN-1110-1: KDE-Libs vulnerabilities
7526a4952ef76e2e39565995c0fbf4f03f621875.body: Tim Brown discovered that KDE KHTML did not properly escape URLs fromexternally generated error pages. An attacker could expoit this to conductcross-site scripting attacks. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, ifa user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted serverrequest, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, orsteal confidential data (such as passwords), within the same domain.(CVE-2011-1168)

4859f138aa2b6378aee2723cdb6f633e7b00f796.title: USN-1569-1: PHP vulnerabilities
4859f138aa2b6378aee2723cdb6f633e7b00f796.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain character sequenceswhen applying HTTP response-splitting protection. A remote attacker couldcreate a specially-crafted URL and inject arbitrary headers.(CVE-2011-1398, CVE-2012-4388)

bb2837162ac83dc22dba908b60889eb7cc52da44.title: USN-1135-1: Exim vulnerability
bb2837162ac83dc22dba908b60889eb7cc52da44.body: It was discovered that the Exim daemon did not correctly handle certainDKIM identities. A remote attacker could send specially crafted email torun arbitrary code as the Exim user.

a96643ab33f6eb5f5e4dedd23cfce5651d836589.title: USN-1152-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
a96643ab33f6eb5f5e4dedd23cfce5651d836589.body: It was discovered that libvirt did not use thread-safe error reporting. Aremote attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service viaapplication crash. (CVE-2011-1486)

db173dff880d185ea3dc033bb0031c905c9a4388.title: USN-1596-1: Python 2.6 vulnerabilities
db173dff880d185ea3dc033bb0031c905c9a4388.body: Niels Heinen discovered that the urllib and urllib2 modules would processLocation headers that specify a redirection to file: URLs. A remoteattacker could exploit this to obtain sensitive information or cause adenial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 11.04. (CVE-2011-1521)

232bc3c04f9888771b42205e64394e9f6c84f9a6.title: USN-1613-2: Python 2.4 vulnerabilities
232bc3c04f9888771b42205e64394e9f6c84f9a6.body: Niels Heinen discovered that the urllib and urllib2 modules would process Location headers that specify a redirection to file: URLs. A remote attacker could exploit this to obtain sensitive information or cause a denial of service. (CVE-2011-1521)

7ab35366527d08b7f85f92980119579eb7a747d1.title: USN-1592-1: Python 2.7 vulnerabilities
7ab35366527d08b7f85f92980119579eb7a747d1.body: Niels Heinen discovered that the urllib and urllib2 modules would processLocation headers that specify a redirection to file: URLs. A remoteattacker could exploit this to obtain sensitive information or cause adenial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 11.04. (CVE-2011-1521)

560c34f26d07880ee4cb4fd7ac77680c6ea7a878.title: USN-1613-1: Python 2.5 vulnerabilities
560c34f26d07880ee4cb4fd7ac77680c6ea7a878.body: Niels Heinen discovered that the urllib and urllib2 modules would processLocation headers that specify a redirection to file: URLs. A remoteattacker could exploit this to obtain sensitive information or cause adenial of service. (CVE-2011-1521)

cedde3a226fe2a557b8c6c21f1ebc82a3cfe147a.title: USN-1151-1: Nagios vulnerabilities
cedde3a226fe2a557b8c6c21f1ebc82a3cfe147a.body: Stefan Schurtz discovered than Nagios did not properly sanitize its inputwhen processing certain requests, resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS)vulnerabilities. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user weretricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, aremote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or stealconfidential data, within the same domain.

0957603916625b5c58c172f8f088d64b8af104eb.title: USN-1148-1: libmodplug vulnerabilities
0957603916625b5c58c172f8f088d64b8af104eb.body: It was discovered that libmodplug did not correctly handle certainmalformed S3M media files. If a user or automated system were tricked intoopening a crafted S3M file, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2011-1574)

bf538c2face49714231a992e08c850ba159f8a27.title: USN-1114-1: KDENetwork vulnerability
bf538c2face49714231a992e08c850ba159f8a27.body: It was discovered that KGet did not properly perform input validation whenprocessing metalink files. If a user were tricked into opening a craftedmetalink file, a remote attacker could overwrite files via directorytraversal, which could eventually lead to arbitrary code execution.

266c8ad1e45fcaa514c5a9e7fd1ee2ac3e1e7cc1.title: USN-1146-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
266c8ad1e45fcaa514c5a9e7fd1ee2ac3e1e7cc1.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the pidmap function did not correctly handlelarge requests. A local attacker could exploit this to crash the system,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2011-1593)

1b0e3e1c6e9664366d8dbdf0de6bbb2dc6cdb06c.title: USN-1136-1: rdesktop vulnerability
1b0e3e1c6e9664366d8dbdf0de6bbb2dc6cdb06c.body: It was discovered that rdesktop incorrectly handled specially craftedpaths when using disk redirection. If a user were tricked into connectingto a malicious server, an attacker could access arbitrary files on theuser's filesystem.

a7b02ce628084f0d7ba6ebf85cbd8f7fccd12c23.title: USN-1142-1: GDM vulnerability
a7b02ce628084f0d7ba6ebf85cbd8f7fccd12c23.body: Henne Vogelsang discovered that under certain PolicyKit configurations, GDMcould be made to launch a browser. A local attacker could exploit this togain access to files with the privileges of the gdm user. PolicyKit is notconfigured in this manner in Ubuntu by default.

b9053c6adea6f1f0fdbf9bf97f49859eaadbee4d.title: USN-1131-1: Postfix vulnerability
b9053c6adea6f1f0fdbf9bf97f49859eaadbee4d.body: Thomas Jarosch discovered that Postfix incorrectly handled authenticationmechanisms other than PLAIN and LOGIN when the Cyrus SASL library is used.A remote attacker could use this to cause Postfix to crash, leading to adenial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code as the postfix user.

dcf1f1421e35ae995b59455ebae512c1f5648ed5.title: USN-1145-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
dcf1f1421e35ae995b59455ebae512c1f5648ed5.body: It was discovered that QEMU did not properly perform validation of I/Ooperations from the guest which could lead to heap corruption. An attackercould exploit this to cause a denial of service of the guest or possiblyexecute code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2011-1750)

20f11b3cd06ab0d7e3620a8832b32256b57aadac.title: USN-1145-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
20f11b3cd06ab0d7e3620a8832b32256b57aadac.body: Nelson Elhage discoverd that QEMU did not properly handle memory whenremoving ISA devices. An attacker could exploit this to cause a denial ofservice of the guest or possibly execute code with the privileges of theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2011-1751)

3317d7adb5491afa8dafbcefe46240d10be1d483.title: USN-1144-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
3317d7adb5491afa8dafbcefe46240d10be1d483.body: Joe Schaefer discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module for Apachedid not properly handle certain baselined WebDAV resource requests. Aremote attacker could use this flaw to cause the service to crash, leadingto a denial of service. (CVE-2011-1752)

c8858af5472aefeeb565413fe2cd4b3b94c53614.title: USN-1166-1: OProfile vulnerabilities
c8858af5472aefeeb565413fe2cd4b3b94c53614.body: Stephane Chauveau discovered that OProfile did not properly perform inputvalidation when processing arguments to opcontrol. A local user who isallowed to run opcontrol with privileges could exploit this to runarbitrary commands as the privileged user. (CVE-2011-1760, CVE-2011-2471)

823767f76ff0d74ca1dbc7820b7cea704c075d64.title: USN-1148-1: libmodplug vulnerabilities
823767f76ff0d74ca1dbc7820b7cea704c075d64.body: It was discovered that libmodplug did not correctly handle certainmalformed ABC media files. If a user or automated system were tricked intoopening a crafted ABC file, an attacker could cause a denial of service orpossibly execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2011-1761)

0cd58906d4066c25a3365a501d44d2eecbe24c49.title: USN-1127-1: usb-creator vulnerability
0cd58906d4066c25a3365a501d44d2eecbe24c49.body: Evan Broder discovered that usb-creator did not properly enforcerestrictions when performing privileged disk operations. A local attackercould use this flaw to perform certain disk operations, such as unmountarbitrary mountpoints.

9dc4d7b752562e122156ebed3f48e5d34f052121.title: USN-1169-1: APT vulnerability
9dc4d7b752562e122156ebed3f48e5d34f052121.body: William Grant discovered that APT incorrectly validated inline GPGsignatures. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middleattack, this flaw could potentially be used to install altered packages.

340da26478232481705f4e523ea9ccc88cef4d61.title: USN-1188-1: eCryptfs vulnerabilities
340da26478232481705f4e523ea9ccc88cef4d61.body: Vasiliy Kulikov and Dan Rosenberg discovered that eCryptfs incorrectlyvalidated permissions on the requested mountpoint. A local attacker coulduse this flaw to mount to arbitrary locations, leading to privilegeescalation. (CVE-2011-1831)

a986baf0379656d6f4f3971ebc40036b99af207e.title: USN-1188-1: eCryptfs vulnerabilities
a986baf0379656d6f4f3971ebc40036b99af207e.body: Vasiliy Kulikov and Dan Rosenberg discovered that eCryptfs incorrectlyvalidated permissions on the requested mountpoint. A local attacker coulduse this flaw to unmount to arbitrary locations, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2011-1832)

c61465414ce0c4c3a19e331c3972d9ceb708ef10.title: USN-1188-1: eCryptfs vulnerabilities
c61465414ce0c4c3a19e331c3972d9ceb708ef10.body: Vasiliy Kulikov and Dan Rosenberg discovered that eCryptfs incorrectlyvalidated permissions on the requested source directory. A local attackercould use this flaw to mount an arbitrary directory, possibly leading toinformation disclosure. A pending kernel update will provide the otherhalf of the fix for this issue. (CVE-2011-1833)

dff5f1af8017edb298db10474302f1418c11f9b2.title: USN-1188-1: eCryptfs vulnerabilities
dff5f1af8017edb298db10474302f1418c11f9b2.body: Dan Rosenberg and Marc Deslauriers discovered that eCryptfs incorrectlyhandled modifications to the mtab file when an error occurs. A localattacker could use this flaw to corrupt the mtab file, and possibly unmountarbitrary locations, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2011-1834)

03388108140b7723f2e3f35eb796c855326944fd.title: USN-1188-1: eCryptfs vulnerabilities
03388108140b7723f2e3f35eb796c855326944fd.body: Marc Deslauriers discovered that eCryptfs incorrectly handled permissionsduring recovery. A local attacker could use this flaw to possibly accessanother user's data during the recovery process. This issue only applied toUbuntu 11.04. (CVE-2011-1836)

918cd046a853b1dc46435a1e71d3502d86d9ffc6.title: USN-1188-1: eCryptfs vulnerabilities
918cd046a853b1dc46435a1e71d3502d86d9ffc6.body: Vasiliy Kulikov discovered that eCryptfs incorrectly handled lock counters.A local attacker could use this flaw to possibly overwrite arbitrary files.The default symlink restrictions in Ubuntu 10.10 and 11.04 should protectagainst this issue. (CVE-2011-1837)

2d0c0db0000199c506e5e934b7d3a48b5fb2fcd9.title: USN-1144-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
2d0c0db0000199c506e5e934b7d3a48b5fb2fcd9.body: Kamesh Jayachandran discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module forApache did not properly handle access control in certain situations. Aremote user could use this flaw to gain access to files that wouldotherwise be unreadable. (CVE-2011-1921)

2ca441f2b4420f846c30ade592e39d3ccb1fd932.title: USN-1143-1: Dovecot vulnerability
2ca441f2b4420f846c30ade592e39d3ccb1fd932.body: It was discovered that the message header parser in Dovecot did notproperly handle '\0' characters in header names. This could allow aremote attacker to cause a denial of service through a crafted emailmessage by crashing the Dovecot daemon or corrupting mailboxes.

8a170a98fd5390a756da7232df8f473fac732a59.title: USN-1153-1: libxml2 vulnerability
8a170a98fd5390a756da7232df8f473fac732a59.body: Chris Evans discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled memory allocation.If an application using libxml2 opened a specially crafted XML file, anattacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute code as theuser invoking the program.

61a7f87b84406fd2ef594e2fd7c3859bf766ef08.title: USN-1328-1: Linux kernel (Marvell DOVE) vulnerabilities
61a7f87b84406fd2ef594e2fd7c3859bf766ef08.body: Clement Lecigne discovered a bug in the HFS filesystem. A local attackercould exploit this to cause a kernel oops. (CVE-2011-2203)

6307176e506fe94b82342f4708505a662b481ca5.title: USN-1324-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
6307176e506fe94b82342f4708505a662b481ca5.body: Clement Lecigne discovered a bug in the HFS filesystem. A local attackercould exploit this to cause a kernel oops. (CVE-2011-2203)

f93456272d2c2dc949c1e4c43239af75fc92e8f2.title: USN-1344-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f93456272d2c2dc949c1e4c43239af75fc92e8f2.body: Clement Lecigne discovered a bug in the HFS filesystem. A local attackercould exploit this to cause a kernel oops. (CVE-2011-2203)

5742d5a8330ab60fc959ece8f27600c032975ffb.title: USN-1165-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
5742d5a8330ab60fc959ece8f27600c032975ffb.body: Nelson Elhage discoverd that QEMU did not properly validate certainvirtqueue requests from the guest. An attacker could exploit this to causea denial of service of the guest or possibly execute code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-2212)

2a29a053f3533f31ed40ee377d437f70e0114c72.title: USN-1149-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
2a29a053f3533f31ed40ee377d437f70e0114c72.body: David Chan discovered that cookies did not honor same-origin conventions.This could potentially lead to cookie data being leaked to a third party.(CVE-2011-2362)

b7b0784f31504f254be3af81e46900b552fea810.title: USN-1149-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
b7b0784f31504f254be3af81e46900b552fea810.body: Chris Rohlf and Yan Ivnitskiy discovered an integer overflow vulnerabilityin JavaScript Arrays. An attacker could potentially use this to executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.(CVE-2011-2371)

8b34e8835d12dbbfa28be783c8b2c71e797b8716.title: USN-1149-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
8b34e8835d12dbbfa28be783c8b2c71e797b8716.body: Martin Barbella discovered that under certain conditions, viewing a XULdocument while JavaScript was disabled caused deleted memory to beaccessed. An attacker could potentially use this to crash Firefox orexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.(CVE-2011-2373)

976a7b2105f71a66a095580382fcbda004425881.title: USN-1149-1: Firefox and Xulrunner vulnerabilities
976a7b2105f71a66a095580382fcbda004425881.body: Jordi Chancel discovered a vulnerability on multipart/x-mixed-replaceimages due to memory corruption. An attacker could potentially use this tocrash Firefox or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking Firefox. (CVE-2011-2377)

f4095b4302875f4d5efc815219f87172af2a03db.title: USN-1171-1: Likewise Open vulnerability
f4095b4302875f4d5efc815219f87172af2a03db.body: It was discovered that an SQL injection vulnerability exists in theLikewise Security Authority (lsass) local authentication provider. Alocal attacker could use this to gain elevated privileges.

3ed44532b6138d0f4dd54ff7b3cb2c1c816ffa30.title: USN-1166-1: OProfile vulnerabilities
3ed44532b6138d0f4dd54ff7b3cb2c1c816ffa30.body: Stephane Chauveau discovered a directory traversal vulnerability inOProfile when processing the --save argument to opcontrol. A local usercould exploit this to overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges ofthe user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-2472)

7845ec43001e91d1ced6f69cef53795b9602f0bc.title: USN-1229-1: PostgreSQL vulnerability
7845ec43001e91d1ced6f69cef53795b9602f0bc.body: It was discovered that the blowfish algorithm in the pgcrypto moduleincorrectly handled certain 8-bit characters, resulting in the passwordhashes being easier to crack than expected. An attacker who could obtainthe password hashes would be able to recover the plaintext with lesseffort.

9a7b6e86df021493c8dc299cbc7f0d349d86ad40.title: USN-1175-1: libpng vulnerabilities
9a7b6e86df021493c8dc299cbc7f0d349d86ad40.body: Frank Busse discovered that libpng did not properly handle certainmalformed PNG images. If a user or automated system were tricked intoopening a crafted PNG file, an attacker could cause libpng to crash,resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu10.04 LTS, 10.10, and 11.04. (CVE-2011-2501)

93be98a57f10173e2ebcf80179279da147b156e7.title: USN-1180-1: libvirt vulnerability
93be98a57f10173e2ebcf80179279da147b156e7.body: Eric Blake discovered an integer overflow flaw in libvirt. A remoteauthenticated attacker could exploit this by sending a crafted VCPU RPCcall and cause a denial of service via application crash.

90e759336aae73b361b350bc8f103065cee3017f.title: USN-1165-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
90e759336aae73b361b350bc8f103065cee3017f.body: Stefan Hajnoczi discovered that QEMU did not properly perform integercomparisons when performing virtqueue input validation. An attacker couldexploit this to cause a denial of service of the guest or possibly executecode with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-2512)

7e0dae2e70e96bc5e79359392223625edf03b844.title: USN-1178-1: IcedTea-Web, OpenJDK 6 vulnerabilities
7e0dae2e70e96bc5e79359392223625edf03b844.body: Omair Majid discovered that an unsigned Web Start applicationor applet could determine the path to the cache directory usedto store downloaded class and jar files by querying class loaderproperties. This could allow a remote attacker to discover a user'sname and home directory path. (CVE-2011-2513)

4e4aa2c6efb495fdd33ee2c273c50b4de8899986.title: USN-1178-1: IcedTea-Web, OpenJDK 6 vulnerabilities
4e4aa2c6efb495fdd33ee2c273c50b4de8899986.body: Omair Majid discovered that an unsigned Web Start application couldmanipulate the content of the security warning dialog message to showdifferent file names in prompts. This could allow a remote attackerto confuse a user into granting access to a different file than theybelieve they are granting access to. This issue only affected Ubuntu11.04. (CVE-2011-2514)

9403c7b731886bb6c61d914631e9c1f0c3d60607.title: USN-1182-1: Samba vulnerabilities
9403c7b731886bb6c61d914631e9c1f0c3d60607.body: Yoshihiro Ishikawa discovered that the Samba Web Administration Tool (SWAT)was vulnerable to cross-site request forgeries (CSRF). If a Sambaadministrator were tricked into clicking a link on a specially crafted webpage, an attacker could trigger commands that could modify the Sambaconfiguration. (CVE-2011-2522)

4d6f05a1c4c41d280d5593b1a664641e4b0cd08f.title: USN-1181-1: libsoup vulnerability
4d6f05a1c4c41d280d5593b1a664641e4b0cd08f.body: It was discovered that libsoup did not properly validate its input whenprocessing SoupServer requests. A remote attacker could exploit this toaccess files via directory traversal.

1040b54dc95cab0747be83a24940cc5e657c5c17.title: USN-1177-1: QEMU vulnerability
1040b54dc95cab0747be83a24940cc5e657c5c17.body: Andrew Griffiths discovered that QEMU did not correctly drop privilegeswhen using the 'runas' argument. Under certain circumstances a localattacker could exploit this to escalate privileges.

60783c289cbe0671c09bfd45a396b60dc8a27601.title: USN-1175-1: libpng vulnerabilities
60783c289cbe0671c09bfd45a396b60dc8a27601.body: Frank Busse discovered that libpng did not properly handle certain PNGimages with invalid sCAL chunks. If a user or automated system were trickedinto opening a crafted PNG file, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2011-2692)

264f53fe5f4d4f1ed0c670d6fd2a4cca40cbe19c.title: USN-1182-1: Samba vulnerabilities
264f53fe5f4d4f1ed0c670d6fd2a4cca40cbe19c.body: Nobuhiro Tsuji discovered that the Samba Web Administration Tool (SWAT) didnot properly sanitize its input when processing password change requests,resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. With cross-sitescripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing serveroutput during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploitthis to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the samedomain. (CVE-2011-2694)

f039a809115781d5585af14e72c597181acbdd9f.title: USN-1174-1: libsndfile vulnerability
f039a809115781d5585af14e72c597181acbdd9f.body: Hossein Lotfi discovered that libsndfile did not properly verify the headerlength and number of channels for PARIS Audio Format (PAF) audio files. Anattacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program.

0daf659564f9b7ac83f74d1d5902919e90786b86.title: USN-1194-1: Foomatic filters vulnerabilities
0daf659564f9b7ac83f74d1d5902919e90786b86.body: It was discovered that the foomatic-rip Foomatic filter incorrectlyhandled command-line options. An attacker could use this flaw to causeFoomatic to execute arbitrary code as the "lp" user.In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the CUPSAppArmor profile.

4d268b98c45d9c1f0e8b931850e456caa6baaefa.title: USN-1179-1: ClamAV vulnerability
4d268b98c45d9c1f0e8b931850e456caa6baaefa.body: It was discovered that the hash processing code in libclamav improperlyhandled messages with certain hashes. This could allow a remote attacker tocraft a document that could cause clamav to crash, resulting in a denial ofservice.

b0ef5dc13cffa624b71e7c81bb05302d681e3166.title: USN-1276-1: KDE Utilities vulnerability
b0ef5dc13cffa624b71e7c81bb05302d681e3166.body: Tim Brown discovered that Ark did not properly perform input validationwhen previewing archive files. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted archive file, an attacker could remove files via directorytraversal.

e5714f7909aed00006af193b7d2608608736de7f.title: USN-1190-1: DHCP vulnerabilities
e5714f7909aed00006af193b7d2608608736de7f.body: David Zych discovered that DHCP incorrectly handled certain malformedpackets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause DHCP to crash,resulting in a denial of service.

94f261da0ae1049fa0459eaa837de1d1253cdd13.title: USN-1191-1: libXfont vulnerability
94f261da0ae1049fa0459eaa837de1d1253cdd13.body: Tomas Hoger discovered that libXfont incorrectly handled certain malformedcompressed fonts. An attacker could use a specially crafted font file tocause libXfont to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code in order togain privileges.

5fe6a9b5c86b7cc303a593eb1de1898896361b9e.title: USN-1207-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
5fe6a9b5c86b7cc303a593eb1de1898896361b9e.body: Tomas Hoger discovered that the CUPS image library incorrectly handled LZWstreams. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause a denial of serviceor possibly execute arbitrary code.

ae4bab6d9cbc4719be46bf5e5eaa0765908d2b89.title: USN-1214-1: GIMP vulnerability
ae4bab6d9cbc4719be46bf5e5eaa0765908d2b89.body: Tomas Hoger discovered that GIMP incorrectly handled malformed LZW streams.If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted GIF image file, anattacker could cause GIMP to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code withthe user's privileges.

c21d6e6b536687c1bfd1dc907bfdb4d284c42743.title: USN-1255-1: libmodplug vulnerabilities
c21d6e6b536687c1bfd1dc907bfdb4d284c42743.body: Hossein Lotfi discovered that libmodplug did not correctly handle certainmalformed media files. If a user or automated system were tricked intoopening a crafted media file, an attacker could cause a denial of serviceor possibly execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2011-2911, CVE-2011-2912, CVE-2011-2913)

1eb958f46affbdbced1548cde27b0e6dac28a61f.title: USN-1255-1: libmodplug vulnerabilities
1eb958f46affbdbced1548cde27b0e6dac28a61f.body: It was discovered that libmodplug did not correctly handle certainmalformed media files. If a user or automated system were tricked intoopening a crafted media file, an attacker could cause a denial of serviceor possibly execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2011-2914, CVE-2011-2915)

d0b956471245d991a58e3b1b9f6d8b2a3dc66666.title: USN-1643-1: Perl vulnerabilities
d0b956471245d991a58e3b1b9f6d8b2a3dc66666.body: It was discovered that the decode_xs function in the Encode module isvulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow via a crafted Unicode string.An attacker could use this overflow to cause a denial of service.(CVE-2011-2939)

95917fead87be4c0ab7f1f223e6be583b6bc8d51.title: USN-1417-1: libpng vulnerability
95917fead87be4c0ab7f1f223e6be583b6bc8d51.body: It was discovered that libpng incorrectly handled certain memoryoperations. If a user or automated system using libpng were tricked intoopening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit this to causea denial of service or execute code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program.

4a0c2e6cbaec9565464af1a707795db0522f228b.title: USN-1237-1: PAM vulnerabilities
4a0c2e6cbaec9565464af1a707795db0522f228b.body: Kees Cook discovered that the PAM pam_env module incorrectly handledcertain malformed environment files. A local attacker could use this flawto cause a denial of service, or possibly gain privileges. The defaultcompiler options for affected releases should reduce the vulnerability to adenial of service. (CVE-2011-3148)

52f13c9e8a858268627f23bee11c087e020b7b2a.title: USN-1237-1: PAM vulnerabilities
52f13c9e8a858268627f23bee11c087e020b7b2a.body: Kees Cook discovered that the PAM pam_env module incorrectly handledvariable expansion. A local attacker could use this flaw to cause a denialof service. (CVE-2011-3149)

4cd50aed029fba856d3f5b1a3800273ad4ce1bf2.title: USN-1270-1: Software Center vulnerability
4cd50aed029fba856d3f5b1a3800273ad4ce1bf2.body: David B. discovered that Software Center incorrectly validated servercertificates when performing secure connections. If a remote attacker wereable to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited toview sensitive information or install altered packages and repositories.

047b872c6e1ef305bfb284ee56fd4e0d01e4f422.title: USN-1284-1: Update Manager vulnerabilities
047b872c6e1ef305bfb284ee56fd4e0d01e4f422.body: David Black discovered that Update Manager incorrectly extracted thedownloaded upgrade tarball before verifying its GPG signature. If a remoteattacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw couldpotentially be used to replace arbitrary files. (CVE-2011-3152)

b424007b5daeecbaaf7f62233ae994366b60776a.title: USN-1199-1: Apache vulnerability
b424007b5daeecbaaf7f62233ae994366b60776a.body: A flaw was discovered in the byterange filter in Apache. A remote attackercould exploit this to cause a denial of service via resource exhaustion.

3745dc521fcd6a1038bd7225d06d09a236d248c4.title: USN-1504-1: Qt vulnerabilities
3745dc521fcd6a1038bd7225d06d09a236d248c4.body: A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in the HarfBuzz module. If auser were tricked into opening a crafted font file in a Qt application,an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-3193)

a054b8d0924f643c48c75ac83b5cc18d6d0363e6.title: USN-1504-1: Qt vulnerabilities
a054b8d0924f643c48c75ac83b5cc18d6d0363e6.body: It was discovered that Qt did not properly handle greyscale TIFF images.If a Qt application could be made to process a crafted TIFF file, anattacker could cause a denial of service. (CVE-2011-3194)

15307c120ac584b0e61bc440ea1fefa3076751ab.title: USN-1200-1: Quassel vulnerability
15307c120ac584b0e61bc440ea1fefa3076751ab.body: It was discovered that Quassel did not properly handle CTCP requests. Aremote attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service viaapplication crash.

4a36f2601bd0f4c3b9d5a9eba990065d9e1bf648.title: USN-1249-1: BackupPC vulnerabilities
4a36f2601bd0f4c3b9d5a9eba990065d9e1bf648.body: It was discovered that BackupPC did not properly sanitize its input whenprocessing backup browser error messages, resulting in a cross-sitescripting (XSS) vulnerability. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities,if a user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted serverrequest, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, orsteal confidential data, within the same domain. This issue did not affectUbuntu 11.10. (CVE-2011-3361)

f354d59f61d08ed2bb41aa174157dacf6f566e2b.title: USN-1263-1: IcedTea-Web, OpenJDK 6 vulnerabilities
f354d59f61d08ed2bb41aa174157dacf6f566e2b.body: Deepak Bhole discovered a flaw in the Same Origin Policy (SOP)implementation in the IcedTea web browser plugin. This could allow aremote attacker to open connections to certain hosts that shouldnot be permitted. (CVE-2011-3377)

1c1af333797fa585269ead0eb494816a6957f705.title: USN-1695-1: RPM vulnerabilities
1c1af333797fa585269ead0eb494816a6957f705.body: It was discovered that RPM incorrectly handled certain package headers. Ifa user or automated system were tricked into installing a specially craftedRPM package, an attacker could cause RPM to crash, resulting in a denial ofservice, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

a457d46eb8cabca8365c0fdd2f87a3762264c47a.title: USN-1263-1: IcedTea-Web, OpenJDK 6 vulnerabilities
a457d46eb8cabca8365c0fdd2f87a3762264c47a.body: Juliano Rizzo and Thai Duong discovered that the block-wise AESencryption algorithm block-wise as used in TLS/SSL was vulnerable toa chosen-plaintext attack. This could allow a remote attacker to viewconfidential data. (CVE-2011-3389)

6948469f34cf5f3e9f7b96a34f81036e5b764585.title: USN-1333-1: Libav vulnerabilities
6948469f34cf5f3e9f7b96a34f81036e5b764585.body: Steve Manzuik discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformedMatroska files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted Matroskafile, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 11.04. (CVE-2011-3504)

778a88b4c6993114b97a90965ad5c293101f9341.title: USN-1320-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
778a88b4c6993114b97a90965ad5c293101f9341.body: Steve Manzuik discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain malformedMatroska files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted Matroskafile, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2011-3504)

ab8a0417fbc9cc0b0550b7b88c46f50897d4949e.title: USN-1643-1: Perl vulnerabilities
ab8a0417fbc9cc0b0550b7b88c46f50897d4949e.body: It was discovered that the 'new' constructor in the Digest module isvulnerable to an eval injection. An attacker could use this to executearbitrary code. (CVE-2011-3597)

75890ddb1e44ad0249993c8dd320a8ad4c182ab9.title: USN-1257-1: radvd vulnerabilities
75890ddb1e44ad0249993c8dd320a8ad4c182ab9.body: Vasiliy Kulikov discovered that radvd incorrectly parsed theND_OPT_DNSSL_INFORMATION option. A remote attacker could exploit this witha specially-crafted request and cause the radvd daemon to crash, orpossibly execute arbitrary code. The default compiler options for affectedreleases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial of service. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 11.04 and 11.10. (CVE-2011-3601)

cc795ca61bd85faaa1d967d8a775dc7ef1bc0db2.title: USN-1257-1: radvd vulnerabilities
cc795ca61bd85faaa1d967d8a775dc7ef1bc0db2.body: Vasiliy Kulikov discovered that radvd incorrectly filtered interface nameswhen creating certain files. A local attacker could exploit this tooverwrite certain files on the system, bypassing intended permissions.(CVE-2011-3602)

718da7c92a4cfc3725a521a6cc1570448bab6d1d.title: USN-1257-1: radvd vulnerabilities
718da7c92a4cfc3725a521a6cc1570448bab6d1d.body: Vasiliy Kulikov discovered that radvd incorrectly handled certain lengths.A remote attacker could exploit this to cause the radvd daemon to crash,resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2011-3604)

c23403752f4c6a3294c675848d44f22bd7194fb2.title: USN-1257-1: radvd vulnerabilities
c23403752f4c6a3294c675848d44f22bd7194fb2.body: Vasiliy Kulikov discovered that radvd incorrectly handled delays when usedin unicast mode, which is not the default in Ubuntu. If used in unicastmode, a remote attacker could cause radvd outages, resulting in a denial ofservice. (CVE-2011-3605)

6b432b78ef90ce8be6cdde92462ecec6266f0264.title: USN-1258-1: ClamAV vulnerability
6b432b78ef90ce8be6cdde92462ecec6266f0264.body: Stephane Chazelas discovered the bytecode engine of ClamAV improperlyhandled recursion under certain circumstances. This could allow a remoteattacker to craft a file that could cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in adenial of service.

d3144184af7140c07e3e9e8d641f6a2ad94955e9.title: USN-1283-1: APT vulnerability
d3144184af7140c07e3e9e8d641f6a2ad94955e9.body: It was discovered that APT incorrectly handled the Verify-Hostconfiguration option. If a remote attacker were able to perform aman-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could potentially be used to stealrepository credentials. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS and10.10. (CVE-2011-3634)

a2e90918188b501fb39543ade0d014b890bb168e.title: USN-1401-1: Xulrunner vulnerabilities
a2e90918188b501fb39543ade0d014b890bb168e.body: It was discovered that a flaw in the Mozilla SVG implementation couldresult in an out-of-bounds memory access if SVG elements were removedduring a DOMAttrModified event handler. If the user were tricked intoopening a specially crafted page, an attacker could exploit this to cause adenial of service via application crash. (CVE-2011-3658)

80ead3af6197771b0c09a2280911f338dd80aacf.title: USN-1217-1: Puppet vulnerability
80ead3af6197771b0c09a2280911f338dd80aacf.body: Kristian Erik Hermansen discovered a directory traversal vulnerability inthe SSLFile indirection base class. A remote attacker could exploit this tooverwrite files with the privileges of the Puppet Master.

feda52fc7df99c25ec7811c4c85e57fd160590b1.title: USN-1223-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
feda52fc7df99c25ec7811c4c85e57fd160590b1.body: It was discovered that Puppet used a predictable filename when using the--edit resource. A local attacker could exploit this to edit arbitraryfiles or run arbitrary code as the user invoking the program, typicallyroot. (CVE-2011-3871)

f7b3ac083d2f23e35c062ca173fbbad6fdecf3c2.title: USN-1223-2: Puppet regression
f7b3ac083d2f23e35c062ca173fbbad6fdecf3c2.body: It was discovered that Puppet used a predictable filename when using the --edit resource. A local attacker could exploit this to edit arbitrary files or run arbitrary code as the user invoking the program, typically root. (CVE-2011-3871)

ce37149e49b15fcd8f192c14704415bb884521ad.title: USN-1238-1: Puppet vulnerability
ce37149e49b15fcd8f192c14704415bb884521ad.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled the non-default"certdnsnames" option when generating certificates. If this setting wasadded to puppet.conf, the puppet master’s DNS alt names were added to theX.509 Subject Alternative Name field of all certificates, not just thepuppet master’s certificate. An attacker that has an incorrect agentcertificate in his possession can use it to impersonate the puppet masterin a man-in-the-middle attack.

a5d14078c7b85e3f5b517256ef5ff533d699e4b3.title: USN-1238-2: Puppet regression
a5d14078c7b85e3f5b517256ef5ff533d699e4b3.body: USN-1238-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Puppet. The upstream patch introduced aregression in Ubuntu 11.04 when executing certain commands. This updatefixes the problem.We apologize for the inconvenience.Original advisory details:It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled the non-default "certdnsnames" option when generating certificates. If this setting was added to puppet.conf, the puppet master’s DNS alt names were added to the X.509 Subject Alternative Name field of all certificates, not just the puppet master’s certificate. An attacker that has an incorrect agent certificate in his possession can use it to impersonate the puppet master in a man-in-the-middle attack.

811fd0e7a2bbe92aca86cf2ba5001da5ec11299f.title: USN-1479-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
811fd0e7a2bbe92aca86cf2ba5001da5ec11299f.body: Mateusz Jurczyk and Gynvael Coldwind discovered that FFmpeg incorrectlyhandled certain malformed DV files. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted DV file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-3929, CVE-2011-3936)

5b91e860308845771d347241b99c4df08f560655.title: USN-1479-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
5b91e860308845771d347241b99c4df08f560655.body: Mateusz Jurczyk and Gynvael Coldwind discovered that FFmpeg incorrectlyhandled certain malformed NSV files. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted NSV file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-3940)

1848c4704f16144e86ec03203f6e4509e027e3a1.title: USN-1479-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
1848c4704f16144e86ec03203f6e4509e027e3a1.body: Mateusz Jurczyk and Gynvael Coldwind discovered that FFmpeg incorrectlyhandled certain malformed MJPEG-B files. If a user were tricked intoopening a crafted MJPEG-B file, an attacker could cause a denial of servicevia application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-3947)

5e20dac8e397770d87e31221cd748af3d120519f.title: USN-1479-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
5e20dac8e397770d87e31221cd748af3d120519f.body: Mateusz Jurczyk and Gynvael Coldwind discovered that FFmpeg incorrectlyhandled certain malformed DPCM files. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted DPCM file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-3951)

f4ef15a764017237acbbd0e4e9daebdf4684211f.title: USN-1479-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
f4ef15a764017237acbbd0e4e9daebdf4684211f.body: Mateusz Jurczyk and Gynvael Coldwind discovered that FFmpeg incorrectlyhandled certain malformed KMVC files. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted KMVC file, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program. (CVE-2011-3952)

a27e5be116a0e84ecf4aa1c4814225612984efff.title: USN-1266-1: OpenLDAP vulnerability
a27e5be116a0e84ecf4aa1c4814225612984efff.body: It was discovered that slapd contained an off-by-one error. Anauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this by sending acrafted crafted LDIF entry containing an empty postalAddress.

17d84601f9f1bdd2d2daa0d2e01c07ebe7009221.title: USN-1308-1: bzip2 vulnerability
17d84601f9f1bdd2d2daa0d2e01c07ebe7009221.body: vladz discovered that executables compressed by bzexe insecurely createtemporary files when they are ran. A local attacker could exploit this issue toexecute arbitrary code as the user running a compressed executable.

c07aafd3637915e07afae9bdd44e513e3ec5e6e7.title: USN-1328-1: Linux kernel (Marvell DOVE) vulnerabilities
c07aafd3637915e07afae9bdd44e513e3ec5e6e7.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel handles user-defined key types. Anunprivileged local user could exploit this to crash the system.(CVE-2011-4110)

5dfe17a295358994b382a0640fee63c5e76eb43b.title: USN-1324-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
5dfe17a295358994b382a0640fee63c5e76eb43b.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel handles user-defined key types. Anunprivileged local user could exploit this to crash the system.(CVE-2011-4110)

7221935c944c5af04680f6d24f7aa84f43156707.title: USN-1344-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7221935c944c5af04680f6d24f7aa84f43156707.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel handles user-defined key types. Anunprivileged local user could exploit this to crash the system.(CVE-2011-4110)

9a659d1d90976c5f2b512782d2caf05c3d1ef5c4.title: USN-1418-1: GnuTLS vulnerabilities
9a659d1d90976c5f2b512782d2caf05c3d1ef5c4.body: Alban Crequy discovered that the GnuTLS library incorrectly checked arraybounds when copying TLS session data. A remote attacker could crash a clientapplication, leading to a denial of service, as the client application preparedfor TLS session resumption. (CVE-2011-4128)

2d7c9acec4bc9a5f1cd5847da4264fc0f281a736.title: USN-1289-1: colord vulnerability
2d7c9acec4bc9a5f1cd5847da4264fc0f281a736.body: It was discovered that colord incorrectly handled certain SQL queries. Alocal attacker could exploit this to modify arbitrary sqlite databases. OnUbuntu, colord runs as its own user by default, so standard filepermissions would limit which databases could be altered.

dde9377d9b7443c15f800f51c503c87d99ac449d.title: USN-1333-1: Libav vulnerabilities
dde9377d9b7443c15f800f51c503c87d99ac449d.body: Phillip Langlois discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certainmalformed VP3 streams. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted file,an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2011-4352)

da39a00afbfc3e4c447ec4294df829b1eb3684d9.title: USN-1320-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
da39a00afbfc3e4c447ec4294df829b1eb3684d9.body: Phillip Langlois discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certainmalformed VP3 streams. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted file,an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.10. (CVE-2011-4352)

78736b865718a55e085653280c083b2c38bf2b94.title: USN-1320-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
78736b865718a55e085653280c083b2c38bf2b94.body: Phillip Langlois discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certainmalformed VP5 and VP6 streams. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2011-4353)

bb5c2abe8dc1cf1f229b03c391572185d2225305.title: USN-1333-1: Libav vulnerabilities
bb5c2abe8dc1cf1f229b03c391572185d2225305.body: Phillip Langlois discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certainmalformed VP5 and VP6 streams. If a user were tricked into opening acrafted file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2011-4353)

f3e7a9de00f06df74cd66cbe15c0dd80d40d10de.title: USN-1333-1: Libav vulnerabilities
f3e7a9de00f06df74cd66cbe15c0dd80d40d10de.body: It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformed VMDfiles. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted VMD file, an attackercould cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2011-4364)

0dabb95127b4fb5e12d29cec3e1382ee45100113.title: USN-1320-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
0dabb95127b4fb5e12d29cec3e1382ee45100113.body: It was discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain malformed VMDfiles. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted VMD file, an attackercould cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2011-4364)

ea9a60f399edfb7f7b2192eb965bb51e24ef2651.title: USN-1265-1: system-config-printer vulnerability
ea9a60f399edfb7f7b2192eb965bb51e24ef2651.body: Marc Deslauriers discovered that system-config-printer's cupshelpersscripts used by the Ubuntu automatic printer driver download servicequeried the OpenPrinting database using an insecure connection. If a remoteattacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw couldbe exploited to install altered packages and repositories.

dc273da2f92e916af2e7677d630503b43049e4c2.title: USN-1351-1: AccountsService vulnerability
dc273da2f92e916af2e7677d630503b43049e4c2.body: Hayawardh Vijayakumar discovered that AccountsService incorrectly handledprivileges when modifying the language settings on Ubuntu. A local attackercould exploit this issue to modify arbitrary files, and possibly create adenial of service or obtain increased privileges.

2165382097849a065ac2cd890796e711f20b3325.title: USN-1352-1: Software Properties vulnerability
2165382097849a065ac2cd890796e711f20b3325.body: David Black discovered that Software Properties incorrectly validatedserver certificates when performing secure connections to download PPA GPGkey fingerprints. If a remote attacker were able to perform aman-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to install alteredpackage repository GPG keys.

1ccc869428671379410d7dde0ec53d6621b3bf72.title: USN-1465-2: Ubuntu One storage protocol update
1ccc869428671379410d7dde0ec53d6621b3bf72.body: USN-1465-1 fixed a vulnerability in the Ubuntu One Client. This update addsa required fix to the Ubuntu One storage protocol library.Original advisory details:It was discovered that the Ubuntu One Client incorrectly validated server certificates when using HTTPS connections. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to alter or compromise confidential information.

2ca24375051a96d353e0a0c5e00187d3d9680abe.title: USN-1465-1: Ubuntu One Client vulnerability
2ca24375051a96d353e0a0c5e00187d3d9680abe.body: It was discovered that the Ubuntu One Client incorrectly validated servercertificates when using HTTPS connections. If a remote attacker were ableto perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited toalter or compromise confidential information.

6e2a84cabeeea4ca4774a33c80bce3e701456598.title: USN-1465-3: Ubuntu One Client regression
6e2a84cabeeea4ca4774a33c80bce3e701456598.body: USN-1465-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Ubuntu One Client. The update failed toinstall on certain Ubuntu 10.04 LTS systems that had a legacy Python 2.5package installed. This update fixes the problem.We apologize for the inconvenience.Original advisory details:It was discovered that the Ubuntu One Client incorrectly validated server certificates when using HTTPS connections. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to alter or compromise confidential information.

fa34c2efff1a05c4a20bd821bedf2322a689d55c.title: USN-1429-1: Jetty vulnerability
fa34c2efff1a05c4a20bd821bedf2322a689d55c.body: It was discovered that Jetty computed hash values for form parameterswithout restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably.This could allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service bysending many crafted parameters.

9813e51e5326f057fafe3a532cd6a0c75a5b1946.title: USN-1315-1: JasPer vulnerabilities
9813e51e5326f057fafe3a532cd6a0c75a5b1946.body: Jonathan Foote discovered that JasPer incorrectly handled certain malformedJPEG-2000 image files. If a user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted JPEG-2000 image file, a remote attacker could cause JasPer to crashor possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

abafddffd4e00568140baa0548944c85980590fc.title: USN-1309-1: DHCP vulnerability
abafddffd4e00568140baa0548944c85980590fc.body: It was discovered that the DHCP server incorrectly handled certainmalformed packets when configured to evaluate regular expressions. A remoteattacker could use this issue to cause DHCP to crash, resulting in a denialof service.

cd60ab91a77153a77063f431237682cef14d9bc3.title: USN-1307-1: PHP vulnerability
cd60ab91a77153a77063f431237682cef14d9bc3.body: Florent Hochwelker discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain EXIFheaders in JPEG files. A remote attacker could exploit this issue toview sensitive information or cause the PHP server to crash.

fc4fbe2d1a9c28c4421e4fbe3123c26e291b2a43.title: USN-1333-1: Libav vulnerabilities
fc4fbe2d1a9c28c4421e4fbe3123c26e291b2a43.body: Phillip Langlois discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certainmalformed SVQ1 streams. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted SVQ1stream file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2011-4579)

b04df3882d1a76423f59f78382157d864b6c1309.title: USN-1320-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
b04df3882d1a76423f59f78382157d864b6c1309.body: Phillip Langlois discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certainmalformed SVQ1 streams. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted SVQ1stream file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2011-4579)

1b205c025aa2ef7fdfcc9143c67c7658f2500c02.title: USN-1348-1: ICU vulnerability
1b205c025aa2ef7fdfcc9143c67c7658f2500c02.body: It was discovered that ICU did not properly handle invalid locale dataduring Unicode conversion. If an application using ICU processed crafteddata, an attacker could cause it to crash or potentially execute arbitrarycode with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

4d985750b25883d8b4080d6235e6fdd6b9d511b0.title: USN-1349-1: X.Org vulnerability
4d985750b25883d8b4080d6235e6fdd6b9d511b0.body: It was discovered that the X wrapper incorrectly checked certain consolepermissions when launched by unprivileged users. An attacker connectedremotely could use this flaw to start X, bypassing the console permissionscheck.

e03cc94e54a40a90ab1051a09e88242dca616bfa.title: USN-1338-1: Rsyslog vulnerability
e03cc94e54a40a90ab1051a09e88242dca616bfa.body: Peter Eisentraut discovered that Rsyslog would not properly perform inputvalidation when configured to use imfile. If an attacker were able tocraft messages in a file that Rsyslog monitored, an attacker could cause adenial of service. The imfile module is disabled by default in Ubuntu.

b6294f194c74a7b4e0a565b4da860492d5bb397b.title: USN-1249-1: BackupPC vulnerabilities
b6294f194c74a7b4e0a565b4da860492d5bb397b.body: It was discovered that BackupPC did not properly sanitize its input whenprocessing backup browser error messages, resulting in a cross-sitescripting (XSS) vulnerability. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities,if a user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted serverrequest, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, orsteal confidential data, within the same domain. This issue did not affectUbuntu 11.10. (CVE-2011-3361)Jamie Strandboge discovered that BackupPC did not properly sanitize itsinput when processing log file viewer error messages, resulting incross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

56df52b9d52f22cb6ea4fb3973d84d8bbacb997e.title: USN-1596-1: Python 2.6 vulnerabilities
56df52b9d52f22cb6ea4fb3973d84d8bbacb997e.body: It was discovered that SimpleHTTPServer did not use a charset parameter inthe Content-Type HTTP header. An attacker could potentially exploit thisto conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks against Internet Explorer 7users. This issue only affected Ubuntu 11.04. (CVE-2011-4940)

c465dbf5e575556366951bbd35a282b1e55d495a.title: USN-1613-2: Python 2.4 vulnerabilities
c465dbf5e575556366951bbd35a282b1e55d495a.body: It was discovered that SimpleHTTPServer did not use a charset parameter in the Content-Type HTTP header. An attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks against Internet Explorer 7 users. (CVE-2011-4940)

58ab0d4ac196fb90da610dfb950d3e9b6138067e.title: USN-1613-1: Python 2.5 vulnerabilities
58ab0d4ac196fb90da610dfb950d3e9b6138067e.body: It was discovered that SimpleHTTPServer did not use a charset parameter inthe Content-Type HTTP header. An attacker could potentially exploit thisto conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks against Internet Explorer 7users. (CVE-2011-4940)

17180e07dba1c2155694c8a863ee95d071f6a3ee.body: It was discovered that SimpleHTTPServer did not use a charset parameter inthe Content-Type HTTP header. 71ae7e1aa1ffbf258377c8d5976b76aa770419a3.body: It was discovered that Python distutils contained a race condition whencreating the ~/.pypirc file. A local attacker could exploit this to obtainsensitive information. (CVE-2011-4944)

a98ecf7724b29010a44ed6c3b9c60ffcdb32f667.title: USN-1613-2: Python 2.4 vulnerabilities
a98ecf7724b29010a44ed6c3b9c60ffcdb32f667.body: It was discovered that Python distutils contained a race condition when creating the ~/.pypirc file. A local attacker could exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2011-4944)

478ac760d0dae1b21adb3f2cebcc44462a0f4636.title: USN-1613-1: Python 2.5 vulnerabilities
478ac760d0dae1b21adb3f2cebcc44462a0f4636.body: It was discovered that Python distutils contained a race condition whencreating the ~/.pypirc file. A local attacker could exploit this to obtainsensitive information. (CVE-2011-4944)
