b173c77e8c37431a312804a64176a62642ba5420.body: It was discovered that Python distutils contained a race condition whencreating the ~/.pypirc file. A local attacker could exploit this to obtainsensitive information. (CVE-2011-4944)

cbe2feb0d58c88210340ccb7d39a90e73d423750.title: USN-1616-1: Python 3.1 vulnerabilities
cbe2feb0d58c88210340ccb7d39a90e73d423750.body: It was discovered that Python distutils contained a race condition whencreating the ~/.pypirc file. A local attacker could exploit this to obtainsensitive information. (CVE-2011-4944)

83d72cfe6fbc4da38a0a21512d748b1c438f8859.title: USN-1722-1: jQuery vulnerability
83d72cfe6fbc4da38a0a21512d748b1c438f8859.body: It was discovered that jQuery incorrectly handled selecting elements usinglocation.hash, resulting in a possible cross-site scripting (XSS) issue.With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked intoviewing a specially crafted page, a remote attacker could exploit this tomodify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain.

6ed91b85ee4f62df696a4ec040d8ea9fa471d510.title: USN-2080-1: Memcached vulnerabilities
6ed91b85ee4f62df696a4ec040d8ea9fa471d510.body: Stefan Bucur discovered that Memcached incorrectly handled certain largebody lengths. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Memcached tocrash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2011-4971)

d84dd91833d9cbef86a0cbc7f9824f5966d74b72.title: USN-1339-1: QEMU vulnerability
d84dd91833d9cbef86a0cbc7f9824f5966d74b72.body: Nicolae Mogoreanu discovered that QEMU did not properly verify legacy modepackets in the e1000 network driver. A remote attacker could exploit thisto cause a denial of service or possibly execute code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program.When using QEMU with libvirt or virtualization management software based onlibvirt such as Eucalyptus and OpenStack, QEMU guests are individuallyisolated by an AppArmor profile by default in Ubuntu.

706a4f0634c5908abd5a02fb67bc79b908de5d98.title: USN-1326-1: Nova vulnerability
706a4f0634c5908abd5a02fb67bc79b908de5d98.body: Nachi Ueno, Rohit Karajgi, and Venkatesan Ravikumar discovered that whenNova is configured to use the OpenStack API, it would not correctly enforceaccess controls on certain incoming requests. A remote authenticatedattacker could exploit this to change resources of arbitrary tenants.

237f7f2c483d54621af220447c3297c3f6977cc8.title: USN-1556-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
237f7f2c483d54621af220447c3297c3f6977cc8.body: Chen Haogang discovered an integer overflow that could result in memorycorruption. A local unprivileged user could use this to crash the system.(CVE-2012-0044)

3600a65434e83d375f64f5d3c5faa7289cf2723c.title: USN-1555-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3600a65434e83d375f64f5d3c5faa7289cf2723c.body: Chen Haogang discovered an integer overflow that could result in memorycorruption. A local unprivileged user could use this to crash the system.(CVE-2012-0044)

3b9bda5c6f5b09e6fcb011a2a27ddb5cdf7fd9b9.title: USN-1336-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
3b9bda5c6f5b09e6fcb011a2a27ddb5cdf7fd9b9.body: Jüri Aedla discovered that the kernel incorrectly handled /proc//mempermissions. A local attacker could exploit this and gain root privileges.(CVE-2012-0056)

ddd139fcec7fbe70d091d633fadf7111a9b83b14.title: USN-1366-1: devscripts vulnerabilities
ddd139fcec7fbe70d091d633fadf7111a9b83b14.body: Paul Wise discovered that debdiff did not properly sanitize its input whenprocessing .dsc and .changes files. If debdiff processed a crafted file, anattacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2012-0210)

ca9c71b8e97fe86aeed1edabb584b7a38dea5c96.title: USN-1366-1: devscripts vulnerabilities
ca9c71b8e97fe86aeed1edabb584b7a38dea5c96.body: Raphael Geissert discovered that debdiff did not properly sanitize its inputwhen processing source packages. If debdiff processed an original sourcetarball, with crafted filenames in the top-level directory, an attacker couldexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2012-0211)

fd07418df9cc0dc1c5828c22d55dc24f6e9208c7.title: USN-1366-1: devscripts vulnerabilities
fd07418df9cc0dc1c5828c22d55dc24f6e9208c7.body: Raphael Geissert discovered that debdiff did not properly sanitize its inputwhen processing filename parameters. If debdiff processed a crafted filenameparameter, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking the program. (CVE-2012-0212)

9882864205d3d7f3e9eee3707b31b5634ee703c7.title: USN-1593-1: devscripts vulnerabilities
9882864205d3d7f3e9eee3707b31b5634ee703c7.body: Raphael Geissert discovered that the debdiff.pl tool incorrectly handledshell metacharacters. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a specially crafted filename, a remote attacher could possiblyexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2012-0212)

ce6c2312f3edd3fdb3d5af9edb42e564ed2e06d0.title: USN-1385-1: APT vulnerability
ce6c2312f3edd3fdb3d5af9edb42e564ed2e06d0.body: Simon Ruderich discovered that APT incorrectly handled repositories thatuse InRelease files. The default Ubuntu repositories do not use InReleasefiles, so this issue only affected third-party repositories. If a remoteattacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw couldpotentially be used to install altered packages.

f75c5dec694817b79605e1675bc16ac033c46774.title: USN-1435-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
f75c5dec694817b79605e1675bc16ac033c46774.body: Joonas Kuorilehto and Aleksis Kauppinen discovered that ImageMagickincorrectly handled certain ResolutionUnit tags. If a user or automatedsystem using ImageMagick were tricked into opening a specially craftedimage, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service orpossibly execute code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2012-0247, CVE-2012-1185)

2aac30ce145602122c05821f61722977a51598cf.title: USN-1435-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
2aac30ce145602122c05821f61722977a51598cf.body: Aleksis Kauppinen, Joonas Kuorilehto and Tuomas Parttimaa discovered thatImageMagick incorrectly handled certain JPEG EXIF tags. If a user orautomated system using ImageMagick were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted image, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service.(CVE-2012-0259)

08f9975c34f7cc3918f5938c19aa0566a4707274.title: USN-1540-2: NSS vulnerability
08f9975c34f7cc3918f5938c19aa0566a4707274.body: USN-1540-1 fixed vulnerabilities in NSS. This update provides thecorresponding updates for Ubuntu 12.04 LTS.Original advisory details:Kaspar Brand discovered a vulnerability in how the Network Security Services (NSS) ASN.1 decoder handles zero length items. If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted certificate, an attacker could possibly exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash.

cac15bc5854f94e996a5da05d26c124438bb83f4.title: USN-1540-1: NSS vulnerability
cac15bc5854f94e996a5da05d26c124438bb83f4.body: Kaspar Brand discovered a vulnerability in how the Network SecurityServices (NSS) ASN.1 decoder handles zero length items. If the user weretricked into opening a specially crafted certificate, an attacker couldpossibly exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash.

d502d69dca13810789292d9c300d7b6d281e432d.title: USN-1370-1: libvorbis vulnerability
d502d69dca13810789292d9c300d7b6d281e432d.body: It was discovered that libvorbis did not correctly handle certain malformedogg files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted ogg filewith an application that uses libvorbis, an attacker could cause a denialof service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

8a090ac7377efc01ae1c86ff1d00859cd1cb3962.title: USN-1400-3: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
8a090ac7377efc01ae1c86ff1d00859cd1cb3962.body: Mike Brooks discovered that using carriage return line feed (CRLF) injection, one could introduce a new Content Security Policy (CSP) rule which allows for cross-site scripting (XSS) on sites with a separate header injection vulnerability. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing a specially crafted page, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain. (CVE-2012-0451)

bff304b0e41c9606533439cbc7ff3720a99f5aa3.body: Daniel Glazman discovered that the Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) implementation is vulnerable to crashing due to modification of a keyframe followed by access to the cssText of the keyframe. If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted web page, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-0459)

ad75ec97c43e45d54ed41d83e6c145efc0a8b20b.body: It was discovered that cvs incorrectly handled certain responses fromproxy servers. If a user were tricked into connecting to a malicious proxyserver, a remote attacker could cause cvs to crash, or possibly executearbitrary code.

d51789480836bd28a7aba6653ab5e14cdd1d6a7a.title: USN-1358-1: PHP vulnerabilities
d51789480836bd28a7aba6653ab5e14cdd1d6a7a.body: It was discovered that PHP allowed the magic_quotes_gpc setting tobe disabled remotely. This could allow a remote attacker to bypassrestrictions that could prevent an SQL injection. (CVE-2012-0831)

7d0ab074f9875f732f7c5035a31cf543fee41b63.body: It was discovered that SimpleXMLRPCServer did not properly validate itsinput when handling HTTP POST requests. A remote attacker could exploitthis to cause a denial of service via excessive CPU utilization.(CVE-2012-0845)

6fd08f8b27223e562359411d91cff4424b9ef0ec.title: USN-1374-1: Samba vulnerability
6fd08f8b27223e562359411d91cff4424b9ef0ec.body: Andy Davis discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain AndX offsets.A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request to the server andcause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

47bc3927499d6be62344b07d8b98d54042f9faeb.title: USN-1613-2: Python 2.4 vulnerabilities
47bc3927499d6be62344b07d8b98d54042f9faeb.body: It was discovered that the Expat module in Python 2.5 computed hash values without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably. If a user or application using pyexpat were tricked into opening a crafted XML file, an attacker could cause a denial of service by consuming excessive CPU resources. (CVE-2012-0876)

3a7d765f242feb2b360703ce571aa53a6584a6ba.title: USN-1527-1: Expat vulnerabilities
3a7d765f242feb2b360703ce571aa53a6584a6ba.body: It was discovered that Expat computed hash values without restricting theability to trigger hash collisions predictably. If a user or application linkedagainst Expat were tricked into opening a crafted XML file, an attacker couldcause a denial of service by consuming excessive CPU resources. (CVE-2012-0876)

c4e08dfc8002c8118d11fe85ef9bd8527868699d.title: USN-1613-1: Python 2.5 vulnerabilities
c4e08dfc8002c8118d11fe85ef9bd8527868699d.body: It was discovered that the Expat module in Python 2.5 computed hash valueswithout restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably. Ifa user or application using pyexpat were tricked into opening a crafted XMLfile, an attacker could cause a denial of service by consuming excessiveCPU resources. (CVE-2012-0876)

718df8b60bb364c876f62a5e829d2bdca1b494e3.title: USN-1399-2: Light Display Manager vulnerability
718df8b60bb364c876f62a5e829d2bdca1b494e3.body: Ryan Lortie discovered that a guest session script bundled in the LightDisplay Manager package improperly cleaned out certain guest session files.A local attacker could use this issue to delete arbitrary files.

fde463d189608a6ef2603810cd635498157bb4c9.title: USN-1414-1: Aptdaemon vulnerability
fde463d189608a6ef2603810cd635498157bb4c9.body: It was discovered that Aptdaemon incorrectly handled installing packageswithout performing a transaction simulation. An attacker could possibly usethis flaw to install altered packages.

f6910a3832785a81531aee0127c3bf72c38f279d.title: USN-1420-1: NVIDIA graphics drivers vulnerability
f6910a3832785a81531aee0127c3bf72c38f279d.body: It was discovered that the NVIDIA graphics drivers could be reconfigured togain access to arbitrary system memory. A local attacker could use thisissue to possibly gain root privileges.

5d59e2afd3b6c8a9ac61869340b99b5929f1d0af.title: USN-1479-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
5d59e2afd3b6c8a9ac61869340b99b5929f1d0af.body: Fabian Yamaguchi discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certainmalformed VQA files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted VQAfile, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, orpossibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2012-0947)

14db878fea0a41793326e5c7559f49b4a5739c8a.title: USN-1443-1: Update Manager vulnerabilities
14db878fea0a41793326e5c7559f49b4a5739c8a.body: It was discovered that Update Manager created system state archive fileswith incorrect permissions when upgrading releases. A local user couldpossibly use this to read repository credentials. (CVE-2012-0948)

7da7fd3a645393cbe53281d0e095cbffcf1d7769.title: USN-1443-1: Update Manager vulnerabilities
7da7fd3a645393cbe53281d0e095cbffcf1d7769.body: Felix Geyer discovered that the Update Manager Apport hook incorrectlyuploaded certain system state archive files to Launchpad when reportingbugs. This could possibly result in repository credentials being includedin public bug reports. (CVE-2012-0949)

9ab32ebd8b07cb89160ef8d10d78c665028acd97.title: USN-1443-2: Update Manager vulnerability
9ab32ebd8b07cb89160ef8d10d78c665028acd97.body: USN-1443-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Update Manager. The fix forCVE-2012-0949 was discovered to be incomplete. This update fixes theproblem.Original advisory details:Felix Geyer discovered that the Update Manager Apport hook incorrectly uploaded certain system state archive files to Launchpad when reporting bugs. This could possibly result in repository credentials being included in public bug reports. (CVE-2012-0949)

3ededa02680775bf660c62432ae9e96f3b230136.title: USN-1477-1: APT vulnerability
3ededa02680775bf660c62432ae9e96f3b230136.body: Georgi Guninski discovered that APT did not properly validate importedkeyrings via apt-key net-update. USN-1475-1 added additional verificationfor imported keyrings, but it was insufficient. If a remote attacker wereable to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could potentially beused to install altered packages. This update corrects the issue bydisabling the net-update option completely. A future update will re-enablethe option with corrected verification.

27cb09997ac73ee8cf814f17782c710e135dfa09.title: USN-1475-1: APT update
27cb09997ac73ee8cf814f17782c710e135dfa09.body: Georgi Guninski discovered that APT relied on GnuPG argument order and didnot check GPG subkeys when validating imported keyrings via apt-keynet-update. While it appears that a man-in-the-middle attacker cannotexploit this, as a hardening measure this update adjusts apt-key tovalidate all subkeys when checking for key collisions.

8c6569b6899f836cccfb7a497fe0f230abe6a496.title: USN-1561-1: ubiquity-slideshow-ubuntu vulnerability
8c6569b6899f836cccfb7a497fe0f230abe6a496.body: Paul Mutton discovered that ubiquity-slideshow-ubuntu incorrectly handledthe Twitter feed displayed during system installation. A remote attackercould use this flaw to inject code into the Twitter feed and read arbitraryfiles off the filesystem during system installation. This flaw has beenresolved in the Ubuntu 12.04.1 LTS installation images by disabling theTwitter feed.

28144e991ae0bbb1e79dd74f7e363eb7dc242b07.title: USN-1624-1: Remote Login Service vulnerability
28144e991ae0bbb1e79dd74f7e363eb7dc242b07.body: It was discovered that Remote Login Service incorrectly purged accountinformation when switching users. A local attacker could use this issue topossibly obtain sensitive information.

ff4fe14d8dc1f441dca71a238ac151d58ccd0ccc.title: USN-1639-1: unity-firefox-extension vulnerability
ff4fe14d8dc1f441dca71a238ac151d58ccd0ccc.body: It was discovered that unity-firefox-extension incorrectly handled certaincallbacks. A remote attacker could use this issue to causeunity-firefox-extension to crash, resulting in a denial of service, orpossibly execute arbitrary code.

07020bb111a44b9869a74375354c71bcce1aebf4.title: USN-1662-1: APT vulnerability
07020bb111a44b9869a74375354c71bcce1aebf4.body: It was discovered that APT set inappropriate permissions on the term.logfile. A local attacker could use this flaw to possibly obtain sensitiveinformation.

a88c891d80eae66051827cec90b5a655491ca58b.title: USN-1372-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
a88c891d80eae66051827cec90b5a655491ca58b.body: It was discovered that Puppet did not drop privileges when executingcommands as different users. If an attacker had control of the executionmanifests or the executed command, this could be used to execute code withelevated group permissions (typically root). (CVE-2012-1053)

51603528fb04f579592646a3dc86f9d23fa4a3a7.title: USN-1372-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
51603528fb04f579592646a3dc86f9d23fa4a3a7.body: It was discovered that Puppet unsafely opened files when the k5login typeis used to manage files. A local attacker could exploit this to overwritearbitrary files and escalate privileges. (CVE-2012-1054)

a077ebd0101b4a18e969cbbdc52e2bbbfd8d0fe1.body: Mateusz Jurczyk discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certainmalformed BDF font files. If a user were tricked into using a specially craftedfont file, a remote attacker could cause FreeType to crash. (CVE-2012-1126)

dec2241e2baec18548d034b8e6ef0ec485bd249f.title: USN-1613-2: Python 2.4 vulnerabilities
dec2241e2baec18548d034b8e6ef0ec485bd249f.body: Tim Boddy discovered that the Expat module in Python 2.5 did not properly handle memory reallocation when processing XML files. If a user or application using pyexpat were tricked into opening a crafted XML file, an attacker could cause a denial of service by consuming excessive memory resources. (CVE-2012-1148)

4fadef3ae29027753c377c6887620b1d2fc5998f.title: USN-1527-1: Expat vulnerabilities
4fadef3ae29027753c377c6887620b1d2fc5998f.body: Tim Boddy discovered that Expat did not properly handle memory reallocationwhen processing XML files. If a user or application linked against Expat weretricked into opening a crafted XML file, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice by consuming excessive memory resources. This issue only affectedUbuntu 8.04 LTS, 10.04 LTS, 11.04 and 11.10. (CVE-2012-1148)

fc43e1515e5f2f964e44f9c0d0cdcf8a4c395ffd.title: USN-1613-1: Python 2.5 vulnerabilities

613bfa81f02996911465341623a1d73cb0af4dad.title: USN-1596-1: Python 2.6 vulnerabilities
613bfa81f02996911465341623a1d73cb0af4dad.body: It was discovered that Python was susceptible to hash algorithm attacks.An attacker could cause a denial of service under certian circumstances.This update adds the '-R' command line option and honors setting thePYTHONHASHSEED environment variable to 'random' to salt str and datetimeobjects with an unpredictable value. (CVE-2012-1150)

7dc071cc13854e4044ad5dcedb5ea3cc09f149e6.title: USN-1424-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
7dc071cc13854e4044ad5dcedb5ea3cc09f149e6.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL could be made to dereference a NULL pointerwhen processing S/MIME messages. A remote attacker could use this to causea denial of service. These issues did not affect Ubuntu 8.04 LTS.(CVE-2006-7250, CVE-2012-1165)

ba1bea22d49fbf959ab974209fe7a0d6c5809cae.title: USN-1398-1: LTSP Display Manager vulnerability
ba1bea22d49fbf959ab974209fe7a0d6c5809cae.body: Tenho Tuhkala discovered that the LTSP Display Manager (ldm) incorrectlyfiltered keybindings. An attacker could use the default keybindings toexecute arbitrary commands as root at the login screen.

af978c4b803fbef98cc8208ae210eb67b9e5d695.title: USN-1416-1: tiff vulnerabilities
af978c4b803fbef98cc8208ae210eb67b9e5d695.body: Alexander Gavrun discovered that the TIFF library incorrectly allocatedspace for a tile. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening aspecially crafted TIFF image, a remote attacker could execute arbitrarycode with user privileges, or crash the application, leading to a denial ofservice. (CVE-2012-1173)

7a7db5de3e7686da013b4517c7ab99c2ba2a9d49.title: USN-1547-1: libGData, evolution-data-server vulnerability
7a7db5de3e7686da013b4517c7ab99c2ba2a9d49.body: Vreixo Formoso discovered that the libGData library, as usedby Evolution and other applications, did not properly verify SSLcertificates. A remote attacker could exploit this to perform a manin the middle attack to view sensitive information or alter datatransmitted via the GData protocol.

1096988608a6d7c53042d3b498c8875b0458efc3.title: USN-1423-1: Samba vulnerability
1096988608a6d7c53042d3b498c8875b0458efc3.body: Brian Gorenc discovered that Samba incorrectly calculated array bounds whenhandling remote procedure calls (RPC) over the network. A remote,unauthenticated attacker could exploit this to execute arbitrary code as theroot user. (CVE-2012-1182)

38afe6c97e97d720c9f6cc2c6d33710363893212.title: USN-1395-1: PyPAM vulnerability
38afe6c97e97d720c9f6cc2c6d33710363893212.body: Markus Vervier discovered that PyPAM incorrectly handled passwordscontaining NULL bytes. An attacker could exploit this to cause applicationsusing PyPAM to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

83e16b1dab7cc90b57c725614df0738aec575656.title: USN-1436-1: Libtasn1 vulnerability
83e16b1dab7cc90b57c725614df0738aec575656.body: Matthew Hall discovered that Libtasn1 incorrectly handled certain largevalues. An attacker could exploit this with a specially crafted ASN.1structure and cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrarycode.

ef47c4b18f7e608b1ad2823a959c38a8f4724715.title: USN-2123-1: file vulnerabilities
ef47c4b18f7e608b1ad2823a959c38a8f4724715.body: It was discovered that file incorrectly handled Composite Document files.An attacker could use this issue to cause file to crash, resulting in adenial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS and Ubuntu12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-1571)

71d882e382f8225ff1bf04afde779aa077fb837d.title: USN-1418-1: GnuTLS vulnerabilities
71d882e382f8225ff1bf04afde779aa077fb837d.body: Matthew Hall discovered that the GnuTLS library incorrectly handled TLSrecords. A remote attacker could crash client and server applications, leadingto a denial of service, by sending a crafted TLS record. (CVE-2012-1573)

dfec499be2ff9c90202293aff07989851666ca88.body: It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled certain JPEG EXIFtags. (CVE-2012-1610)

b53b8714fbf49559e8b3af63b556a23c20b061ec.body: It was discovered that Puppet used a predictable filename when downloading MacOS X package files. A local attacker could exploit this to overwrite arbitraryfiles. (CVE-2012-1906)

f76dfd3b244912f4872e1a3adacda7815d70a875.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
f76dfd3b244912f4872e1a3adacda7815d70a875.body: Mariusz Mlynsk discovered that it is possible to shadow the location object using Object.defineProperty. This could potentially result in a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against plugins. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing a specially crafted page, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents or steal confidential data within the same domain. (CVE-2012-1956)

51bf1c5784dcf4bb16f9a5873353c79f287a2498.title: USN-1419-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
51bf1c5784dcf4bb16f9a5873353c79f287a2498.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled filebucket retrievalrequests. A local attacker could exploit this to read arbitrary files.(CVE-2012-1986)

6b21f6b09cce02dc59f712daf04c5afbca2d3883.title: USN-1419-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
6b21f6b09cce02dc59f712daf04c5afbca2d3883.body: It was discovered that Puppet used a predictable filename for the Telnetconnection log file. A local attacker could exploit this to overwrite arbitraryfiles. This issue only affected Ubuntu 11.10. (CVE-2012-1989)

e41eea2c4872f4f209bc6465cfd490721dd8e83d.title: USN-1439-1: Horizon vulnerabilities
e41eea2c4872f4f209bc6465cfd490721dd8e83d.body: Matthias Weckbecker discovered a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilityin Horizon via the log viewer refrash mechanism. If a user were trickedinto viewing a specially crafted log message, a remote attacker couldexploit this to modify the contents or steal confidential data within thesame domain. (CVE-2012-2094)

0ab11c602b174267a4ef6e0f907eadbcd996aa5f.title: USN-1438-1: Nova vulnerability
0ab11c602b174267a4ef6e0f907eadbcd996aa5f.body: Dan Prince discovered that Nova did not enforce quotas for security groupsand rules added to security groups. An authenticated user could exploitthis to cause a denial of service.

b2709da2d7271a1631ecb97cee3dab17d97a2f69.title: USN-1424-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
b2709da2d7271a1631ecb97cee3dab17d97a2f69.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that OpenSSL did not properly perform boundschecking when processing DER data via BIO or FILE functions. A remoteattacker could trigger this flaw in services that used SSL to cause adenial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with applicationprivileges. (CVE-2012-2110)

b972f10dd9d573862e99b5a233056c898b98e24a.title: USN-1434-1: Samba vulnerability
b972f10dd9d573862e99b5a233056c898b98e24a.body: Ivano Cristofolini discovered that Samba incorrectly handled some LocalSecurity Authority (LSA) remote procedure calls (RPC). A remote, authenticatedattacker could exploit this to grant administrative privileges to arbitraryusers. The administrative privileges could be used to bypass permission checksperformed by the Samba server.

8b7607a2eb21f72cf9524f7a9782ab41bde4b0f3.title: USN-1529-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8b7607a2eb21f72cf9524f7a9782ab41bde4b0f3.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's macvtap device driver, which isused in KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine) to create a network bridgebetween host and guest. A privleged user in a guest could exploit this flawto crash the host, if the vhost_net module is loaded with theexperimental_zcopytx option enabled. (CVE-2012-2119)

f04a1aabd5f3fbc542523d7d9167973e17604109.title: USN-1577-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
f04a1aabd5f3fbc542523d7d9167973e17604109.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's KVM (kernel virtual machine).An administrative user in the guest OS could leverage this flaw to cause adenial of service in the host OS. (CVE-2012-2121)

a11c1177c3d3f1cda0378313e0ebae217bb9711d.title: USN-2037-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
a11c1177c3d3f1cda0378313e0ebae217bb9711d.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's KVM (kernel virtual machine).An administrative user in the guest OS could leverage this flaw to cause adenial of service in the host OS. (CVE-2012-2121)

2909ab585f98666deab25c81b28f50e6ff68b903.title: USN-2036-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
2909ab585f98666deab25c81b28f50e6ff68b903.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's KVM (kernel virtual machine).An administrative user in the guest OS could leverage this flaw to cause adenial of service in the host OS. (CVE-2012-2121)

ac56880ec5b3a6b156ce8526e75a7e7fb7f4a37e.title: USN-1582-1: RubyGems vulnerabilities
ac56880ec5b3a6b156ce8526e75a7e7fb7f4a37e.body: John Firebaugh discovered that the RubyGems remote gem fetcher did not properlyverify SSL certificates. A remote attacker could exploit this to perform a manin the middle attack to alter gem files being downloaded for installation.(CVE-2012-2126)

095204cc55323b690c30263450c6ec4bfcbff44d.title: USN-1607-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
095204cc55323b690c30263450c6ec4bfcbff44d.body: Vadim Ponomarev discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel causing a referenceleak when PID namespaces are used. A remote attacker could exploit thisflaw causing a denial of service. (CVE-2012-2127)

740973f9909f9b5b21bd512e7512e54c5a85fd7c.title: USN-1594-1: Linux kernel (Oneiric backport) vulnerabilities
740973f9909f9b5b21bd512e7512e54c5a85fd7c.body: Vadim Ponomarev discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel causing a referenceleak when PID namespaces are used. A remote attacker could exploit thisflaw causing a denial of service. (CVE-2012-2127)

bf38f17b596fc36dc9edcefe29a90d3395d022f0.title: USN-1428-1: OpenSSL vulnerability
bf38f17b596fc36dc9edcefe29a90d3395d022f0.body: It was discovered that the fix for CVE-2012-2110 was incomplete for OpenSSL0.9.8. A remote attacker could trigger this flaw in services that used SSLto cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code withapplication privileges. Ubuntu 11.10 was not affected by this issue.(CVE-2012-2131)

59d5ad3b774ea133c3fa1f58096709b5e0293c83.title: USN-1535-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
59d5ad3b774ea133c3fa1f58096709b5e0293c83.body: An error was discovered in the Linux kernel's network TUN/TAP deviceimplementation. A local user with access to the TUN/TAP interface (which isnot available to unprivileged users until granted by a root user) couldexploit this flaw to crash the system or potential gain administrativeprivileges. (CVE-2012-2136)

0ea5f1a02c45c6374afe5b2ea2b6dd2fd6f8f10f.title: USN-1529-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
0ea5f1a02c45c6374afe5b2ea2b6dd2fd6f8f10f.body: An error was discovered in the Linux kernel's network TUN/TAP deviceimplementation. A local user with access to the TUN/TAP interface (which isnot available to unprivileged users until granted by a root user) couldexploit this flaw to crash the system or potential gain administrativeprivileges. (CVE-2012-2136)

d7f32fa6ad7ffee085e2232b9046cb17193f34a9.title: USN-1529-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d7f32fa6ad7ffee085e2232b9046cb17193f34a9.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel's KVM (Kernel-based VirtualMachine) subsystem handled MSI (Message Signaled Interrupts). A localunprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service orpotentially elevate privileges. (CVE-2012-2137)

7f3c45e4add9522b21165f402adea2a9075331b7.title: USN-1607-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7f3c45e4add9522b21165f402adea2a9075331b7.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel's KVM (Kernel-based VirtualMachine) subsystem handled MSI (Message Signaled Interrupts). A localunprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service orpotentially elevate privileges. (CVE-2012-2137)

caa832ed6851a9a6d36ca66ecb0b40edf70e17d0.title: USN-1606-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
caa832ed6851a9a6d36ca66ecb0b40edf70e17d0.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel's KVM (Kernel-based VirtualMachine) subsystem handled MSI (Message Signaled Interrupts). A localunprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service orpotentially elevate privileges. (CVE-2012-2137)

57130e541edacd1cf36a437cd71f9fab7102bda4.title: USN-1594-1: Linux kernel (Oneiric backport) vulnerabilities
57130e541edacd1cf36a437cd71f9fab7102bda4.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel's KVM (Kernel-based VirtualMachine) subsystem handled MSI (Message Signaled Interrupts). A localunprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service orpotentially elevate privileges. (CVE-2012-2137)

5497da02304a3f76acb4c48481033642df3dce00.title: USN-1609-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerability
5497da02304a3f76acb4c48481033642df3dce00.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel's KVM (Kernel-based VirtualMachine) subsystem handled MSI (Message Signaled Interrupts). A localunprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service orpotentially elevate privileges. (CVE-2012-2137)

7b16ec0332c6c48ddebfa0dee7bf8ec3a4978e1b.title: USN-1593-1: devscripts vulnerabilities
7b16ec0332c6c48ddebfa0dee7bf8ec3a4978e1b.body: Raphael Geissert discovered that the dscverify tool incorrectly escapedarguments to external commands. If a user or automated system were trickedinto processing specially crafted files, a remote attacher could possiblyexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2012-2240)

5596cb26497364ecf966bae75d3948cba63f1c78.title: USN-1593-1: devscripts vulnerabilities
5596cb26497364ecf966bae75d3948cba63f1c78.body: Raphael Geissert discovered that the dget tool incorrectly performed inputvalidation. If a user or automated system were tricked into processingspecially crafted files, a remote attacher could delete arbitrary files.(CVE-2012-2241)

6b7620fd9722ff5730dae0c5acc3723b7b382704.title: USN-1593-1: devscripts vulnerabilities
6b7620fd9722ff5730dae0c5acc3723b7b382704.body: Raphael Geissert discovered that the dget tool incorrectly escapedarguments to external commands. If a user or automated system were trickedinto processing specially crafted files, a remote attacher could possiblyexecute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS andUbuntu 11.04. (CVE-2012-2242)

05c99b5f4e527cd03b9f597bac8a6f3b6adac22e.title: USN-1481-1: PHP vulnerabilities
05c99b5f4e527cd03b9f597bac8a6f3b6adac22e.body: It was discovered that a Debian/Ubuntu specific patch caused PHP toincorrectly handle empty salt strings. A remote attacker could possibly usethis flaw to bypass authentication. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04LTS and Ubuntu 11.04. (CVE-2012-2317)

5716b478c4c8a143c72b40c3bd3c36438b3bec2b.title: USN-1535-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5716b478c4c8a143c72b40c3bd3c36438b3bec2b.body: An error was discovered in the Linux kernel's memory subsystem (hugetlb).An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial ofservice (crash the system). (CVE-2012-2390)

aa3722d271f116003f5874a2a8eb76d734a87d4e.title: USN-1515-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
aa3722d271f116003f5874a2a8eb76d734a87d4e.body: An error was discovered in the Linux kernel's memory subsystem (hugetlb).An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial ofservice (crash the system).

0c5a49795f57a167b6f7f102ad753801a4a8dd2e.title: USN-1466-1: Nova vulnerability
0c5a49795f57a167b6f7f102ad753801a4a8dd2e.body: It was discovered that, when defining security groups in Nova usingthe EC2 or OS APIs, specifying the network protocol (e.g. 'TCP') inthe incorrect case would cause the security group to not be appliedcorrectly. An attacker could use this to bypass Nova security grouprestrictions.

0639a577aa935cdc90142c63da52815573d8423a.title: USN-1536-1: LibreOffice vulnerability
0639a577aa935cdc90142c63da52815573d8423a.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled certain encryptiontags in Open Document Text (.odt) files. If a user were tricked intoopening a specially crafted file, an attacker could cause LibreOffice tocrash or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the userinvoking the program.

941cc9d1f33121dfbdb09bdf62e24db66fb10ed7.title: USN-1537-1: OpenOffice.org vulnerability
941cc9d1f33121dfbdb09bdf62e24db66fb10ed7.body: It was discovered that OpenOffice.org incorrectly handled certainencryption tags in Open Document Text (.odt) files. If a user were trickedinto opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could causeOpenOffice.org to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with theprivileges of the user invoking the program.

6163922d7357292509f7ca5d16e4f9cd3a0a6a1d.title: USN-1546-1: libgc vulnerability
6163922d7357292509f7ca5d16e4f9cd3a0a6a1d.body: It was discovered that multiple integer overflows existed in themalloc and calloc implementations in the Boehm-Demers-Weiser garbagecollecting memory allocator (libgc). These could allow an attackerto cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

8bea81ac259048c0da042430293f22ea2c555611.title: USN-1627-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
8bea81ac259048c0da042430293f22ea2c555611.body: It was discovered that the mod_negotiation module incorrectly handledcertain filenames, which could result in browsers becoming vulnerable tocross-site scripting attacks when processing the output. With cross-sitescripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing serveroutput during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploitthis to modify the contents, or steal confidential data (such aspasswords), within the same domain. (CVE-2012-2687)

1914a98ce051b2cf1ccc9b600a2787425531b9ea.title: USN-1637-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
1914a98ce051b2cf1ccc9b600a2787425531b9ea.body: It was discovered that the Apache Tomcat HTTP NIO connector incorrectlyhandled header data. A remote attacker could cause a denial of service bysending requests with a large amount of header data. (CVE-2012-2733)

03e39104a81cde57bb0985df4a367a3a04eabc04.title: USN-1567-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
03e39104a81cde57bb0985df4a367a3a04eabc04.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel passed the replacement sessionkeyring to a child process. An unprivileged local user could exploit thisflaw to cause a denial of service (panic). (CVE-2012-2745)

eda9765f6e87160810a33af58aa69e3df6f57d8e.title: USN-1606-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
eda9765f6e87160810a33af58aa69e3df6f57d8e.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel passed the replacement sessionkeyring to a child process. An unprivileged local user could exploit thisflaw to cause a denial of service (panic). (CVE-2012-2745)

1eec904cfce97dc7659858e1fcb26bbe0000f667.title: USN-1597-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerability
1eec904cfce97dc7659858e1fcb26bbe0000f667.body: A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel passed the replacement sessionkeyring to a child process. An unprivileged local user could exploit thisflaw to cause a denial of service (panic).

8f492f75e2c7289c703a8d578986a1ea63f1e538.title: USN-1705-1: Libav vulnerabilities
8f492f75e2c7289c703a8d578986a1ea63f1e538.body: It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformed mediafiles. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted media file, anattacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram.

20f6534b74e67be37d8022e33590be0ecd22661a.title: USN-1706-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
20f6534b74e67be37d8022e33590be0ecd22661a.body: It was discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain malformed mediafiles. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted media file, anattacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram.

3d3123cdce2bcd0abe370bb1f8c7901133ada573.title: USN-1587-1: libxml2 vulnerability
3d3123cdce2bcd0abe370bb1f8c7901133ada573.body: Juri Aedla discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled certain memoryoperations. If a user or application linked against libxml2 were trickedinto opening a specially crafted XML file, an attacker could cause theapplication to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking the program.

f1f684783b06b4a27adfdb61a78c847f993c2b0e.title: USN-1513-1: libexif vulnerabilities
f1f684783b06b4a27adfdb61a78c847f993c2b0e.body: Mateusz Jurczyk discovered that libexif incorrectly parsed certainmalformed EXIF tags. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a specially crafted image file, an attacker could cause libexifto crash, leading to a denial of service, or possibly obtain sensitiveinformation. (CVE-2012-2812, CVE-2012-2813)

0267c63ad9409da60d8fbf3ccd02ac5bc35c568f.title: USN-1513-1: libexif vulnerabilities
0267c63ad9409da60d8fbf3ccd02ac5bc35c568f.body: Mateusz Jurczyk discovered that libexif incorrectly parsed certainmalformed EXIF tags. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a specially crafted image file, an attacker could cause libexifto crash, leading to a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrarycode. (CVE-2012-2814)

1e95c69e4329f97cc027dc384c2ff6007d751845.title: USN-1513-1: libexif vulnerabilities
1e95c69e4329f97cc027dc384c2ff6007d751845.body: Yunho Kim discovered that libexif incorrectly parsed certain malformed EXIFtags. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing aspecially crafted image file, an attacker could cause libexif to crash,leading to a denial of service, or possibly obtain sensitive information.(CVE-2012-2836)

c0ed483611e06935711707ab714afc5334d0e864.title: USN-1513-1: libexif vulnerabilities
c0ed483611e06935711707ab714afc5334d0e864.body: Yunho Kim discovered that libexif incorrectly parsed certain malformed EXIFtags. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing aspecially crafted image file, an attacker could cause libexif to crash,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2012-2837)

c91a0c852898249d1cc3628efda0f9d100bec73c.title: USN-1513-1: libexif vulnerabilities
c91a0c852898249d1cc3628efda0f9d100bec73c.body: Dan Fandrich discovered that libexif incorrectly parsed certain malformedEXIF tags. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing aspecially crafted image file, an attacker could cause libexif to crash,leading to a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2012-2840, CVE-2012-2841)

2fe89e6dc2d17e3e6615820790ba1551442dae18.title: USN-1623-1: Mesa vulnerability
2fe89e6dc2d17e3e6615820790ba1551442dae18.body: It was discovered that Mesa incorrectly handled certain arrays. An attackercould use this issue to cause Mesa to crash, resulting in a denial ofservice, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

87e874627f0f3ea713c4326ae90f63b55a4982ac.title: USN-1800-1: HAProxy vulnerabilities
87e874627f0f3ea713c4326ae90f63b55a4982ac.body: It was discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled configurations whereglobal.tune.bufsize was set to a value higher than the default. A remoteattacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2012-2942)

b820367528e85a82734e97a4a1af9514421d3761.title: USN-1693-1: OpenJDK 7 vulnerabilities
b820367528e85a82734e97a4a1af9514421d3761.body: It was discovered that OpenJDK 7's security mechanism could be bypassed viaJava applets. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious website, aremote attacker could exploit this to perform arbitrary code execution asthe user invoking the program.

ae744208e22d4a8ad4af5a6bce2e08c48f282bc6.title: USN-1559-1: GIMP vulnerabilities
ae744208e22d4a8ad4af5a6bce2e08c48f282bc6.body: Joseph Sheridan discovered that GIMP incorrectly handled certain malformedheaders in FIT files. If a user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted FIT image file, an attacker could cause GIMP to crash.(CVE-2012-3236)

883533af0bd5bafa279ba4f640836718af2c86cd.title: USN-1503-1: Rhythmbox vulnerability
883533af0bd5bafa279ba4f640836718af2c86cd.body: Hans Spaans discovered that the Context plugin in Rhythmbox created atemporary directory in an insecure manner. A local attacker could exploitthis to execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program. TheContext plugin is disabled by default in Ubuntu.

37008b4a216daa5fd94daf0c0938aa3ce1062a02.title: USN-1497-1: Nova vulnerabilities
37008b4a216daa5fd94daf0c0938aa3ce1062a02.body: Matthias Weckbecker discovered that, when using the OpenStack API tosetup libvirt-based hypervisors, an authenticated user could injectfiles in arbitrary locations on the file system of the host runningNova. A remote attacker could use this to gain root privileges. Thisissue only affects Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-3360)

29628cb854de814f5c9c0953125f0d6c5c1c5250.title: USN-1497-1: Nova vulnerabilities
29628cb854de814f5c9c0953125f0d6c5c1c5250.body: Pádraig Brady discovered that an authenticated user could corruptarbitrary files of the host running Nova. A remote attacker coulduse this to cause a denial of service or possibly gain privileges.(CVE-2012-3361)

b5dd4121704405c2d9f5a25a73c76105a052b659.title: USN-1529-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b5dd4121704405c2d9f5a25a73c76105a052b659.body: Dan Rosenberg discovered flaws in the Linux kernel's NCI (Near FieldCommunication Controller Interface). A remote attacker could exploit theseflaws to crash the system or potentially execute privileged code.(CVE-2012-3364)

6be7ae9a1b95a03d3e6a607c0c28e65d3978dc86.title: USN-1501-1: Nova vulnerability
6be7ae9a1b95a03d3e6a607c0c28e65d3978dc86.body: Dan Prince discovered that the Nova scheduler, when usingDifferentHostFilter or SameHostFilter, would make repeated databaseinstance lookup calls based on passed scheduler hints. An authenticatedattacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

437fcc51d17617e2188a41405791f15c27e8175a.title: USN-1557-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
437fcc51d17617e2188a41405791f15c27e8175a.body: Some errors where discovered in the Linux kernel's UDF file system, whichis used to mount some CD-ROMs and DVDs. An unprivileged local user coulduse these flaws to crash the system.

3337467a99700f44665443f59e86e942febf93af.title: USN-1529-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3337467a99700f44665443f59e86e942febf93af.body: Some errors where discovered in the Linux kernel's UDF file system, whichis used to mount some CD-ROMs and DVDs. An unprivileged local user coulduse these flaws to crash the system. (CVE-2012-3400)

1c8045f6a2c6604d1d1da975e1036867a2b4d9c3.title: USN-1556-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
1c8045f6a2c6604d1d1da975e1036867a2b4d9c3.body: Some errors where discovered in the Linux kernel's UDF file system, whichis used to mount some CD-ROMs and DVDs. An unprivileged local user coulduse these flaws to crash the system. (CVE-2012-3400)

0cca9638d5419494ba8c02f9a1e55cf9fc92b1db.title: USN-1555-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
0cca9638d5419494ba8c02f9a1e55cf9fc92b1db.body: Some errors where discovered in the Linux kernel's UDF file system, whichis used to mount some CD-ROMs and DVDs. An unprivileged local user coulduse these flaws to crash the system. (CVE-2012-3400)

9af5363f4ceac4cc01d0a70cc37c6abd266609a6.title: USN-1511-1: tiff vulnerability
9af5363f4ceac4cc01d0a70cc37c6abd266609a6.body: Huzaifa Sidhpurwala discovered that the tiff2pdf utility incorrectlyhandled certain malformed TIFF images. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a specially crafted TIFF image, a remote attackercould crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with user privileges.

b23519f51460c958141fe83a7f0b5783c1275ba9.title: USN-1559-1: GIMP vulnerabilities
b23519f51460c958141fe83a7f0b5783c1275ba9.body: Murray McAllister discovered that GIMP incorrectly handled malformed KiSSpalette files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted KiSSpalette file, an attacker could cause GIMP to crash, or possibly executearbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2012-3403)

f5049d28954df8fc872311fa7ec7fc85916f61b0.title: USN-1589-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
f5049d28954df8fc872311fa7ec7fc85916f61b0.body: It was discovered that positional arguments to the printf() familyof functions were not handled properly in the GNU C Library. Anattacker could possibly use this to cause a stack-based bufferoverflow, creating a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode. (CVE-2012-3404, CVE-2012-3405, CVE-2012-3406)

02a402052ce04e8ad08ac90c4b53ff9a5f971d41.title: USN-1568-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
02a402052ce04e8ad08ac90c4b53ff9a5f971d41.body: Ben Hutchings reported a flaw in the Linux kernel with some network driversthat support TSO (TCP segment offload). A local or peer user could exploitthis flaw to to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2012-3412)

25a9f22edf2bc1604f794cd04086170550e377ce.title: USN-1580-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities

43c9b2e355abc7284d2052e1825824d8e3c37396.title: USN-1578-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities

33c99dc2801abe439d6a7aa0b2af1adfb1aeb425.title: USN-1521-1: IcedTea-Web vulnerabilities
33c99dc2801abe439d6a7aa0b2af1adfb1aeb425.body: Chamal De Silva discovered that the IcedTea-Web Java web browserplugin could dereference an uninitialized pointer. A remote attackercould use this to craft a malicious web page that could cause adenial of service by crashing the web browser or possibly executearbitrary code. (CVE-2012-3422)

701387a5b8ddde8882b7284b481afd6b0a5f437b.title: USN-1521-1: IcedTea-Web vulnerabilities
701387a5b8ddde8882b7284b481afd6b0a5f437b.body: Steven Bergom and others discovered that the IcedTea-Web Java webbrowser plugin assumed that all strings provided by browsers are NULLterminated, which is not guaranteed by the NPAPI (Netscape PluginApplication Programming Interface). A remote attacker could use thisto craft a malicious Java applet that could cause a denial of serviceby crashing the web browser, expose sensitive information or possiblyexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2012-3423)

42b1196ff454dcd9c43b800140598722751d5ce9.title: USN-2815-1: libpng vulnerabilities
42b1196ff454dcd9c43b800140598722751d5ce9.body: Mikulas Patocka discovered that libpng incorrectly handled certain largefields. If a user or automated system using libpng were tricked intoopening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit this to causelibpng to crash, leading to a denial of service. This issue only affectedUbuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-3425)

5bf628b86b1248399a499b6b5f86aaa9960c5e7d.title: USN-1552-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerabilities
5bf628b86b1248399a499b6b5f86aaa9960c5e7d.body: Derek Higgins discovered that OpenStack Keystone did not properlyimplement token expiration. A remote attacker could use this tocontinue to access an account that has been disabled or has a changedpassword. (CVE-2012-3426)

de9fc1bb2b6d44f040a50f8f46e4261201eb65d7.title: USN-1568-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
de9fc1bb2b6d44f040a50f8f46e4261201eb65d7.body: Jay Fenlason and Doug Ledford discovered a bug in the Linux kernelimplementation of RDS sockets. A local unprivileged user could potentiallyuse this flaw to read privileged information from the kernel.(CVE-2012-3430)

3bc9fa8e1d9581aa781f4bc491f69015bea70303.title: USN-1580-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
3bc9fa8e1d9581aa781f4bc491f69015bea70303.body: Jay Fenlason and Doug Ledford discovered a bug in the Linux kernelimplementation of RDS sockets. A local unprivileged user could potentiallyuse this flaw to read privileged information from the kernel.(CVE-2012-3430)

b04b2858401d2e87bd3285c9ce9d6dbf214fc23e.body: Jay Fenlason and Doug Ledford discovered a bug in the Linux kernelimplementation of RDS sockets. A local unprivileged user could potentiallyuse this flaw to read privileged information from the kernel.(CVE-2012-3430)

809884d016f982019c41c75506ebe22cd0d3564a.title: USN-1572-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
809884d016f982019c41c75506ebe22cd0d3564a.body: Jay Fenlason and Doug Ledford discovered a bug in the Linux kernelimplementation of RDS sockets. A local unprivileged user could potentiallyuse this flaw to read privileged information from the kernel.(CVE-2012-3430)

190adcf495b1cdee9bb09881879778eb1af4d822.body: Jay Fenlason and Doug Ledford discovered a bug in the Linux kernelimplementation of RDS sockets. A local unprivileged user could potentiallyuse this flaw to read privileged information from the kernel.(CVE-2012-3430)

5db5e975c9efbaf5d6b59098e9eabdc7af545201.title: USN-1577-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
5db5e975c9efbaf5d6b59098e9eabdc7af545201.body: Jay Fenlason and Doug Ledford discovered a bug in the Linux kernelimplementation of RDS sockets. A local unprivileged user could potentiallyuse this flaw to read privileged information from the kernel.(CVE-2012-3430)

0f528773fa1d874524670694d01c4b73d7bc7ec3.title: USN-1575-1: Linux kernel (Oneiric backport) vulnerabilities
0f528773fa1d874524670694d01c4b73d7bc7ec3.body: Jay Fenlason and Doug Ledford discovered a bug in the Linux kernelimplementation of RDS sockets. A local unprivileged user could potentiallyuse this flaw to read privileged information from the kernel.(CVE-2012-3430)

0bd2aaf10e8c859db9a4c360a875388537e4e509.title: USN-1578-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
0bd2aaf10e8c859db9a4c360a875388537e4e509.body: Jay Fenlason and Doug Ledford discovered a bug in the Linux kernelimplementation of RDS sockets. A local unprivileged user could potentiallyuse this flaw to read privileged information from the kernel.(CVE-2012-3430)

82fd64e323258c5141d2130e96a5cf17486130ab.title: USN-1560-1: Django vulnerabilities
82fd64e323258c5141d2130e96a5cf17486130ab.body: It was discovered that Django incorrectly validated the scheme of aredirect target. If a user were tricked into opening a specially craftedURL, an attacker could possibly exploit this to conduct cross-sitescripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2012-3442)

68e0d675c947621de00b76e2ebc95dc4166a8659.title: USN-1560-1: Django vulnerabilities
68e0d675c947621de00b76e2ebc95dc4166a8659.body: It was discovered that Django incorrectly handled validating certainimages. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause the server toconsume memory, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2012-3443)

edf162a5b161f0c1161062f786c985b522cbaf6a.title: USN-1560-1: Django vulnerabilities
edf162a5b161f0c1161062f786c985b522cbaf6a.body: Jeroen Dekkers discovered that Django incorrectly handled certain imagedimensions. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause the server toconsume resources, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2012-3444)

6e78043fb0db3da6cac6b38b7351cb7188ca0fee.title: USN-1526-1: KOffice vulnerability
6e78043fb0db3da6cac6b38b7351cb7188ca0fee.body: It was discovered that KOffice incorrectly handled certain malformedMS Word documents. If a user or automated system were tricked into openinga crafted MS Word file, an attacker could cause a denial of service orexecute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking the program.

991d87c0ae0a9623339dab5c9a1ef51f66a4cbfd.title: USN-1525-1: Calligra vulnerability
991d87c0ae0a9623339dab5c9a1ef51f66a4cbfd.body: It was discovered that Calligra incorrectly handled certain malformedMS Word documents. If a user or automated system were tricked into openinga crafted MS Word file, an attacker could cause a denial of service orexecute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking the program.

49bd0344146fd25548d6ea2c176de669bd965968.title: USN-1541-1: libotr vulnerability
49bd0344146fd25548d6ea2c176de669bd965968.body: Justin Ferguson discovered multiple heap overflows in libotr. A remoteattacker could use this to craft a malformed OTR message that couldcause a denial of service via application crash or possibly executearbitrary code.

5f5cc60ab22337cd423a49bbfd577b22894f051e.title: USN-1589-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
5f5cc60ab22337cd423a49bbfd577b22894f051e.body: It was discovered that multiple integer overflows existed in thestrtod(), strtof() and strtold() functions in the GNU C Library. Anattacker could possibly use this to trigger a stack-based bufferoverflow, creating a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrarycode. (CVE-2012-3480)

5235540313bf7da9648b982c7a4b9f3e9dc55479.title: USN-1559-1: GIMP vulnerabilities
5235540313bf7da9648b982c7a4b9f3e9dc55479.body: Matthias Weckbecker discovered that GIMP incorrectly handled malformed GIFimage files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted GIFimage file, an attacker could cause GIMP to crash, or possibly executearbitrary code with the user's privileges. (CVE-2012-3481)

d1cc1ff7f2c38dd62454a245bb113bf0313d9beb.title: USN-1542-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
d1cc1ff7f2c38dd62454a245bb113bf0313d9beb.body: Peter Eisentraut discovered that the XSLT functionality in the optionalXML2 extension would allow unprivileged database users to both read andwrite data with the privileges of the database server. (CVE-2012-3488)

3e357117ad0dcf768e205c0994771c874c0c2d36.title: USN-1542-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
3e357117ad0dcf768e205c0994771c874c0c2d36.body: Noah Misch and Tom Lane discovered that the XML functionality in theoptional XML2 extension would allow unprivileged database users toread data with the privileges of the database server. (CVE-2012-3489)

c1f48ad61f22baf9f36d47fab629834e9c857f45.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
c1f48ad61f22baf9f36d47fab629834e9c857f45.body: Sang Kil Cha discovered multiple integer overflows in the_objalloc_alloc function and objalloc_alloc macro in binutils. Thiscould allow an attacker to cause a denial of service (applicationcrash). This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 10.04 LTS.(CVE-2012-3509)

6193b93ecd9b21eb33c577132773d4da09d43946.title: USN-1622-1: Munin vulnerabilities
6193b93ecd9b21eb33c577132773d4da09d43946.body: It was discovered that Munin incorrectly handled plugin state filepermissions. An attacker obtaining privileges of the munin user could usethis issue to escalate privileges to root. (CVE-2012-3512)

db26efaca883848d05ec4bd55aebeb4c71a48bfc.title: USN-1622-1: Munin vulnerabilities
db26efaca883848d05ec4bd55aebeb4c71a48bfc.body: It was discovered that Munin incorrectly handled specifying an alternateconfiguration file. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue toexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the web server. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 12.10. (CVE-2012-3513)

fc887e83062a24c5cf2aedd69e330af99a6a388c.title: USN-1590-1: QEMU vulnerability
fc887e83062a24c5cf2aedd69e330af99a6a388c.body: It was discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled certain VT100 escapesequences. A guest user with access to an emulated character device coulduse this flaw to cause QEMU to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code onthe host.

7efd862c3d30db61df746603a6e385caf0599885.title: USN-1610-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
7efd862c3d30db61df746603a6e385caf0599885.body: Pablo Neira Ayuso discovered a flaw in the credentials of netlink messages.An unprivileged local attacker could exploit this by getting a netlinkbased service, that relies on netlink credentials, to perform privilegedactions. (CVE-2012-3520)

8b3de5b824a8426890bd10ee90e6fbca635eef9f.title: USN-1599-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerability
8b3de5b824a8426890bd10ee90e6fbca635eef9f.body: Pablo Neira Ayuso discovered a flaw in the credentials of netlink messages.An unprivileged local attacker could exploit this by getting a netlinkbased service, that relies on netlink credentials, to perform privilegedactions. (CVE-2012-3520)

a12b9d6c79efba13ba74a7b6628fe9ebf0b6509d.title: USN-1576-2: DBus regressions
a12b9d6c79efba13ba74a7b6628fe9ebf0b6509d.body: USN-1576-1 fixed vulnerabilities in DBus. The update caused a regressionfor certain services launched from the activation helper, and caused anunclean shutdown on upgrade. This update fixes the problem.We apologize for the inconvenience.Original advisory details:Sebastian Krahmer discovered that DBus incorrectly handled environment variables when running with elevated privileges. A local attacker could possibly exploit this flaw with a setuid binary and gain root privileges.

358fd5eea92e35a31fdd301104d4ab222994c0b1.title: USN-1576-1: DBus vulnerability
358fd5eea92e35a31fdd301104d4ab222994c0b1.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that DBus incorrectly handled environmentvariables when running with elevated privileges. A local attacker couldpossibly exploit this flaw with a setuid binary and gain root privileges.

56c2cee8ce097a023434725408c1399812f5aaf9.title: USN-1565-1: OpenStack Horizon vulnerability
56c2cee8ce097a023434725408c1399812f5aaf9.body: Thomas Biege discovered that the Horizon authentication mechanismdid not validate the next parameter. An attacker could use this toconstruct a link to legitimate OpenStack web dashboard that redirectedthe user to a malicious website after authentication.

63585d9f45a784df6c0a9354d39ed8fe59fdbe85.title: USN-1552-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerabilities
63585d9f45a784df6c0a9354d39ed8fe59fdbe85.body: Dolph Mathews discovered that OpenStack Keystone did not properlyrestrict to administrative users the ability to update users'tenants. A remote attacker that can reach the administrative API canuse this to add any user to any tenant. (CVE-2012-3542)

09ede42977bae2ecb4a3a398c3ef51c554ae7e5b.title: USN-2547-1: Mono vulnerabilities
09ede42977bae2ecb4a3a398c3ef51c554ae7e5b.body: It was discovered that Mono incorrectly handled hash collisions. A remoteattacker could possibly use this issue to cause Mono to crash, resulting ina denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS.(CVE-2012-3543)

cfcc416a613572b67a1e8d1d4d976646bf05ed66.title: USN-1841-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
cfcc416a613572b67a1e8d1d4d976646bf05ed66.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled certain requestssubmitted using chunked transfer encoding. A remote attacker could use thisflaw to cause the Tomcat server to stop responding, resulting in a denialof service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS and Ubuntu 12.04 LTS.(CVE-2012-3544)

2a1867c076ef2b2ff8ca73f31c669c2d1c6f7868.title: USN-1685-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
2a1867c076ef2b2ff8ca73f31c669c2d1c6f7868.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly performed certain securityconstraint checks in the FORM authenticator. A remote attacker couldpossibly use this flaw with a specially-crafted URI to bypass securityconstraint checks. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 11.10and Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-3546)

ede5501aa332505dab6e3d9d436a3e8f907b9d1d.title: USN-1585-1: FreeRADIUS vulnerability
ede5501aa332505dab6e3d9d436a3e8f907b9d1d.body: Timo Warns discovered that FreeRADIUS incorrectly handled certain longtimestamps in client certificates. A remote attacker could exploit thisflaw and cause the FreeRADIUS server to crash, resulting in a denial ofservice, or possibly execute arbitrary code.The default compiler options for affected releases should reduce thevulnerability to a denial of service.

2416d4198e9cac79115181acd8daa9fce19ddb2e.title: USN-1519-1: DHCP vulnerabilities
2416d4198e9cac79115181acd8daa9fce19ddb2e.body: Markus Hietava discovered that the DHCP server incorrectly handled certainmalformed client identifiers. A remote attacker could use this issue tocause DHCP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2012-3571)

2aac6da98a015e663eb99118b524c8ab39281ba8.title: USN-1518-1: Bind vulnerability
2aac6da98a015e663eb99118b524c8ab39281ba8.body: Einar Lonn discovered that Bind incorrectly initialized the failing-querycache. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause Bind to crash,resulting in a denial of service.

f7725eee64416c5a135f384bf388e27ef4bef29c.title: USN-1506-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
f7725eee64416c5a135f384bf388e27ef4bef29c.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled certain HTTP GETrequests. An attacker could use this flaw with a valid client certificateto retrieve arbitrary files from the Puppet master. (CVE-2012-3864)

029ed2cf1f993ef1d76b428a8d6059218866216e.title: USN-1506-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
029ed2cf1f993ef1d76b428a8d6059218866216e.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled Delete requests. If aPuppet master were reconfigured to allow the "Delete" method, an attackeron an authenticated host could use this flaw to delete arbitrary files fromthe Puppet server, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2012-3865)

9c4296c88a8d1b3e2d477075431a4d40b105dd61.title: USN-1506-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
9c4296c88a8d1b3e2d477075431a4d40b105dd61.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly set file permissions on thelast_run_report.yaml file. An attacker could use this flaw to accesssensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 11.10 and Ubuntu12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-3866)

a9eb3f329aa80ce8e15a38e7cac0d66feff51e43.title: USN-1506-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
a9eb3f329aa80ce8e15a38e7cac0d66feff51e43.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled agent certificate names.An attacker could use this flaw to create a specially crafted certificateand trick an administrator into signing a certificate that can then be usedto man-in-the-middle agent nodes. (CVE-2012-3867)

5f428df0c1c0c5da2b3b9a125686df7edf4a53f4.title: USN-1519-1: DHCP vulnerabilities
5f428df0c1c0c5da2b3b9a125686df7edf4a53f4.body: Glen Eustace discovered that the DHCP server incorrectly handled memory. Aremote attacker could use this issue to cause DHCP to crash, resulting in adenial of service. (CVE-2012-3954)

78b0e3060243d4c1a106615668310527ef28295e.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
78b0e3060243d4c1a106615668310527ef28295e.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered an escalation of privilege vulnerability through about:newtab. This could possibly lead to potentially code execution with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3965)

09fe7aaf73ce5b4c6be49f7e3e4b1550954dd77e.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
09fe7aaf73ce5b4c6be49f7e3e4b1550954dd77e.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered an escalation of privilege vulnerability throughabout:newtab. This could possibly lead to potentially code execution withthe privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3965)

cb4da2233ab657c8292719e795131a4dc3baed2a.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
cb4da2233ab657c8292719e795131a4dc3baed2a.body: Frédéric Hoguin discovered that bitmap format images with a negative height could potentially result in memory corruption. If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3966)

d21cb3efc4f331d20d1ebb8b50a3f94e18fc7b9e.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d21cb3efc4f331d20d1ebb8b50a3f94e18fc7b9e.body: Frédéric Hoguin discovered that bitmap format images with a negative heightcould potentially result in memory corruption. If the user were trickedinto opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploitthis to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentiallyexecute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.(CVE-2012-3966)

e4bd60cb4f35a23d6fde2dcae6563bc605686b4d.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
e4bd60cb4f35a23d6fde2dcae6563bc605686b4d.body: It was discovered that Firefox's WebGL implementation was vulnerable to multiple memory safety issues. If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3967, CVE-2012-3968)

b10b3d2686bfd3f9a99b687e9b63720947b69108.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
b10b3d2686bfd3f9a99b687e9b63720947b69108.body: It was discovered that Firefox's WebGL implementation was vulnerable tomultiple memory safety issues. If the user were tricked into opening aspecially crafted page, an attacker could exploit these to cause a denialof service via application crash, or potentially execute code with theprivileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3967, CVE-2012-3968)

53a8f1bdb8d4fc60e750724fcff9a04f52907479.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
53a8f1bdb8d4fc60e750724fcff9a04f52907479.body: Arthur Gerkis discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox's Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) implementation. If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3969, CVE-2012-3970)

a74f6873b4ae5a73463bdc7586b0be5f5920cf6f.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a74f6873b4ae5a73463bdc7586b0be5f5920cf6f.body: Arthur Gerkis discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox'sScalable Vector Graphics (SVG) implementation. If the user were trickedinto opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit these tocause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially executecode with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3969,CVE-2012-3970)

6c264c07fa1a08d0fd7ea77b07318a1b52068828.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
6c264c07fa1a08d0fd7ea77b07318a1b52068828.body: Christoph Diehl discovered multiple memory safety issues in the bundled Graphite 2 library. If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3971)

96f217df1cb78c514aff5c45a9cb507e4c33cd4f.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
96f217df1cb78c514aff5c45a9cb507e4c33cd4f.body: Christoph Diehl discovered multiple memory safety issues in the bundledGraphite 2 library. If the user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted page, an attacker could exploit these to cause a denial of servicevia application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges ofthe user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3971)

7e982e12f13dba771c2941444e501985102bf726.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
7e982e12f13dba771c2941444e501985102bf726.body: Nicolas Grégoire discovered an out-of-bounds read in the format-number feature of XSLT. This could potentially cause inaccurate formatting of numbers and information leakage. (CVE-2012-3972)

6b66cc86e7567529f674c344ef7dfc98d3575c7b.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
6b66cc86e7567529f674c344ef7dfc98d3575c7b.body: Nicolas Grégoire discovered an out-of-bounds read in the format-numberfeature of XSLT. This could potentially cause inaccurate formatting ofnumbers and information leakage. (CVE-2012-3972)

f7da32c0530b8b730de9bf61c31ea08432305d67.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
f7da32c0530b8b730de9bf61c31ea08432305d67.body: Mark Goodwin discovered that under certain circumstances, Firefox's developer tools could allow remote debugging even when disabled. (CVE-2012-3973)

e8041fb2c6c5f523c7bf3e2e36c0dc143fcd3fa6.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
e8041fb2c6c5f523c7bf3e2e36c0dc143fcd3fa6.body: Mark Goodwin discovered that under certain circumstances, Firefox'sdeveloper tools could allow remote debugging even when disabled.(CVE-2012-3973)

d5514182d832b0b3b4083a19c76ac726d3e88486.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
d5514182d832b0b3b4083a19c76ac726d3e88486.body: It was discovered that when the DOMParser is used to parse text/html data in a Firefox extension, linked resources within this HTML data will be loaded. If the data being parsed in the extension is untrusted, it could lead to information leakage and potentially be combined with other attacks to become exploitable. (CVE-2012-3975)

c602e458204b6559ad285083d1d5fbb078fb5128.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
c602e458204b6559ad285083d1d5fbb078fb5128.body: It was discovered that when the DOMParser is used to parse text/html datain a Firefox extension, linked resources within this HTML data will beloaded. If the data being parsed in the extension is untrusted, it couldlead to information leakage and potentially be combined with other attacksto become exploitable. (CVE-2012-3975)

93c77ea85fec329a01b1a9304478b3d602a486ef.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
93c77ea85fec329a01b1a9304478b3d602a486ef.body: Mark Poticha discovered that under certain circumstances incorrect SSL certificate information can be displayed on the addressbar, showing the SSL data for a previous site while another has been loaded. This could potentially be used for phishing attacks. (CVE-2012-3976)

9665308724e4db1be3085a8fe47e250fc1c46de0.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
9665308724e4db1be3085a8fe47e250fc1c46de0.body: Mark Poticha discovered that under certain circumstances incorrect SSLcertificate information can be displayed on the addressbar, showing the SSLdata for a previous site while another has been loaded. This couldpotentially be used for phishing attacks. (CVE-2012-3976)

46f23aca38cf97a76cbd096a7323db7fc7ca6345.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
46f23aca38cf97a76cbd096a7323db7fc7ca6345.body: It was discovered that, in some instances, certain security checks in the location object could be bypassed. This could allow for the loading of restricted content and can potentially be combined with other issues to become exploitable. (CVE-2012-3978)

d5288b3218a381823372ff21d697ac2fa86f64bf.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d5288b3218a381823372ff21d697ac2fa86f64bf.body: It was discovered that, in some instances, certain security checks in thelocation object could be bypassed. This could allow for the loading ofrestricted content and can potentially be combined with other issues tobecome exploitable. (CVE-2012-3978)

7b7b7b8f75dfe6f0f4ccc7dd011469fee870ac2a.title: USN-1548-2: Firefox regression
7b7b7b8f75dfe6f0f4ccc7dd011469fee870ac2a.body: Colby Russell discovered that eval in the web console can execute injected code with chrome privileges, leading to the running of malicious code in a privileged context. If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3980)

dd6590c24337e2fc3a6263816d1fda7fc3de961f.title: USN-1548-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
dd6590c24337e2fc3a6263816d1fda7fc3de961f.body: Colby Russell discovered that eval in the web console can execute injectedcode with chrome privileges, leading to the running of malicious code in aprivileged context. If the user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted page, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of servicevia application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges ofthe user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2012-3980)

14368e09f050468fe96bc6edbc8fc55ad828c02c.title: USN-1611-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
14368e09f050468fe96bc6edbc8fc55ad828c02c.body: Henrik Skupin, Jesse Ruderman, Christian Holler, Soroush Dalili and othersdiscovered several memory corruption flaws in Thunderbird. If a user weretricked into opening a malicious website and had JavaScript enabled, anattacker could exploit these to execute arbitrary JavaScript code withinthe context of another website or arbitrary code as the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2012-3982, CVE-2012-3983, CVE-2012-3988, CVE-2012-3989,CVE-2012-4191)

3ccd4801684e7bf58ec961ded4615b036292ac98.title: USN-1611-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
3ccd4801684e7bf58ec961ded4615b036292ac98.body: David Bloom and Jordi Chancel discovered that Thunderbird did not alwaysproperly handle the element. If a user were tricked into opening amalicious website and had JavaScript enabled, a remote attacker couldexploit this to conduct URL spoofing and clickjacking attacks.(CVE-2012-3984)Collin Jackson discovered that Thunderbird did not properly follow theHTML5 specification for document.domain behavior. If a user were trickedinto opening a malicious website and had JavaScript enabled, a remoteattacker could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacksvia JavaScript execution. (CVE-2012-3985)Johnny Stenback discovered that Thunderbird did not properly performsecurity checks on test methods for DOMWindowUtils. (CVE-2012-3986)Alice White discovered that the security checks for GetProperty could bebypassed when using JSAPI. If a user were tricked into opening a speciallycrafted web page and had JavaScript enabled, a remote attacker couldexploit this to execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.(CVE-2012-3991)Mariusz Mlynski discovered a history state error in Thunderbird. If a userwere tricked into opening a malicious website and had JavaScript enabled, aremote attacker could exploit this to spoof the location property to injectscript or intercept posted data. (CVE-2012-3992)Mariusz Mlynski and others discovered several flaws in Thunderbird thatallowed a remote attacker to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked intoviewing a specially crafted page and had JavaScript enabled, a remoteattacker could exploit these to modify the contents, or steal confidentialdata, within the same domain. (CVE-2012-3993, CVE-2012-3994, CVE-2012-4184)Abhishek Arya, Atte Kettunen and others discovered several memory flaws inThunderbird when using the Address Sanitizer tool. If a user were trickedinto opening a malicious website and had JavaScript enabled, an attackercould exploit these to execute arbitrary JavaScript code within the contextof another website or execute arbitrary code as the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2012-3990, CVE-2012-3995, CVE-2012-4179, CVE-2012-4180,CVE-2012-4181, CVE-2012-4182, CVE-2012-4183, CVE-2012-4185, CVE-2012-4186,CVE-2012-4187, CVE-2012-4188)It was discovered that Thunderbird allowed improper access to the Locationobject. An attacker could exploit this to obtain sensitive information.Under certain circumstances, a remote attacker could use this vulnerabilityto potentially execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program.(CVE-2012-4192, CVE-2012-4193) Update instructions The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 12.04 thunderbird - 16.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.12.04.1 Ubuntu 11.10 thunderbird - 16.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.11.10.1 Ubuntu 11.04 thunderbird - 16.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.11.04.1 Ubuntu 10.04 thunderbird - 16.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.10.04.1 After a standard system update you need to restart Thunderbird to makeall the necessary changes. de112c10f09777f59224c65061341d0ff7204d67.body: It was discovered that the evalInSandbox function's JavaScript sandboxcontext could be circumvented. An attacker could exploit this to perform across-site scripting (XSS) attack or steal a copy of a local file if theuser has installed an add-on vulnerable to this attack. With cross-sitescripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing a speciallycrafted page, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents,or steal confidential data, within the same domain. (CVE-2012-4201)

1cd7d305b04e16eb6f027785205ccb02b6e27d31.title: USN-1638-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
1cd7d305b04e16eb6f027785205ccb02b6e27d31.body: Masato Kinugawa discovered that when HZ-GB-2312 charset encoding is usedfor text, the "~" character will destroy another character near the chunkdelimiter. This can lead to a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack in pagesencoded in HZ-GB-2312. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a userwere tricked into viewing a specially crafted page, a remote attacker couldexploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, withinthe same domain. (CVE-2012-4207)
