(CVE-2012-4209)

482c159ac9386e6e332c166bf10c6ab4272ca979.title: USN-1636-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
482c159ac9386e6e332c166bf10c6ab4272ca979.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that the location property can be accessed bybinary plugins through top.location with a frame whose name attribute'svalue is set to "top". This can allow for possible cross-site scripting(XSS) attacks through plugins. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities,if a user were tricked into viewing a specially crafted page and hadJavaScript enabled, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify thecontents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain.(CVE-2012-4209)

876a914b2f2f2c7449e383f756ee8beee57773a1.title: USN-1638-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
876a914b2f2f2c7449e383f756ee8beee57773a1.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that when a maliciously crafted stylesheet isinspected in the Style Inspector, HTML and CSS can run in a chromeprivileged context without being properly sanitized first. If a user weretricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could executearbitrary code with the privliges of the user invoking the program.(CVE-2012-4210)

b8b6f179b98dc9a6e4f2179a0eade34060fdf89f.title: USN-1638-3: Firefox regressions
b8b6f179b98dc9a6e4f2179a0eade34060fdf89f.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that when a maliciously crafted stylesheet is inspected in the Style Inspector, HTML and CSS can run in a chrome privileged context without being properly sanitized first. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privliges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2012-4210)

59233124b173aa56164108f8f8de4f1153f85967.title: USN-1638-2: ubufox update
59233124b173aa56164108f8f8de4f1153f85967.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that when a maliciously crafted stylesheet is inspected in the Style Inspector, HTML and CSS can run in a chrome privileged context without being properly sanitized first. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious web page, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privliges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2012-4210)

5801556dce87b2e3d2807f5d569a04ea1bdc2c2c.title: USN-1638-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
5801556dce87b2e3d2807f5d569a04ea1bdc2c2c.body: Abhishek Arya discovered multiple use-after-free and buffer overflow issuesin Firefox. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious page, anattacker could exploit these to execute arbitrary code as the user invokingthe program. (CVE-2012-4214, CVE-2012-4215, CVE-2012-4216, CVE-2012-5829,CVE-2012-5839, CVE-2012-5840, CVE-2012-4212, CVE-2012-4213, CVE-2012-4217,CVE-2012-4218)

734f8779e9baf68a14caedc02d46e72d86cb9006.title: USN-1638-3: Firefox regressions
734f8779e9baf68a14caedc02d46e72d86cb9006.body: Abhishek Arya discovered multiple use-after-free and buffer overflow issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious page, an attacker could exploit these to execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program. (CVE-2012-4214, CVE-2012-4215, CVE-2012-4216, CVE-2012-5829, CVE-2012-5839, CVE-2012-5840, CVE-2012-4212, CVE-2012-4213, CVE-2012-4217, CVE-2012-4218)

ebc8c799be5ea4868fce536a3e3f1073a1efc925.title: USN-1638-2: ubufox update
ebc8c799be5ea4868fce536a3e3f1073a1efc925.body: Abhishek Arya discovered multiple use-after-free and buffer overflow issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious page, an attacker could exploit these to execute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program. (CVE-2012-4214, CVE-2012-4215, CVE-2012-4216, CVE-2012-5829, CVE-2012-5839, CVE-2012-5840, CVE-2012-4212, CVE-2012-4213, CVE-2012-4217, CVE-2012-4218)

946a4152e8b2b2e688c4e83d4873070fa6000b49.title: USN-1636-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
946a4152e8b2b2e688c4e83d4873070fa6000b49.body: Abhishek Arya discovered multiple use-after-free and buffer overflow issuesin Thunderbird. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious website andhad JavaScript enabled, an attacker could exploit these to executearbitrary JavaScript code within the context of another website orarbitrary code as the user invoking the program. (CVE-2012-4214,CVE-2012-4215, CVE-2012-4216, CVE-2012-5829, CVE-2012-5839, CVE-2012-5840,CVE-2012-4212, CVE-2012-4213, CVE-2012-4217, CVE-2012-4218)

7bb553f838a53dd1b921feaeb17abcc08e8297f8.title: USN-1604-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
7bb553f838a53dd1b921feaeb17abcc08e8297f8.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin incorrectly handled group names thatcontain virtual group names such as "All", "Known" or "Trusted". This couldresult in a remote user having incorrect permissions. (CVE-2012-4404)

e95bda2d07e402b4117827235e9463e1c2650b50.title: USN-1581-1: Ghostscript vulnerability
e95bda2d07e402b4117827235e9463e1c2650b50.body: Marc Schönefeld discovered that Ghostscript did not correctly handlecertain image files. If a user or automated system were tricked intoopening a specially crafted file, an attacker could cause a denial ofservice and possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

7a8581b7784eb258a1eaf0f22d59c01c83a8b049.title: USN-1991-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
7a8581b7784eb258a1eaf0f22d59c01c83a8b049.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled the strcoll()function. An attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, orpossibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2012-4412, CVE-2012-4424)

86038716d63b40b0d767e24f31088883ee1ae84e.title: USN-1564-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerability
86038716d63b40b0d767e24f31088883ee1ae84e.body: Dolph Mathews discovered that when roles are granted and revoked tousers in Keystone, pre-existing tokens were not updated or invalidatedto take the new roles into account. An attacker could use this tocontinue to access resources that have been revoked.

46d6a6084ed9454f604d9f69311d9256cd6e2396.title: USN-2730-1: OpenSLP vulnerabilities
46d6a6084ed9454f604d9f69311d9256cd6e2396.body: Georgi Geshev discovered that OpenSLP incorrectly handled processingcertain service requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issueto cause OpenSLP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-4428)

17c778ba9adda62fc6178474c289f2d0e449c550.title: USN-1701-1: Vino vulnerability
17c778ba9adda62fc6178474c289f2d0e449c550.body: It was discovered that Vino incorrectly transmitted clipboard activitybefore authenticating the remote connection. A remote attacker couldconnect to Vino and monitor clipboard activity.

5b3f95ec177b3a9cf2ef57fc771172c45b4f8613.title: USN-1685-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
5b3f95ec177b3a9cf2ef57fc771172c45b4f8613.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled requests that lack asession identifier. A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw tobypass the cross-site request forgery protection. (CVE-2012-4431)

1270e3c7acd1fe2b32b435630a448381e31a1cb5.title: USN-1631-1: LibTIFF vulnerabilities
1270e3c7acd1fe2b32b435630a448381e31a1cb5.body: It was discovered that LibTIFF incorrectly handled certain malformed imagesusing the PixarLog compression format. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a specially crafted TIFF image, a remote attackercould crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2012-4447)

fe503e4acea129afc1e87f84b2de824c282a2649.title: USN-1629-1: libproxy vulnerabilities
fe503e4acea129afc1e87f84b2de824c282a2649.body: Tomas Mraz discovered that libproxy incorrectly handled certain PAC files.A remote attacker could use this issue to cause libproxy to crash, or topossibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2012-4504, CVE-2012-4505)

8e3ff815325fd53d2d13d3c72b0c6fc6b3a741cc.title: USN-1632-1: Django vulnerability
8e3ff815325fd53d2d13d3c72b0c6fc6b3a741cc.body: James Kettle discovered Django did not properly filter the Host HTTP headerwhen processing certain requests. An attacker could exploit this togenerate and display arbitrary URLs to users.

732fbcaf389914107b3fa100e21f664ae83445ad.title: USN-1757-1: Django vulnerabilities
732fbcaf389914107b3fa100e21f664ae83445ad.body: James Kettle discovered that Django did not properly filter the Host HTTPheader when processing certain requests. An attacker could exploit this togenerate and display arbitrary URLs to users. Although this issue had beenpreviously addressed in USN-1632-1, this update adds additional hardeningmeasures to host header validation. This update also adds a newALLOWED_HOSTS setting that can be set to a list of acceptable values forheaders. (CVE-2012-4520)

2d1f3b0dc39dd24cbac37bd3da3f2ef2d2b1ee28.title: USN-1685-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
2d1f3b0dc39dd24cbac37bd3da3f2ef2d2b1ee28.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled sendfile and HTTPS whenthe NIO connector is used. A remote attacker could use this flaw to causeTomcat to stop responsing, resulting in a denial of service. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 11.10 and Ubuntu 12.04 LTS.(CVE-2012-4534)

1cc8000ce05eab025b1a902fd26a48a9963ba1b7.title: USN-1625-1: Icedtea-Web vulnerability
1cc8000ce05eab025b1a902fd26a48a9963ba1b7.body: Arthur Gerkis discovered a buffer overflow in the Icedtea-Web plugin. If auser were tricked into opening a malicious website, an attacker couldcause the plugin to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code as the userinvoking the program.

3ea7fccfd0f98e94e2aa0948d4df16c84ee04f55.title: USN-1635-1: libunity-webapps vulnerability
3ea7fccfd0f98e94e2aa0948d4df16c84ee04f55.body: It was discovered that libunity-webapps improperly handled certain hashtables. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause libunity-webappsto crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

a505cb556bd319b91a820176dd5016350a7adcdd.title: USN-1640-1: libssh vulnerabilities
a505cb556bd319b91a820176dd5016350a7adcdd.body: Xi Wang and Florian Weimer discovered that libssh incorrectly handledmemory. A remote attacker could use this to cause libssh to crash,resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2012-4559, CVE-2012-4560, CVE-2012-4561, CVE-2012-4562)

8ad2a713160bfa77f9a098616388c9f0afc2e97d.title: USN-1648-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8ad2a713160bfa77f9a098616388c9f0afc2e97d.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service. (CVE-2012-4565)

f27133100cda309d8f59d26bd7cc7afa3dcbc681.title: USN-1644-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f27133100cda309d8f59d26bd7cc7afa3dcbc681.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service. (CVE-2012-4565)

4dbd8417f219ad3067f956ba9bd6f7ad4cbbea02.title: USN-1647-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
4dbd8417f219ad3067f956ba9bd6f7ad4cbbea02.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service. (CVE-2012-4565)

34885ed6e17cb1977d551ef09369340413eada1f.title: USN-1649-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
34885ed6e17cb1977d551ef09369340413eada1f.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service. (CVE-2012-4565)

b59ec4f92a0379093ee1d32d566f8fad62d35a3a.title: USN-1646-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b59ec4f92a0379093ee1d32d566f8fad62d35a3a.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service. (CVE-2012-4565)

2384ac0828bf8cc8df7bdc693e92bcd440856bd9.title: USN-1645-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
2384ac0828bf8cc8df7bdc693e92bcd440856bd9.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service. (CVE-2012-4565)

4cd6996ac9304d4be07f0ce7c7c59d221ed21b68.title: USN-1652-1: Linux kernel (Oneiric backport) vulnerabilities
4cd6996ac9304d4be07f0ce7c7c59d221ed21b68.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service. (CVE-2012-4565)

6f2e65ae98d9afe5884de9a8fde6fe07a3e0bfa9.title: USN-1651-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
6f2e65ae98d9afe5884de9a8fde6fe07a3e0bfa9.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service. (CVE-2012-4565)

e338591c0bd66d77cd82b71340e84a10a36fe226.title: USN-1650-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
e338591c0bd66d77cd82b71340e84a10a36fe226.body: Rodrigo Freire discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's TCP illinoiscongestion control algorithm. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service.

fcbf09e1770142b5640e41dcff604d8205f6e1d4.title: USN-1634-1: Python Keyring vulnerabilities
fcbf09e1770142b5640e41dcff604d8205f6e1d4.body: Dwayne Litzenberger discovered that Python Keyring's CryptedFileKeyringfile format used weak cryptography. A local attacker may use this issue tobrute-force CryptedFileKeyring keyring files. This issue only affectedUbuntu 11.10 and Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-4571)

d60027ed719ea6235677f929d882a95a67aaa1f5.title: USN-1626-1: Glance vulnerability
d60027ed719ea6235677f929d882a95a67aaa1f5.body: Gabe Westmaas discovered that Glance did not always properly enforce accesscontrols when deleting images. An authenticated user could delete arbitraryimages by using the v1 API under certain circumstances.

4ed415f995b27691cee105d92e0ae557daf689e6.title: USN-1626-2: Glance vulnerability
4ed415f995b27691cee105d92e0ae557daf689e6.body: USN-1626-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the v1 API of Glance. This updateprovides the corresponding updates for the v2 API.Original advisory details:Gabe Westmaas discovered that Glance did not always properly enforce access controls when deleting images. An authenticated user could delete arbitrary images by using the v1 API under certain circumstances.

8e252d859cbc1b3579ef86406301fa3be9579dd1.title: USN-1628-1: Qt vulnerability
8e252d859cbc1b3579ef86406301fa3be9579dd1.body: Juliano Rizzo and Thai Duong discovered a flaw in the Transport LayerSecurity (TLS) protocol when it is used with data compression. If anattacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flawcould be exploited to view sensitive information. This update disablesTLS data compression in Qt by default.

b777552ebbfaad7cef2aac777513691ee0205117.title: USN-1627-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
b777552ebbfaad7cef2aac777513691ee0205117.body: It was discovered that the Apache HTTP Server was vulnerable to the "CRIME"SSL data compression attack. Although this issue had been mitigated on theclient with newer web browsers, this update also disables SSL datacompression on the server. A new SSLCompression directive for Apache hasbeen backported that may be used to re-enable SSL data compression incertain environments. For more information, please refer to:http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_ssl.html#sslcompression(CVE-2012-4929)

417e6554dd78f1c9b881e790359919d5536106f2.title: USN-1898-1: OpenSSL vulnerability
417e6554dd78f1c9b881e790359919d5536106f2.body: The TLS protocol 1.2 and earlier can encrypt compressed data withoutproperly obfuscating the length of the unencrypted data, which allowsman-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext content by observinglength differences during a series of guesses in which a provided stringpotentially matches an unknown string in encrypted and compressed traffic.This is known as a CRIME attack in HTTP. Other protocols layered on top ofTLS may also make these attacks practical.This update disables compression for all programs using SSL and TLSprovided by the OpenSSL library. To re-enable compression for programsthat need compression to communicate with legacy services, define thevariable OPENSSL_DEFAULT_ZLIB in the program's environment.

9e5022261874dc8841f9e0e21a075acd89f30185.title: USN-1818-1: Mesa vulnerability
9e5022261874dc8841f9e0e21a075acd89f30185.body: It was discovered that Mesa incorrectly handled certain arrays. An attackercould use this issue to cause Mesa to crash, resulting in a denial ofservice, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

45aea720b07379038cf5cea1729c408d600999e8.title: USN-1656-1: Libxml2 vulnerability
45aea720b07379038cf5cea1729c408d600999e8.body: It was discovered that libxml2 had a heap-based buffer underflowwhen parsing entities. If a user or automated system were tricked intoprocessing a specially crafted XML document, applications linked againstlibxml2 could be made to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.

a655a39701db365c306beb9c8f69102a6939bd99.title: USN-1643-1: Perl vulnerabilities
a655a39701db365c306beb9c8f69102a6939bd99.body: It was discovered that Perl's 'x' string repeat operator is vulnerableto a heap-based buffer overflow. An attacker could use this to executearbitrary code. (CVE-2012-5195)

d7f3727fcddced785d2a0471fd8885fd3bef864b.title: USN-1588-1: Software Properties vulnerability
d7f3727fcddced785d2a0471fd8885fd3bef864b.body: It was discovered that the apt-add-repository tool incorrectly validatedPPA GPG keys when importing from a keyserver. If a remote attacker wereable to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited toinstall altered package repository GPG keys.

df36d143ee89e12a881e80683191e409e78ba94c.title: USN-1733-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
df36d143ee89e12a881e80683191e409e78ba94c.body: Jean-Philippe Aumasson discovered that Ruby incorrectly generatedpredictable hash values. An attacker could use this issue to generate hashcollisions and cause a denial of service. (CVE-2012-5371)

1846c4f4f2f7f525ddfa9f74b0f874d0b4d7cfad.title: USN-1946-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
1846c4f4f2f7f525ddfa9f74b0f874d0b4d7cfad.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. A local user could cause a denial of service by creating alarge number of files with names that have the same CRC32 hash value.(CVE-2012-5374)

c8945e97f3f48368d7ba5aec6551cebd6528654e.title: USN-1945-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
c8945e97f3f48368d7ba5aec6551cebd6528654e.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. A local user could cause a denial of service by creating alarge number of files with names that have the same CRC32 hash value.(CVE-2012-5374)

435e23c331169e1741ba645f0651110641b5c982.title: USN-1947-1: Linux kernel (Quantal HWE) vulnerabilities
435e23c331169e1741ba645f0651110641b5c982.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. A local user could cause a denial of service by creating alarge number of files with names that have the same CRC32 hash value.(CVE-2012-5374)

a3caf47101daf8e6bbff83bd5967af0fbf34677c.title: USN-1944-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a3caf47101daf8e6bbff83bd5967af0fbf34677c.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. A local user could cause a denial of service by creating alarge number of files with names that have the same CRC32 hash value.(CVE-2012-5374)

4b6a9c5b8dff2aafd5fcb28920ea7633083e7ac4.title: USN-2017-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4b6a9c5b8dff2aafd5fcb28920ea7633083e7ac4.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. A local user could cause a denial of service by creating alarge number of files with names that have the same CRC32 hash value.(CVE-2012-5374)

a0283da157d74b5843f40471fb437f38563990a2.title: USN-1946-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
a0283da157d74b5843f40471fb437f38563990a2.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. A local user could cause a denial of service (prevent filecreation) for a victim, by creating a file with a specific CRC32C hashvalue in a directory important to the victim. (CVE-2012-5375)

3ef8135b040762e2a7891737d7077de21ea516a6.title: USN-1945-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
3ef8135b040762e2a7891737d7077de21ea516a6.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. 8df0fb95a3343e8e91d2ab76d158ca7e4202c222.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. cbe2e4ccbe23adb367e07a73590f16a515682820.title: USN-1944-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities

A local user could cause a denial of service (prevent filecreation) for a victim, by creating a file with a specific CRC32C hashvalue in a directory important to the victim. (CVE-2012-5375)

6dda83b88fcda8c34ee69c0504e89faa1caa2425.title: USN-2017-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
6dda83b88fcda8c34ee69c0504e89faa1caa2425.body: A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in theLinux kernel. A local user could cause a denial of service (prevent filecreation) for a victim, by creating a file with a specific CRC32C hashvalue in a directory important to the victim. (CVE-2012-5375)

da5bf52cf9a11d08456b4a5f2eebc1492e11af76.title: USN-1654-1: CUPS vulnerability
da5bf52cf9a11d08456b4a5f2eebc1492e11af76.body: It was discovered that users in the lpadmin group could modify certain CUPSconfiguration options to escalate privileges. An attacker could use this topotentially gain root privileges.

7265da88b0da7780087b18fbe4a151a3af9ad4a1.title: USN-1659-1: GIMP vulnerability
7265da88b0da7780087b18fbe4a151a3af9ad4a1.body: It was discovered that GIMP incorrectly handled malformed XWD files. If auser were tricked into opening a specially crafted XWD file, an attackercould cause GIMP to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with theuser's privileges.

67afd039e0b2b8e18650f93156ac0b8010deecb7.title: USN-1655-1: LibTIFF vulnerability
67afd039e0b2b8e18650f93156ac0b8010deecb7.body: It was discovered that LibTIFF incorrectly handled certain malformedimages using the DOTRANGE tag. If a user or automated system weretricked into opening a specially crafted TIFF image, a remote attackercould crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with user privileges.

519d458d05006a3de23bf3a08e5708ff15f7594f.title: USN-1658-1: MySQL vulnerability
519d458d05006a3de23bf3a08e5708ff15f7594f.body: It was discovered that MySQL incorrectly handled certain long arguments. Aremote authenticated attacker could use this issue to possibly executearbitrary code.

0b43d223c818636931d5451e986af8b1ddae0d6d.title: USN-1703-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
0b43d223c818636931d5451e986af8b1ddae0d6d.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in MySQL and this update includesnew upstream MySQL versions to fix these issues.MySQL has been updated to 5.1.67 in Ubuntu 10.04 LTS and Ubuntu 11.10.Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 12.10 have been updated to MySQL 5.5.29.In addition to security fixes, the updated packages contain bug fixes, newfeatures, and possibly incompatible changes.Please see the following for more information:http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.1/en/news-5-1-67.htmlhttp://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.5/en/news-5-5-29.htmlhttp://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpujan2013-1515902.html

e7d16344a1838460aac162fedd3e965a401763d7.title: USN-1723-1: Qt vulnerabilities
e7d16344a1838460aac162fedd3e965a401763d7.body: Richard J. Moore and Peter Hartmann discovered that Qt allowed redirectingrequests from http to file schemes. If an attacker were able to perform aman-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to view sensitiveinformation. This issue only affected Ubuntu 11.10, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS,and Ubuntu 12.10. (CVE-2012-5624)

8571b123847c927247240255be3d35b8335c9959.title: USN-1663-1: Nova vulnerability
8571b123847c927247240255be3d35b8335c9959.body: Eric Windisch discovered that Nova did not properly clear LVM-backed imagesbefore they were reallocated which could potentially lead to an informationleak. This issue only affected setups using libvirt LVM-backed instances.

c734352efc6b21f822e2ce15795878613fba6ae7.title: USN-1713-1: Squid vulnerabilities
c734352efc6b21f822e2ce15795878613fba6ae7.body: It was discovered that squid's cachemgr.cgi was vulnerable to excessiveresource use. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to perform a denialof service attack on the server and other hosted services. (CVE-2012-5643)

40d1f5386072329e925378726ec3bee10e6df3b8.title: USN-1712-1: Inkscape vulnerabilities
40d1f5386072329e925378726ec3bee10e6df3b8.body: It was discoverd that Inkscape incorrectly handled XML external entities inSVG files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially-crafted SVGfile, Inkscape could possibly include external files in drawings, resultingin information disclosure. (CVE-2012-5656)

a41fe25232e8118d3df02e78300845c3e9b2cce4.title: USN-1686-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
a41fe25232e8118d3df02e78300845c3e9b2cce4.body: Mateusz Jurczyk discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certainmalformed BDF font files. If a user were tricked into using a speciallycrafted font file, a remote attacker could cause FreeType to crash orpossibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

aef8b9d192bb470df3ebd7e4854cfbfa1d68e5b1.title: USN-1618-1: Exim vulnerability
aef8b9d192bb470df3ebd7e4854cfbfa1d68e5b1.body: It was discovered that Exim incorrectly handled DKIM DNS decoding. Thisflaw could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

75f36f15ad9b7d8dbcf7b35cc69f69e4e519acfc.title: USN-1657-1: Bind vulnerability
75f36f15ad9b7d8dbcf7b35cc69f69e4e519acfc.body: It was discovered that Bind incorrectly handled certain crafted querieswhen DNS64 was enabled. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause Bindto crash, resulting in a denial of service.

180461f41ca19e8a7d50eef8761bc1852b8f2f7f.title: USN-2693-1: Bind vulnerabilities
180461f41ca19e8a7d50eef8761bc1852b8f2f7f.body: Pories Ediansyah discovered that Bind incorrectly handled certainconfigurations involving DNS64. A remote attacker could use this issue witha specially crafted query to cause Bind to crash, resulting in a denial ofservice. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-5689)

ad3da1d92e1d28661cfb39b873c2665ae3b3205e.title: USN-1642-1: Lynx vulnerabilities
ad3da1d92e1d28661cfb39b873c2665ae3b3205e.body: It was discovered that Lynx did not properly verify that an HTTPScertificate was signed by a trusted certificate authority. This could allowan attacker to perform a "man in the middle" (MITM) attack which would makethe user believe their connection is secure, but is actually beingmonitored. This update changes the behavior of Lynx such that self-signedcertificates no longer validate. Users requiring the previous behavior canuse the 'FORCE_SSL_PROMPT' option in lynx.cfg. (CVE-2012-5821)

0a69a4c344e5a8cee2367e8daa6f264d5b5e2d16.title: USN-1681-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
0a69a4c344e5a8cee2367e8daa6f264d5b5e2d16.body: Abhishek Arya discovered several user-after-free and buffer overflows in Firefox. An attacker could exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2013-0760, CVE-2013-0761, CVE-2013-0762, CVE-2013-0763, CVE-2013-0766, CVE-2013-0767, CVE-2013-0771, CVE-2012-5829)

c59e1468f3a7822a7a9622b4fa99a2cc656416c6.title: USN-1681-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
c59e1468f3a7822a7a9622b4fa99a2cc656416c6.body: Abhishek Arya discovered several user-after-free and buffer overflows inFirefox. 3e75af1a67b8598f166ba91bd68f1a771d0e7297.body: Several memory corruption flaws were discovered in Firefox. If a user weretricked into opening a malicious page, an attacker could exploit these toexecute arbitrary code as the user invoking the program. (CVE-2012-5830,CVE-2012-5833, CVE-2012-5835, CVE-2012-5838)

3354ff17d3eef8f4ab3e8715f819453a9c672233.title: USN-1636-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
3354ff17d3eef8f4ab3e8715f819453a9c672233.body: Several memory corruption flaws were discovered in Thunderbird. If a userwere tricked into opening a malicious website and had JavaScript enabled,an attacker could exploit these to execute arbitrary JavaScript code withinthe context of another website or arbitrary code as the user invoking theprogram. (CVE-2012-5830, CVE-2012-5833, CVE-2012-5835, CVE-2012-5838)

07d94561d1036bdc096e591387e0a273d2b63945.title: USN-1638-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
07d94561d1036bdc096e591387e0a273d2b63945.body: Jonathan Stephens discovered that combining vectors involving the settingof Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) properties in conjunction with SVG textcould cause Firefox to crash. If a user were tricked into opening amalicious web page, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash or execute arbitrary code with the privliges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2012-5836)

476cc66a2da9ebba49501d343bcb345a999e2617.title: USN-1636-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
476cc66a2da9ebba49501d343bcb345a999e2617.body: Jonathan Stephens discovered that combining vectors involving the settingof Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) properties in conjunction with SVG textcould cause Thunderbird to crash. If a user were tricked into opening amalicious E-Mail, an attacker could cause a denial of service viaapplication crash or execute arbitrary code with the privliges of the userinvoking the program. (CVE-2012-5836)

0a8aef16c56f29818ec8b2cc402ac781e53cfe52.title: USN-1638-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
0a8aef16c56f29818ec8b2cc402ac781e53cfe52.body: Masato Kinugawa discovered that scripts entered into the Developer Toolbarcould run in a chrome privileged context. An attacker could use thisvulnerability to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks or executearbitrary code as the user invoking Firefox. With cross-site scriptingvulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing a specially craftedpage, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, orsteal confidential data, within the same domain. (CVE-2012-5837)

3b331f5ec7d0a38c1406e3a477b427d852cd95e1.title: USN-1638-3: Firefox regressions
3b331f5ec7d0a38c1406e3a477b427d852cd95e1.body: Masato Kinugawa discovered that scripts entered into the Developer Toolbar could run in a chrome privileged context. An attacker could use this vulnerability to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks or execute arbitrary code as the user invoking Firefox. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing a specially crafted page, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain. (CVE-2012-5837)

d3334c0860002f728bfc37b193e9a2d793aedd38.title: USN-1638-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d3334c0860002f728bfc37b193e9a2d793aedd38.body: Bobby Holley discovered that cross-origin wrappers were allowing writeactions on objects when only read actions should have been properlyallowed. This can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. Withcross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing aspecially crafted page, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify thecontents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain.(CVE-2012-5841)

92e3cc1c70daeadd6560c280c0dd5f0e09f65500.title: USN-1638-2: ubufox update
92e3cc1c70daeadd6560c280c0dd5f0e09f65500.body: Bobby Holley discovered that cross-origin wrappers were allowing write actions on objects when only read actions should have been properly allowed. This can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing a specially crafted page, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain. (CVE-2012-5841)

970a2be5878887663bc31c8a59c82b209d8663bd.title: USN-1636-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
970a2be5878887663bc31c8a59c82b209d8663bd.body: Bobby Holley discovered that cross-origin wrappers were allowing writeactions on objects when only read actions should have been properlyallowed. This can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. Withcross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing aspecially crafted page and had JavaScript enabled, a remote attacker couldexploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, withinthe same domain. (CVE-2012-5841)

56d9caec233854c22542084e23dab773a231382e.title: USN-1637-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
56d9caec233854c22542084e23dab773a231382e.body: It was discovered that Apache Tomcat incorrectly handled DIGESTauthentication. A remote attacker could possibly use these flaws to performa replay attack and bypass authentication. (CVE-2012-5885, CVE-2012-5886,CVE-2012-5887)

8ec663a60a53d0cc9fb46624dde88ffcdcf2be4e.title: USN-1712-1: Inkscape vulnerabilities
8ec663a60a53d0cc9fb46624dde88ffcdcf2be4e.body: It was discovered that Inkscape attempted to open certain files from the/tmp directory instead of the current directory. A local attacker couldtrick a user into opening a different file than the one that was intended.This issue only applied to Ubuntu 11.10, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 12.10.(CVE-2012-6076)

b111683c336d3559d87d46b930dd9c11cf1f6f15.title: USN-1680-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
b111683c336d3559d87d46b930dd9c11cf1f6f15.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin did not properly sanitize its input whenprocessing AnyWikiDraw and TWikiDraw actions. A remote attacker with writeaccess could exploit this to overwrite arbitrary files and executearbitrary code with the priviliges of the web server (user 'www-data').It was discovered that MoinMoin also did not properly sanitize its inputwhen processing the AttachFile action. A remote attacker could exploitthis to overwrite files via directory traversal.

868c347bd57fb0bb4a20936328b57a39273c3571.title: USN-1682-1: GnuPG vulnerability
868c347bd57fb0bb4a20936328b57a39273c3571.body: KB Sriram discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled certain malformed keys.If a user or automated system were tricked into importing a malformed key,the GnuPG keyring could become corrupted.

e262577d62a2045431571ab124da2afd396c929b.title: USN-1723-1: Qt vulnerabilities
e262577d62a2045431571ab124da2afd396c929b.body: Stephen Cheng discovered that Qt may report incorrect errors when sslcertificate verification fails. (CVE-2012-6093)

72e1978d4b75831435dac3266ba296caab1966f0.title: USN-1702-1: PHP vulnerability
72e1978d4b75831435dac3266ba296caab1966f0.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled the openssl_encrypt functionwhen used with an empty string. An attacker could use this flaw to causePHP to disclose arbitrary memory contents and possibly expose sensitiveinformation.

2158fc56c08717ea91b62ff76479201b9b8602e4.title: USN-1747-1: Transmission vulnerability
2158fc56c08717ea91b62ff76479201b9b8602e4.body: It was discovered that Transmission incorrectly handled certain microtransport protocol packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to causea denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

3513b03b0d6fdfbfd44de85de4c4284c6a0810e6.title: USN-2054-1: Samba vulnerabilities
3513b03b0d6fdfbfd44de85de4c4284c6a0810e6.body: It was discovered that Winbind incorrectly handled invalid group names withthe require_membership_of parameter. If an administrator used an invalidgroup name by mistake, access was granted instead of having the login fail.(CVE-2012-6150)

dde77613a8cc2ef7d12006431d03b1a0653df15d.title: USN-2166-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
dde77613a8cc2ef7d12006431d03b1a0653df15d.body: Ken Farnen discovered that Net-SNMP incorrectly handled AgentX timeouts. Aremote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash or tohang, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2012-6151)

b7b57b6a2c907101bafa67699d506ce9474578ec.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
b7b57b6a2c907101bafa67699d506ce9474578ec.body: Thijs Alkemade and Robert Vehse discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handledthe Yahoo! protocol. A remote attacker could use this issue to causePidgin to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2012-6152)

2beb7092cea51d652c0247df4af491e8e79b8a94.title: USN-2769-1: Apache Commons HttpClient vulnerabilities
2beb7092cea51d652c0247df4af491e8e79b8a94.body: Florian Weimer discovered the fix for CVE-2012-5783 was incomplete for ApacheCommons HttpClient. An attacker could exploit this to perform a man in themiddle attack to view sensitive information or alter encrypted communications.This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-6153)

0a2943abbd6f4f51f8d007c3fa9e8072fa9faead.title: USN-2099-1: Perl vulnerability
0a2943abbd6f4f51f8d007c3fa9e8072fa9faead.body: It was discovered that Perl's Locale::Maketext module incorrectly handledbackslashes and fully qualified method names. An attacker could possiblyuse this flaw to execute arbitrary code when an application used untrustedtemplates.

e85dd754a36ee6bb1521d0e548148dc5a2dc8226.title: USN-2056-1: DjVuLibre vulnerability
e85dd754a36ee6bb1521d0e548148dc5a2dc8226.body: It was discovered that DjVuLibre incorrectly handled certain memoryoperations. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing aspecially crafted DjVu file, applications could be made to crash, resultingin a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

a997210d91c6d814c82cd80665502c46a3507e9b.body: Mathias Krause discovered several errors in the Linux kernel's xfrm_userimplementation. A local attacker could exploit these flaws to examine partsof kernel memory. (CVE-2012-6537)

fbecb21b7731ffd05790f28c0ee0ff9a107e12ff.title: USN-1813-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
fbecb21b7731ffd05790f28c0ee0ff9a107e12ff.body: Mathias Krause discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's ISO9660 CDROM file system driver. A local user could exploit this flaw toexamine some of the kernel's heap memory. (CVE-2012-6549)

1a876bc5a296c70a7eabcfb9ab0189934925e35a.title: USN-1812-1: Linux kernel (Quantal HWE) vulnerabilities
1a876bc5a296c70a7eabcfb9ab0189934925e35a.body: Mathias Krause discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's ISO9660 CDROM file system driver. A local user could exploit this flaw toexamine some of the kernel's heap memory. (CVE-2012-6549)

9ea183a78387d4d60c931ffd5bdd394f8295840c.title: USN-1809-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9ea183a78387d4d60c931ffd5bdd394f8295840c.body: Mathias Krause discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's ISO9660 CDROM file system driver. A local user could exploit this flaw toexamine some of the kernel's heap memory. (CVE-2012-6549)

1b9fcf48fbd8b05e4fbda5d9b324a392225c47ce.title: USN-1811-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
1b9fcf48fbd8b05e4fbda5d9b324a392225c47ce.body: Mathias Krause discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's ISO9660 CDROM file system driver. A local user could exploit this flaw toexamine some of the kernel's heap memory. (CVE-2012-6549)

3ef005c43b27da5adf313d19b03dfaa365cf502c.title: USN-1814-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
3ef005c43b27da5adf313d19b03dfaa365cf502c.body: Mathias Krause discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's ISO9660 CDROM file system driver. A local user could exploit this flaw toexamine some of the kernel's heap memory. (CVE-2012-6549)

cbd7ca1fb195e56f5ad18d40d173c1854c0a367a.title: USN-1399-1: gdm-guest-session vulnerability
cbd7ca1fb195e56f5ad18d40d173c1854c0a367a.body: Ryan Lortie discovered that gdm-guest-session improperly cleaned outcertain guest session files. A local attacker could use this issue todelete arbitrary files.

03ebfca4fcd49a5588c169ca30422a4d44004f5c.title: USN-2432-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
03ebfca4fcd49a5588c169ca30422a4d44004f5c.body: Siddhesh Poyarekar discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handledcertain multibyte characters when using the iconv function. An attackercould possibly use this issue to cause applications to crash, resulting ina denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS and Ubuntu12.04 LTS. (CVE-2012-6656)

1bd4f823a6ae4a6bdd604d2bde67ebff0a0582f1.title: USN-3010-1: Expat vulnerabilities
1bd4f823a6ae4a6bdd604d2bde67ebff0a0582f1.body: It was discovered that Expat unexpectedly called srand in certaincircumstances. This could reduce the security of calling applications.(CVE-2012-6702)

794ca70b08b2368035986448f5b483ae86fe1e71.title: USN-2129-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
794ca70b08b2368035986448f5b483ae86fe1e71.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel when inotify is usedto monitor the /dev/ptmx device. A local user could exploit this flaw todiscover keystroke timing and potentially discover sensitive informationlike password length. (CVE-2013-0160)

911b6ec4cae62a508f634923d905d2bd0c083f69.title: USN-2128-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
911b6ec4cae62a508f634923d905d2bd0c083f69.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel when inotify is usedto monitor the /dev/ptmx device. A local user could exploit this flaw todiscover keystroke timing and potentially discover sensitive informationlike password length. (CVE-2013-0160)

5514fea01bdeceb010b484bc7efdae556cf45949.title: USN-1735-1: OpenJDK vulnerabilities
5514fea01bdeceb010b484bc7efdae556cf45949.body: Nadhem Alfardan and Kenny Paterson discovered that the TLS protocol as usedin OpenJDK was vulnerable to a timing side-channel attack known as the"Lucky Thirteen" issue. A remote attacker could use this issue to performplaintext-recovery attacks via analysis of timing data. (CVE-2013-0169)

3cbcb46f5172ab9a5029f95bb417abdda3d4e0db.title: USN-1708-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
3cbcb46f5172ab9a5029f95bb417abdda3d4e0db.body: Tingting Zheng discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled cleanup undercertain error conditions. A remote attacker could exploit this and causelibvirt to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly executearbitrary code. (CVE-2013-0170)

1ec0e3d23095f48ee266bbc9963327a795dfc282.title: USN-1707-1: libssh vulnerability
1ec0e3d23095f48ee266bbc9963327a795dfc282.body: Yong Chuan Koh discovered that libssh incorrectly handled certainnegotiation requests. A remote attacker could use this to cause libssh tocrash, resulting in a denial of service.

b6b40cbde2cecacdfc7f22ecdd3ca468ecbebce2.title: USN-2080-1: Memcached vulnerabilities
b6b40cbde2cecacdfc7f22ecdd3ca468ecbebce2.body: Jeremy Sowden discovered that Memcached incorrectly handled logging certaindetails when the -vv option was used. An attacker could use this issue tocause Memcached to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-0179)

2fab112a32821ea9805df9d323bc154f9f13c7ba.title: USN-1713-1: Squid vulnerabilities
2fab112a32821ea9805df9d323bc154f9f13c7ba.body: It was discovered that the patch for CVE-2012-5643 was incorrect. Aremote attacker could exploit this flaw to perform a denial of serviceattack. (CVE-2013-0189)

8d37ccfc5d5f9524742f55e3dbe20a6b99612a92.title: USN-1728-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerability
8d37ccfc5d5f9524742f55e3dbe20a6b99612a92.body: Andrew Cooper of Citrix reported a Xen stack corruption in the Linuxkernel. An unprivileged user in a 32bit PVOPS guest can cause the guestkernel to crash, or operate erroneously.

05b1b7a384fa49c461fa760e8072a49c93acf6e6.title: USN-1725-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
05b1b7a384fa49c461fa760e8072a49c93acf6e6.body: Andrew Cooper of Citrix reported a Xen stack corruption in the Linuxkernel. An unprivileged user in a 32bit PVOPS guest can cause the guestkernel to crash, or operate erroneously.

11de3892742d66dc4c1c5ebebca054154bd05989.title: USN-1709-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerability
11de3892742d66dc4c1c5ebebca054154bd05989.body: Phil Day discovered that nova-volume did not validate access to volumes. Anauthenticated attacker could exploit this to bypass intended accesscontrols and boot from arbitrary volumes.

c59e9956ad0eefa203fc2da4f7a43f42d3c92bcf.title: USN-2549-1: libarchive vulnerabilities
c59e9956ad0eefa203fc2da4f7a43f42d3c92bcf.body: Fabian Yamaguchi discovered that libarchive incorrectly handled certaintype conversions. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to causelibarchive to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue onlyaffected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-0211)

2b95add994bccf1bf9d393a7347f1671c72ce9f8.title: USN-1710-1: OpenStack Glance vulnerability
2b95add994bccf1bf9d393a7347f1671c72ce9f8.body: Dan Prince discovered an issue in Glance error reporting. An authenticatedattacker could exploit this to expose the Glance operator's Swiftcredentials for a misconfigured or otherwise unusable Swift endpoint.

c3e1f07f7449028344816125b527322c563c3db1.title: USN-2922-1: Samba vulnerabilities
c3e1f07f7449028344816125b527322c563c3db1.body: It was discovered that the Samba Web Administration Tool (SWAT) wasvulnerable to clickjacking and cross-site request forgery attacks. Thisissue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-0213, CVE-2013-0214)

374401db528d1b09f3765ccafe14e7a752168056.title: USN-1795-1: Linux kernel (Quantal HWE) vulnerabilities
374401db528d1b09f3765ccafe14e7a752168056.body: Andrew Jones discovered a flaw with the xen_iret function in Linux kernel'sXen virtualizeation. In the 32-bit Xen paravirt platform an unprivilegedguest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (crashthe system) or gain guest OS privilege. (CVE-2013-0228)

3c6ec79eefd5e51e3b43bc50fb9344d9ff04c2fe.title: USN-1796-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3c6ec79eefd5e51e3b43bc50fb9344d9ff04c2fe.body: Andrew Jones discovered a flaw with the xen_iret function in Linux kernel'sXen virtualizeation. In the 32-bit Xen paravirt platform an unprivilegedguest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (crashthe system) or gain guest OS privilege. (CVE-2013-0228)

2840c907be99deddd8f32bfc0577d77bd6e37216.title: USN-1797-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
2840c907be99deddd8f32bfc0577d77bd6e37216.body: Andrew Jones discovered a flaw with the xen_iret function in Linux kernel'sXen virtualizeation. In the 32-bit Xen paravirt platform an unprivilegedguest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (crashthe system) or gain guest OS privilege. (CVE-2013-0228)

7e598fb646dde6238b2231c8d452ac77ca361cbf.title: USN-1805-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7e598fb646dde6238b2231c8d452ac77ca361cbf.body: Andrew Jones discovered a flaw with the xen_iret function in Linux kernel'sXen virtualizeation. In the 32-bit Xen paravirt platform an unprivilegedguest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (crashthe system) or gain guest OS privilege. (CVE-2013-0228)

9ea1b30cf947b59cf2ce83e10391c9d266681a53.title: USN-1808-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
9ea1b30cf947b59cf2ce83e10391c9d266681a53.body: Andrew Jones discovered a flaw with the xen_iret function in Linux kernel'sXen virtualizeation. In the 32-bit Xen paravirt platform an unprivilegedguest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (crashthe system) or gain guest OS privilege. (CVE-2013-0228)

6cb687ac60524720fd3efb3b6ece244bd2879cb9.title: USN-1779-1: GNOME Online Accounts vulnerability
6cb687ac60524720fd3efb3b6ece244bd2879cb9.body: It was discovered that GNOME Online Accounts did not properly check SSLcertificates when configuring online accounts. If a remote attacker wereable to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited toalter or compromise credentials and confidential information.

2a035f4824a4a7b354941bda11d86ee287e6f33b.title: USN-1714-1: QXL graphics driver vulnerability
2a035f4824a4a7b354941bda11d86ee287e6f33b.body: It was discovered that the QXL graphics driver incorrectly handledterminated connections. An attacker that could connect to a guest usingSPICE and the QXL graphics driver could cause the guest to hang or crash,resulting in a denial of service.

1f149c7f48ca5c14fe50ce6aae0f1b8126c85212.title: USN-1991-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
1f149c7f48ca5c14fe50ce6aae0f1b8126c85212.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled multibytecharacters in the regular expression matcher. An attacker could use thisissue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2013-0242)

a80d4d51dc9b992b19e362cb12a8a6d85467d5a3.title: USN-1715-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerability
a80d4d51dc9b992b19e362cb12a8a6d85467d5a3.body: Dan Prince discovered that Keystone did not properly perform inputvalidation when handling certain error conditions. An unauthenticated usercould exploit this to cause a denial of service in Keystone API servers viadisk space exhaustion.

8e2d5bdd57dd149e6f1fdf7a7fa5729f5e22507f.title: USN-1721-1: curl vulnerability
8e2d5bdd57dd149e6f1fdf7a7fa5729f5e22507f.body: It was discovered that curl incorrectly handled SASL authentication whencommunicating over POP3, SMTP or IMAP. If a user or automated system weretricked into processing a specially crafted URL, an attacker could causea denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. The defaultcompiler options for affected releases should reduce the vulnerability to adenial of service.

6539eeb39ebf968a160158c10569ebcc487f32da.title: USN-1727-1: Boost vulnerability
6539eeb39ebf968a160158c10569ebcc487f32da.body: It was discovered that the Boost.Locale library incorrectly validated someinvalid UTF-8 sequences. An attacker could possibly use this issue tobypass input validation in certain applications.

37b82a558f5e2714e17f4d038d1cc4bb701a7dd1.title: USN-1717-1: PostgreSQL vulnerability
37b82a558f5e2714e17f4d038d1cc4bb701a7dd1.body: Sumit Soni discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled calling a certaininternal function with invalid arguments. An authenticated attacker coulduse this issue to cause PostgreSQL to crash, resulting in a denial ofservice.

397ff754e04bf8fb20b98171ab4bd37ea91ae89e.title: USN-1733-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
397ff754e04bf8fb20b98171ab4bd37ea91ae89e.body: Evgeny Ermakov discovered that documentation generated by rdoc isvulnerable to a cross-site scripting issue. With cross-site scriptingvulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing a specially craftedpage, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or stealconfidential data, within the same domain. (CVE-2013-0256)

fda81c0a3cac21749ad8a3c22ba698529e384b2b.title: USN-1733-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
fda81c0a3cac21749ad8a3c22ba698529e384b2b.body: Thomas Hollstegge and Ben Murphy discovered that the JSON implementationin Ruby incorrectly handled certain crafted documents. An attacker coulduse this issue to cause a denial of service or bypass certain protectionmechanisms. (CVE-2013-0269)

4da2d8d2d8e737057fcc85dc98830ffa1a8f3425.title: USN-1746-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
4da2d8d2d8e737057fcc85dc98830ffa1a8f3425.body: It was discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled long HTTP headers in theMXit protocol handler. A malicious remote server could use this issue toexecute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-0272)

066d7d149b218fd7ca714b69cf2c6e453058da4a.title: USN-1753-1: DBus-GLib vulnerability
066d7d149b218fd7ca714b69cf2c6e453058da4a.body: Sebastian Krahmer and Bastien Nocera discovered that DBus-GLib did notproperly validate the message sender when the "NameOwnerChanged" signal wasreceived. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate theirprivileges.

3b7f138312281a5748ab9104600261e6eb4b244c.title: USN-1757-1: Django vulnerabilities
3b7f138312281a5748ab9104600261e6eb4b244c.body: Orange Tsai discovered that Django incorrectly performed permission checkswhen displaying the history view in the admin interface. An administratorcould use this flaw to view the history of any object, regardless ofintended permissions. (CVE-2013-0305)

736d3235db0a6eed92bc6cd95f12d2581fdc4964.title: USN-1757-1: Django vulnerabilities
736d3235db0a6eed92bc6cd95f12d2581fdc4964.body: It was discovered that Django incorrectly handled a large number of formswhen generating formsets. An attacker could use this flaw to cause Djangoto consume memory, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-0306)

53aff51a394730d69826cb2be89352a54b203bf7.title: USN-1771-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerabilities
53aff51a394730d69826cb2be89352a54b203bf7.body: Loganathan Parthipan discovered that Nova did not properly validate VNCtokens after an instance was deleted. An authenticated attacker couldexploit this to access other virtual machines under certain circumstances.This issue did not affect Ubuntu 11.10. (CVE-2013-0335)

1fc29f1f233e0bf834cc61549dedf1739f2359a1.title: USN-1782-1: libxml2 vulnerability
1fc29f1f233e0bf834cc61549dedf1739f2359a1.body: It was discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled XML entity expansion.An attacker could use this flaw to cause libxml2 to consume large amountsof resources, resulting in a denial of service.

6b7a8a893f8d04557c7f25c25bd706fe8b2c4c8a.title: USN-1904-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
6b7a8a893f8d04557c7f25c25bd706fe8b2c4c8a.body: It was discovered that libxml2 would load XML external entities by default.If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafteddocument, an attacker could possibly obtain access to arbitrary files orcause resource consumption. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS,Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 12.10. (CVE-2013-0339)

7ada0b704d7365c8ad837c06d69ad422bb3bbe35.title: USN-1904-2: libxml2 regression
7ada0b704d7365c8ad837c06d69ad422bb3bbe35.body: It was discovered that libxml2 would load XML external entities by default. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, an attacker could possibly obtain access to arbitrary files or cause resource consumption. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 12.10. (CVE-2013-0339)

629d5e76ddb045616bdfc298d25bbb0355c78e88.title: USN-1805-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
629d5e76ddb045616bdfc298d25bbb0355c78e88.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel's Bluetooth stackwhen HIDP (Human Interface Device Protocol) support is enabled. A localunprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause an information leak fromthe kernel. (CVE-2013-0349)

df6643d0368af0d04a7979003f19406a4c43ec8d.title: USN-1808-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
df6643d0368af0d04a7979003f19406a4c43ec8d.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel's Bluetooth stackwhen HIDP (Human Interface Device Protocol) support is enabled. A localunprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause an information leak fromthe kernel. (CVE-2013-0349)

450a19d45100e65792448292dcfed59d611e1a52.title: USN-1806-1: OpenJDK 7 vulnerabilities
450a19d45100e65792448292dcfed59d611e1a52.body: Ben Murphy discovered a vulnerability in the OpenJDK JRE related toinformation disclosure and data integrity. An attacker could exploit thisto execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-0401)

bf15c83bf88b131740666a6937994c20a7f3abcd.title: USN-1802-1: Samba vulnerability
bf15c83bf88b131740666a6937994c20a7f3abcd.body: It was discovered that Samba incorrectly handled CIFS share attributes whenSMB2 was used. A remote authenticated user could possibly gain write accessto certain shares, bypassing the intended permissions.

6304c8a346fb878f268fc3aadd2fcbc0f43ef625.title: USN-1681-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
6304c8a346fb878f268fc3aadd2fcbc0f43ef625.body: Atte Kettunen discovered that Firefox did not properly handle HTML tables with a large number of columns and column groups. If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2013-0744)

0db0100cb9baf4d70c96a32558597941ad4d419f.title: USN-1681-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
0db0100cb9baf4d70c96a32558597941ad4d419f.body: Atte Kettunen discovered that Firefox did not properly handle HTML tableswith a large number of columns and column groups. If the user were trickedinto opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could exploit this tocause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially executecode with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2013-0744)

879f2d72590545428c3d4d2745bc78225f9a3124.body: Olli Pettay and Boris Zbarsky discovered flaws in the Javacript engine of Firefox. 4c220439325ca60bf6972de00980cdb017a52e95.body: Olli Pettay and Boris Zbarsky discovered flaws in the Javacript engine ofFirefox. ce14cd5e672cdb9464d01cb1caceefeb4462a99f.body: Jesse Ruderman discovered a flaw in the way Firefox handled plugins. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, a remote attacker could exploit this to bypass security protections to conduct clickjacking attacks. (CVE-2013-0747)

acd5b08584583e6ff83b93c46150a3fe4f498f25.body: Jesse Ruderman discovered a flaw in the way Firefox handled plugins. If auser were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, a remote attackercould exploit this to bypass security protections to conduct clickjackingattacks. (CVE-2013-0747)

d2215509b77e46e719fa6986acb5e2adce483eda.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the Javascript engine, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow. c3e490753b531a1aa2b86528df3597611057934a.title: USN-1681-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
c3e490753b531a1aa2b86528df3597611057934a.body: Sviatoslav Chagaev discovered that Firefox did not properly handle XBL files with multiple XML bindings with SVG content. a169f6803da07a465dfeab02983012fb7be206ac.body: Sviatoslav Chagaev discovered that Firefox did not properly handle XBLfiles with multiple XML bindings with SVG content. 2bc2e5532b3aea6c55c4aaa885f821763b360031.body: It was discovered that gnome-screensaver did not start automatically afterlogging in. This may result in the screen not being automatically lockedafter the inactivity timeout is reached, permitting an attacker withphysical access to gain access to an unlocked session.

08a1843e1b0229d2d4b749b8c9d6b5605da76926.title: USN-1762-1: APT vulnerability
08a1843e1b0229d2d4b749b8c9d6b5605da76926.body: Ansgar Burchardt discovered that APT incorrectly handled InRelease files.If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, thisflaw could potentially be used to install altered packages.This update corrects the issue by disabling InRelease file supportcompletely. Please note that this update breaks third-party repositoriesthat provide only a InRelease file and no separate Release and Release.gpgfiles. The default Ubuntu repositories do not use InRelease files.

4ebfece0c983f20b2258962e97fa17a1ef1b2ca1.title: USN-2248-1: OpenStack Cinder vulnerability
4ebfece0c983f20b2258962e97fa17a1ef1b2ca1.body: Darragh O'Reilly discovered that the Ubuntu packaging for OpenStack Cinderdid not properly set up its sudo configuration. If a different flaw wasfound in OpenStack Cinder, this vulnerability could be used to escalateprivileges. (CVE-2013-1068)

252560585ee833a032de450b63b9dd56fd5372ec.body: Darragh O'Reilly discovered that the Ubuntu packaging for OpenStack Novadid not properly set up its sudo configuration. If a different flaw wasfound in OpenStack Nova, this vulnerability could be used to escalateprivileges. This issue only affected Ubuntu 13.10 and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.(CVE-2013-1068)

5fd442ec35f3e48d40cf4b3c95ab968e89ec78ff.title: USN-2105-1: MAAS vulnerabilities
5fd442ec35f3e48d40cf4b3c95ab968e89ec78ff.body: James Troup discovered that MAAS stored RabbitMQ authenticationcredentials in a world-readable file. A local authenticated usercould read this password and potentially gain privileges of otheruser accounts. This update restricts the file permissions to preventunintended access. (CVE-2013-1069)

0f7a591e7991a59d62991ab4b85a9499e1211895.title: USN-2105-1: MAAS vulnerabilities
0f7a591e7991a59d62991ab4b85a9499e1211895.body: Chris Glass discovered that the MAAS API was vulnerable to cross-sitescripting vulnerabilities. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities,if a user were tricked into viewing a specially crafted page, a remoteattacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidentialdata, within the same domain. (CVE-2013-1070)

c2da7a4feb157e757b5fa9d9534f9a480198332a.title: USN-1873-1: telepathy-gabble vulnerabilities
c2da7a4feb157e757b5fa9d9534f9a480198332a.body: Maksim Otstavnov discovered that telepathy-gabble incorrectly handledTLS when connecting to legacy jabber servers. If a remote attacker wereable to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited toview sensitive information. (CVE-2013-1431)

422728e58961ac2bb15d9fa8543273c2c5f174a5.title: USN-1806-1: OpenJDK 7 vulnerabilities
422728e58961ac2bb15d9fa8543273c2c5f174a5.body: James Forshaw discovered a vulnerability in the OpenJDK JRE related toinformation disclosure, data integrity and availability. An attacker couldexploit this to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-1488)

7c54e6408418938e9b49f0fea7b9a58e11703adb.title: USN-1755-2: OpenJDK 7 vulnerabilities
7c54e6408418938e9b49f0fea7b9a58e11703adb.body: It was discovered that OpenJDK did not properly check return values when performing color conversion for images. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted image with OpenJDK, such as with the Java plugin, a remote attacker could cause OpenJDK to crash or execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2013-1493)

8bb0ebdae24b339d6590cd2b71a20134ba6ba7ba.title: USN-1752-1: GnuTLS vulnerability
8bb0ebdae24b339d6590cd2b71a20134ba6ba7ba.body: Nadhem Alfardan and Kenny Paterson discovered that the TLS protocol as usedin GnuTLS was vulnerable to a timing side-channel attack known as the"Lucky Thirteen" issue. A remote attacker could use this issue to performplaintext-recovery attacks via analysis of timing data.

5a727da724afa4d3d14b7ff49b195dc3eafe97e3.title: USN-1763-1: NSS vulnerability
5a727da724afa4d3d14b7ff49b195dc3eafe97e3.body: Nadhem Alfardan and Kenny Paterson discovered that the TLS protocol as usedin NSS was vulnerable to a timing side-channel attack known as the"Lucky Thirteen" issue. A remote attacker could use this issue to performplaintext-recovery attacks via analysis of timing data.

dd4e158cd77893eaee8404d433b711c9e14bbb66.title: USN-1761-1: PHP vulnerability
dd4e158cd77893eaee8404d433b711c9e14bbb66.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled XML external entities inSOAP WSDL files. A remote attacker could use this flaw to read arbitraryfiles off the server.

3827d9c75348bf05ffa55f083c58684b5417122f.title: USN-1759-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
3827d9c75348bf05ffa55f083c58684b5417122f.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled certain client requests.An attacker on an authenticated client could use this issue to possiblyperform unauthorized actions. (CVE-2013-1652)

9ffd43134f4b09e53fbe1a1e2d37d3794d288e96.title: USN-1759-1: Puppet vulnerabilities
9ffd43134f4b09e53fbe1a1e2d37d3794d288e96.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled serialized attributes.An attacker on an authenticated client could use this issue to possiblycause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary. (CVE-2013-1655)

50027f7efab5211f72e1d9b21f15c7f4ab3d2555.title: USN-1757-1: Django vulnerabilities
50027f7efab5211f72e1d9b21f15c7f4ab3d2555.body: It was discovered that Django incorrectly deserialized XML. An attackercould use this flaw to perform entity-expansion and external-entity/DTDattacks. This updated modified Django behaviour to no longer allow DTDs,perform entity expansion, or fetch external entities/DTDs. (CVE-2013-1664,CVE-2013-1665)

a5d1143f1a08358d2dccdbb137f4d19b24bbee7d.title: USN-1770-1: Perl vulnerability
a5d1143f1a08358d2dccdbb137f4d19b24bbee7d.body: Yves Orton discovered that Perl incorrectly handled hashing when usinguser-provided hash keys. An attacker could use this flaw to perform adenial of service attack against software written in Perl.

835ef12800f7813cf4e1307c38902ea9d22311fd.body: Cody Crews discovered that some constructors could be used to bypassrestrictions enforced by their Chrome Object Wrapper (COW). An attackercould exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.(CVE-2013-1670)

197c2fa04d7ae0601cef187c7402564c3444ae06.body: It was discovered that the file input element could expose the full localpath under certain conditions. An attacker could potentially exploit thisto steal sensitive information. (CVE-2013-1671)

b46640ec8e333b4e1e7c91b6bcfa299ed1f1053b.body: A use-after-free was discovered when resizing video content whilst it isplaying. An attacker could potentially exploit this to execute code withthe privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2013-1674)

If a user were trickedinto connecting to a malicious server, an attacker could possibly exploitthese to cause a denial of service via application crash, potentiallyexecute arbitrary code, or lead to information disclosure.This update also adds TLS v1.2 support to Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.04LTS, Ubuntu 12.10, and Ubuntu 13.04.

a8f84691499f57bfeddb2f53f20eee701f0b0268.body: Marco Schoepl discovered that Sudo incorrectly handled time stamp fileswhen the system clock is set to epoch. A local attacker could use thisissue to run Sudo commands without a password prompt.

d9cfb3de9df45dcc4d3db4e8fb786dccc1039c30.body: It was discovered that poppler contained multiple security issues whenparsing malformed PDF documents. 83500ef662d990faadf40452a50657381a41edbc.title: USN-1780-1: Ruby vulnerability
83500ef662d990faadf40452a50657381a41edbc.body: Ben Murphy discovered that the Ruby REXML library incorrectly handled XMLentity expansion. An attacker could use this flaw to cause Ruby to consumelarge amounts of memory, resulting in a denial of service.

794b41616f567fda3765eee3b0f76982ce8616cd.title: USN-1771-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerabilities
794b41616f567fda3765eee3b0f76982ce8616cd.body: Vish Ishaya discovered that Nova did not always enforce quotas on fixedIPs. An authenticated attacker could exploit this to cause a denial ofservice via resource consumption. Nova will now enforce a quota limit of10 fixed IPs per instance, which is configurable via 'quota_fixed_ips'in /etc/nova/nova.conf. (CVE-2013-1838)

505bd794d28d2a7443ffe5e29fffbbcdd77a7bdf.title: USN-1764-1: OpenStack Glance vulnerability
505bd794d28d2a7443ffe5e29fffbbcdd77a7bdf.body: Stuart McLaren discovered an issue with Glance v1 API requests. Anauthenticated attacker could exploit this to expose the Glance operator'sSwift and/or S3 credentials via the response headers when requesting acached image.

7f41111a3f2d8dbbb4514c2908a7f793d1be56d1.title: USN-1893-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
7f41111a3f2d8dbbb4514c2908a7f793d1be56d1.body: Alexander Klink discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module forApache did not properly handle a large number of properties. A remoteauthenticated attacker could use this flaw to cause memory consumption,leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2013-1845)

f3f14d30c4e451fa52f0a2ee0d47bc3a2031a648.title: USN-1893-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
f3f14d30c4e451fa52f0a2ee0d47bc3a2031a648.body: Ben Reser discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module forApache did not properly handle certain LOCKs. A remote authenticatedattacker could use this flaw to cause Subversion to crash, leading to adenial of service. (CVE-2013-1846)

daa6d06e6c94fb611e76e7703048b008345b2867.body: A format-string bug was discovered in the Linux kernel's ext3 filesystemdriver. A local user could exploit this flaw to possibly escalateprivileges on the system. (CVE-2013-1848)

74588e560ff0bc6901ead1c566a801d840d2de25.title: USN-1909-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
74588e560ff0bc6901ead1c566a801d840d2de25.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in MySQL and this update includesnew upstream MySQL versions to fix these issues.MySQL has been updated to 5.1.70 in Ubuntu 10.04 LTS. Ubuntu 12.04 LTS,Ubuntu 12.10 and Ubuntu 13.04 have been updated to MySQL 5.5.32.In addition to security fixes, the updated packages contain bug fixes,new features, and possibly incompatible changes.Please see the following for more information:http://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.1/en/news-5-1-70.htmlhttp://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.5/en/news-5-5-32.htmlhttp://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpujuly2013-1899826.html

a41a4ddb1aa3cdee56c9d257ff8d408a8a3865f8.title: USN-1903-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
a41a4ddb1aa3cdee56c9d257ff8d408a8a3865f8.body: It was discovered that the mod_rewrite module incorrectly sanitized non-printable characters before writing data to log files. A remote attackercould possibly use this flaw to execute arbitrary commands by injectingescape sequences in the log file. (CVE-2013-1862)

a879fe9dc107262b153d481f4e59ddbfcd77030b.title: USN-1772-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerability
a879fe9dc107262b153d481f4e59ddbfcd77030b.body: Guang Yee discovered that Keystone would not always perform allverification checks when configured to use PKI. If the keystone server wasconfigured to use PKI and services or users requested online verification,an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass revocation checks.Keystone uses UUID tokens by default in Ubuntu.

9ec112d50cbe9ea25b3c0b26e8391be1130790dc.title: USN-1888-1: Mesa vulnerabilities
9ec112d50cbe9ea25b3c0b26e8391be1130790dc.body: It was discovered that Mesa incorrectly handled certain memorycalculations. An attacker could use this flaw to cause an application tocrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-1872)

fbae65618d6b358f698ecfb5fa159d2f0492a203.title: USN-2149-1: librsvg vulnerability
fbae65618d6b358f698ecfb5fa159d2f0492a203.body: It was discovered that librsvg would load XML external entities by default.If a user were tricked into viewing a specially crafted SVG file, anattacker could possibly obtain access to arbitrary files.

dba4d1905427e99707fabe76befb2dd38d804ef5.title: USN-2149-2: GTK+ update
dba4d1905427e99707fabe76befb2dd38d804ef5.body: USN-2149-1 fixed a vulnerability in librsvg. This update provides acompatibility fix for GTK+ to work with the librsvg security update.Original advisory details:It was discovered that librsvg would load XML external entities by default. If a user were tricked into viewing a specially crafted SVG file, an attacker could possibly obtain access to arbitrary files.

e26c4e3febbf8a4c785789629b12fa20da224a1d.title: USN-1893-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
e26c4e3febbf8a4c785789629b12fa20da224a1d.body: Greg McMullin, Stefan Fuhrmann, Philip Martin, and Ben Reser discoveredthat the Subversion mod_dav_svn module for Apache did not properly handlecertain log REPORT requests. A remote attacker could use this flaw to causeSubversion to crash, leading to a denial of service. This issue onlyaffected Ubuntu 12.10 and Ubuntu 13.04. (CVE-2013-1884)

f0dcf6159b609db5611535352f68a30c241dec52.title: USN-1903-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
f0dcf6159b609db5611535352f68a30c241dec52.body: It was discovered that the mod_dav module incorrectly handled certain MERGErequests. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server tostop responding, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-1896)

f087f6281aa50ebca862da808dac0ca4712ac837.title: USN-1789-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
f087f6281aa50ebca862da808dac0ca4712ac837.body: Mitsumasa Kondo and Kyotaro Horiguchi discovered that PostgreSQLincorrectly handled certain connection requests containing database namesstarting with a dash. A remote attacker could use this flaw to damage ordestroy files within a server's data directory. This issue only applied toUbuntu 11.10, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 12.10. (CVE-2013-1899)

b1262f37d1239acafa7cc5e111b03550c853cb8a.title: USN-1789-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
b1262f37d1239acafa7cc5e111b03550c853cb8a.body: Marko Kreen discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly generated randomnumbers. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to possibly guessanother database user's random numbers. (CVE-2013-1900)

c4aaad86d25573fa3d75a47e5fe0bcf87f5f9b42.title: USN-1789-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
c4aaad86d25573fa3d75a47e5fe0bcf87f5f9b42.body: Noah Misch discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain privilegechecks. An unprivileged attacker could use this flaw to possibly interferewith in-progress backups. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 11.10,Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 12.10. (CVE-2013-1901)

f3f30222463b11f075e25602479d287870430bd6.title: USN-1800-1: HAProxy vulnerabilities
f3f30222463b11f075e25602479d287870430bd6.body: Yves Lafon discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled HTTP keywords in TCPinspection rules when HTTP keep-alive is enabled. A remote attacker coulduse this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrarycode. (CVE-2013-1912)

82c831d1b1e0807e096af1f816d88a59df48a308.title: USN-2051-1: GIMP vulnerability
82c831d1b1e0807e096af1f816d88a59df48a308.body: Murray McAllister discovered that GIMP incorrectly handled malformed XWDfiles. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted XWD file, anattacker could cause GIMP to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code withthe user's privileges.

c0471f277c6ba895b221dfc95a40f78f71f1c892.title: USN-1991-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
c0471f277c6ba895b221dfc95a40f78f71f1c892.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled large numbersof domain conversion results in the getaddrinfo() function. An attackercould use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2013-1914)

06b181ee107232102ebb9ce7cd5c9bd951fa2a35.title: USN-1829-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
06b181ee107232102ebb9ce7cd5c9bd951fa2a35.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel's /dev/dvb device. Alocal user could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from thekernel's stack memory. (CVE-2013-1928)

0c56992b0dae854e10eaca0f5f46f3ff47f1a5ed.title: USN-1836-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
0c56992b0dae854e10eaca0f5f46f3ff47f1a5ed.body: A buffer overflow vulnerability was discovered in the Broadcom tg3 ethernetdriver for the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to causea denial of service (crash the system) or potentially escalate privilegeson the system. (CVE-2013-1929)

61f2b0515be3f392e82ed3fec6abbc084fa78860.title: USN-1834-1: Linux kernel (Quantal HWE) vulnerabilities
61f2b0515be3f392e82ed3fec6abbc084fa78860.body: A buffer overflow vulnerability was discovered in the Broadcom tg3 ethernetdriver for the Linux kernel. f7d8175ba26ac290300a0e36b8d1d4bd5e6340f3.title: USN-1835-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities

f448321fec56cf704d07b0e4d8243e9f4c991ca5.title: USN-1803-1: X.Org X server vulnerability
f448321fec56cf704d07b0e4d8243e9f4c991ca5.body: It was discovered that the X.Org X server did not properly clear inputevents in certain circumstances. A local attacker with physical accesscould use this flaw to capture keystrokes.

add56ae105b434089e6480d89f157b82313c6b58.title: USN-1939-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
add56ae105b434089e6480d89f157b82313c6b58.body: Michael S. Tsirkin discovered a flaw in how the Linux kernel's KVMsubsystem allocates memory slots for the guest's address space. A localuser could exploit this flaw to gain system privileges or obtain sensitiveinformation from kernel memory. (CVE-2013-1943)

d34719aa45843f6dcd7f3ae564963b4c0be0d734.title: USN-1801-1: curl vulnerability
d34719aa45843f6dcd7f3ae564963b4c0be0d734.body: YAMADA Yasuharu discovered that libcurl was vulnerable to a cookieleak when doing requests across domains with matching tails. curl didnot properly restrict cookies to domains and subdomains. If a user orautomated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted URL,an attacker could read cookie values stored by unrelated webservers.

40cfa66b94ab9b376a782632ed8fd8ad91d7a44b.title: USN-1895-1: libvirt vulnerability
40cfa66b94ab9b376a782632ed8fd8ad91d7a44b.body: It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled certain storage poolrequests. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause libvirt toconsume resources, resulting in a denial of service.

9982679dd7a734257dc5240c296872184c3a2399.title: USN-1817-1: libxml2 vulnerability
9982679dd7a734257dc5240c296872184c3a2399.body: It was discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled memory management whenparsing certain XML files. An attacker could use this flaw to cause libxml2to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or to possibly executearbitrary code.

a5e9372849b0f2a0d4e2298fc38319de2f06eddc.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered multiple security issues in various X.orglibraries and components. An attacker could use these issues to causeapplications to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code.

9f623f1bc06747d886f032a8d24df49d2f526dc2.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered multiple security issues in various X.orglibraries and components. An attacker could use these issues to causeapplications to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code.

0559a129cc48ca00f7a70b8cfa866d83489d0478.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered that Mesa incorrectly handled certain memorycalculations. An attacker could use this flaw to cause an application tocrash, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-1993)

ccb6b80200f9e59928ad2fbfbb926f5fa41fcc4f.title: USN-1871-1: xserver-xorg-video-openchrome vulnerability
