b6fee7ad1d0ac0824c1621497fc3c5663a4dc1f1.title: USN-1816-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
b6fee7ad1d0ac0824c1621497fc3c5663a4dc1f1.body: It was discovered that ClamAV would incorrectly parse a UPX-packedexecutable, leading to possible inappropriate heap reads. An attackercould use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial ofservice, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-2020)

065e3ae38241cf597786804e4b6bbecffc3c3a06.title: USN-1816-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
065e3ae38241cf597786804e4b6bbecffc3c3a06.body: It was discovered that ClamAV would incorrectly parse a PDF document,potentially writing beyond the size of a static array. An attacker coulduse this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service,or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-2021)

83c81536fc9b87da1cbe168101139790a4d5c745.title: USN-1948-1: httplib2 vulnerability
83c81536fc9b87da1cbe168101139790a4d5c745.body: It was discovered that httplib2 only validated SSL certificates on thefirst request to a connection, and didn't report validation failures onsubsequent requests. If a remote attacker were able to perform aman-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could possibly be exploited in certainscenarios to alter or compromise confidential information in applicationsthat used the httplib2 library.

5547536dc11dc36ba5a925f6bca3648f70585c21.title: USN-1820-1: gpsd vulnerability
5547536dc11dc36ba5a925f6bca3648f70585c21.body: It was discovered that gpsd incorrectly handled certain malformed GPS data.An attacker could use this issue to cause gpsd to crash, resulting in adenial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

a725ba35f3c3ec469cc72fea0eebffa98b1db14d.title: USN-1861-1: libxp vulnerability
a725ba35f3c3ec469cc72fea0eebffa98b1db14d.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered multiple security issues in various X.orglibraries and components. An attacker could use these issues to causeapplications to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code.

e145520d01497992297f9ac760eabeb06d61dd32.title: USN-1866-1: libxtst vulnerability
e145520d01497992297f9ac760eabeb06d61dd32.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered multiple security issues in various X.orglibraries and components. An attacker could use these issues to causeapplications to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code.

76732e67bb3c5d80feb0545eb4d6a0df14f5d536.title: USN-1855-1: libxcb vulnerability
76732e67bb3c5d80feb0545eb4d6a0df14f5d536.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered multiple security issues in various X.orglibraries and components. An attacker could use these issues to causeapplications to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code.

6e15377ba6def8dfec27e9f59712d113ab982f58.title: USN-2035-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
6e15377ba6def8dfec27e9f59712d113ab982f58.body: Vit Ondruch discovered that Ruby did not perform taint checking for certainfunctions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass certainintended restrictions. (CVE-2013-2065)

09a010e882e8b68430bce78fe571f2ad0d74fb1b.title: USN-1841-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
09a010e882e8b68430bce78fe571f2ad0d74fb1b.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled certain authenticationrequests. A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to inject arequest that would get executed with a victim's credentials. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 12.10.(CVE-2013-2067)

40bef44e6caed2bbb66e750e7ee144ed64774670.title: USN-1841-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
40bef44e6caed2bbb66e750e7ee144ed64774670.body: It was discovered that Tomcat sometimes exposed elements of a previousrequest to the current request. This could allow a remote attacker topossibly obtain sensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu12.10 and Ubuntu 13.04. (CVE-2013-2071)

229f8e59dba1da43fbdd91ab9d5ca22a5303e657.title: USN-1842-1: KDE-Libs vulnerability
229f8e59dba1da43fbdd91ab9d5ca22a5303e657.body: It was discovered that KIO would sometimes display web authenticationcredentials under certain error conditions. If a user were tricked intoopening a specially crafted web page, an attacker could potentially exploitthis to expose confidential information.

b711ec8a43f488f5c675896960e31fd399e5d265.title: USN-1828-1: Linux kernel (Quantal HWE) vulnerability
b711ec8a43f488f5c675896960e31fd399e5d265.body: An flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's perf_events interface. A localuser could exploit this flaw to escalate privileges on the system.

57aa0e1a38fb9759787b1c755fcaa5d6c160beb0.title: USN-1827-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
57aa0e1a38fb9759787b1c755fcaa5d6c160beb0.body: An flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's perf_events interface. A localuser could exploit this flaw to escalate privileges on the system.

096913cb70c4148beaca8743ea3853686b3bc2ce.title: USN-1826-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
096913cb70c4148beaca8743ea3853686b3bc2ce.body: An flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's perf_events interface. A localuser could exploit this flaw to escalate privileges on the system.

247a4dac43457a4406cb26e8bbec7c3602ed0634.title: USN-1825-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
247a4dac43457a4406cb26e8bbec7c3602ed0634.body: An flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's perf_events interface. A localuser could exploit this flaw to escalate privileges on the system.

ed369b4e122d52283766f80b8a83d8b9745f383e.title: USN-1836-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
ed369b4e122d52283766f80b8a83d8b9745f383e.body: An flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's perf_events interface. A localuser could exploit this flaw to escalate privileges on the system.(CVE-2013-2094)

9da353fda6ad1b118f9133213016cd01a97ed4ea.title: USN-1838-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
9da353fda6ad1b118f9133213016cd01a97ed4ea.body: An flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's perf_events interface. A localuser could exploit this flaw to escalate privileges on the system.(CVE-2013-2094)

145661af5bbba698616e54d77ab3a918332e76c8.title: USN-1831-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerability
145661af5bbba698616e54d77ab3a918332e76c8.body: Loganathan Parthipan discovered that Nova did not verify the size of QCOW2instance storage. An authenticated attacker could exploit this to cause adenial of service by creating an image with a large virtual size withlittle data, then filling the virtual disk.

a312db142532c5d665d8b41f8b81743088a3da5e.title: USN-1983-1: Python 2.7 vulnerabilities
a312db142532c5d665d8b41f8b81743088a3da5e.body: Florian Weimer discovered that Python incorrectly handled matching multiplewildcards in ssl certificate hostnames. An attacker could exploit this tocause Python to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. Thisissue only affected Ubuntu 13.04. (CVE-2013-2099)

76a282f2eab14ed75d40e0e7e714bc0331ac6989.title: USN-1985-1: Python 3.3 vulnerabilities
76a282f2eab14ed75d40e0e7e714bc0331ac6989.body: Florian Weimer discovered that Python incorrectly handled matching multiplewildcards in ssl certificate hostnames. An attacker could exploit this tocause Python to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service.(CVE-2013-2099)

3e5b2df6622ba9302c5c7e7f16dc6482ab8a43ad.title: USN-1984-1: Python 3.2 vulnerabilities
3e5b2df6622ba9302c5c7e7f16dc6482ab8a43ad.body: Florian Weimer discovered that Python incorrectly handled matching multiplewildcards in ssl certificate hostnames. An attacker could exploit this tocause Python to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service.(CVE-2013-2099)

4a010a99da7ef7de41af9c46cca95c0aaeb3db43.title: USN-1875-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerabilities
4a010a99da7ef7de41af9c46cca95c0aaeb3db43.body: Eoghan Glynn and Alex Meade discovered that Keystone did not properlyperform expiry checks for the PKI tokens used in Keystone. If Keystone weresetup to use PKI tokens, a previously authenticated user could continue touse a PKI token for longer than intended. This issue only affected Ubuntu12.10 which does not use PKI tokens by default. (CVE-2013-2104)

18aaed9d01653ad80de9a22cec76d7bc4a302d18.title: USN-1851-1: python-keystoneclient vulnerability
18aaed9d01653ad80de9a22cec76d7bc4a302d18.body: Eoghan Glynn and Alex Meade discovered that python-keystoneclient did notproperly perform expiry checks for the PKI tokens used in Keystone. IfKeystone were setup to use PKI tokens (the default in Ubuntu 13.04), apreviously authenticated user could continue to use a PKI token for longerthan intended.

3fc11aeed73783543ff7f0a638a82616228f67d5.title: USN-1872-1: PHP vulnerability
3fc11aeed73783543ff7f0a638a82616228f67d5.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled the quoted_printable_encodefunction. An attacker could use this flaw to cause PHP to crash, resultingin a denial of service, or to possibly execute arbitrary code.

2815d76ec9ffd39825033964a6953ef1f12f6c96.title: USN-1843-1: GnuTLS vulnerability
2815d76ec9ffd39825033964a6953ef1f12f6c96.body: It was discovered that GnuTLS incorrectly handled certain padding bytes. Aremote attacker could use this flaw to cause an application using GnuTLS tocrash, leading to a denial of service.

ce7308a729face204c905f9705fb6b52f49e513f.title: USN-1885-1: libKDcraw vulnerability
ce7308a729face204c905f9705fb6b52f49e513f.body: It was discovered that libKDcraw incorrectly handled broken full-colorimages. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing aspecially crafted raw image, applications linked against libKDcraw could bemade to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly executearbitrary code.

77370cf00bf9ec76a0d670f4fb3989e5429ffef2.title: USN-1884-1: LibRaw vulnerability
77370cf00bf9ec76a0d670f4fb3989e5429ffef2.body: It was discovered that LibRaw incorrectly handled broken full-color images.If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a speciallycrafted raw image, applications linked against LibRaw could be made tocrash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrarycode.

320f201c5fae6f2ca5a598ad4d24153a1ef6f130.title: USN-1938-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
320f201c5fae6f2ca5a598ad4d24153a1ef6f130.body: A flaw was discovered in the Xen subsystem of the Linux kernel when itprovides read-only access to a disk that supports TRIM or SCSI UNMAP to aguest OS. A privileged user in the guest OS could exploit this flaw todestroy data on the disk, even though the guest OS should not be able towrite to the disk. (CVE-2013-2140)

8eea0d5a062f6ea3a9fd10d2e233119b20107962.title: USN-1944-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8eea0d5a062f6ea3a9fd10d2e233119b20107962.body: A flaw was discovered in the Xen subsystem of the Linux kernel when itprovides read-only access to a disk that supports TRIM or SCSI UNMAP to aguest OS. A privileged user in the guest OS could exploit this flaw todestroy data on the disk, even though the guest OS should not be able towrite to the disk. (CVE-2013-2140)

a4063635e64a1701c607c45fb9a271f39dc5498b.body: Florian Weimer discovered that the Module::Signature perl moduleincorrectly loaded unknown ciphers from relative directories. An attackercould possibly use this flaw to execute arbitrary code when a signature isverified.

d361af96db5a0f35b47dd513530f3b72c8326d0d.body: Alexandru Cornea discovered that DBus incorrectly handled certain messages.A local attacker could use this issue to cause system services to crash,resulting in a denial of service.

271e1738402796634c3cd88d290fb5c26fb709d9.title: USN-2028-1: Apache XML Security for Java vulnerability
271e1738402796634c3cd88d290fb5c26fb709d9.body: James Forshaw discovered that Apache XML Security for Java incorrectlyvalidated CanonicalizationMethod parameters. An attacker could use thisflaw to spoof XML signatures.

a89c405b99d7f3d50ad5575f9349272350f0a66e.title: USN-1894-1: curl vulnerability
a89c405b99d7f3d50ad5575f9349272350f0a66e.body: Timo Sirainen discovered that libcurl incorrectly handled memory whenparsing URL encoded strings. An attacker could possibly use this issue tocause libcurl to crash, leading to a denial of service, or executearbitrary code.

6df52e2e96931a84128d6326e2a6c8f260c468f6.title: USN-1889-1: HAProxy vulnerability
6df52e2e96931a84128d6326e2a6c8f260c468f6.body: David Torgerson discovered that HAProxy incorrectly parsed certain HTTPheaders. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause HAProxy to stopresponding, resulting in a denial of service.

9595895cd72efe5229a494848b42535e976c4b42.title: USN-2029-1: Apache Commons FileUpload vulnerability
9595895cd72efe5229a494848b42535e976c4b42.body: It was discovered that Apache Commons FileUpload incorrectly handled filenames with NULL bytes in serialized instances. An attacker could use thisissue to possibly write to arbitrary files.

588af5db15457531f139c204d38d5ab8b86b2d48.body: Martin Carpenter discovered that pt_chown in the GNU C Library did not properly check permissions for tty files. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges or expose sensitive information. (CVE-2013-2207, CVE-2016-2856)

9ec87afc36e2a36bcabf48523d90b434b09f9f7d.title: USN-1783-1: Bind vulnerability
9ec87afc36e2a36bcabf48523d90b434b09f9f7d.body: Matthew Horsfall discovered that Bind incorrectly handled regularexpression checking. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause Bind toconsume an excessive amount of memory, possibly resulting in a denial ofservice. This issue was corrected by disabling RDATA regular expressionsyntax checking.

4980ae4ef1bd0e80f74bb0481af708063b134faa.title: USN-1790-1: Libav vulnerabilities
4980ae4ef1bd0e80f74bb0481af708063b134faa.body: It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformed mediafiles. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted media file, anattacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possiblyexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking theprogram.

2cc4907a2eda3786905c5dcd28b2bc3b13925e7d.body: Mathias Krause discovered a memory leak in the Linux kernel's crypto reportAPI. A local user with CAP_NET_ADMIN could exploit this leak to examinesome of the kernel's stack memory. (CVE-2013-2546)

3bd7cb889b0eb351ad34894338ee3fb2c68a4849.body: It was discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled documents that endabruptly. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening aspecially crafted document, an attacker could possibly cause libxml2 tocrash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-2877)

b7df478663c789fa5b231ba81adb1f91e4a7f50d.title: USN-1886-1: Puppet vulnerability
b7df478663c789fa5b231ba81adb1f91e4a7f50d.body: It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled YAML payloads. Anattacker on an untrusted client could use this issue to execute arbitrarycode on the master.

106a7da4357a0fa9ad41b5e29b1e7549765e32f1.title: USN-1902-1: Ruby vulnerability
106a7da4357a0fa9ad41b5e29b1e7549765e32f1.body: William (B.J.) Snow Orvis discovered that Ruby incorrectly verified thehostname in SSL certificates. An attacker could trick Ruby into trusting arogue server certificate, which was signed by a trusted certificateauthority, to perform a man-in-the-middle attack.

2b10a059a4b8870a2f5716671b4c5fda680b29c7.title: USN-2004-1: python-glanceclient vulnerability
2b10a059a4b8870a2f5716671b4c5fda680b29c7.body: Thomas Leaman discovered that the Python client library for Glance did notproperly verify SSL certificates. A remote attacker could exploit this toperform a man in the middle attack.

6b591f58bb710f964adccef220fee1ca264dd1e6.title: USN-1905-1: PHP vulnerabilities
6b591f58bb710f964adccef220fee1ca264dd1e6.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled the xml_parse_into_structfunction. If a PHP application parsed untrusted XML, an attacker could usethis flaw with a specially-crafted XML document to cause PHP to crash,resulting in a denial of service, or to possibly execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2013-4113)

176f1bac2264b65907a1f41159ca76263fdbe842.title: USN-2755-1: Cyrus SASL vulnerability
176f1bac2264b65907a1f41159ca76263fdbe842.body: It was discovered that Cyrus SASL incorrectly handled certain invalidpassword salts. An attacker could use this issue to cause Cyrus SASL tocrash, resulting in a denial of service.

8addc753e7db5275af7d755b9e8f7a55779b3c7a.title: USN-1966-1: Samba vulnerability
8addc753e7db5275af7d755b9e8f7a55779b3c7a.body: Jeremy Allison discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain extendedattribute lists. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Sambato hang, resulting in a denial of service.

ebd43f8c3b08fcde9b24fdece7f7683c9c216c99.body: David Gibson discovered that SPICE incorrectly handled certain networkerrors. An attacker could use this issue to cause the SPICE server tocrash, resulting in a denial of service.

cfb74416b17cb4d11276950bb6aae75a06416722.body: Peter Portante discovered that Swift did not properly handle requests withold X-Timestamp values. An authenticated attacker could exploit this tocause a denial of service via disk consumption.

22d82317d6e3532c8e2b906f972e0d36757cd221.body: Hannes Frederic Sowa discovered a flaw in setsockopt UDP_CORK option in theLinux kernel's IPv6 stack. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause adenial of service (system crash). (CVE-2013-4162)

1e3718f30b71815dc772dd00a97113e15290832b.title: USN-2035-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
1e3718f30b71815dc772dd00a97113e15290832b.body: Charlie Somerville discovered that Ruby incorrectly handled floating pointnumber conversion. An attacker could possibly use this issue with anapplication that converts text to floating point numbers to cause theapplication to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly executearbitrary code. (CVE-2013-4164)

fabd1a30282490683ad3d29c6275b9c34cc75984.title: USN-2005-1: Cinder vulnerabilities
fabd1a30282490683ad3d29c6275b9c34cc75984.body: Grant Murphy discovered that Cinder would allow XML entity processing. Aremote unauthenticated attacker could exploit this using the Cinder API tocause a denial of service via resource exhaustion. (CVE-2013-4179,CVE-2013-4202)

0176ba1d1c854d6e548af1adc3cd69b691ca2a5d.title: USN-2005-1: Cinder vulnerabilities
0176ba1d1c854d6e548af1adc3cd69b691ca2a5d.body: Rongze Zhu discovered that the Cinder LVM driver did not zero out datawhen deleting snapshots. This could expose sensitive information toauthenticated users when subsequent servers use the volume. (CVE-2013-4183)

8452f91dfeeaaf27acc2897448d2f0ecc7c19f33.title: USN-1971-1: Linux kernel (Raring HWE) vulnerabilities
8452f91dfeeaaf27acc2897448d2f0ecc7c19f33.body: A memory leak was discovered in the user namespace facility of the Linuxkernel. A local user could cause a denial of service (memory consumption)via the CLONE_NEWUSER unshare call. (CVE-2013-4205)

64dfa4ed962ff91a7847678f48b4baab94ab679f.title: USN-1974-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
64dfa4ed962ff91a7847678f48b4baab94ab679f.body: A memory leak was discovered in the user namespace facility of the Linuxkernel. A local user could cause a denial of service (memory consumption)via the CLONE_NEWUSER unshare call. (CVE-2013-4205)

cbf4b494d79eb5cf2d3d8ccaa958664da050b5a5.title: USN-1991-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
cbf4b494d79eb5cf2d3d8ccaa958664da050b5a5.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library readdir_r() function incorrectlyhandled crafted NTFS or CIFS images. An attacker could use this issue tocause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2013-4237)

750eb0efda36dc348cde9f69286d166297c25616.title: USN-1982-1: Python 2.6 vulnerability
750eb0efda36dc348cde9f69286d166297c25616.body: Ryan Sleevi discovered that Python did not properly handle certificateswith NULL characters in the Subject Alternative Name field. An attackercould exploit this to perform a man in the middle attack to view sensitiveinformation or alter encrypted communications.

afd5fef81d489518e87b25702f3e2251c3a6e09a.title: USN-1923-1: GnuPG, Libgcrypt vulnerability
afd5fef81d489518e87b25702f3e2251c3a6e09a.body: Yuval Yarom and Katrina Falkner discovered a timing-based information leak,known as Flush+Reload, that could be used to trace execution in programs.GnuPG and Libgcrypt followed different execution paths based on key-relateddata, which could be used to expose the contents of private keys.

600259c4ec9fc081c1256cf7ba2373ca6c266cce.title: USN-1937-1: PHP vulnerability
600259c4ec9fc081c1256cf7ba2373ca6c266cce.body: It was discovered that PHP did not properly handle certificates with NULLcharacters in the Subject Alternative Name field. An attacker could exploitthis to perform a man in the middle attack to view sensitive information oralter encrypted communications.

f98300166bf3ace14625cce149a5f16d4253fdd7.body: Vince Weaver discovered a flaw in the perf subsystem of the Linux kernel onARM platforms. A local user could exploit this flaw to gain privileges orcause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2013-4254)

45bf0463a81e0424e0eaf689b57c1d3fa99417ab.title: USN-1986-1: Network Audio System (NAS) vulnerabilities
45bf0463a81e0424e0eaf689b57c1d3fa99417ab.body: Hamid Zamani discovered multiple security issues in the Network AudioSystem (NAS) server. An attacker could possibly use these issues to cause adenial of service or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-4256, CVE-2013-4257)

7efac0aa7ad8a07da3a9a5632531cc7e107bff61.title: USN-2049-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7efac0aa7ad8a07da3a9a5632531cc7e107bff61.body: Miroslav Vadkerti discovered a flaw in how the permissions for networksysctls are handled in the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local user couldexploit this flaw to have privileged access to files in /proc/sys/net/.(CVE-2013-4270)

296c3b0bccb97678f038d8aadb81ca7e6367e34d.title: USN-2027-1: SPICE vulnerability
296c3b0bccb97678f038d8aadb81ca7e6367e34d.body: Tomas Jamrisko discovered that SPICE incorrectly handled long passwords inSPICE tickets. An attacker could use this issue to cause the SPICE serverto crash, resulting in a denial of service.

e02e729ba48fb3d02615518add4bd89b553bc159.title: USN-2130-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
e02e729ba48fb3d02615518add4bd89b553bc159.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled certain inconsistentHTTP headers. A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to conductrequest smuggling attacks. (CVE-2013-4286)

cb2168f284a5cb72be2c48127966301a01e800c0.title: USN-2002-1: Keystone vulnerabilities
cb2168f284a5cb72be2c48127966301a01e800c0.body: Kieran Spear discovered that Keystone did not properly verify PKI tokenswhen performing revocation when using the memcache and KVS backends. Anauthenticated attacker could exploit this to bypass intended accessrestrictions. (CVE-2013-4294)

193f5dc8ec26a61279d19a68ad0eff0d87e1e71b.title: USN-1954-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
193f5dc8ec26a61279d19a68ad0eff0d87e1e71b.body: It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled certain memory statsrequests. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause libvirt tocrash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.10, and Ubuntu 13.04. (CVE-2013-4296)

036df2a3f2a42161cd97773ff9f94e493087bf5e.title: USN-1949-1: ImageMagick vulnerability
036df2a3f2a42161cd97773ff9f94e493087bf5e.body: It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled decoding GIF imagecomments. If a user or automated system using ImageMagick were tricked intoopening a specially crafted GIF image, an attacker could exploit this tocause a denial of service or possibly execute code with the privileges ofthe user invoking the program.

40d0e6693a3923b9523c26808d28b76a15e54599.title: USN-2043-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities

587d6ecabc3b919e9189c2509d36c93fa1c36a77.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel did not properly enforce rlimitsfor file descriptors sent over UNIX domain sockets. A local attacker coulduse this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2013-4312)

An attacker couldexploit this to perform a man in the middle attack to view sensitiveinformation or alter encrypted communications.

1fbfcfe8280a37a82b94e397a01480cbc95250fa.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled certain requestssubmitted using chunked transfer encoding. A remote attacker could use thisflaw to cause the Tomcat server to stop responding, resulting in a denialof service. (CVE-2013-4322)

40d1bd19980d9e30d7ee430956259874319c5bf9.body: Anton Johansson discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled certain invalidTLS handshakes. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL tocrash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-4353)

5d4fd08c91d4213621315d182414bb32c70ced68.body: It was discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled Xen disks. A local guestcould possibly use this flaw to consume resources, resulting in a denial ofservice. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.10 and Ubuntu 13.10.(CVE-2013-4375)

4b21f21d957352e878b292b71c92e69e5fe65c37.body: Sibiao Luo discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled device hot-unplugging.A local user could possibly use this flaw to cause a denial of service.This issue only affected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2013-4377)

aaaa13e66f3a0f94fa04adf4a04813b4efbdd417.title: USN-2026-1: libvirt vulnerability
aaaa13e66f3a0f94fa04adf4a04813b4efbdd417.body: It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly checked privileges when thevirConnectDomainXMLToNative API function was used. An attacker couldpossibly use this flaw to gain write privileges, contrary to expectedbehaviour.

e71b1d7c2896cd5c718d49232d749dd9e7a348c5.title: USN-1987-1: GnuPG vulnerabilities
e71b1d7c2896cd5c718d49232d749dd9e7a348c5.body: Taylor R Campbell discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled certain OpenPGPmessages. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing aspecially-crafted message, GnuPG could consume resources, resulting in adenial of service. (CVE-2013-4402)

3c2cd4ef524f7f7d6776be38050b9b2f69b37679.title: USN-2054-1: Samba vulnerabilities
3c2cd4ef524f7f7d6776be38050b9b2f69b37679.body: Stefan Metzmacher and Michael Adam discovered that Samba incorrectlyhandled DCE-RPC fragment length fields. A remote attacker could use thisissue to cause Samba to crash, resulting in a denial of service, orpossibly execute arbitrary code as the root user. (CVE-2013-4408)

6a347c55c0b1dbfa9ae8e07fe13e4ff33e04e48b.title: USN-2003-1: Glance vulnerability
6a347c55c0b1dbfa9ae8e07fe13e4ff33e04e48b.body: Stuart McLaren discovered that Glance did not properly enforce the'download_image' policy for cached images. An authenticated user couldexploit this to obtain sensitive information in an image protected by thissetting.

37b01375289e8341fba14a8ae17a55a677e5fc57.title: USN-2012-1: Light Display Manager vulnerability
37b01375289e8341fba14a8ae17a55a677e5fc57.body: Christian Prim discovered that Light Display Manager incorrectly appliedthe AppArmor security profile when the Guest account is used. A localattacker could use this issue to possibly gain access to sensitiveinformation.

7d2390973201e3c573b77b4ebde7f74521eaf437.title: USN-2247-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerabilities
7d2390973201e3c573b77b4ebde7f74521eaf437.body: Bernhard M. Wiedemann and Pedraig Brady discovered that OpenStack Nova didnot properly verify the virtual size of a QCOW2 images. A remoteauthenticated attacker could exploit this to create a denial of service viadisk consumption. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.(CVE-2013-4463, CVE-2013-4469)

d7823a45b9456ac0e4bd447d525a6be704062241.title: USN-2043-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d7823a45b9456ac0e4bd447d525a6be704062241.body: Hannes Frederic Sowa discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's UDPFragmentation Offload (UFO). An unprivileged local user could exploit thisflaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gainadministrative privileges. (CVE-2013-4470)

b3642b159cf738d42c004e0aeb6cccf79fb4cece.title: USN-2958-1: poppler vulnerabilities
b3642b159cf738d42c004e0aeb6cccf79fb4cece.body: It was discovered that the poppler pdfseparate tool incorrectly handledcertain filenames. A local attacker could use this issue to cause the toolto crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrarycode. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-4473,CVE-2013-4474)

78948d39754b9f313347c7cd673c2ba6b3e3b78a.title: USN-2054-1: Samba vulnerabilities
78948d39754b9f313347c7cd673c2ba6b3e3b78a.body: Hemanth Thummala discovered that Samba incorrectly handled filepermissions when vfs_streams_depot or vfs_streams_xattr were enabled. Aremote attacker could use this issue to bypass intended restrictions.(CVE-2013-4475)

1fb7d08bb018f8ac16884eeb9898f3f185121606.title: USN-2034-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerability
1fb7d08bb018f8ac16884eeb9898f3f185121606.body: Brant Knudson discovered a logic error in the LDAP backend in Keystonewhere removing a role on a tenant for a user who does not have that rolewould instead add the role to the user. An authenticated user could usethis to gain privileges. Ubuntu is not configured to use the LDAP Keystonebackend by default.

454306a702876485dae5e1eca945837067b3f0b1.body: Multiple integer overflow flaws were discovered in the Alchemy LCD frame-buffer drivers in the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local user couldexploit this flaw to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2013-4511)

74100fd3314fafa97570a1b0240579c5db1d1bbc.body: Michael S. Tsirkin, Anthony Liguori, and Michael Roth discovered multipleissues with QEMU state loading after migration. An attacker able to modifythe state data could use these issues to cause a denial of service, orpossibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-4148, CVE-2013-4149,CVE-2013-4150, CVE-2013-4151, CVE-2013-4526, CVE-2013-4527, CVE-2013-4529,CVE-2013-4530, CVE-2013-4531, CVE-2013-4532, CVE-2013-4533, CVE-2013-4534,CVE-2013-4535, CVE-2013-4536, CVE-2013-4537, CVE-2013-4538, CVE-2013-4539,CVE-2013-4540, CVE-2013-4541, CVE-2013-4542, CVE-2013-6399, CVE-2014-0182,CVE-2014-3461)

506e96f7290b6041496734523625992d3508bade.title: USN-2182-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
506e96f7290b6041496734523625992d3508bade.body: Michael S. Tsirkin discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled vmxnet3devices. A local guest could possibly use this issue to cause a denial ofservice, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host. This issue onlyapplied to Ubuntu 13.10 and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-4544)

10fd58b497105f954fb86eed0963644c6316ce4f.title: USN-2048-1: curl vulnerability
10fd58b497105f954fb86eed0963644c6316ce4f.body: Scott Cantor discovered that libcurl incorrectly verified CN and SAN namefields when digital signature verification was disabled. When libcurl isbeing used in this uncommon way by specific applications, an attacker couldexploit this to perform a man in the middle attack to view sensitiveinformation or alter encrypted communications.

18b747792eeab4bd384b97981818c7b18b45fd34.title: USN-2014-1: OpenSSH vulnerability
18b747792eeab4bd384b97981818c7b18b45fd34.body: Markus Friedl discovered that OpenSSH incorrectly handled memory when theAES-GCM cipher was used. A remote authenticated attacker could use thisissue to execute arbitrary code as their user, possibly bypassingshell or command restrictions.

a85f24d2cead47357cdf6a76c220b43be267e772.title: USN-2057-1: Qt vulnerability
a85f24d2cead47357cdf6a76c220b43be267e772.body: It was discovered that QXmlSimpleReader in Qt incorrectly handled XMLentity expansion. An attacker could use this flaw to cause Qt applicationsto consume large amounts of resources, resulting in a denial of service.

2a44a4fe64db131bca439d08a1096d43033673ab.body: Saran Neti reported a flaw in the ipv6 UDP Fragmentation Offload (UFI) inthe Linux kernel. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause adenial of service (panic). (CVE-2013-4563)

cdd69f949dcd6ae2a0d639f98d8d449f5a48b2e4.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's IP Virtual Server (IP_VS)support. A local user with the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability could exploit thisflaw to gain additional administrative privileges. (CVE-2013-4588)

4b3423541d8923ce4befce55218357cac341ac0d.body: A flaw in the handling of memory regions of the kernel virtual machine(KVM) subsystem was discovered. A local user with the ability to assign adevice could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption). (CVE-2013-4592)

1006a318e3db0f9f7d0edff6a282cfd1a315cad5.title: USN-1905-1: PHP vulnerabilities
1006a318e3db0f9f7d0edff6a282cfd1a315cad5.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled the jdtojewish function. Anattacker could use this flaw to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denialof service. (CVE-2013-4635)

15d474215f6ac6485ef02eb9f2b4aad25e1a1844.title: USN-1906-1: File Roller vulnerability
15d474215f6ac6485ef02eb9f2b4aad25e1a1844.body: Yorick Koster discovered that File Roller incorrectly sanitized paths. If auser were tricked into extracting a specially-crafted archive, an attackercould create and overwrite files outside of the extraction directory.

7bab2b33aa475433e34c81bdfb1baeaaae1f1f36.title: USN-2087-1: NSPR vulnerability
7bab2b33aa475433e34c81bdfb1baeaaae1f1f36.body: It was discovered that NSPR incorrectly handled certain malformed X.509certificates. A remote attacker could use a crafted X.509 certificate tocause NSPR to crash, leading to a denial of service, or possibly executearbitrary code.

67d96eab9f2938285e85c204989627d852c8a779.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
67d96eab9f2938285e85c204989627d852c8a779.body: Ben Turner, Bobby Holley, Jesse Ruderman, Christian Holler and ChristophDiehl discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user weretricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker couldpotentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingFirefox. (CVE-2013-5609, CVE-2013-5610)

e45963157766bd16c71af3ec12b50231e402fb2b.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
e45963157766bd16c71af3ec12b50231e402fb2b.body: Masato Kinugawa discovered that pages with missing character set encodinginformation can inherit character encodings across navigations fromanother domain. An attacker could potentially exploit this to conductcross-site scripting attacks. (CVE-2013-5612)

eeb10367485ddaf24067454ff77a9a85c5e7dd32.title: USN-2053-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
eeb10367485ddaf24067454ff77a9a85c5e7dd32.body: Tyson Smith, Jesse Schwartzentruber and Atte Kettunen discovered ause-after-free in functions for synthetic mouse movement handling. If auser had enabled scripting, an attacker could potentially exploit thisto cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrarycode with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2013-5613)

56e48d78dace41b818b3771e232b2d4dd1bbe480.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
56e48d78dace41b818b3771e232b2d4dd1bbe480.body: Tyson Smith, Jesse Schwartzentruber and Atte Kettunen discovered ause-after-free in functions for synthetic mouse movement handling. Anattacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking Firefox. (CVE-2013-5613)

4c07caa559addcaca150d4b2419299f92937064c.title: USN-2053-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
4c07caa559addcaca150d4b2419299f92937064c.body: Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber discovered a use-after-free inevent listeners. If a user had enabled scripting, an attacker couldpotentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via applicationcrash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invokingThunderbird. (CVE-2013-5616)

7c21a7078ea27ec6695f707fe6efe8ddbff7de9a.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
7c21a7078ea27ec6695f707fe6efe8ddbff7de9a.body: Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber discovered a use-after-free inevent listeners. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause adenial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code withthe privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2013-5616)

a810fca2d6766635358b93376af41ca0974c3e60.title: USN-2053-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
a810fca2d6766635358b93376af41ca0974c3e60.body: A use-after-free was discovered in the table editing interface. Anattacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2013-5618)

67b2b865abe5bfab57d01881e67b305faa5978af.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
67b2b865abe5bfab57d01881e67b305faa5978af.body: A use-after-free was discovered in the table editing interface. Anattacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service viaapplication crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of theuser invoking Firefox. (CVE-2013-5618)

5818de5fe3583cd32cfe5668a1fe65a1a22c2baf.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
5818de5fe3583cd32cfe5668a1fe65a1a22c2baf.body: Dan Gohman discovered that binary search algorithms in Spidermonkeyused arithmetic prone to overflow in several places. However, thisis issue not believed to be exploitable. (CVE-2013-5619)

6a74ca00c8e32dba18fbc47dd10ad1c190f4486a.title: USN-1954-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
6a74ca00c8e32dba18fbc47dd10ad1c190f4486a.body: It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled certain bitmapoperations. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause libvirt tocrash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu13.04. (CVE-2013-5651)

676f54f349ab0e584ae5ed21653fd592aa10183a.title: USN-2523-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
676f54f349ab0e584ae5ed21653fd592aa10183a.body: Martin Holst Swende discovered that the mod_headers module allowed HTTPtrailers to replace HTTP headers during request processing. A remoteattacker could possibly use this issue to bypass RequestHeaders directives.(CVE-2013-5704)

97dd357d373241f656447014cc84ab0adedf2ada.title: USN-1980-1: Vino vulnerability
97dd357d373241f656447014cc84ab0adedf2ada.body: Jonathan Claudius discovered that Vino incorrectly handled closing invalidconnections. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Vino toconsume resources, resulting in a denial of service.

a07de88d1d916f2c5c7da65d6fcdf6216ddeeac7.title: USN-2090-1: Munin vulnerabilities
a07de88d1d916f2c5c7da65d6fcdf6216ddeeac7.body: Christoph Biedl discovered that Munin incorrectly handled certainmultigraph data. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Munin toconsume resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-6048)

5165263ba6b9d444f70a449cd77625b0dbad7b66.title: USN-2067-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
5165263ba6b9d444f70a449cd77625b0dbad7b66.body: Catalin Marinas reported a flaw in the get_user and put_user API functionsin the Linux kernel on ARM platforms. An unprivileged local user couldexploit this flaw to gain administrator privileges. (CVE-2013-6282)

787be11f673be0b5df133d3eec47030ebe7026db.title: USN-2090-1: Munin vulnerabilities
787be11f673be0b5df133d3eec47030ebe7026db.body: Christoph Biedl discovered that Munin incorrectly handled certainmultigraph service names. A remote attacker could use this issue to causeMunin to stop data collection, resulting in a denial of service.(CVE-2013-6359)

b4eba8a6bbb0c7556cdda6080cf6fe9fe00bb732.title: USN-2110-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities

23a33323a0273f6ed31cfda5e39e8cf3386f2f67.title: USN-2108-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities

e8ea7a1c6e25470503769d7a66fe97d458cd7707.title: USN-2107-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e8ea7a1c6e25470503769d7a66fe97d458cd7707.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's compat ioctls for AdaptecAACRAID scsi raid devices. An unprivileged local user could sendadministrative commands to these devices potentially compromising the datastored on the device. (CVE-2013-6383)

3302748c81d69617313af5c2b4027cef73631abf.title: USN-2061-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerability
3302748c81d69617313af5c2b4027cef73631abf.body: Steven Hardy discovered that Keystone did not properly enforce trusts whenusing the ec2tokens API. An authenticated attacker could exploit this toretrieve a token not scoped to the trust and elevate privileges to thetrustor's roles.

5938d7d6c6fcae7f17411e99dd9e20a606a4ad10.title: USN-2098-1: LibYAML vulnerability
5938d7d6c6fcae7f17411e99dd9e20a606a4ad10.body: Florian Weimer discovered that LibYAML incorrectly handled certain largeyaml documents. An attacker could use this issue to cause LibYAML to crash,resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

36cfc00e5e06d70dee55757606893804cdace810.title: USN-2676-1: NBD vulnerabilities
36cfc00e5e06d70dee55757606893804cdace810.body: It was discovered that NBD incorrectly handled IP address matching. Aremote attacker could use this issue with an IP address that has a partialmatch and bypass access restrictions. This issue only affectedUbuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-6410)

6bd3476e2d1365a1d093173bc504bfd545a4bdce.title: USN-2055-1: PHP vulnerabilities
6bd3476e2d1365a1d093173bc504bfd545a4bdce.body: Stefan Esser discovered that PHP incorrectly parsed certificates. Anattacker could use a malformed certificate to cause PHP to crash, resultingin a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-6420)

9401dbc04737df13dc3e8ff71dac22129fe84064.title: USN-2058-1: curl vulnerability
9401dbc04737df13dc3e8ff71dac22129fe84064.body: Marc Deslauriers discovered that libcurl incorrectly verified CN and SANname fields when digital signature verification was disabled in the GnuTLSbackend. When libcurl is being used in this uncommon way by specificapplications, an attacker could exploit this to perform a man in the middleattack to view sensitive information or alter encrypted communications.

fe7caa2efa8ad3aee89c0afe3bee8c97770456c6.title: USN-2500-1: X.Org X server vulnerabilities
fe7caa2efa8ad3aee89c0afe3bee8c97770456c6.body: It was discovered that the X.Org X server incorrectly handled certaintrapezoids. An attacker able to connect to an X server, either locally orremotely, could use this issue to possibly crash the server. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-6424)

37afd2d137a33e5ed55dff1588ed91f3c38f49db.title: USN-2085-1: HPLIP vulnerabilities
37afd2d137a33e5ed55dff1588ed91f3c38f49db.body: It was discovered that HPLIP contained an upgrade tool that would downloadcode in an unsafe fashion. If a remote attacker were able to perform aman-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to execute arbitrarycode. (CVE-2013-6427)

f6475d2901b29fa756d99d16e78c30d3f190268f.title: USN-2255-1: OpenStack Neutron vulnerabilities
f6475d2901b29fa756d99d16e78c30d3f190268f.body: Darragh O'Reilly discovered that the Ubuntu packaging for OpenStack Neutrondid not properly set up its sudo configuration. If a different flaw wasfound in OpenStack Neutron, this vulnerability could be used to escalateprivileges. (CVE-2013-6433)

8407165865c3227809d0f460b77ff1f2e8e89e1d.title: USN-2093-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
8407165865c3227809d0f460b77ff1f2e8e89e1d.body: Martin Kletzander discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled readingmemory tunables from LXC guests. A local user could possibly use this flawto cause libvirtd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issueonly affected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2013-6436)

ee9dbc51ee1e54dfac1936e4edfcb8b563c8c709.title: USN-2152-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
ee9dbc51ee1e54dfac1936e4edfcb8b563c8c709.body: Ning Zhang & Amin Tora discovered that the mod_dav module incorrectlyhandled whitespace characters in CDATA sections. A remote attacker coulduse this issue to cause the server to stop responding, resulting in adenial of service. (CVE-2013-6438)

fb8041a0938ee7af388cd6c4b5c9437ae61f10f5.title: USN-2104-1: LXC vulnerability
fb8041a0938ee7af388cd6c4b5c9437ae61f10f5.body: Florian Sagar discovered that the LXC sshd template set incorrect mountpermissions. An attacker could possibly use this flaw to cause privilegeescalation on the host.

9e07e170db4b4478a4c98d72f1ac1067a740e0cc.title: USN-2079-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
9e07e170db4b4478a4c98d72f1ac1067a740e0cc.body: Ron Barber discovered that OpenSSL used an incorrect data structure toobtain a version number. A remote attacker could use this issue to causeOpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-6449)

22315c630260928a77e59d418dbd4e41a1bd61b8.title: USN-2079-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
22315c630260928a77e59d418dbd4e41a1bd61b8.body: Dmitry Sobinov discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled certain DTLSretransmissions. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL tocrash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-6450)

7a8bfeb2861355411b375993e89a6acb7cd59862.title: USN-2093-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
7a8bfeb2861355411b375993e89a6acb7cd59862.body: Dario Faggioli discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled the libxldriver. A local user could possibly use this flaw to cause libvirtd tocrash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrarycode. This issue only affected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2013-6457)

9d69044a7553998376742e3362a296838f0e5686.title: USN-2078-1: libXfont vulnerability
9d69044a7553998376742e3362a296838f0e5686.body: It was discovered that libXfont incorrectly handled certain malformed BDFfonts. An attacker could use a specially crafted font file to causelibXfont to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code in order to gainprivileges. The default compiler options for affected releases shouldreduce the vulnerability to a denial of service.

518b41e9e23f605a8450ad30cc892cfa45de2669.title: USN-2143-1: cups-filters vulnerabilities
518b41e9e23f605a8450ad30cc892cfa45de2669.body: Florian Weimer discovered that cups-filters incorrectly handled memoryin the urftopdf filter. An attacker could possibly use this issue toexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the lp user. This issue onlyaffected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2013-6473)

0e61d01d320697d30beb00c0d1be0afa4e4d8cf4.title: USN-2143-1: cups-filters vulnerabilities
0e61d01d320697d30beb00c0d1be0afa4e4d8cf4.body: Florian Weimer discovered that cups-filters incorrectly handled memoryin the pdftoopvp filter. An attacker could possibly use this issue toexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the lp user. (CVE-2013-6474,CVE-2013-6475)

1dc12632eb2345770ed41d3e45c9eef4ae0f8534.title: USN-2144-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
1dc12632eb2345770ed41d3e45c9eef4ae0f8534.body: Florian Weimer discovered that the pdftoopvp filter bundled in the CUPSpackage incorrectly handled memory. An attacker could possibly use thisissue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the lp user.(CVE-2013-6474, CVE-2013-6475)

bc2432875452982e3f175472ee7782904625f3d0.title: USN-2144-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
bc2432875452982e3f175472ee7782904625f3d0.body: Florian Weimer discovered that the pdftoopvp filter bundled in the CUPSpackage did not restrict driver directories. An attacker could possibly usethis issue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the lp user.(CVE-2013-6476)

b3a237a0ed2428e04eef33b9cec258d82656e52b.title: USN-2143-1: cups-filters vulnerabilities
b3a237a0ed2428e04eef33b9cec258d82656e52b.body: Florian Weimer discovered that cups-filters did not restrict driverdirectories in in the pdftoopvp filter. An attacker could possibly use thisissue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the lp user.(CVE-2013-6476)

44cce14f59872b9aea4dd6872036996c987a4c78.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
44cce14f59872b9aea4dd6872036996c987a4c78.body: Jaime Breva Ribes discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled the XMPPprotocol. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash,resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-6477)

b1d5708231350f6a5ccaf3436e6c6889860610bb.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
b1d5708231350f6a5ccaf3436e6c6889860610bb.body: It was discovered that Pidgin incorrecly handled long URLs. A remoteattacker could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in adenial of service. (CVE-2013-6478)

8ab1810fcc7d1819bb7a4c1813a529acac5275f5.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
8ab1810fcc7d1819bb7a4c1813a529acac5275f5.body: Jacob Appelbaum discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled certain HTTPresponses. A malicious remote server or a man in the middle could use thisissue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in a denial of service.(CVE-2013-6479)

708219d404fd875772b36727070a3dd88484594f.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
708219d404fd875772b36727070a3dd88484594f.body: Daniel Atallah discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled the Yahoo!protocol. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash,resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2013-6481)

2bcc210f40cfd12fb8ced8985905415f74af1655.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
2bcc210f40cfd12fb8ced8985905415f74af1655.body: Fabian Yamaguchi and Christian Wressnegger discovered that Pidginincorrectly handled the MSN protocol. A remote attacker could use thisissue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in a denial of service.(CVE-2013-6482)

19f38278de8f9f37cfe47fa312045dc23acffcbe.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
19f38278de8f9f37cfe47fa312045dc23acffcbe.body: Fabian Yamaguchi and Christian Wressnegger discovered that Pidginincorrectly handled XMPP iq replies. A remote attacker could use thisissue to spoof messages. (CVE-2013-6483)

29b94a6c67361d7b304a77aded1d7206d00a2de4.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
29b94a6c67361d7b304a77aded1d7206d00a2de4.body: It was discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled STUN server responses. Aremote attacker could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting ina denial of service. (CVE-2013-6484)

bf240a2784c2d70c97bf926935fec9e52e7e9858.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
bf240a2784c2d70c97bf926935fec9e52e7e9858.body: Matt Jones discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled certain chunked HTTPresponses. A malicious remote server or a man in the middle could use thisissue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in a denial of service, orpossibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-6485)

e8da89aff5ff28ed756457735e3eb2bfa65251b3.title: USN-2101-1: libgadu vulnerability
e8da89aff5ff28ed756457735e3eb2bfa65251b3.body: Yves Younan and Ryan Pentney discovered that libgadu incorrectly handledcertain Gadu-Gadu HTTP messages. A malicious remote server or a man in themiddle could use this issue to cause applications using libgadu to crash,resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

bf86babf607eedb28ec581b1809268aa2e2c8e65.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
bf86babf607eedb28ec581b1809268aa2e2c8e65.body: Yves Younan and Ryan Pentney discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handledcertain Gadu-Gadu HTTP messages. A malicious remote server or a man in themiddle could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in a denialof service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-6487)

44da8cacd01d14b55a10e977ee4b251947a14d65.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
44da8cacd01d14b55a10e977ee4b251947a14d65.body: Yves Younan and Pawel Janic discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled MXitemoticons. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash,resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.(CVE-2013-6489)

6e457de6c5fe1d135be611fe12e23da5ba3839d3.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
6e457de6c5fe1d135be611fe12e23da5ba3839d3.body: Yves Younan discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled SIMPLE headers. Aremote attacker could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting ina denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-6490)

9d3c0b8b4754ef1523105e35edb82193f6fe14af.title: USN-2247-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerabilities
9d3c0b8b4754ef1523105e35edb82193f6fe14af.body: JuanFra Rodriguez Cardoso discovered that OpenStack Nova did not enforceSSL connections when Nova was configured to use QPid and qpid_protocol isset to 'ssl'. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middleattack, this flaw could be exploited to view sensitive information. Ubuntudoes not use QPid with Nova by default. This issue did not affect Ubuntu14.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-6491)

d5b53c95f006ebbe7614048d91160ff253ea02cd.title: USN-2131-1: IcedTea Web vulnerability
d5b53c95f006ebbe7614048d91160ff253ea02cd.body: Michael Scherer discovered that IcedTea Web created temporary directoriesin an unsafe fashion. A local attacker could possibly use this issue toobtain or modify sensitive information from other local user sessions.

326c90d794ff78c2d45b002feb14a17eca53aed2.title: USN-2053-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
326c90d794ff78c2d45b002feb14a17eca53aed2.body: Michal Zalewski discovered several issues with JPEG image handling. Anattacker could potentially exploit these to obtain sensitive information.(CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630)

10cb711101dc433310629a7be2321a152503768e.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
10cb711101dc433310629a7be2321a152503768e.body: Michal Zalewski discovered several issues with JPEG image handling. Anattacker could potentially exploit these to obtain sensitive information.(CVE-2013-6629, CVE-2013-6630)

2bfac03ad71a8eff52fb063079091389be36d58a.title: USN-2060-1: libjpeg, libjpeg-turbo vulnerabilities
2bfac03ad71a8eff52fb063079091389be36d58a.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that libjpeg and libjpeg-turbo incorrectlyhandled certain memory operations. An attacker could use this issue witha specially-crafted JPEG file to possibly expose sensitive information.

295d4f4b7b8603eb60a8de15899fcf6273ef79e7.title: USN-2053-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
295d4f4b7b8603eb60a8de15899fcf6273ef79e7.body: Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber discovered a crash when insertingan ordered list in to a document using script. If a user had enabledscripting, an attacker could potentially exploit this to executearbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird.(CVE-2013-6671)

6143235224b72d58085c245c3120526720ae4cc9.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
6143235224b72d58085c245c3120526720ae4cc9.body: Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber discovered a crash when insertingan ordered list in to a document using script. An attacker couldpotentially exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the privilegesof the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2013-6671)

bb07a275a1e9234330088dd8867505dac4ee34e5.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
bb07a275a1e9234330088dd8867505dac4ee34e5.body: Vincent Lefevre discovered that web content could access clipboard dataunder certain circumstances, resulting in information disclosure.(CVE-2013-6672)

0e243b4b365a31e3b34197178e70181d596ce9b9.title: USN-2053-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
0e243b4b365a31e3b34197178e70181d596ce9b9.body: Sijie Xia discovered that trust settings for built-in EV root certificateswere ignored under certain circumstances, removing the ability for a userto manually untrust certificates from specific authorities.(CVE-2013-6673)

3d4981bdce697c7cf995271e0cf1c43fae275827.title: USN-2052-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
3d4981bdce697c7cf995271e0cf1c43fae275827.body: Sijie Xia discovered that trust settings for built-in EV root certificateswere ignored under certain circumstances, removing the ability for a userto manually untrust certificates from specific authorities.(CVE-2013-6673)

458940f1f04e2823dd93d8014d66adcccac60683.title: USN-2119-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
458940f1f04e2823dd93d8014d66adcccac60683.body: Fabián Cuchietti and Ateeq ur Rehman Khan discovered that it was possibleto bypass Javascript execution restrictions when replying to or forwardingmail messages in certain circumstances. An attacker could potentiallyexploit this to steal confidential information or modify message content.(CVE-2013-6674)

334eebdc0ac8057d0dea5d401e4265611c332f7e.title: USN-2055-1: PHP vulnerabilities
334eebdc0ac8057d0dea5d401e4265611c332f7e.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled DateInterval objects. Anattacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denialof service. (CVE-2013-6712)

09bd9e792a1b89eca8a5933c8e76ba9d4021f092.title: USN-2069-1: Linux kernel (Raring HWE) vulnerabilities
09bd9e792a1b89eca8a5933c8e76ba9d4021f092.body: Nico Golde reported a flaw in the Linux kernel's userspace IO (uio) driver.A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption) or possibly gain privileges. (CVE-2013-6763)

4a1d94fabfbb23d4631b0d16519407c69ada4636.title: USN-2062-1: OpenStack Horizon vulnerability
4a1d94fabfbb23d4631b0d16519407c69ada4636.body: Chris Chapman discovered cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilitiesin Horizon via the Volumes and Network Topology pages. An authenticatedattacker could exploit these to conduct stored cross-site scripting (XSS)attacks against users viewing these pages in order to modify the contentsor steal confidential data within the same domain.

397d05257b8e73877e5c13a9128f770b157a765b.title: USN-2069-1: Linux kernel (Raring HWE) vulnerabilities
397d05257b8e73877e5c13a9128f770b157a765b.body: Evan Huus reported a buffer overflow in the Linux kernel's radiotap headerparsing. A remote attacker could cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) via a specially crafted header. (CVE-2013-7027)

709b93bbe07b008c48a973433a4875e50ad4afba.title: USN-2935-3: PAM regression
709b93bbe07b008c48a973433a4875e50ad4afba.body: It was discovered that the PAM pam_userdb module incorrectly used a case-insensitive method when comparing hashed passwords. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to make brute force attacks easier. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-7041)

3307dcf157341c9f6d0f00b44871d8d6c5199cc9.title: USN-2935-1: PAM vulnerabilities
3307dcf157341c9f6d0f00b44871d8d6c5199cc9.body: It was discovered that the PAM pam_userdb module incorrectly used acase-insensitive method when comparing hashed passwords. A local attackercould possibly use this issue to make brute force attacks easier. Thisissue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-7041)

488b178891beca6e04f90247816a35ef06800e37.title: USN-2935-2: PAM regression

bc922561961b8a75088cb3140e1f9bd36905c312.title: USN-2247-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerabilities
bc922561961b8a75088cb3140e1f9bd36905c312.body: Loganathan Parthipan discovered that OpenStack Nova did not properly createexpected files during KVM live block migration. A remote authenticatedattacker could exploit this to obtain root disk snapshot contents viaephemeral storage. This issue did not affect Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.(CVE-2013-7130)

293a9498c7ac65d664f1e5cc5f220ddb0a4d4764.title: USN-2126-1: PHP vulnerabilities
293a9498c7ac65d664f1e5cc5f220ddb0a4d4764.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain values when usingthe imagecrop function. An attacker could possibly use this issue to causePHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, obtain sensitiveinformation, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affectedUbuntu 13.10. (CVE-2013-7226, CVE-2013-7327, CVE-2013-7328, CVE-2014-2020)

daea227d074dafec0269ea40d461425b70df878d.title: USN-2080-1: Memcached vulnerabilities
daea227d074dafec0269ea40d461425b70df878d.body: It was discovered that Memcached incorrectly handled SASL authentication.A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass SASL authenticationcompletely. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.10, Ubuntu 13.04 and Ubuntu13.10. (CVE-2013-7239)

5bd46fbfaad6c59aeeec514d0348b294541cc770.body: mpd reported an information leak in the recvfrom, recvmmsg, and recvmsgsystem calls in the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local user could exploitthis flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory.(CVE-2013-7263)
