cc0ccb3d83a3c2023383d40a75f2b2c1ec3c5af0.body: mpb reported an information leak in the Low-Rate Wireless Personal Area Networks support (IEEE 802.15.4) in the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory. (CVE-2013-7281)

04e44f31edd989dc6f85d9afdf6cd2723fb97f45.title: USN-2135-1: Linux kernel (Quantal HWE) vulnerabilities
04e44f31edd989dc6f85d9afdf6cd2723fb97f45.body: mpb reported an information leak in the Low-Rate Wireless Personal Area Networks support (IEEE 802.15.4) in the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel stack memory. (CVE-2013-7281)

13bea3cabe0ab78663e157d680af592f2f21d0ad.title: USN-2126-1: PHP vulnerabilities
13bea3cabe0ab78663e157d680af592f2f21d0ad.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain values when using the imagecrop function. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, obtain sensitive information, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2013-7226, CVE-2013-7327, CVE-2013-7328, CVE-2014-2020)

dd8fa7fc2c1745c9bf1090996479ca3572c90798.title: USN-2186-1: Date and Time Indicator vulnerability
dd8fa7fc2c1745c9bf1090996479ca3572c90798.body: It was discovered that the Date and Time Indicator incorrectly allowed Evolution to be opened at the greeter screen. An attacker could use this issue to possibly gain unexpected access to applications such as a web browser with privileges of the greeter user.

a74ae2f7e2b78ac68b0319506a60a3e61c9a003f.title: USN-2514-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
a74ae2f7e2b78ac68b0319506a60a3e61c9a003f.body: A flaw was discovered in the automatic loading of modules in the crypto subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to load installed kernel modules, increasing the attack surface and potentially using this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2013-7421)

6746c5fe1dc0b9612fed5af4ded97bce9b1c82e1.title: USN-2513-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
6746c5fe1dc0b9612fed5af4ded97bce9b1c82e1.body: A flaw was discovered in the automatic loading of modules in the crypto subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to load installed kernel modules, increasing the attack surface and potentially using this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2013-7421)

5b3100f307a493f38ad320f19d393ba8fe0414ea.title: USN-2543-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
5b3100f307a493f38ad320f19d393ba8fe0414ea.body: A flaw was discovered in the automatic loading of modules in the crypto subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to load installed kernel modules, increasing the attack surface and potentially using this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2013-7421)

48a22040aa1c2ad6e3671b055edc00d4a9368c69.title: USN-2544-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
48a22040aa1c2ad6e3671b055edc00d4a9368c69.body: A flaw was discovered in the automatic loading of modules in the crypto subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to load installed kernel modules, increasing the attack surface and potentially using this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2013-7421)

74fb9d40a20a96ca839bdc02c40490beaa12edbe.title: USN-2545-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
74fb9d40a20a96ca839bdc02c40490beaa12edbe.body: A flaw was discovered in the automatic loading of modules in the crypto subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to load installed kernel modules, increasing the attack surface and potentially using this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2013-7421)

c498df398ee6d9403bd606ec2bb26b750eaac7ad.title: USN-2546-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c498df398ee6d9403bd606ec2bb26b750eaac7ad.body: A flaw was discovered in the automatic loading of modules in the crypto subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to load installed kernel modules, increasing the attack surface and potentially using this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2013-7421)

177058e8bf7916c2c3f6ae771e16cd0aca7e54bd.title: USN-2916-1: Perl vulnerabilities
177058e8bf7916c2c3f6ae771e16cd0aca7e54bd.body: It was discovered that Perl incorrectly handled certain regular expressions with an invalid backreference. An attacker could use this issue to cause Perl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2013-7422)

54996eac0b79ea07d888ad240ca0734c324d1f8a.title: USN-2568-1: libx11, libxrender vulnerability
54996eac0b79ea07d888ad240ca0734c324d1f8a.body: Abhishek Arya discovered that libX11 incorrectly handled memory in the MakeBigReq macro. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause applications to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. In addition, following the macro fix in libx11, a number of other packages have also been rebuilt as security updates including libxrender, libxext, libxi, libxfixes, libxrandr, libsdl1.2, libxv, libxp, and xserver-xorg-video-vmware.

5d369de8c6c42d3fbce4cd9255fbc1c07658d0f4.title: USN-2676-1: NBD vulnerabilities
5d369de8c6c42d3fbce4cd9255fbc1c07658d0f4.body: Tuomas Räsänen discovered that NBD incorrectly handled wrong export names and closed connections during negotiation. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause NBD to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-7441)

3fb2501e09a05cc94751436aacacee754fb449dd.title: USN-2698-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
3fb2501e09a05cc94751436aacacee754fb449dd.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled skip-scan optimization. An attacker could use this issue to cause applications using SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-7443)

8f6b69d4b28e5f52e91482dacb479e4a058ad897.title: USN-2945-1: XChat-GNOME vulnerability
8f6b69d4b28e5f52e91482dacb479e4a058ad897.body: It was discovered that XChat-GNOME incorrectly verified the hostname in an SSL certificate. An attacker could trick XChat-GNOME into trusting a rogue server's certificate, which was signed by a trusted certificate authority, to perform a man-in-the-middle attack.

1276b77f4494a7aaa2b6c8a1d4e34619210f552d.title: USN-3030-1: GD library vulnerabilities
1276b77f4494a7aaa2b6c8a1d4e34619210f552d.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled memory when using gdImageScaleTwoPass(). A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2013-7456)

f1651b9a9e17f9fbac4d5b9e11b85a58783fcfdc.title: USN-2142-1: UDisks vulnerability
f1651b9a9e17f9fbac4d5b9e11b85a58783fcfdc.body: Florian Weimer discovered that UDisks incorrectly handled certain long path names. A local attacker could use this issue to cause udisks to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. The default compiler options for affected releases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial of service.

10389e52f92ff00afd5b143651f675f1934fdc69.title: USN-2097-1: curl vulnerability
10389e52f92ff00afd5b143651f675f1934fdc69.body: Paras Sethia and Yehezkel Horowitz discovered that libcurl incorrectly reused connections when NTLM authentication was being used. This could lead to the use of unintended credentials, possibly exposing sensitive information.

28b81eec5ea52cfc08a63ab9fc725db2452f1b9b.title: USN-2145-1: libssh vulnerability
28b81eec5ea52cfc08a63ab9fc725db2452f1b9b.body: Aris Adamantiadis discovered that libssh allowed the OpenSSL PRNG state to be reused when implementing forking servers. This could allow an attacker to possibly obtain information about the state of the PRNG and perform cryptographic attacks.

0e0414e732b92e22422764f4687b3f341ee4ea75.title: USN-2100-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
0e0414e732b92e22422764f4687b3f341ee4ea75.body: Daniel Atallah discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled IRC argument parsing. A malicious remote server or a man in the middle could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-0020)

9c78a94b5187280be73ccac9f684125479685e8c.title: USN-2093-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
9c78a94b5187280be73ccac9f684125479685e8c.body: Eric Blake discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled certain ACLs. An attacker could use this flaw to possibly obtain certain sensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2014-0028)

c2b1a1f0fcdc1a8cfb17aa9b488d949a54bec999.title: USN-2316-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
c2b1a1f0fcdc1a8cfb17aa9b488d949a54bec999.body: Lieven Govaerts discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module incorrectly handled certain request methods when SVNListParentPath was enabled. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-0032)

6c99a65132a0140e0351e610d118fb10b8631c90.title: USN-2130-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
6c99a65132a0140e0351e610d118fb10b8631c90.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly applied the disableURLRewriting setting when handling a session id in a URL. A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to conduct session fixation attacks. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-0033)

925ace7ad2fe92bdd51ef61fe65150ad95bb458e.title: USN-2094-1: Linux kernel (Raring HWE) vulnerability
925ace7ad2fe92bdd51ef61fe65150ad95bb458e.body: Pageexec reported a bug in the Linux kernel's recvmsg syscall when called from code using the x32 ABI. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or gain administrator privileges.

2900975b22065e35a7404f6d8feee872783d7401.title: USN-2096-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
2900975b22065e35a7404f6d8feee872783d7401.body: Pageexec reported a bug in the Linux kernel's recvmmsg syscall when called from code using the x32 ABI. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or gain administrator privileges.

9182b8a7f763fb06e1c391459b570baac58020ca.title: USN-2095-1: Linux kernel (Saucy HWE) vulnerability
9182b8a7f763fb06e1c391459b570baac58020ca.body: Pageexec reported a bug in the Linux kernel's recvmsg syscall when called from code using the x32 ABI. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or gain administrator privileges.

52d69d1b7311272487a208303d1f4305317882e0.title: USN-2130-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
52d69d1b7311272487a208303d1f4305317882e0.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled malformed Content-Type headers and multipart requests. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause the Tomcat server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.10 and Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2014-0050)

a27cf7759f6f621754a5b34bf033fea8125feb38.title: USN-2194-1: OpenStack Neutron vulnerability
a27cf7759f6f621754a5b34bf033fea8125feb38.body: Aaron Rosen discovered that OpenStack Neutron did not properly perform authorization checks when creating ports when using plugins relying on the l3-agent. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to access the network of other tenants.

440efa6a8137a6d051f99b15b9fc50a989583892.title: USN-2120-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
440efa6a8137a6d051f99b15b9fc50a989583892.body: Noah Misch and Jonas Sundman discovered that PostgreSQL did not correctly enforce ADMIN OPTION restrictions. An authenticated attacker could use this issue to possibly revoke access from others, contrary to expected permissions. (CVE-2014-0060)

ac4379dc1453f7f0255d39648ffe4caf69192945.title: USN-2120-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
ac4379dc1453f7f0255d39648ffe4caf69192945.body: Andres Freund discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled validator functions. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate their privileges. (CVE-2014-0061)

f0f4da4817bfd8b578495208a9454ef20b6be12f.title: USN-2120-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
f0f4da4817bfd8b578495208a9454ef20b6be12f.body: Daniel Schüssler discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled datetime input. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PostgreSQL to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-0063)

4b85dfbf6b063dec19e4e693b18ea22d4293c8da.title: USN-2120-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
4b85dfbf6b063dec19e4e693b18ea22d4293c8da.body: It was discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain size calculations. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PostgreSQL to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-0064)

16550590c53e0bc18ac3ec19049455efa0b7c7f8.title: USN-2120-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
16550590c53e0bc18ac3ec19049455efa0b7c7f8.body: Peter Eisentraut and Jozef Mlich discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain buffer sizes. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PostgreSQL to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-0065)

1b917e82faec42c6d430022e62910b8685d9c18e.title: USN-2120-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
1b917e82faec42c6d430022e62910b8685d9c18e.body: Honza Horak discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly used the crypt() library function. This issue could possibly cause PostgreSQL to crash, resulting in a denial of service (CVE-2014-0066)

59366226ed0168a1ac64f8cfe5df05f50bee54c7.title: USN-2165-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
59366226ed0168a1ac64f8cfe5df05f50bee54c7.body: Yuval Yarom and Naomi Benger discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled timing during swap operations in the Montgomery ladder implementation. An attacker could use this issue to perform side-channel attacks and possibly recover ECDSA nonces. (CVE-2014-0076)

8c815ba7786a3094eca53c45b01e629ef93fea76.title: USN-2127-1: GnuTLS vulnerability
8c815ba7786a3094eca53c45b01e629ef93fea76.body: Nikos Mavrogiannopoulos discovered that GnuTLS incorrectly handled certificate verification functions. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited with specially crafted certificates to view sensitive information.

13abf993fe4bb3b40fd821b575c167e3ad793e55.title: USN-2152-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
13abf993fe4bb3b40fd821b575c167e3ad793e55.body: Rainer M Canavan discovered that the mod_log_config module incorrectly handled certain cookies. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.10 and Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2014-0098)

a813af08d16850f70e999f993ddc67fda81c73dd.title: USN-2174-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
a813af08d16850f70e999f993ddc67fda81c73dd.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's handling of the SCTP handshake. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-0101)

5448799965b83c3275bf5d0f9edc82508a0c336f.title: USN-2173-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5448799965b83c3275bf5d0f9edc82508a0c336f.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's handling of the SCTP handshake. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-0101)

c6a36a44f42c3f2c3d2bb11582e154593ee38587.title: USN-2146-1: Sudo vulnerabilities
c6a36a44f42c3f2c3d2bb11582e154593ee38587.body: Sebastien Macke discovered that Sudo incorrectly handled blacklisted environment variables when the env_reset option was disabled. A local attacker could use this issue to possibly run unintended commands by using blacklisted environment variables. In a default Ubuntu installation, the env_reset option is enabled by default. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS and Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-0106)

5589e841a5886a69e4b717ba83dd45d0185a8963.title: USN-2654-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
5589e841a5886a69e4b717ba83dd45d0185a8963.body: It was discovered that the Tomcat XML parser incorrectly handled XML External Entities (XXE). A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to read arbitrary files. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-0119)

401a0d068c7884ebcd50a7ae31cd3a3b875e73f8.title: USN-2247-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerabilities
401a0d068c7884ebcd50a7ae31cd3a3b875e73f8.body: Stanislaw Pitucha discovered that OpenStack Nova did not enforce the image format when rescuing an instance. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to read host files. In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt guest AppArmor profile. This issue only affected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2014-0134)

e45c18b838f4711109fbf480955878f57c8e871e.title: USN-2167-1: curl vulnerabilities
e45c18b838f4711109fbf480955878f57c8e871e.body: Steve Holme discovered that libcurl incorrectly reused wrong connections when using protocols other than HTTP and FTP. This could lead to the use of unintended credentials, possibly exposing sensitive information. (CVE-2014-0138)

5db78abb138e6724c2611395bb95ad9892988a96.title: USN-2167-1: curl vulnerabilities
5db78abb138e6724c2611395bb95ad9892988a96.body: Richard Moore discovered that libcurl incorrectly validated wildcard SSL certificates that contain literal IP addresses. An attacker could possibly exploit this to perform a man in the middle attack to view sensitive information or alter encrypted communications. (CVE-2014-0139)

06bcbd8c0b619b035b1302904beaac2436aae437.title: USN-2182-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
06bcbd8c0b619b035b1302904beaac2436aae437.body: Michael S. Tsirkin discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled virtio-net MAC addresses. A local guest could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host. (CVE-2014-0150)

e86b9020223e4cda436d477830cb61f9240a22ba.title: USN-2165-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
e86b9020223e4cda436d477830cb61f9240a22ba.body: Neel Mehta discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled memory in the TLS heartbeat extension. An attacker could use this issue to obtain up to 64k of memory contents from the client or server, possibly leading to the disclosure of private keys and other sensitive information. (CVE-2014-0160)

8b96ef56e174177fd2ea900cdaaec9303dad782f.title: USN-2193-1: OpenStack Glance vulnerability
8b96ef56e174177fd2ea900cdaaec9303dad782f.body: Paul McMillan discovered that the Sheepdog backend in OpenStack Glance did not properly handle untrusted input. A remote authenticated attacker exploit this to execute arbitrary commands as the glance user.

cabcbbd39ae4ce6b36f9e201e5fd8e42d57cbd5b.title: USN-2247-1: OpenStack Nova vulnerabilities
cabcbbd39ae4ce6b36f9e201e5fd8e42d57cbd5b.body: Mark Heckmann discovered that OpenStack Nova did not enforce RBAC policy when adding security group rules via the EC2 API. A remote authenticated user could exploit this to gain unintended access to this API. This issue only affected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2014-0167)

5a245c2f4c2dbfa9be10d619a7bcd31c81203938.title: USN-2188-1: elfutils vulnerability
5a245c2f4c2dbfa9be10d619a7bcd31c81203938.body: Florian Weimer discovered that the elfutils libdw library incorrectly handled malformed compressed debug sections in ELF files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted ELF file, applications linked against libdw could be made to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

c174cd4c329c06d5a491b62c489a7cdbd4935647.title: USN-2366-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
c174cd4c329c06d5a491b62c489a7cdbd4935647.body: Daniel P. Berrange and Richard Jones discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled XML documents containing XML external entity declarations. An attacker could use this issue to cause libvirtd to crash, resulting in a denial of service on all affected releases, or possibly read arbitrary files if fine grained access control was enabled on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-0179, CVE-2014-5177)

052bb76b78fdeba9c1012be15dad22b3745703e5.title: USN-2255-1: OpenStack Neutron vulnerabilities
052bb76b78fdeba9c1012be15dad22b3745703e5.body: Stephen Ma and Christoph Thiel discovered that the openvswitch-agent in OpenStack Neutron did not properly perform input validation when creating security group rules when specifying --remote-ip-prefix. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to prevent application of additional rules. (CVE-2014-0187)

4d43ea2a97c5707185e2024522ded8a7b77f9c7d.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
4d43ea2a97c5707185e2024522ded8a7b77f9c7d.body: Wolfgang Schenk discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed GIF images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted GIF image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-0190)

a9bb20d0a3310e256dfd569216785076a898d3cd.title: USN-2211-1: libXfont vulnerabilities
a9bb20d0a3310e256dfd569216785076a898d3cd.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered that libXfont incorrectly handled font metadata file parsing. A local attacker could use this issue to cause libXfont to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code in order to gain privileges. (CVE-2014-0209)

a60ac7d89ecc7c38ffdd191f2f946f149af71b04.title: USN-2211-1: libXfont vulnerabilities
a60ac7d89ecc7c38ffdd191f2f946f149af71b04.body: Ilja van Sprundel discovered that libXfont incorrectly handled X Font Server replies. A malicious font server could return specially-crafted data that could cause libXfont to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.10 and Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2014-0210, CVE-2014-0211)

da20c005e4f8d4bf5a498f268626b80309ee487e.title: USN-2655-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
da20c005e4f8d4bf5a498f268626b80309ee487e.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled HTTP responses occurring before the entire request body was finished being read. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a limited denial of service. (CVE-2014-0230)

dd2b693784780d505fec0ce0b7e2473547558ad7.title: USN-2654-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
dd2b693784780d505fec0ce0b7e2473547558ad7.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled HTTP responses occurring before the entire request body was finished being read. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a limited denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-0230)

0fb03d3594966544ff948190e504e965f32cff6f.title: USN-2147-1: Mutt vulnerability
0fb03d3594966544ff948190e504e965f32cff6f.body: Beatrice Torracca and Evgeni Golov discovered a buffer overflow in mutt while expanding addresses when parsing email headers. An attacker could specially craft an email to cause mutt to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking mutt.

a252ee27591eae6c96be3f1f71d013bfb9e990f6.title: USN-2183-1: dpkg vulnerability
a252ee27591eae6c96be3f1f71d013bfb9e990f6.body: Jakub Wilk discovered that dpkg incorrectly certain paths and symlinks when unpacking source packages. If a user or an automated system were tricked into unpacking a specially crafted source package, a remote attacker could modify files outside the target unpack directory, leading to a denial of service or potentially gaining access to the system.

b335f2671107cce0586185fd5773398022068bcd.title: USN-2169-1: Django vulnerabilities
b335f2671107cce0586185fd5773398022068bcd.body: Benjamin Bach discovered that Django incorrectly handled dotted Python paths when using the reverse() function. An attacker could use this issue to cause Django to import arbitrary modules from the Python path, resulting in possible code execution. (CVE-2014-0472)

aada4fab0904d78caab39d0c7a2be876da82f095.title: USN-2169-1: Django vulnerabilities
aada4fab0904d78caab39d0c7a2be876da82f095.body: Paul McMillan discovered that Django incorrectly cached certain pages that contained CSRF cookies. An attacker could possibly use this flaw to obtain a valid cookie and perform attacks which bypass the CSRF restrictions. (CVE-2014-0473)

7df795ebe215cdb0362c3afe1d6ee109dc613ae3.title: USN-2169-1: Django vulnerabilities
7df795ebe215cdb0362c3afe1d6ee109dc613ae3.body: Michael Koziarski discovered that Django did not always perform explicit conversion of certain fields when using a MySQL database. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain unexpected results. (CVE-2014-0474)

3697ae132fafa3906c3203973c2536f84d5dfb64.title: USN-2230-1: chkrootkit vulnerability
3697ae132fafa3906c3203973c2536f84d5dfb64.body: Thomas Stangner discovered that chkrootkit incorrectly quoted certain values. A local attacker could use this issue to execute arbitrary code when chkrootkit is run and gain root privileges.

b57a0b8227f8de284b5c4c9a780591163d2df62e.title: USN-2246-1: APT vulnerability
b57a0b8227f8de284b5c4c9a780591163d2df62e.body: Jakub Wilk discovered that APT did not correctly validate signatures when downloading source packages. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could potentially be used to install altered source packages.

5caefc8e9a05c5b0abda6af52c5a7b708f388727.title: USN-2348-1: APT vulnerabilities
5caefc8e9a05c5b0abda6af52c5a7b708f388727.body: It was discovered that APT did not invalidate repository data when it switched from an unauthenticated to an authenticated state. (CVE-2014-0488)

848263fa32028c7c1b745a9d315bd8ef59e772f2.title: USN-2348-1: APT vulnerabilities
848263fa32028c7c1b745a9d315bd8ef59e772f2.body: It was discovered that the APT Acquire::GzipIndexes option caused APT to skip checksum validation. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, and was not enabled by default. (CVE-2014-0489)

6662a333cd35f2973f442c229b6d181a435a3416.title: USN-2348-1: APT vulnerabilities
6662a333cd35f2973f442c229b6d181a435a3416.body: It was discovered that APT did not correctly validate signatures when manually downloading packages using the download command. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-0490)

d5d738e35a86588c16b243cd904ede0beb5731dd.title: USN-2081-1: Bind vulnerability
d5d738e35a86588c16b243cd904ede0beb5731dd.body: Jared Mauch discovered that Bind incorrectly handled certain queries for NSEC3-signed zones. A remote attacker could use this flaw with a specially crafted query to cause Bind to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service.

620d14e393dfc8f62e79a54601424dc82c8a2662.title: USN-2739-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
620d14e393dfc8f62e79a54601424dc82c8a2662.body: It was discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certain malformed font files. If a user were tricked into using a specially crafted font file, a remote attacker could cause FreeType to crash or hang, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly expose uninitialized memory.

1297185713cbebb0974aba2bfd7aa862e0378499.title: USN-2411-1: mountall vulnerability
1297185713cbebb0974aba2bfd7aa862e0378499.body: Saurav Sengupta discovered that mountall incorrectly handled umask when calling the mount utility, resulting in certain filesystems possibly being mounted with incorrect permissions.

55c4542278568cca18d6bd85cfe79e8b3ad1ffd2.title: USN-2413-1: AppArmor vulnerability
55c4542278568cca18d6bd85cfe79e8b3ad1ffd2.body: An AppArmor policy miscompilation flaw was discovered in apparmor_parser. Under certain circumstances, a malicious application could use this flaw to perform operations that are not allowed by AppArmor policy. The flaw may also prevent applications from accessing resources that are allowed by AppArmor policy.

6a49d69ae751aa7786adda3634b243d408f7829e.title: USN-2451-1: cgmanager vulnerability
6a49d69ae751aa7786adda3634b243d408f7829e.body: Serge Hallyn discovered that cgmanager did not consistently enforce proper nesting when modifying cgroup properties. A local attacker in a privileged container could use this to set cgroup values for all cgroups.

21080f9f72ca2dcd037c59e3ea0f9b9c13dacb2e.title: USN-2113-1: Linux kernel (Saucy HWE) vulnerabilities
21080f9f72ca2dcd037c59e3ea0f9b9c13dacb2e.body: halfdog reported an error in the AMD K7 and K8 platform support in the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw on AMD based systems to cause a denial of service (task kill) or possibly gain privileges via a crafted application. (CVE-2014-1438)

cd81cd61f9d8267894ae878b49e8a966c95cf866.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel's SIOCWANDEV ioctl call. A local user with the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability could exploit this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-1444)

9d267731302ae47771202f99545c82fb180bc96f.title: USN-2102-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
9d267731302ae47771202f99545c82fb180bc96f.body: Christian Holler, Terrence Cole, Jesse Ruderman, Gary Kwong, Eric Rescorla, Jonathan Kew, Dan Gohman, Ryan VanderMeulen, Carsten Book, Andrew Sutherland, Byron Campen, Nicholas Nethercote, Paul Adenot, David Baron, Julian Seward and Sotaro Ikeda discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1477, CVE-2014-1478)

9936804a956600dadea1be63a8cde740f04d9656.title: USN-2102-2: Firefox regression
9936804a956600dadea1be63a8cde740f04d9656.body: Christian Holler, Terrence Cole, Jesse Ruderman, Gary Kwong, Eric Rescorla, Jonathan Kew, Dan Gohman, Ryan VanderMeulen, Carsten Book, Andrew Sutherland, Byron Campen, Nicholas Nethercote, Paul Adenot, David Baron, Julian Seward and Sotaro Ikeda discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1477, CVE-2014-1478)

e6ea2348f0818f08df4c8b5875b4075434a6b75a.title: USN-2102-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
e6ea2348f0818f08df4c8b5875b4075434a6b75a.body: Fredrik Lönnqvist discovered a use-after-free in Firefox. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the priviliges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1482)

852e23f20f225aa11ccb298ba08068972f7714ba.body: Fredrik Lönnqvist discovered a use-after-free in Thunderbird. 11ed56f6daae5adb051b686f0c65738a884f0795.body: Arthur Gerkis discovered a use-after-free in Firefox. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the priviliges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1486)

410ee7f1e5f6ff3bc1b9eee6cd3c91e9a79b58b2.title: USN-2102-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
410ee7f1e5f6ff3bc1b9eee6cd3c91e9a79b58b2.body: Yazan Tommalieh discovered that web pages could activate buttons on the default Firefox startpage (about:home) in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause data loss by triggering a session restore. (CVE-2014-1489)

fd87e5cd5073072f5065ae754ac2e09780a7471b.title: USN-2102-2: Firefox regression
fd87e5cd5073072f5065ae754ac2e09780a7471b.body: Yazan Tommalieh discovered that web pages could activate buttons on the default Firefox startpage (about:home) in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause data loss by triggering a session restore. (CVE-2014-1489)

d9a7e6974f97ba6f497f1eb7be9f173f2191be09.title: USN-2159-1: NSS vulnerability
d9a7e6974f97ba6f497f1eb7be9f173f2191be09.body: It was discovered that NSS incorrectly handled wildcard certificates when used with internationalized domain names. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to spoof SSL servers.

d97f701d89be6e0d7c51529218d48f08ad5e4921.title: USN-2185-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d97f701d89be6e0d7c51529218d48f08ad5e4921.body: Christian Heimes discovered that NSS did not handle IDNA domain prefixes correctly for wildcard certificates. An attacker could potentially exploit this by using a specially crafted certificate to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack. (CVE-2014-1492)

337e41f1c015baa38c5031937f688abe791825da.title: USN-2151-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
337e41f1c015baa38c5031937f688abe791825da.body: Benoit Jacob, Olli Pettay, Jan Varga, Jan de Mooij, Jesse Ruderman, Dan Gohman and Christoph Diehl discovered multiple memory safety issues in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2014-1493)

fcb0d7ae285088b8705fd22bb712d80140629c09.title: USN-2151-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
fcb0d7ae285088b8705fd22bb712d80140629c09.body: Atte Kettunen discovered an out-of-bounds read during WAV file decoding. If a user had enabled audio, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash. (CVE-2014-1497)

3273ee00b21b21c59ba8e0d81e74eb926b304228.title: USN-2151-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
3273ee00b21b21c59ba8e0d81e74eb926b304228.body: Robert O'Callahan discovered a mechanism for timing attacks involving SVG filters and displacements input to feDisplacementMap. If a user had enabled scripting, an attacker could potentially exploit this to steal confidential information across domains. (CVE-2014-1505)

e5de9ec8c518cd3d5ab4abbe8f885fd3172be298.title: USN-2151-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
e5de9ec8c518cd3d5ab4abbe8f885fd3172be298.body: Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber discovered an out-of-bounds read during polygon rendering in MathML. If a user had enabled scripting, an attacker could potentially exploit this to steal confidential information across domains. (CVE-2014-1508)

6c1e5327b933347144143214cb05b76062d69e91.title: USN-2151-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
6c1e5327b933347144143214cb05b76062d69e91.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that web content could open a chrome privileged page and bypass the popup blocker in some circumstances. If a user had enabled scripting, an attacker could potentially exploit this to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2014-1510, CVE-2014-1511)

72de110e8cf88fb7c68dbaaa767bdaa035133b54.title: USN-2151-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
72de110e8cf88fb7c68dbaaa767bdaa035133b54.body: It was discovered that memory pressure during garbage collection resulted in memory corruption in some circumstances. If a user had enabled scripting, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2014-1512)

abe76d187917164b1d9109dc20ee660a5fcbd9db.title: USN-2151-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
abe76d187917164b1d9109dc20ee660a5fcbd9db.body: Jüri Aedla discovered out-of-bounds reads and writes with TypedArrayObject in some circumstances. (CVE-2014-1513)

5b9ff42de78b0af0b4fee753999d8bffaacce49e.title: USN-2151-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
5b9ff42de78b0af0b4fee753999d8bffaacce49e.body: George Hotz discovered an out-of-bounds write with TypedArrayObject. b9bedf384c03a616ba7182a1ceea42774689f52f.body: An out of bounds read was discovered in Web Audio. An attacker could potentially exploit this cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1522)

9e4308e39d98bdc1f4b2f18dbf012c2d06dc48eb.title: USN-2189-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
9e4308e39d98bdc1f4b2f18dbf012c2d06dc48eb.body: Abhishek Arya discovered an out of bounds read when decoding JPG images. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash. (CVE-2014-1523)

96a95280531b0fdb286901578a1c1bfd5acd4636.body: Abhishek Arya discovered an out of bounds read when decoding JPG images. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash. (CVE-2014-1523)

a76d5673be476e349d6b11d3a2ff37db9183bce1.body: Abhishek Arya discovered a use-after-free in the Text Track Manager when processing HTML video. 3f9bd0d29590328ad9c20740e28da7cf1bdd4938.body: Boris Zbarsky discovered that the debugger bypassed XrayWrappers for some objects. 08e04bd48dc78e0b8ef78980d13c0c889cb33e78.title: USN-2185-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
08e04bd48dc78e0b8ef78980d13c0c889cb33e78.body: It was discovered that browser history navigations could be used to load a site with the addressbar displaying the wrong address. An attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting or phishing attacks. (CVE-2014-1530)

945e28201e50d1574d14bb8f3acb42d864b93d91.title: USN-2189-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
945e28201e50d1574d14bb8f3acb42d864b93d91.body: A use-after-free was discovered when resizing images in some circumstances. If a user had enabled scripting, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2014-1531)

a76f815001a18f74915035f02375c5815a018d5a.title: USN-2185-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a76f815001a18f74915035f02375c5815a018d5a.body: A use-after-free was discovered when resizing images in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1531)

8be981187f38c0132b3b16ef015c7b0039140536.title: USN-2189-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
8be981187f38c0132b3b16ef015c7b0039140536.body: Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber discovered a use-after-free during host resolution in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2014-1532)

c30a044b6ad6d58c3274346de2cad75c970bbf3a.title: USN-2185-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
c30a044b6ad6d58c3274346de2cad75c970bbf3a.body: Tyson Smith and Jesse Schwartzentruber discovered a use-after-free during host resolution in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1532)

52949c3ab8f23befa6eb6832375dd3b8f5e698b2.title: USN-2243-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
52949c3ab8f23befa6eb6832375dd3b8f5e698b2.body: Gary Kwong, Christoph Diehl, Christian Holler, Hannes Verschore, Jan de Mooij, Ryan VanderMeulen, Jeff Walden, Kyle Huey, Jesse Ruderman, Gregor Wagner, Benoit Jacob and Karl Tomlinson discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1533, CVE-2014-1534)

186088865465ff031a16b35ff952520467a9f5e7.title: USN-2243-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
186088865465ff031a16b35ff952520467a9f5e7.body: Holger Fuhrmannek discovered a buffer overflow in Web Audio. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the priviliges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1542)

a08a7c01e7db25b857ac34ed4e4ef56ab463ece5.title: USN-2361-1: NSS vulnerability
a08a7c01e7db25b857ac34ed4e4ef56ab463ece5.body: Antoine Delignat-Lavaud and others discovered that NSS incorrectly handled parsing ASN.1 values. An attacker could use this issue to forge RSA certificates.

0ff65486fb72d80b508f79bc8ec64242f50cf833.title: USN-2360-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
0ff65486fb72d80b508f79bc8ec64242f50cf833.body: Antoine Delignat-Lavaud and others discovered that NSS incorrectly handled parsing ASN.1 values. An attacker could use this issue to forge RSA certificates.

c18a72d59d879fbb117e22e90736f9d6b5142395.title: USN-2360-2: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
c18a72d59d879fbb117e22e90736f9d6b5142395.body: USN-2360-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Firefox. This update provides the corresponding updates for Thunderbird. Original advisory details: Antoine Delignat-Lavaud and others discovered that NSS incorrectly handled parsing ASN.1 values. An attacker could use this issue to forge RSA certificates.

de8fcdcac461062ab4c7dbc885221b8da20f2861.title: USN-2372-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
de8fcdcac461062ab4c7dbc885221b8da20f2861.body: Bobby Holley, Christian Holler, David Bolter, Byron Campen, Jon Coppeard, Carsten Book, Martijn Wargers, Shih-Chiang Chien, Terrence Cole and Jeff Walden discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1574, CVE-2014-1575)

b8155c4a2e7046b9f1c9d815a342296ae30f8eee.title: USN-2372-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
b8155c4a2e7046b9f1c9d815a342296ae30f8eee.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer overflow during CSS manipulation. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1576)

bc03f9a8ed2a8f6bbe1ddde693031fd4c1eaebf9.title: USN-2373-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
bc03f9a8ed2a8f6bbe1ddde693031fd4c1eaebf9.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer overflow during CSS manipulation. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2014-1576)

a5ccaf39d75d201d8b5a9b4cc31a6a598c68cf07.title: USN-2372-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a5ccaf39d75d201d8b5a9b4cc31a6a598c68cf07.body: Abhishek Arya discovered an out-of-bounds write when buffering WebM video in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2014-1578)

14d067d79e661ade766dc1dd4632eafb0dbc3418.title: USN-2373-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
14d067d79e661ade766dc1dd4632eafb0dbc3418.body: Abhishek Arya discovered an out-of-bounds write when buffering WebM video in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2014-1578)

a1362e24de4bdb1f1dd47223c74fb4bfa9e16ea9.title: USN-2372-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a1362e24de4bdb1f1dd47223c74fb4bfa9e16ea9.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that memory may not be correctly initialized when rendering a malformed GIF in to a canvas in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to steal sensitive information. (CVE-2014-1580)

1578d34cfe4dd636580fc405c908c7c17f64a656.title: USN-2372-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
1578d34cfe4dd636580fc405c908c7c17f64a656.body: Patrick McManus and David Keeler discovered 2 issues that could result in certificate pinning being bypassed in some circumstances. An attacker with a fraudulent certificate could potentially exploit this conduct a man in the middle attack. (CVE-2014-1582, CVE-2014-1584)

5e557f795ee0e1ce13ab815bea71447b1f636129.title: USN-2137-1: Linux kernel (Saucy HWE) vulnerabilities
5e557f795ee0e1ce13ab815bea71447b1f636129.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel when built with the NetFilter Connection Tracking (NF_CONNTRACK) support for IRC protocol (NF_NAT_IRC). A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive kernel information when communicating over a client- to-client IRC connection(/dcc) via a NAT-ed network. (CVE-2014-1690)

e007397421a4fe940ec8969d9c181a800c734f6e.title: USN-2140-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e007397421a4fe940ec8969d9c181a800c734f6e.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel when built with the NetFilter Connection Tracking (NF_CONNTRACK) support for IRC protocol (NF_NAT_IRC). A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive kernel information when communicating over a client- to-client IRC connection(/dcc) via a NAT-ed network. (CVE-2014-1690)

313296bd771c81b5e9b5dd128bba0665b0dd929e.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel when built with the NetFilter Connection Tracking (NF_CONNTRACK) support for IRC protocol (NF_NAT_IRC). A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive kernel information when communicating over a client- to-client IRC connection(/dcc) via a NAT-ed network. (CVE-2014-1690)

7989d979e61880921208fb2b5deca92a174f2cf6.title: USN-2264-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7989d979e61880921208fb2b5deca92a174f2cf6.body: Salva Peiró discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's media- device driver. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-1739)

4c975cce2a1fdee6d99c64e3de92d06deafc4c14.title: USN-2263-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
4c975cce2a1fdee6d99c64e3de92d06deafc4c14.body: Salva Peiró discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's media- device driver. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-1739)

9a8e7b9dcfa8ca7ea5df4c6bb256ad1ef666aed8.title: USN-2261-1: Linux kernel (Saucy HWE) vulnerabilities
9a8e7b9dcfa8ca7ea5df4c6bb256ad1ef666aed8.body: Salva Peiró discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's media- device driver. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-1739)

7140f6b0b32edb6a507ff526ec90273d0b4ee0f0.title: USN-2259-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7140f6b0b32edb6a507ff526ec90273d0b4ee0f0.body: Salva Peiró discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's media- device driver. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-1739)

89b496325a1e24972fd7d4d3671b566073c0c89f.title: USN-2382-1: Requests vulnerabilities
89b496325a1e24972fd7d4d3671b566073c0c89f.body: Jakub Wilk discovered that Requests incorrectly reused authentication credentials after being redirected. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain authentication credentials intended for another site. (CVE-2014-1829, CVE-2014-1830)

d63e97928ca2ed6e8e772041768574e3170b0ed9.title: USN-2649-1: devscripts vulnerability
d63e97928ca2ed6e8e772041768574e3170b0ed9.body: It was discovered that the uupdate tool incorrectly handled symlinks. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing specially crafted files, a remote attacker could possibly replace arbitrary files, leading to a privilege escalation.

c69663ab8425f64d5ae4afee18659d7871fd72e8.title: USN-2133-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c69663ab8425f64d5ae4afee18659d7871fd72e8.body: Matthew Thode reported a denial of service vulnerability in the Linux kernel when SELinux support is enabled. A local user with the CAP_MAC_ADMIN capability (and the SELinux mac_admin permission if running in enforcing mode) could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel crash). (CVE-2014-1874)

3f1e085679898ae559fb3f334d11affce9f82998.title: USN-2138-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3f1e085679898ae559fb3f334d11affce9f82998.body: Matthew Thode reported a denial of service vulnerability in the Linux kernel when SELinux support is enabled. A local user with the CAP_MAC_ADMIN capability (and the SELinux mac_admin permission if running in enforcing mode) could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel crash). (CVE-2014-1874)

b3cece410065e2894bba79fbec50a0b103cc632f.body: Matthew Thode reported a denial of service vulnerability in the Linux kernel when SELinux support is enabled. A local user with the CAP_MAC_ADMIN capability (and the SELinux mac_admin permission if running in enforcing mode) could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel crash). 0dc392ca3d7a5974a82075e31099879753417bc8.title: USN-2135-1: Linux kernel (Quantal HWE) vulnerabilities
0dc392ca3d7a5974a82075e31099879753417bc8.body: Matthew Thode reported a denial of service vulnerability in the Linux kernel when SELinux support is enabled. A local user with the CAP_MAC_ADMIN capability (and the SELinux mac_admin permission if running in enforcing mode) could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel crash). (CVE-2014-1874)

784e2344951365278034d69f892f91551575412c.title: USN-2140-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
784e2344951365278034d69f892f91551575412c.body: Matthew Thode reported a denial of service vulnerability in the Linux kernel when SELinux support is enabled. A local user with the CAP_MAC_ADMIN capability (and the SELinux mac_admin permission if running in enforcing mode) could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel crash). (CVE-2014-1874)

dafa8253bf6f1c6ceb32cac9cf828f61a7d14800.title: USN-2125-1: Python vulnerability
dafa8253bf6f1c6ceb32cac9cf828f61a7d14800.body: Ryan Smith-Roberts discovered that Python incorrectly handled buffer sizes when using the socket.recvfrom_into() function. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Python to crash, resulting in denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

fe33f8c1db67716d0e462cd0a5a2b160c2b6996f.title: USN-2168-1: Python Imaging Library vulnerabilities
fe33f8c1db67716d0e462cd0a5a2b160c2b6996f.body: Jakub Wilk discovered that the Python Imaging Library incorrectly handled temporary files. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to overwrite arbitrary files, or gain access to temporary file contents. (CVE-2014-1932, CVE-2014-1933)

8f4079e6f79611097cdaf5ad8853fd2e4072d6c3.title: USN-2126-1: PHP vulnerabilities
8f4079e6f79611097cdaf5ad8853fd2e4072d6c3.body: Bernd Melchers discovered that PHP's embedded libmagic library incorrectly handled indirect offset values. An attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to consume resources or crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-1943)

965e7368cb25829cb2ac5af60425c397535c6ea2.title: USN-2123-1: file vulnerabilities
965e7368cb25829cb2ac5af60425c397535c6ea2.body: Bernd Melchers discovered that file incorrectly handled indirect offset values. An attacker could use this issue to cause file to consume resources or crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-1943)

c2ad9ab6ce97e7f339d7743fafbcf6e265c92895.title: USN-2121-1: GnuTLS vulnerability
c2ad9ab6ce97e7f339d7743fafbcf6e265c92895.body: Suman Jana discovered that GnuTLS incorrectly handled version 1 intermediate certificates. This resulted in them being considered to be a valid CA certificate by default, which was contrary to documented behaviour.

e06472d3c41cb233a213669534b9b6fbb4dcdc66.title: USN-2122-1: FreeRADIUS vulnerabilities
e06472d3c41cb233a213669534b9b6fbb4dcdc66.body: Pierre Carrier discovered that FreeRADIUS incorrectly handled rlm_pap hash processing. An authenticated user could use this issue to cause FreeRADIUS to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. The default compiler options for affected releases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial of service. (CVE-2014-2015)

f8c9e4c627da781e81e9fa8c8a46aa4b7d13ad1c.title: USN-2132-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
f8c9e4c627da781e81e9fa8c8a46aa4b7d13ad1c.body: It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled decoding certain PSD images. If a user or automated system using ImageMagick were tricked into opening a specially crafted PSD image, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2014-1958, CVE-2014-2030)

e101f511034b8bca0716bfcc6ea6ecc062a00329.title: USN-2137-1: Linux kernel (Saucy HWE) vulnerabilities
e101f511034b8bca0716bfcc6ea6ecc062a00329.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel's NFS filesystem. A local users with write access to an NFS share could exploit this flaw to obtain potential sensative information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-2038)

7d61994da5da3fcde0e29690a65110d0efc4a51f.title: USN-2140-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7d61994da5da3fcde0e29690a65110d0efc4a51f.body: An information leak was discovered in the Linux kernel's NFS filesystem. A local users with write access to an NFS share could exploit this flaw to obtain potential sensative information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-2038)

bef8d6dff30d42b864a79ee6eef8da5fb67b654c.title: USN-2148-1: FreeType vulnerabilities
bef8d6dff30d42b864a79ee6eef8da5fb67b654c.body: Mateusz Jurczyk discovered that FreeType did not correctly handle certain malformed font files. If a user were tricked into using a specially crafted font file, a remote attacker could cause FreeType to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2014-2240, CVE-2014-2241)

d5de98ee42dc64cf7047dd2fc283183ff27364bb.title: USN-2163-1: PHP vulnerability
d5de98ee42dc64cf7047dd2fc283183ff27364bb.body: It was discovered that PHP's embedded libmagic library incorrectly handled PE executables. An attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

a2b5451cbab9c1eb519e3a21a15cc7d186658fae.title: USN-2162-1: file vulnerability
a2b5451cbab9c1eb519e3a21a15cc7d186658fae.body: It was discovered that file incorrectly handled PE executable files. An attacker could use this issue to cause file to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

9735f963d0a9a2e4e71dce552dd229728c05971b.title: USN-2166-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
9735f963d0a9a2e4e71dce552dd229728c05971b.body: It was discovered that the Net-SNMP ICMP-MIB incorrectly validated input. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 13.10. (CVE-2014-2284)

c70f1a5623ef4452e6609ccdba1270be5aad5463.title: USN-2166-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
c70f1a5623ef4452e6609ccdba1270be5aad5463.body: It was discovered that Net-SNMP incorrectly handled AgentX multi-object requests. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to hang, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 12.10. (CVE-2014-2310)

1be632cfd64a8e14f6cd3b0f0039f1546e91a418.title: USN-2987-1: GD library vulnerabilities
1be632cfd64a8e14f6cd3b0f0039f1546e91a418.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled certain color tables in XPM images. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted XPM image, an attacker could cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-2497)

5d2439d232e374f767c8a23ea7c2f639e01d05f0.title: USN-2174-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
5d2439d232e374f767c8a23ea7c2f639e01d05f0.body: An error was discovered in the Linux kernel's DCCP protocol support. A remote attacked could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-2523)

e08bfefc6a9b3d07f43db6e616f31069cff8d57c.title: USN-2173-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e08bfefc6a9b3d07f43db6e616f31069cff8d57c.body: An error was discovered in the Linux kernel's DCCP protocol support. A remote attacked could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-2523)

4d9ad688ef836b61687d785320b0086e17eb9bcb.title: USN-2160-1: LibYAML vulnerability
4d9ad688ef836b61687d785320b0086e17eb9bcb.body: Ivan Fratric discovered that LibYAML incorrectly handled certain malformed YAML documents. An attacker could use this issue to cause LibYAML to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

c024cdd475422d07bb601cd1aec50e3f5ba39bd8.title: USN-2155-1: OpenSSH vulnerability
c024cdd475422d07bb601cd1aec50e3f5ba39bd8.body: Jann Horn discovered that OpenSSH incorrectly handled wildcards in AcceptEnv lines. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly bypass certain intended environment variable restrictions.

17da0336fb51483792f79ecfec5cfce88a343aa7.title: USN-2240-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
17da0336fb51483792f79ecfec5cfce88a343aa7.body: An information leak was discovered in the netfilter subsystem of the Linux kernel. An attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-2568)

d53581fe9407861c42d2762dfde3cc124526156f.title: USN-2935-3: PAM regression
d53581fe9407861c42d2762dfde3cc124526156f.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that the PAM pam_timestamp module incorrectly performed filtering. A local attacker could use this issue to create arbitrary files, or possibly bypass authentication. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-2583)

e66b72e8624c89c0010b043caa588890b428b802.title: USN-2935-1: PAM vulnerabilities
e66b72e8624c89c0010b043caa588890b428b802.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that the PAM pam_timestamp module incorrectly performed filtering. A local attacker could use this issue to create arbitrary files, or possibly bypass authentication. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-2583)

460fecc98c8ada4f808f9f24e6113420d6cd984c.title: USN-2935-2: PAM regression
460fecc98c8ada4f808f9f24e6113420d6cd984c.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that the PAM pam_timestamp module incorrectly performed filtering. A local attacker could use this issue to create arbitrary files, or possibly bypass authentication. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-2583)

8bb848d212c6d541827f652e62b7893a956cfbc6.title: USN-2164-1: OpenSSH vulnerability
8bb848d212c6d541827f652e62b7893a956cfbc6.body: Matthew Vernon discovered that OpenSSH did not correctly check SSHFP DNS records if a server presented an unacceptable host certificate. A malicious server could use this issue to disable SSHFP checking.

3bbbb7560333a74a6b6578667db1c4c944f5e78b.title: USN-2210-1: cups-filters vulnerability
3bbbb7560333a74a6b6578667db1c4c944f5e78b.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that cups-browsed incorrectly filtered remote printer names and strings. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly execute arbitrary commands. (CVE-2014-2707)

738a70aaca92b4a2324f590dccccb78c5218d502.title: USN-2171-1: rsync vulnerability
738a70aaca92b4a2324f590dccccb78c5218d502.body: Ryan Finnie discovered that the rsync daemon incorrectly handled invalid usernames. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause rsync to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service.

f1a40a4431f5439b944bd8d306b1143c52429302.title: USN-2172-1: CUPS vulnerability
f1a40a4431f5439b944bd8d306b1143c52429302.body: Alex Korobkin discovered that the CUPS web interface incorrectly protected against cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. If an authenticated user were tricked into visiting a malicious website while logged into CUPS, a remote attacker could modify the CUPS configuration and possibly steal confidential data.

c0f576731e76ecafa217f3c9810fadf908a29897.title: USN-2182-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
c0f576731e76ecafa217f3c9810fadf908a29897.body: Benoît Canet discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled SMART self-tests. A local guest could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host. (CVE-2014-2894)

c22f96d0f7d808b5f5c50dd681e2b8794e84f502.title: USN-2933-1: Exim vulnerabilities
c22f96d0f7d808b5f5c50dd681e2b8794e84f502.body: Patrick William discovered that Exim incorrectly expanded mathematical comparisons twice. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to perform arbitrary file operations as the Exim user. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-2972)

fa3a7734f1f08a269d9f285150198de913805b63.title: USN-2264-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
fa3a7734f1f08a269d9f285150198de913805b63.body: A bounds check error was discovered in the socket filter subsystem of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) via crafted BPF instructions. (CVE-2014-3144)

9c162f8fed4e71007b4c94d678c944a6f5257d4a.body: Pinkie Pie discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's futex subsystem. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2014-3153)

c897b07a3c24407b729e899849881a8f6e25e937.body: It was discovered that ppp incorrectly handled certain options files. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate privileges.

078e154bf6f57bfd818d1a59d71fbd4397d20159.body: Steven Vittitoe reported multiple stack buffer overflows in Linux kernel's magicmouse HID driver. A physically proximate attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via specially crafted devices. (CVE-2014-3181)

9964a26bb2b40e21368a0aebb6daf7f309880e56.body: Ben Hawkes reported some off by one errors for report descriptors in the Linux kernel's HID stack. 35d1ce9ab8026a4b4322930a8013308b2755f80a.title: USN-2376-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities

d37155846e8f5ecdd91978cb6293b3f747c01333.title: USN-2184-1: Unity vulnerabilities
d37155846e8f5ecdd91978cb6293b3f747c01333.body: Frédéric Bardy discovered that Unity incorrectly filtered keyboard shortcuts when the screen was locked. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to run commands, and unlock the current session. Giovanni Mellini discovered that Unity could display the Dash in certain conditions when the screen was locked. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to run commands, and unlock the current session.

65cd89a0fb8dabc725fc31cc4ca0fe4bfb265dfb.title: USN-2213-1: Dovecot vulnerability
65cd89a0fb8dabc725fc31cc4ca0fe4bfb265dfb.body: It was discovered that Dovecot incorrectly handled closing inactive SSL/TLS connections. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Dovecot to stop responding to new connections, resulting in a denial of service.

84c767db458d76b6a1fe6aaff1d88e6a5e29be86.title: USN-2229-1: GnuTLS vulnerability
84c767db458d76b6a1fe6aaff1d88e6a5e29be86.body: Joonas Kuorilehto discovered that GnuTLS incorrectly handled Server Hello messages. A malicious remote server or a man in the middle could use this issue to cause GnuTLS to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

193af7bacc5bbf5d873ecf38fddcbeaa28604b6a.title: USN-2256-1: Swift vulnerability
193af7bacc5bbf5d873ecf38fddcbeaa28604b6a.body: John Dickinson discovered that Swift did not properly quote the WWW-Authenticate header value. If a user were tricked into navigating to a malicious Swift URL, an attacker could conduct cross-site scripting attacks. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain.

d17c4dc8deb472bbb8a11ba787b8957516507f83.title: USN-2385-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
d17c4dc8deb472bbb8a11ba787b8957516507f83.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled memory when parsing DTLS SRTP extension data. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-3513)

14c4902660a14bc1286d34d5f09c98ab09d806d9.title: USN-2305-1: Samba vulnerability
14c4902660a14bc1286d34d5f09c98ab09d806d9.body: Volker Lendecke discovered that the Samba NetBIOS name service daemon incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could use this issue to execute arbitrary code as the root user.

d9ad28e7887e4acf467e582139c6da5512801dc4.title: USN-2711-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
d9ad28e7887e4acf467e582139c6da5512801dc4.body: It was discovered that Net-SNMP incorrectly handled certain trap messages when the -OQ option was used. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Net-SNMP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3565)

92acd71fa0aaede2d43370a367e57b59bb921bc9.title: USN-2486-1: OpenJDK 6 vulnerabilities
92acd71fa0aaede2d43370a367e57b59bb921bc9.body: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in the OpenJDK JRE related to information disclosure, data integrity and availability. An attacker could exploit these to cause a denial of service or expose sensitive data over the network. (CVE-2014-3566, CVE-2014-6587, CVE-2014-6601, CVE-2015-0395, CVE-2015-0408, CVE-2015-0412)

e3a2b9807393ac0cc8929e5ec53167640ead6b27.title: USN-2487-1: OpenJDK 7 vulnerabilities
e3a2b9807393ac0cc8929e5ec53167640ead6b27.body: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in the OpenJDK JRE related to information disclosure, data integrity and availability. An attacker could exploit these to cause a denial of service or expose sensitive data over the network. (CVE-2014-3566, CVE-2014-6587, CVE-2014-6601, CVE-2015-0395, CVE-2015-0408, CVE-2015-0412)

5c92d8b8de3542577442f14e154665c95283d409.title: USN-2385-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
5c92d8b8de3542577442f14e154665c95283d409.body: It was discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled memory when verifying the integrity of a session ticket. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3567)

82a555097eeeb227dad2a508c5a2c8d31f8fe8dd.title: USN-2523-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
82a555097eeeb227dad2a508c5a2c8d31f8fe8dd.body: Mark Montague discovered that the mod_cache module incorrectly handled empty HTTP Content-Type headers. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to stop responding, leading to a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2014-3581)

d5c57158531d6632306eb20703bc48481acc57c3.title: USN-2523-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
d5c57158531d6632306eb20703bc48481acc57c3.body: Teguh P. Alko discovered that the mod_proxy_fcgi module incorrectly handled long response headers. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to stop responding, leading to a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2014-3583)

a60f496722e48e41a6d942b8be3f894a9b91316b.title: USN-2369-1: file vulnerability
a60f496722e48e41a6d942b8be3f894a9b91316b.body: It was discovered that file incorrectly handled certain CDF documents. A attacker could use this issue to cause file to hang or crash, resulting in a denial of service.

5b4b0cc94568ed66555c213c2e7d02033500be9b.title: USN-2344-1: PHP vulnerabilities
5b4b0cc94568ed66555c213c2e7d02033500be9b.body: It was discovered that the Fileinfo component in php5 contains an integer overflow. An attacker could use this flaw to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted CDF file. (CVE-2014-3587)

fc06035ba171112f2891c3878d3fb32307b44787.title: USN-2344-1: PHP vulnerabilities
fc06035ba171112f2891c3878d3fb32307b44787.body: It was discovered that the php_parserr function contains multiple buffer overflows. An attacker could use this flaw to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted DNS records. (CVE-2014-3597)

68a40904b4ad6afa3513b9c6e8a8d0c1bdd927ca.title: USN-2358-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
68a40904b4ad6afa3513b9c6e8a8d0c1bdd927ca.body: Jack Morgenstein reported a flaw in the page handling of the KVM (Kerenl Virtual Machine) subsystem in the Linux kernel. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (host OS memory corruption) or possibly have other unspecified impact on the host OS. (CVE-2014-3601)

e46d2ec14676c32e633c4d1cc5cc358756fb6deb.title: USN-2359-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e46d2ec14676c32e633c4d1cc5cc358756fb6deb.body: Jack Morgenstein reported a flaw in the page handling of the KVM (Kerenl Virtual Machine) subsystem in the Linux kernel.
