527188941d9c9bf55958c42e21c0e2ca9f85dbb1.title: USN-2327-1: Squid 3 vulnerability
527188941d9c9bf55958c42e21c0e2ca9f85dbb1.body: Matthew Daley discovered that Squid 3 did not properly perform input validation in request parsing. A remote attacker could send crafted Range requests to cause a denial of service.

cbb27095e6dc844c1b4425219a4d7c06635dc891.title: USN-2409-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
cbb27095e6dc844c1b4425219a4d7c06635dc891.body: Laszlo Ersek discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled memory in the vga device. A malicious guest could possibly use this issue to read arbitrary host memory. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2014-3615)

447dde9a724d57a712d70e1121cf677e801f98a1.title: USN-2340-1: procmail vulnerability
447dde9a724d57a712d70e1121cf677e801f98a1.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the formail tool incorrectly handled certain malformed mail headers. An attacker could use this flaw to cause formail to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

57749669000eaba298e6f0e2354b69c5c59b6d84.title: USN-2406-1: OpenStack Keystone vulnerability
57749669000eaba298e6f0e2354b69c5c59b6d84.body: Brant Knudson discovered that OpenStack Keystone did not properly perform input sanitization when performing endpoint catalog substitution. A remote attacker with privileged access for creating endpoints could exploit this to obtain sensitive information.

be3a47265b8f78b5552ec496c1f423144e7e0a52.title: USN-2366-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
be3a47265b8f78b5552ec496c1f423144e7e0a52.body: Luyao Huang discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled certain blkiotune queries. An attacker could use this issue to cause libvirtd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-3633)

f4d5fa4068fa9962216c781cab9d914a03ee62ec.title: USN-2381-1: Rsyslog vulnerabilities
f4d5fa4068fa9962216c781cab9d914a03ee62ec.body: It was discovered that Rsyslog incorrectly handled invalid PRI values. An attacker could use this issue to send malformed messages to the Rsyslog server and cause it to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service and possibly message loss. (CVE-2014-3634, CVE-2014-3683)

006930a9429a55738169717d1f0ff50c0a2eb782.title: USN-2352-1: DBus vulnerabilities
006930a9429a55738169717d1f0ff50c0a2eb782.body: Simon McVittie discovered that DBus incorrectly handled the file descriptors message limit. A local attacker could use this issue to cause DBus to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-3635)

712a6d654fab4b98d88b0582e34e72d4b0047306.title: USN-2352-1: DBus vulnerabilities
712a6d654fab4b98d88b0582e34e72d4b0047306.body: Alban Crequy discovered that DBus incorrectly handled a large number of file descriptor messages. A local attacker could use this issue to cause DBus to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-3636)

7fe0df944e1f134154325b52e3a2b28670575b1a.title: USN-2352-1: DBus vulnerabilities
7fe0df944e1f134154325b52e3a2b28670575b1a.body: Alban Crequy discovered that DBus incorrectly handled a large number of parallel connections and parallel message calls. A local attacker could use this issue to cause DBus to consume resources, possibly resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3638)

2c34df3f453a5bc7303e079a4969ca1af57af23b.title: USN-2352-1: DBus vulnerabilities
2c34df3f453a5bc7303e079a4969ca1af57af23b.body: Alban Crequy discovered that DBus incorrectly handled incomplete connections. A local attacker could use this issue to cause DBus to fail legitimate connection attempts, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3639)

0cb9057712e8cd3f9841643bbd771846fc60ed35.title: USN-2409-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
0cb9057712e8cd3f9841643bbd771846fc60ed35.body: Xavier Mehrenberger and Stephane Duverger discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled certain udp packets when using guest networking. A malicious guest could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3640)

50e22f0083521ab3cdd1a476deb57e5aa0b4193d.title: USN-2405-1: OpenStack Cinder vulnerabilities
50e22f0083521ab3cdd1a476deb57e5aa0b4193d.body: Duncan Thomas discovered that OpenStack Cinder did not properly track the file format when using the GlusterFS of Smbfs drivers. A remote authenticated user could exploit this to potentially obtain file contents from the compute host. (CVE-2014-3641)

1b42fcb3b9940a24a782f8ec0e7bc3ddbfe1617d.title: USN-2418-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
1b42fcb3b9940a24a782f8ec0e7bc3ddbfe1617d.body: A flaw was discovered with invept instruction support when using nested EPT in the KVM (Kernel Virtual Machine). An unprivileged guest user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) on the guest. (CVE-2014-3645)

c7ed61b8c0830d942d62bf31c47dc244d0c066f7.title: USN-2417-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c7ed61b8c0830d942d62bf31c47dc244d0c066f7.body: A flaw was discovered with invept instruction support when using nested EPT in the KVM (Kernel Virtual Machine). An unprivileged guest user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) on the guest. (CVE-2014-3645)

58941df68fe7af2f24303e9291c832138b9d3853.title: USN-2404-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
58941df68fe7af2f24303e9291c832138b9d3853.body: Pavel Hrdina discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled locking when processing the virConnectListAllDomains command. An attacker could use this issue to cause libvirtd to hang, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3657)

ab862de06072852074b908410e5e326a862f4d16.title: USN-2391-1: php5 vulnerabilities
ab862de06072852074b908410e5e326a862f4d16.body: Symeon Paraschoudis discovered that PHP incorrectly handled the mkgmtime function. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3668)

e452e6711b083e53da444f15cf9de422a93b401d.title: USN-2391-1: php5 vulnerabilities
e452e6711b083e53da444f15cf9de422a93b401d.body: Symeon Paraschoudis discovered that PHP incorrectly handled unserializing objects. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3669)

82f7233ac15ac74a91ef023454fb8105ea7995fd.title: USN-2391-1: php5 vulnerabilities
82f7233ac15ac74a91ef023454fb8105ea7995fd.body: Otto Ebeling discovered that PHP incorrectly handled the exif_thumbnail function. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-3670)

dc45a00093a0355c593cc7239973a3d6eface12e.title: USN-2418-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
dc45a00093a0355c593cc7239973a3d6eface12e.body: A flaw in the handling of malformed ASCONF chunks by SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) implementation in the Linux kernel was discovered. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-3673)

b0466d720c62386e4b595b06f4bdd34f096c67d5.title: USN-2417-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b0466d720c62386e4b595b06f4bdd34f096c67d5.body: A flaw in the handling of malformed ASCONF chunks by SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) implementation in the Linux kernel was discovered. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-3673)

154f73e87e77bcc5145f1254dd49913064ef7846.title: USN-2383-1: wpa_supplicant vulnerability
154f73e87e77bcc5145f1254dd49913064ef7846.body: Jouni Malinen discovered that the wpa_cli tool incorrectly sanitized strings when being used with action scripts. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary commands.

16b18e2469a8b460128198dca3829686b49de3ea.title: USN-2418-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
16b18e2469a8b460128198dca3829686b49de3ea.body: It was discovered that excessive queuing by SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) implementation in the Linux kernel can cause memory pressure. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3688)

99a814b98a78739c55a75cc116c36e19b10d1eac.title: USN-2417-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
99a814b98a78739c55a75cc116c36e19b10d1eac.body: It was discovered that excessive queuing by SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) implementation in the Linux kernel can cause memory pressure. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3688)

cb1edbb196c3e521cdc2bfa644e2ffd3245aacc1.title: USN-2409-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
cb1edbb196c3e521cdc2bfa644e2ffd3245aacc1.body: It was discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled parameter validation in the vmware_vga device. A malicious guest could possibly use this issue to write into memory of the host, leading to privilege escalation. (CVE-2014-3689)

490995d11eb8197beadf7eefcc89fa08e951b96a.title: USN-2390-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
490995d11eb8197beadf7eefcc89fa08e951b96a.body: Jacob Appelbaum and an anonymous person discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled certificate validation. A remote attacker could exploit this to perform a man in the middle attack to view sensitive information or alter encrypted communications. (CVE-2014-3694)

fd6a6bdfd1f9c752a19358e947a2b1f8e2e021e0.title: USN-2390-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
fd6a6bdfd1f9c752a19358e947a2b1f8e2e021e0.body: Yves Younan and Richard Johnson discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled certain malformed MXit emoticons. A malicious remote server or a man in the middle could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3695)

5b34e489ec4bf9f85aeccd50f88a0801fe83cf9d.title: USN-2390-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
5b34e489ec4bf9f85aeccd50f88a0801fe83cf9d.body: Yves Younan and Richard Johnson discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled certain malformed Groupwise messages. A malicious remote server or a man in the middle could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3696)

de9a74006a5b61072ebc00595bab13d4803895ff.title: USN-2390-1: Pidgin vulnerabilities
de9a74006a5b61072ebc00595bab13d4803895ff.body: Thijs Alkemade and Paul Aurich discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled memory when processing XMPP messages. A malicious remote server or user could use this issue to cause Pidgin to disclosure arbitrary memory, resulting in an information leak. (CVE-2014-3698)

6178720697013e6fee7033fc7ff8afbe4c4e4cf3.title: USN-2399-1: curl vulnerability
6178720697013e6fee7033fc7ff8afbe4c4e4cf3.body: Symeon Paraschoudis discovered that curl incorrectly handled memory when being used with CURLOPT_COPYPOSTFIELDS and curl_easy_duphandle(). This may result in sensitive data being incorrectly sent to the remote server.

bdec72fbd8825b471b47233dd4e592a7857a6a67.title: USN-2391-1: php5 vulnerabilities
bdec72fbd8825b471b47233dd4e592a7857a6a67.body: Francisco Alonso that PHP incorrectly handled ELF files in the fileinfo extension. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3710)

829d4d0c5ce599eb9e5bc338e7e7b45fe3d52ea4.title: USN-2494-1: file vulnerabilities
829d4d0c5ce599eb9e5bc338e7e7b45fe3d52ea4.body: Francisco Alonso discovered that file incorrectly handled certain ELF files. An attacker could use this issue to cause file to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-3710)

819bf4c34d1d65ad641cb8703fd437c4e3f04e55.title: USN-2212-1: Django vulnerabilities
819bf4c34d1d65ad641cb8703fd437c4e3f04e55.body: Stephen Stewart, Michael Nelson, Natalia Bidart and James Westby discovered that Django improperly removed Vary and Cache-Control headers from HTTP responses when replying to a request from an Internet Explorer or Chrome Frame client. An attacker may use this to retrieve private data or poison caches. This update removes workarounds for bugs in Internet Explorer 6 and 7. (CVE-2014-1418) Peter Kuma and Gavin Wahl discovered that Django did not correctly validate some malformed URLs, which are accepted by some browsers. An attacker may use this to cause unexpected redirects. An update has been provided for 12.04 LTS, 12.10, 13.10, and 14.04 LTS; this issue remains unfixed for 10.04 LTS as no "is_safe_url()" functionality existed in this version.

83e26a1e314ca1e1ddab29e20e51c1dd5b1567d4.title: USN-2216-1: Pidgin vulnerability
83e26a1e314ca1e1ddab29e20e51c1dd5b1567d4.body: It was discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled certain messages from Gadu-Gadu file relay servers. A malicious remote server or a man in the middle could use this issue to cause Pidgin to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

2eb595d076d44f6d74e5e5d3f100b308cebce1f3.title: USN-2215-1: libgadu vulnerability
2eb595d076d44f6d74e5e5d3f100b308cebce1f3.body: It was discovered that libgadu incorrectly handled certain messages from file relay servers. A malicious remote server or a man in the middle could use this issue to cause applications using libgadu to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

cfebc96e748ca75c53d9cb68d263fec3fefa264d.title: USN-2249-1: OpenStack Heat vulnerability
cfebc96e748ca75c53d9cb68d263fec3fefa264d.body: Jason Dunsmore discovered that OpenStack heat did not properly restrict access to template information. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to see URL provider templates of other tenants for a limited time.

8ab29b4aa2d5432256106f7fc4dea18864cc6b09.title: USN-2242-1: dpkg vulnerabilities
8ab29b4aa2d5432256106f7fc4dea18864cc6b09.body: It was discovered that dpkg incorrectly handled certain patches when unpacking source packages. If a user or an automated system were tricked into unpacking a specially crafted source package, a remote attacker could modify files outside the target unpack directory, leading to a denial of service or potentially gaining access to the system.

22ef89681f309691c761bc7207cbd6f6621faede.title: USN-2334-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
22ef89681f309691c761bc7207cbd6f6621faede.body: An flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's audit subsystem when auditing certain syscalls. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive single-bit values from kernel memory or cause a denial of service (OOPS). (CVE-2014-3917)

9834e595080e780e589662c6cf8be6266a3fcb0d.title: USN-2335-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
9834e595080e780e589662c6cf8be6266a3fcb0d.body: An flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's audit subsystem when auditing certain syscalls. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive single-bit values from kernel memory or cause a denial of service (OOPS). (CVE-2014-3917)

657ec98d77fb07ec112b15eaca3ceeb3e4e45e76.title: USN-2334-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
657ec98d77fb07ec112b15eaca3ceeb3e4e45e76.body: An information leak was discovered in the rd_mcp backend of the iSCSI target subsystem in the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from ramdisk_mcp memory by leveraging access to a SCSI initiator. (CVE-2014-4027)

dbacc59e29e1e7ce4b591c1361ef6fc391787648.title: USN-2335-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
dbacc59e29e1e7ce4b591c1361ef6fc391787648.body: An information leak was discovered in the rd_mcp backend of the iSCSI target subsystem in the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from ramdisk_mcp memory by leveraging access to a SCSI initiator. (CVE-2014-4027)

fa96ab363032c2c0bacab5e0676bc058e73a0eb7.title: USN-2255-1: OpenStack Neutron vulnerabilities
fa96ab363032c2c0bacab5e0676bc058e73a0eb7.body: Thiago Martins discovered that OpenStack Neutron would inappropriately apply SNAT rules to IPv6 subnets when using the L3-agent. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to prevent floating IPv4 addresses from being attached throughout the cloud. (CVE-2014-4167)

6fc743bfb5ac8dd1f58ca79a2cf9f54c04b3ad69.title: USN-2916-1: Perl vulnerabilities
6fc743bfb5ac8dd1f58ca79a2cf9f54c04b3ad69.body: Markus Vervier discovered that Perl incorrectly handled nesting in the Data::Dumper module. An attacker could use this issue to cause Perl to consume memory and crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-4330)

3122b702a90e35ebd4536de9d4a71b2baead884b.title: USN-2334-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3122b702a90e35ebd4536de9d4a71b2baead884b.body: Toralf Förster reported an error in the Linux kernels syscall auditing on 32 bit x86 platforms. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (OOPS and system crash). (CVE-2014-4508)

d04c7fe04d197676390935ac8a21624b2f57a563.title: USN-2421-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d04c7fe04d197676390935ac8a21624b2f57a563.body: Don Bailey discovered a flaw in the LZO decompress algorithm used by the Linux kernel. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory corruption or OOPS). (CVE-2014-4608)

4638d4eb03b0967e84e89fbab68c6835e0e3f2de.title: USN-2419-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
4638d4eb03b0967e84e89fbab68c6835e0e3f2de.body: Don Bailey discovered a flaw in the LZO decompress algorithm used by the Linux kernel. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory corruption or OOPS). (CVE-2014-4608)

17a0c8caa7b7592ab0cf991d796a807b4e7738ea.title: USN-2416-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
17a0c8caa7b7592ab0cf991d796a807b4e7738ea.body: Don Bailey discovered a flaw in the LZO decompress algorithm used by the Linux kernel. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory corruption or OOPS). (CVE-2014-4608)

be90103d02e72afec8a1d5c6823b20d0cdd7c503.title: USN-2420-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
be90103d02e72afec8a1d5c6823b20d0cdd7c503.body: Don Bailey discovered a flaw in the LZO decompress algorithm used by the Linux kernel. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory corruption or OOPS). (CVE-2014-4608)

c477d130de82c220875b20d3552ce9ebdd9d158c.title: USN-2418-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
c477d130de82c220875b20d3552ce9ebdd9d158c.body: Don Bailey discovered a flaw in the LZO decompress algorithm used by the Linux kernel. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory corruption or OOPS). (CVE-2014-4608)

b38d6a9dd9871aa017512121e7fa93f7ad9821e8.title: USN-2417-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b38d6a9dd9871aa017512121e7fa93f7ad9821e8.body: Don Bailey discovered a flaw in the LZO decompress algorithm used by the Linux kernel. An attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory corruption or OOPS). (CVE-2014-4608)

95d5df2328b7035cb374ce4c470b7e9967b2d0f3.title: USN-2311-1: pyCADF vulnerability
95d5df2328b7035cb374ce4c470b7e9967b2d0f3.body: Zhi Kun Liu discovered that pyCADF incorrectly filtered certain tokens. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain authentication tokens used in REST requests.

0b50b70a52eafdbea175259dfe4e4fa19e97eda2.title: USN-2258-1: GnuPG vulnerability
0b50b70a52eafdbea175259dfe4e4fa19e97eda2.body: Jean-René Reinhard, Olivier Levillain and Florian Maury discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled certain OpenPGP messages. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially-crafted message, GnuPG could consume resources, resulting in a denial of service.

d6c88866867144982db197da23ff8d932ed555f9.title: USN-2334-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d6c88866867144982db197da23ff8d932ed555f9.body: A use-after-free flaw was discovered in the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA) control implementation of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-4653)

0429a0968be129df51e275e1035bae3d352aa62e.title: USN-2335-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
0429a0968be129df51e275e1035bae3d352aa62e.body: A use-after-free flaw was discovered in the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA) control implementation of the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-4653)

5dd017d5858c0fc09323cc73f8989963d6d1b2a9.title: USN-2334-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5dd017d5858c0fc09323cc73f8989963d6d1b2a9.body: A authorization bug was discovered with the snd_ctl_elem_add function of the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA) in the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit his bug to cause a denial of service (remove kernel controls). (CVE-2014-4654)

6e8ecaaf4b50fcfa572dc95658cc05c40c96f26b.title: USN-2335-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
6e8ecaaf4b50fcfa572dc95658cc05c40c96f26b.body: A authorization bug was discovered with the snd_ctl_elem_add function of the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA) in the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit his bug to cause a denial of service (remove kernel controls). (CVE-2014-4654)

adf23c42ed2b140f50ddd23b86ac0b0acb608c19.title: USN-2334-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
adf23c42ed2b140f50ddd23b86ac0b0acb608c19.body: A flaw discovered in how the snd_ctl_elem function of the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA) handled a reference count. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (integer overflow and limit bypass). (CVE-2014-4655)

c5c8992cf3cfbb4fb3ab5e20b568b78984c548c3.title: USN-2335-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
c5c8992cf3cfbb4fb3ab5e20b568b78984c548c3.body: A flaw discovered in how the snd_ctl_elem function of the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA) handled a reference count. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (integer overflow and limit bypass). (CVE-2014-4655)

d10ad6830ace9b76b21d274d33ec52e01cfb8c94.title: USN-2334-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d10ad6830ace9b76b21d274d33ec52e01cfb8c94.body: An integer overflow flaw was discovered in the control implementation of the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA). A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-4656)

741e9fd05af08a2ac4219bb038d24506dd0b6d14.title: USN-2335-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
741e9fd05af08a2ac4219bb038d24506dd0b6d14.body: An integer overflow flaw was discovered in the control implementation of the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA). A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-4656)

333fa3ca3e33446edd769f7c6514115e055bf5cc.title: USN-2393-1: Wget vulnerability
333fa3ca3e33446edd769f7c6514115e055bf5cc.body: HD Moore discovered that Wget contained a path traversal vulnerability when downloading symlinks using FTP. A malicious remote FTP server or a man in the middle could use this issue to cause Wget to overwrite arbitrary files, possibly leading to arbitrary code execution.

33aa0f5a73b549c09783c1153f673aece3ae0ba9.title: USN-2279-1: Transmission vulnerability
33aa0f5a73b549c09783c1153f673aece3ae0ba9.body: Ben Hawkes discovered that Transmission incorrectly handled certain peer messages. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

f0d7e1344930a3f19bc88453103c5a495bb9721a.title: USN-2397-1: Ruby vulnerabilities
f0d7e1344930a3f19bc88453103c5a495bb9721a.body: Will Wood discovered that Ruby incorrectly handled the encodes() function. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Ruby to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. The default compiler options for affected releases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial of service. (CVE-2014-4975)

4827075f790a78de35fc6e582743b364ecd0928e.title: USN-2341-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
4827075f790a78de35fc6e582743b364ecd0928e.body: Salvatore Bonaccorso discovered that the CUPS web interface incorrectly validated permissions and incorrectly handled symlinks. An attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass file permissions and read arbitrary files, possibly leading to a privilege escalation.

619cbba94c456d2efc95b764e72b52b9f29ab72e.title: USN-2358-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
619cbba94c456d2efc95b764e72b52b9f29ab72e.body: Jason Gunthorpe reported a flaw with SCTP authentication in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS). (CVE-2014-5077)

a5ceb40720be18a0f19d3dd58de01a581084d7a2.title: USN-2334-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a5ceb40720be18a0f19d3dd58de01a581084d7a2.body: Jason Gunthorpe reported a flaw with SCTP authentication in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS). (CVE-2014-5077)

3eec70d899aa859ebc6bef84977231faeb8d4fa9.title: USN-2335-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
3eec70d899aa859ebc6bef84977231faeb8d4fa9.body: Jason Gunthorpe reported a flaw with SCTP authentication in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS). (CVE-2014-5077)

15d2be8accad7f5bae1e63d5790cbe50b7013922.title: USN-2359-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
15d2be8accad7f5bae1e63d5790cbe50b7013922.body: Jason Gunthorpe reported a flaw with SCTP authentication in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS). (CVE-2014-5077)

c6d70cdd9406c67ddeb86e1c09caebf5da41a782.title: USN-2317-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
c6d70cdd9406c67ddeb86e1c09caebf5da41a782.body: Kenton Varda discovered a flaw with read-only bind mounds when used with user namespaces. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to gain full write privileges to a mount that should be read only. (CVE-2014-5206)

5cc1e32f21328a3871932f028708cec5b548b64a.title: USN-2318-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5cc1e32f21328a3871932f028708cec5b548b64a.body: Kenton Varda discovered a flaw with read-only bind mounds when used with user namespaces. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to gain full write privileges to a mount that should be read only. (CVE-2014-5206)

5e0c01d3fc58e3f4691196d4dc9ecdbab423ffb8.title: USN-2317-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
5e0c01d3fc58e3f4691196d4dc9ecdbab423ffb8.body: Eric W. Biederman discovered a flaw with the mediation of mount flags in the Linux kernel's user namespace subsystem. An unprivileged user could exploit this flaw to by-pass mount restrictions, and potentially gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2014-5207)

3d20d43c4f862757fbf06bd33cc05fba9d2a673c.title: USN-2318-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3d20d43c4f862757fbf06bd33cc05fba9d2a673c.body: Eric W. Biederman discovered a flaw with the mediation of mount flags in the Linux kernel's user namespace subsystem. An unprivileged user could exploit this flaw to by-pass mount restrictions, and potentially gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2014-5207)

03e4007ce9b0b748132c35fc24b9d4cd14f0d9ae.title: USN-2409-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
03e4007ce9b0b748132c35fc24b9d4cd14f0d9ae.body: It was discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled USB xHCI controller live migration. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-5263)

b225609e1e03d7b2fd2f69d6df62dab2f27d35fa.title: USN-2498-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
b225609e1e03d7b2fd2f69d6df62dab2f27d35fa.body: Patrik Kis discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled LDAP queries with no results. An authenticated remote attacker could use this issue to cause the KDC to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-5353)

c7cce69446a0a562cb1581bac46ef551cf278d80.title: USN-2322-1: OpenStack Glance vulnerability
c7cce69446a0a562cb1581bac46ef551cf278d80.body: Thomas Leaman and Stuart McLaren discovered that OpenStack Glance did not properly honor the image_size_cap configuration option. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service via disk consumption.

ba38a3b87594d3d9d4b3c856124066c73fe33415.title: USN-2338-1: Lua vulnerability
ba38a3b87594d3d9d4b3c856124066c73fe33415.body: It was discovered that Lua incorrectly handled certain vararg functions with a large number of fixed parameters. An attacker could use this issue to cause Lua applications to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

dccc797e2ca1327b7121656b5717cff6d2ef0bf8.title: USN-2355-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
dccc797e2ca1327b7121656b5717cff6d2ef0bf8.body: Chris Evans reported an flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of iso9660 (compact disk filesystem) images. An attacker who can mount a custom iso9660 image either via a CD/DVD drive or a loopback mount could cause a denial of service (system crash or reboot). (CVE-2014-5471)

f161663cdc371280854fe20082cb5dbfdb28b005.title: USN-2354-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f161663cdc371280854fe20082cb5dbfdb28b005.body: Chris Evans reported an flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of iso9660 (compact disk filesystem) images. An attacker who can mount a custom iso9660 image either via a CD/DVD drive or a loopback mount could cause a denial of service (system crash or reboot). (CVE-2014-5471)

1a2bd46aaf8e94baea560bad7f54c70dda74595f.title: USN-2358-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
1a2bd46aaf8e94baea560bad7f54c70dda74595f.body: Chris Evans reported an flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of iso9660 (compact disk filesystem) images. An attacker who can mount a custom iso9660 image either via a CD/DVD drive or a loopback mount could cause a denial of service (system crash or reboot). (CVE-2014-5471)

4e1f805fd48a62fa55bda076b0ab73be597ea5de.body: Chris Evans reported an flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of iso9660 (compact disk filesystem) images. An attacker who can mount a custom iso9660 image either via a CD/DVD drive or a loopback mount could cause a denial of service (system crash or reboot). (CVE-2014-5471)

3739285ea023ef7a472f123811b98913b6bf2382.body: Chris Evans reported an flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of iso9660 (compact disk filesystem) images. An attacker who can mount a custom iso9660 image, with a self-referential CL entry, either via a CD/DVD drive or a loopback mount could cause a denial of service (unkillable mount process). (CVE-2014-5472)

(CVE-2014-5472)

b12cc0c31a7963780652beef19a5a948947b895e.title: USN-2432-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
b12cc0c31a7963780652beef19a5a948947b895e.body: Adhemerval Zanella Netto discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled certain multibyte characters when using the iconv function. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause applications to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-6040)

3d3a644805c7a2f4e29bec01cfcb9bbd82885279.title: USN-2365-1: LibVNCServer vulnerabilities
3d3a644805c7a2f4e29bec01cfcb9bbd82885279.body: Nicolas Ruff discovered that LibVNCServer incorrectly handled memory when being advertised large screen sizes by the server. If a user were tricked into connecting to a malicious server, an attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-6051, CVE-2014-6052)

bb06305838f0bd49c9d5bd752270adf0e80c813f.title: USN-2365-1: LibVNCServer vulnerabilities
bb06305838f0bd49c9d5bd752270adf0e80c813f.body: Nicolas Ruff discovered that LibVNCServer incorrectly handled zero scaling factor values. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a server to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-6054)

5e4eaa97efd308eb7dc3742745cadca64f3d1a03.title: USN-2921-1: Squid vulnerabilities
5e4eaa97efd308eb7dc3742745cadca64f3d1a03.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that Squid incorrectly handled certain SNMP requests. If SNMP is enabled, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Squid to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-6270)

316aafffc61dfee38826644f11cef4210ac439a6.title: USN-2362-1: Bash vulnerability
316aafffc61dfee38826644f11cef4210ac439a6.body: Stephane Chazelas discovered that Bash incorrectly handled trailing code in function definitions. An attacker could use this issue to bypass environment restrictions, such as SSH forced command environments.

d4a18808bf4932413e355b2d9918d9b4d32f2885.title: USN-2353-1: APT vulnerability
d4a18808bf4932413e355b2d9918d9b4d32f2885.body: It was discovered that APT incorrectly handled certain http URLs. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to cause APT to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. The default compiler options for affected releases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial of service. (CVE-2014-6273)

9460163ab2384680d6babe00224ee8e1e11a8007.title: USN-2380-1: Bash vulnerabilities
9460163ab2384680d6babe00224ee8e1e11a8007.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that Bash incorrectly handled parsing certain function definitions. If an attacker were able to create an environment variable containing a function definition with a very specific name, these issues could possibly be used to bypass certain environment restrictions and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-6277, CVE-2014-6278)

40cf0b12af5e8a0073c21f71aeb4fe668622d354.title: USN-2375-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
40cf0b12af5e8a0073c21f71aeb4fe668622d354.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's UDF filesystem (used on some CD-ROMs and DVDs) when processing indirect ICBs. An attacker who can cause CD, DVD or image file with a specially crafted inode to be mounted can cause a denial of service (infinite loop or stack consumption). (CVE-2014-6410)

391ba94f823bf9f12f49e888063b192b8df4f3dd.title: USN-2377-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
391ba94f823bf9f12f49e888063b192b8df4f3dd.body: A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's UDF filesystem (used on some CD-ROMs and DVDs) when processing indirect ICBs. 6094eaef9bc6998b46c465ec02fa156a98117c1c.title: USN-2408-1: OpenStack Neutron vulnerability
6094eaef9bc6998b46c465ec02fa156a98117c1c.body: Elena Ezhova discovered that OpenStack Neutron did not properly perform access control checks for attributes. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to bypass intended access controls and reset admin-only attributes to default values.

36e59d58005c9cf79900e61b1a2289709f9778c3.title: USN-2377-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
36e59d58005c9cf79900e61b1a2289709f9778c3.body: James Eckersall discovered a buffer overflow in the Ceph filesystem in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and panic) or possibly have other unspecified impact via a long unencrypted auth ticket. (CVE-2014-6416)

4e41b3a780da3677407df97b1e480960d732ba43.title: USN-2376-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4e41b3a780da3677407df97b1e480960d732ba43.body: James Eckersall discovered a buffer overflow in the Ceph filesystem in the Linux kernel. 7e3328fbbbf8eea1163f597cb1aeb4445d18facc.body: James Eckersall discovered a flaw in the handling of memory allocation failures in the Ceph filesystem. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact. (CVE-2014-6417)

f34d67473a00fb8e6eaf651a4ddcd975a84f8a2b.body: James Eckersall discovered a flaw in how the Ceph filesystem validates auth replies. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact. (CVE-2014-6418)

2db2f5608d2505f8eae08cd6e8dd7045fa12ff25.body: James Eckersall discovered a flaw in how the Ceph filesystem validates auth replies. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact. (CVE-2014-6418)

4959f63c389142624d0a8d9450d2f7cc72d4594b.title: USN-2379-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4959f63c389142624d0a8d9450d2f7cc72d4594b.body: James Eckersall discovered a flaw in how the Ceph filesystem validates auth replies. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact. (CVE-2014-6418)

71ca0d9494168d1c4433c6a8f366a8c4de64356a.title: USN-2378-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
71ca0d9494168d1c4433c6a8f366a8c4de64356a.body: James Eckersall discovered a flaw in how the Ceph filesystem validates auth replies. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact. (CVE-2014-6418)

778afe6438d0439b96e0b0c8162fbe91a8a709df.title: USN-2422-1: Squid vulnerabilities
778afe6438d0439b96e0b0c8162fbe91a8a709df.body: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that the Squid pinger incorrectly handled certain malformed ICMP packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Squid to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

a212b5e6014cc2f742692607702b9196bb30da21.title: USN-2705-1: Keystone vulnerabilities
a212b5e6014cc2f742692607702b9196bb30da21.body: Qin Zhao discovered Keystone disabled certification verification when the "insecure" option is set in a paste configuration (paste.ini) file regardless of the value, which allows remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks via a crafted certificate. (CVE-2014-7144)

9f7eb8954bedb34f0c44c8c4429a1ef74b53c7ac.title: USN-2394-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
9f7eb8954bedb34f0c44c8c4429a1ef74b53c7ac.body: Raphael Geissert reported a NULL pointer dereference in the Linux kernel's CIFS client. A remote CIFS server could cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact by deleting IPC$ share during resolution of DFS referrals. (CVE-2014-7145)

04db93c5b7661ad3378343c8949eee8bb7a9a71f.title: USN-2363-1: Bash vulnerability
04db93c5b7661ad3378343c8949eee8bb7a9a71f.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that the security fix for Bash included in USN-2362-1 was incomplete. An attacker could use this issue to bypass certain environment restrictions. (CVE-2014-7169)

fa5eec34a25d1fe81e248732f103a27d32ef3729.title: USN-2363-2: Bash vulnerability
fa5eec34a25d1fe81e248732f103a27d32ef3729.body: USN-2363-1 fixed a vulnerability in Bash. Due to a build issue, the patch for CVE-2014-7169 didn't get properly applied in the Ubuntu 14.04 LTS package. This update fixes the problem.

103739cff6b8be859293774e2e797f285f496ceb.title: USN-2364-1: Bash vulnerabilities
103739cff6b8be859293774e2e797f285f496ceb.body: Florian Weimer and Todd Sabin discovered that the Bash parser incorrectly handled memory. An attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass certain environment restrictions and execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-7186, CVE-2014-7187)

92ea3c08c713e1f2a0111db13d4629ea5a53a590.title: USN-2371-1: Exuberant Ctags vulnerability
92ea3c08c713e1f2a0111db13d4629ea5a53a590.body: It was discovered that Exuberant Ctags incorrectly handled certain minified js files. An attacker could use this issue to possibly cause Exuberant Ctags to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service.

07a15e11c4356b8165a45341c2adfa07e231c2a0.title: USN-2405-1: OpenStack Cinder vulnerabilities
07a15e11c4356b8165a45341c2adfa07e231c2a0.body: Amrith Kumar discovered that OpenStack Cinder did not properly sanitize log message contents. Under certain circumstances, a local attacker with read access to Cinder log files could obtain access to sensitive information. (CVE-2014-7230)

ee1459c2b561c827e53d3a12f698486068a08e41.title: USN-2409-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
ee1459c2b561c827e53d3a12f698486068a08e41.body: James Spadaro discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled certain VNC bytes_per_pixel values. An attacker having access to a VNC console could possibly use this issue to cause a guest to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-7815)

d111d78ea2daa80d75987a008fba4622e694ef7e.title: USN-2432-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
d111d78ea2daa80d75987a008fba4622e694ef7e.body: Tim Waugh discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly enforced the WRDE_NOCMD flag when handling the wordexp function. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary commands. (CVE-2014-7817)

176dc244c3f4abcd4ee4b0f2e75ac2a3842b6984.title: USN-2543-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
176dc244c3f4abcd4ee4b0f2e75ac2a3842b6984.body: The Linux kernel's splice system call did not correctly validate its parameters. A local, unprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-7822)

c9070b7b10d3ca2c5760fc72e3d1dc74682fcb54.title: USN-2541-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c9070b7b10d3ca2c5760fc72e3d1dc74682fcb54.body: The Linux kernel's splice system call did not correctly validate its parameters. A local, unprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-7822)

b59cda661b30e25bdea3cb2327e8987cbbc5e7fd.title: USN-2544-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b59cda661b30e25bdea3cb2327e8987cbbc5e7fd.body: The Linux kernel's splice system call did not correctly validate its parameters. A local, unprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-7822)

97830af62546bb829a41f79f53faea1cee498d61.title: USN-2542-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
97830af62546bb829a41f79f53faea1cee498d61.body: The Linux kernel's splice system call did not correctly validate its parameters. A local, unprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2014-7822)

5590423064e75e907c08b96abc1f128af13f0eaa.title: USN-2425-1: DBus vulnerability
5590423064e75e907c08b96abc1f128af13f0eaa.body: It was discovered that DBus incorrectly handled a large number of file descriptor messages. A local attacker could use this issue to cause DBus to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-7824)

7fde3d7879a5d0e9678305b8ded4aac2e0287351.title: USN-2476-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
7fde3d7879a5d0e9678305b8ded4aac2e0287351.body: Several memory corruption bugs were discovered in V8. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via renderer crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2014-7927, CVE-2014-7928, CVE-2014-7931)

ed14ecd767ea7a8e46ec5f5b6d5a35fb24ec3c37.title: USN-2476-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
ed14ecd767ea7a8e46ec5f5b6d5a35fb24ec3c37.body: Multiple off-by-one errors were discovered in FFmpeg. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2014-7937)

f502d0fc5e3614076e9bdc807f43fcfc2fde1654.title: USN-2476-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
f502d0fc5e3614076e9bdc807f43fcfc2fde1654.body: A memory corruption bug was discovered in the fonts implementation. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2014-7938)

616ff7bcf11dd268e693f3d9dde062df004dd5ba.title: USN-2476-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
616ff7bcf11dd268e693f3d9dde062df004dd5ba.body: It was discovered that ICU did not initialize memory for a data structure correctly. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2014-7940)

ea4bd8dabbe55490d0403bef7b14c0bc16e83a6c.title: USN-2476-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
ea4bd8dabbe55490d0403bef7b14c0bc16e83a6c.body: It was discovered that the fonts implementation did not initialize memory for a data structure correctly. 16ab05d65ca98adf722f72ee2d10208ff17af96f.title: USN-2476-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
16ab05d65ca98adf722f72ee2d10208ff17af96f.body: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in Skia. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2014-7943)

f40f7a3faef9f7dce25fd759e2c9efad3d1b9d2e.title: USN-2476-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
f40f7a3faef9f7dce25fd759e2c9efad3d1b9d2e.body: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2014-7946)

1dd91fd9fce3dcb9dd1bf59c5ba26955a64146b9.title: USN-2476-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
1dd91fd9fce3dcb9dd1bf59c5ba26955a64146b9.body: It was discovered that the AppCache proceeded with caching for SSL sessions even if there is a certificate error. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this by conducting a MITM attack to modify HTML application content. (CVE-2014-7948)

1f875a8de1f40ff6fd9c0ede0e5298c48338b6d4.title: USN-2704-1: Swift vulnerabilities
1f875a8de1f40ff6fd9c0ede0e5298c48338b6d4.body: Rajaneesh Singh discovered Swift does not properly enforce metadata limits. An attacker could abuse this issue to store more metadata than allowed by policy. (CVE-2014-7960)

5391478babfcf5b81bdbbcc904c46dbc93066523.title: USN-2430-1: OpenVPN vulnerability
5391478babfcf5b81bdbbcc904c46dbc93066523.body: Dragana Damjanovic discovered that OpenVPN incorrectly handled certain control channel packets. An authenticated attacker could use this issue to cause an OpenVPN server to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

65a29c6ac1e9334d2e581205bbff38409a11fe16.title: USN-2523-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
65a29c6ac1e9334d2e581205bbff38409a11fe16.body: It was discovered that the mod_lua module incorrectly handled different arguments within different contexts. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass intended access restrictions. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2014-8109)

f437249a2d8a1d98d7bf74e79f1e3d63496b81a1.title: USN-2494-1: file vulnerabilities
f437249a2d8a1d98d7bf74e79f1e3d63496b81a1.body: Thomas Jarosch discovered that file incorrectly handled certain ELF files. An attacker could use this issue to cause file to hang or crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-8116)

aa7bdc9774bb0506a3b5e46cecfd611559f58971.title: USN-2494-1: file vulnerabilities
aa7bdc9774bb0506a3b5e46cecfd611559f58971.body: Thomas Jarosch discovered that file incorrectly limited recursion. An attacker could use this issue to cause file to hang or crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-8117)

43990c453a6872a79f17c6aaa0b8797bd880aadf.title: USN-2535-1: PHP vulnerabilities
43990c453a6872a79f17c6aaa0b8797bd880aadf.body: Thomas Jarosch discovered that PHP incorrectly limited recursion in the fileinfo extension. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PHP to consume resources or crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-8117)

d2afd9570d79503580aa04f55329e460810889b5.title: USN-2516-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d2afd9570d79503580aa04f55329e460810889b5.body: Andy Lutomirski discovered an information leak in the Linux kernel's Thread Local Storage (TLS) implementation allowing users to bypass the espfix to obtain information that could be used to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. A local user could exploit this flaw to obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2014-8133)

3ec5c961cfd37ed59b2bd953beaa12ec2babb445.body: Peter Krempa discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled locking when certain ACL checks failed. A local attacker could use this issue to cause libvirt to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-8136)

28656370d396955f0a9a9fa4ac877910c89c6bbe.title: USN-2483-1: JasPer vulnerabilities
28656370d396955f0a9a9fa4ac877910c89c6bbe.body: Jose Duart discovered that JasPer incorrectly decoded certain malformed JPEG-2000 image files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted JPEG-2000 image file, a remote attacker could cause JasPer to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges. (CVE-2014-8138)

da464b685080f0759761226dc4e787d51d7341af.body: Andrew Bartlett discovered that Samba incorrectly handled delegation of authority when being used as an Active Directory Domain Controller. An attacker given delegation privileges could use this issue to escalate their privileges further.

6f277d7cc986d817154a413ef462cfc912f70116.title: USN-2525-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
6f277d7cc986d817154a413ef462cfc912f70116.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel's Infiniband subsystem did not properly sanitize its input parameters while registering memory regions from userspace. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or to potentially gain administrative privileges.

e1eefdc8edc5bcf3698a88fe19a30b9899a836f3.title: USN-2518-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e1eefdc8edc5bcf3698a88fe19a30b9899a836f3.body: A restriction bypass was discovered in iptables when conntrack rules are specified and the conntrack protocol handler module is not loaded into the Linux kernel. This flaw can cause the firewall rules on the system to be bypassed when conntrack rules are used. (CVE-2014-8160)

61b907cd14fd2ebc7921ee6908029449369fe2a4.title: USN-2515-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
61b907cd14fd2ebc7921ee6908029449369fe2a4.body: A restriction bypass was discovered in iptables when conntrack rules are specified and the conntrack protocol handler module is not loaded into the Linux kernel. 44a63418592ae294b566b4dd70de33c803eef20b.title: USN-2514-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities

87c16aac3fb9564e00ecbf0ed9b796d96d033808.title: USN-2513-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
87c16aac3fb9564e00ecbf0ed9b796d96d033808.body: A restriction bypass was discovered in iptables when conntrack rules are specified and the conntrack protocol handler module is not loaded into the Linux kernel. This flaw can cause the firewall rules on the system to be bypassed when conntrack rules are used. (CVE-2014-8160)

ef653d58cd59be9f55007b51fe28fbbc43b5e3a7.title: USN-2579-1: autofs vulnerability
ef653d58cd59be9f55007b51fe28fbbc43b5e3a7.body: It was discovered that autofs incorrectly filtered environment variables when using program maps. When program maps were configured, a local user could use this issue to escalate privileges. This update changes the default behaviour by adding a prefix to environment variables. Sites using program maps will need to adapt to the new variable names, or revert to the previous names by using a new configuration option called FORCE_STANDARD_PROGRAM_MAP_ENV.

459b4a99e9de4ad912a569b390b5daf5b2fa078b.title: USN-2639-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
459b4a99e9de4ad912a569b390b5daf5b2fa078b.body: Praveen Kariyanahalli, Ivan Fratric and Felix Groebert discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled memory when buffering DTLS data. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-8176)

7260967de366262a66ffbdd1f002c6397093e3de.title: USN-2401-1: Konversation vulnerability
7260967de366262a66ffbdd1f002c6397093e3de.body: Manuel Nickschas discovered that Konversation did not properly perform input sanitization when using Blowfish ECB encryption. A remote attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service.

a5f666dc820fd3de2cbb895911da6d09ab8be04b.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
a5f666dc820fd3de2cbb895911da6d09ab8be04b.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that the srec_scan function in libbfd in GNU binutils allowed out-of-bounds reads. An attacker could use this to craft input to cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 10.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-8484)

e64c74cdee40181139edf772be4ffafda3295839.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
e64c74cdee40181139edf772be4ffafda3295839.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that the setup_group function in libbfd in GNU binutils did not properly check group headers in ELF files. An attacker could use this to craft input that could cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-8485)

0f8982e3abdb185f8be1de91b08f92981258fedc.title: USN-2437-1: Bind vulnerability
0f8982e3abdb185f8be1de91b08f92981258fedc.body: Florian Maury discovered that Bind incorrectly handled delegation. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Bind to consume resources and crash, resulting in a denial of service.

d4a3d634e996809d40ef7b95628bf2328cef193c.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
d4a3d634e996809d40ef7b95628bf2328cef193c.body: Hanno Böck discovered that the _bfd_XXi_swap_aouthdr_in function in libbfd in GNU binutils allowed out-of-bounds writes. An attacker could use this to craft input that could cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-8501)

c6fa17217165ef4ec1f89c964304ca5b4b421621.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
c6fa17217165ef4ec1f89c964304ca5b4b421621.body: Hanno Böck discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in the pe_print_edata function in libbfd in GNU binutils. An attacker could use this to craft input that could cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-8502)

9b08445a2a07ddc91ee668f6ce6097a9ec46c318.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
9b08445a2a07ddc91ee668f6ce6097a9ec46c318.body: Hanno Böck discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the ihex_scan function in libbfd in GNU binutils. An attacker could use this to craft input that could cause a denial of service (application crash). (CVE-2014-8503)

432a859fbbc8714d3cd40763bfe28fd2eeee5ccc.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
432a859fbbc8714d3cd40763bfe28fd2eeee5ccc.body: Michal Zalewski discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the srec_scan function in libbfd in GNU binutils. An attacker could use this to to craft input that could cause a denial of service (application crash); the GNU C library's Fortify Source printf protection should prevent the possibility of executing arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-8504)

0e510eb05354c7a0bc2ed0ada0527d2a9702ae94.title: USN-2944-1: Libav vulnerabilities
0e510eb05354c7a0bc2ed0ada0527d2a9702ae94.body: It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformed media files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted media file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

af7d8d4f29576be7667131d8cb675cb9d94a7b78.title: USN-2534-1: Libav vulnerabilities
af7d8d4f29576be7667131d8cb675cb9d94a7b78.body: It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformed media files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted media file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

2551412aba39e8275a208d184138121841a0156a.title: USN-2403-1: GnuTLS vulnerability
2551412aba39e8275a208d184138121841a0156a.body: Sean Burford discovered that GnuTLS incorrectly handled printing certain elliptic curve parameters. A malicious remote server or client could use this issue to cause GnuTLS to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

1914cdf29cc1585e36d88e177283609fc6673638.title: USN-2414-1: KDE-Runtime vulnerability
1914cdf29cc1585e36d88e177283609fc6673638.body: Tim Brown and Darron Burton discovered that KDE-Runtime incorrectly handled input validation. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary javascript.

4f3fbf480e0b1d650a25668a046822d9f0ca9710.title: USN-2484-1: Unbound vulnerability
4f3fbf480e0b1d650a25668a046822d9f0ca9710.body: Florian Maury discovered that Unbound incorrectly handled delegation. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Unbound to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service.

8af1a3e31a4fc0c69ef1dffff6ea765633a924c3.title: USN-2460-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
8af1a3e31a4fc0c69ef1dffff6ea765633a924c3.body: Muneaki Nishimura discovered that requests from navigator.sendBeacon() lack an origin header. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site request forgery (XSRF) attacks. (CVE-2014-8638)

2f54807c670c5147209da008a5717b9b556f2bac.title: USN-2402-1: KDE workspace vulnerability
2f54807c670c5147209da008a5717b9b556f2bac.body: David Edmundson discovered that the KDE Clock KCM policykit helper did not properly guard against untrusted input. Under certain circumstances, a process running under the user's session could exploit this to run programs as the administrator.

f931a10ffe105cca0fd6a2c397ebe2a30771b4af.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
f931a10ffe105cca0fd6a2c397ebe2a30771b4af.body: Alexander Cherepanov discovered multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in GNU binutils. An attacker could use this to craft input that could delete arbitrary files. (CVE-2014-8737)

648b1871c7f03f647f90e771c6efdaba7eb6bb2d.title: USN-2496-1: GNU binutils vulnerabilities
648b1871c7f03f647f90e771c6efdaba7eb6bb2d.body: Alexander Cherepanov discovered the _bfd_slurp_extended_name_table function in libbfd in GNU binutils allowed invalid writes when handling extended name tables in an archive. An attacker could use this to craft input that could cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-8738)

b428debd620e5d5f03ea78d4259d18bc5b85f6d5.title: USN-2433-1: tcpdump vulnerabilities
b428debd620e5d5f03ea78d4259d18bc5b85f6d5.body: Steffen Bauch discovered that tcpdump incorrectly handled printing OSLR packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause tcpdump to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-8767)

4fe3e8887e304fa94c792e1d9ce79af897122c83.title: USN-2433-1: tcpdump vulnerabilities
4fe3e8887e304fa94c792e1d9ce79af897122c83.body: Steffen Bauch discovered that tcpdump incorrectly handled printing AODV packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause tcpdump to crash, resulting in a denial of service, reveal sensitive information, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-8769)

47c6c57268845d52d6a3d9424ce8b3589a746e03.title: USN-2426-1: FLAC vulnerabilities
47c6c57268845d52d6a3d9424ce8b3589a746e03.body: Michele Spagnuolo discovered that FLAC incorrectly handled certain malformed audio files. An attacker could use this issue to cause FLAC to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

391880a09e65e6a9821da7e03f90e56539d08876.title: USN-2518-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
391880a09e65e6a9821da7e03f90e56539d08876.body: A flaw was discovered in how supplemental group memberships are handled in certain namespace scenarios. A local user could exploit this flaw to bypass file permission restrictions. (CVE-2014-8989)

3af5ced541491df65108f910da625a87580e83e7.title: USN-2515-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
3af5ced541491df65108f910da625a87580e83e7.body: A flaw was discovered in how supplemental group memberships are handled in certain namespace scenarios. A local user could exploit this flaw to bypass file permission restrictions. (CVE-2014-8989)

9147a3fc668580b02da76c5f4ace9bbdc34774da.title: USN-2516-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9147a3fc668580b02da76c5f4ace9bbdc34774da.body: A flaw was discovered in how supplemental group memberships are handled in certain namespace scenarios. A local user could exploit this flaw to bypass file permission restrictions. (CVE-2014-8989)

dbff99ee001db8fa967bf59997a76efee0386aa4.title: USN-2517-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
dbff99ee001db8fa967bf59997a76efee0386aa4.body: A flaw was discovered in how supplemental group memberships are handled in certain namespace scenarios. A local user could exploit this flaw to bypass file permission restrictions. (CVE-2014-8989)

84777c38768199989eb0927091fbf984fdd3afb0.title: USN-2434-2: Ghostscript vulnerability
84777c38768199989eb0927091fbf984fdd3afb0.body: USN-2434-1 fixed a vulnerability in JasPer. This update provides the corresponding fix for the JasPer library embedded in the Ghostscript package. Original advisory details: Jose Duart discovered that JasPer incorrectly handled certain malformed JPEG-2000 image files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted JPEG-2000 image file, a remote attacker could cause JasPer to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

88af68d61f96db65cd80f172ac3f7b311570b891.title: USN-2434-1: JasPer vulnerability
88af68d61f96db65cd80f172ac3f7b311570b891.body: Jose Duart discovered that JasPer incorrectly handled certain malformed JPEG-2000 image files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted JPEG-2000 image file, a remote attacker could cause JasPer to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

b93642e3ffab519e18dfb57c58883ebd296944fd.title: USN-2423-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
b93642e3ffab519e18dfb57c58883ebd296944fd.body: Damien Millescamp discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled certain PE files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-9050)

34c28a5f852623e3a89c399acbaa130c5f9ce0cf.title: USN-2578-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
34c28a5f852623e3a89c399acbaa130c5f9ce0cf.body: Alexander Cherepanov discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled certain RTF files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted RTF document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-9093)

0f3199ab703f073a0cfc26a4dd81c4b6a0cfca4e.title: USN-2456-1: GNU cpio vulnerabilities
0f3199ab703f073a0cfc26a4dd81c4b6a0cfca4e.body: Michal Zalewski discovered an out of bounds write issue in the process_copy_in function of GNU cpio. An attacker could specially craft a cpio archive that could create a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-9112)

c22e6853f628bcb9b51d0a597e7c09e73ed8b18a.title: USN-2461-2: libyaml-libyaml-perl vulnerability
c22e6853f628bcb9b51d0a597e7c09e73ed8b18a.body: Stanisław Pitucha and Jonathan Gray discovered that libyaml-libyaml-perl did not properly handle wrapped strings. An attacker could create specially crafted YAML data to trigger an assert, causing a denial of service.

6f052490501f62d5a6e4987878ccbb0d0d898e3f.title: USN-2461-3: PyYAML vulnerability
6f052490501f62d5a6e4987878ccbb0d0d898e3f.body: Stanisław Pitucha and Jonathan Gray discovered that PyYAML did not properly handle wrapped strings. An attacker could create specially crafted YAML data to trigger an assert, causing a denial of service.

deb6d522502e415f23aa146d076ee522bb95c88c.title: USN-2461-1: LibYAML vulnerability
deb6d522502e415f23aa146d076ee522bb95c88c.body: Stanisław Pitucha and Jonathan Gray discovered that LibYAML did not properly handle wrapped strings. An attacker could create specially crafted YAML data to trigger an assert, causing a denial of service.

4119a87cfb45e1f151511997cc23ce8a947e3ec0.title: USN-2433-1: tcpdump vulnerabilities
4119a87cfb45e1f151511997cc23ce8a947e3ec0.body: It was discovered that tcpdump incorrectly handled printing PPP packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause tcpdump to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-9140)

d0d319973c9cecdee669752332d0c2334d746d3c.title: USN-2491-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
d0d319973c9cecdee669752332d0c2334d746d3c.body: Andy Lutomirski discovered that the Linux kernel does not properly handle faults associated with the Stack Segment (SS) register in the x86 architecture. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2014-9322)

83057052bc9883873cefc237e5045f8666e61d0d.title: USN-2488-2: ClamAV vulnerability
83057052bc9883873cefc237e5045f8666e61d0d.body: USN-2488-1 fixed a vulnerability in ClamAV for Ubuntu 14.10, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 10.04 LTS. Original advisory details: Sebastian Andrzej Siewior discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled certain upack packer files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

e2112d82784c457e615557f32b5e2148e7a12749.title: USN-2519-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
e2112d82784c457e615557f32b5e2148e7a12749.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled receiving a positive answer while processing the network name when performing DNS resolution. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the GNU C Library to hang, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2014-9402)

acbdbefe2b92ecaa7fd8b261e10ec8d2d07ac528.title: USN-2518-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
acbdbefe2b92ecaa7fd8b261e10ec8d2d07ac528.body: A flaw was discovered in how Thread Local Storage (TLS) is handled by the task switching function in the Linux kernel for x86_64 based machines. A local user could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Radomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2014-9419)

20b1cb8dff6f9b07c8988ba3b6d81954488085b0.body: It was discovered that the libgssrpc library leaked uninitialized bytes. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2014-9423)

f8a3bbe0926cc6012dbcc85c4d73ca34317cd477.body: A flaw was discovered in the fragment handling of the B.A.T.M.A.N. Advanced Meshing Protocol in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (mesh-node system crash) via fragmented packets. (CVE-2014-9428)

e0feb9f65d69c4c82a91d3af8265ba8e58def913.body: It was discovered that Exiv2 incorrectly handled certain tag values in video files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially-crafted video file, a remote attacker could cause Exiv2 to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

382adbe8f98ac97407a899f3dc46da91cfdb6422.title: USN-2512-1: Linux kernel (EC2) vulnerabilities
382adbe8f98ac97407a899f3dc46da91cfdb6422.body: A memory leak was discovered in the ISO 9660 CDROM file system when parsing rock ridge ER records. A local user could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory via a crafted iso9660 image. (CVE-2014-9584)

c692a1c130671161483cc6bb01e642ea2a4f7808.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that unzip incorrectly handled certain malformed zip archives. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted zip archive, an attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code.

faee0b355ec9ac0678394ba408dc563257a9079b.body: László Böszörményi discovered that GNU patch did not correctly handle some patch files. An attacker could specially craft a patch file that could cause a denial of service. (CVE-2014-9637)

5c0967ff33a3655aefd6c7ba19b57369f3d6b08e.title: USN-2514-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
5c0967ff33a3655aefd6c7ba19b57369f3d6b08e.body: A flaw was discovered in the crypto subsystem when screening module names for automatic module loading if the name contained a valid crypto module name, eg. vfat(aes). A local user could exploit this flaw to load installed kernel modules, increasing the attack surface and potentially using this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2014-9644)
