7c1d8e94e6b948730750b496a5511bea0fd4b6a8.body: Dmitry Chernenkov discovered a buffer overflow in eCryptfs' encrypted file name decoding. A local unprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2014-9683)

f87c10c67a9a38850af228a73a38ecb76f732fa3.title: USN-2542-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
f87c10c67a9a38850af228a73a38ecb76f732fa3.body: Dmitry Chernenkov discovered a buffer overflow in eCryptfs' encrypted file name decoding. A local unprivileged user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2014-9683)

0f9a5225161b6ff02eeaeae5e15928e14c64046c.title: USN-2535-1: PHP vulnerabilities
0f9a5225161b6ff02eeaeae5e15928e14c64046c.body: S. Paraschoudis discovered that PHP incorrectly handled memory in the enchant binding. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-9705)

dfafdac5866afe6cd24603a169c973b91e5e880e.title: USN-2987-1: GD library vulnerabilities
dfafdac5866afe6cd24603a169c973b91e5e880e.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled certain malformed GIF images. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted GIF image, an attacker could cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2014-9709)

28fc01bf7c71c7f89d2f28e7dd28b11e93d7cb11.title: USN-2742-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
28fc01bf7c71c7f89d2f28e7dd28b11e93d7cb11.body: Dietrich Clauss discovered that the OpenLDAP package incorrectly shipped with a potentially unsafe default access control configuration. Depending on how the database is configure, this may allow users to impersonate others by modifying attributes such as their Unix user and group numbers. (CVE-2014-9713)

56eef488cee227c460eefb23e10cf76650040d31.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
56eef488cee227c460eefb23e10cf76650040d31.body: USN-2985-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the GNU C Library. The fix for CVE-2014-9761 introduced a regression which affected applications that use the libm library but were not fully restarted after the upgrade. This update removes the fix for CVE-2014-9761 and a future update will be provided to address this issue.

27322412213d95261c85c4249245be692e0ad7ff.title: USN-2985-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
27322412213d95261c85c4249245be692e0ad7ff.body: Joseph Myers discovered that the GNU C Library did not properly handle long arguments to functions returning a representation of Not a Number (NaN). An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (stack exhaustion leading to an application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2014-9761)

bdb7294ec3dc5cb716ddd6102df79775b0cb1468.title: USN-2901-1: xdelta3 vulnerability
bdb7294ec3dc5cb716ddd6102df79775b0cb1468.body: It was discovered that xdelta3 incorrectly handled certain files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially-crafted file, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause xdelta3 to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

fb78db1748e09aec8ac9ac4e0142254b89a8f9fb.title: USN-2918-1: pixman vulnerability
fb78db1748e09aec8ac9ac4e0142254b89a8f9fb.body: Vincent LE GARREC discovered an integer underflow in pixman. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could cause pixman to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

0c170d58904153aae93cd8c23470db1d33c9a0c6.title: USN-2952-1: PHP vulnerabilities
0c170d58904153aae93cd8c23470db1d33c9a0c6.body: It was discovered that the PHP Zip extension incorrectly handled directories when processing certain zip files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to create arbitrary directories. (CVE-2014-9767)

fa921ecfe4240904dce20c6108dbbd007baea4e0.title: USN-2952-2: PHP regression
fa921ecfe4240904dce20c6108dbbd007baea4e0.body: It was discovered that the PHP Zip extension incorrectly handled directories when processing certain zip files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to create arbitrary directories. (CVE-2014-9767)

c2290f5e0b7a199c9537673f83a8b718d6353e75.title: USN-3131-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
c2290f5e0b7a199c9537673f83a8b718d6353e75.body: It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled certain malformed image files. If a user or automated system using ImageMagick were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

0a0913471f83ecc188d11225bbf3dac6f6ce2179.title: USN-2721-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
0a0913471f83ecc188d11225bbf3dac6f6ce2179.body: Evgeny Kotkov discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module incorrectly handled large numbers of REPORT requests. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-0202)

921de25ea1492d187792c25894f4ff81ce9a1122.title: USN-2469-1: Django vulnerabilities
921de25ea1492d187792c25894f4ff81ce9a1122.body: Mikko Ohtamaa discovered that Django incorrectly handled user-supplied redirect URLs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a cross-site scripting attack. (CVE-2015-0220)

2b0184b7b3d67a6ca889b6528bb397200276c12e.title: USN-2469-1: Django vulnerabilities
2b0184b7b3d67a6ca889b6528bb397200276c12e.body: Alex Gaynor discovered that Django incorrectly handled reading files in django.views.static.serve(). A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Django to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0221)

5509db90c20fac43ee2c69e14b6a68b0d2a76bf7.title: USN-2523-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
5509db90c20fac43ee2c69e14b6a68b0d2a76bf7.body: Guido Vranken discovered that the mod_lua module incorrectly handled a specially crafted websocket PING in certain circumstances. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the server to stop responding, leading to a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-0228)

f22f343fcfd500286da0312a17bd8f8a5c8d77f3.title: USN-2867-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
f22f343fcfd500286da0312a17bd8f8a5c8d77f3.body: Luyao Huang discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled VNC passwords in shapshot and image files. A remote authenticated user could use this issue to possibly obtain VNC passwords. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2015-0236)

229f6d31b30148afe2058e7d65d7b9e9fcd75c9b.title: USN-2518-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
229f6d31b30148afe2058e7d65d7b9e9fcd75c9b.body: A flaw was discovered in the Kernel Virtual Machine's (KVM) emulation of the SYSTENTER instruction when the guest OS does not initialize the SYSENTER MSRs. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

d6bdfccc6261086050c7aaf7251e5ab05805d832.title: USN-2515-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
d6bdfccc6261086050c7aaf7251e5ab05805d832.body: A flaw was discovered in the Kernel Virtual Machine's (KVM) emulation of the SYSTENTER instruction when the guest OS does not initialize the SYSENTER MSRs. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

cd6567a390182a08022a57137b01331651a22da3.title: USN-2516-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
cd6567a390182a08022a57137b01331651a22da3.body: A flaw was discovered in the Kernel Virtual Machine's (KVM) emulation of the SYSTENTER instruction when the guest OS does not initialize the SYSENTER MSRs. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

f166cd043e75ce48e781609dcfcf3729e93b373a.title: USN-2517-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
f166cd043e75ce48e781609dcfcf3729e93b373a.body: A flaw was discovered in the Kernel Virtual Machine's (KVM) emulation of the SYSTENTER instruction when the guest OS does not initialize the SYSENTER MSRs. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

e183894e10f4b1303d672669df5f33da5636457d.title: USN-2514-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
e183894e10f4b1303d672669df5f33da5636457d.body: A flaw was discovered in the Kernel Virtual Machine's (KVM) emulation of the SYSTENTER instruction when the guest OS does not initialize the SYSENTER MSRs. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

8885a97092fc4bb8762b841d0dc278472eea0819.title: USN-2513-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8885a97092fc4bb8762b841d0dc278472eea0819.body: A flaw was discovered in the Kernel Virtual Machine's (KVM) emulation of the SYSTENTER instruction when the guest OS does not initialize the SYSENTER MSRs. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

5f4d0a0be0cdf39e27bebb1f0f056a7e4fdf5b41.title: USN-2507-1: e2fsprogs vulnerabilities
5f4d0a0be0cdf39e27bebb1f0f056a7e4fdf5b41.body: Jose Duart discovered that e2fsprogs incorrectly handled invalid block group descriptor data. A local attacker could use this issue with a crafted filesystem image to possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-0247, CVE-2015-1572)

6fcd998904d4e6fdfa96fe20e0a2a768f3a47934.title: USN-2721-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
6fcd998904d4e6fdfa96fe20e0a2a768f3a47934.body: Evgeny Kotkov discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn and svnserve modules incorrectly certain crafted parameter combinations. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0248)

00c469b8e5f997c3397d36edba08241c330f49e0.title: USN-2500-1: X.Org X server vulnerabilities
00c469b8e5f997c3397d36edba08241c330f49e0.body: Olivier Fourdan discovered that the X.Org X server incorrectly handled XkbSetGeometry requests resulting in an information leak. An attacker able to connect to an X server, either locally or remotely, could use this issue to possibly obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0255)

7edbd65bab1e06b7e732207913fa8a641204fde7.title: USN-2580-1: tcpdump vulnerabilities
7edbd65bab1e06b7e732207913fa8a641204fde7.body: It was discovered that tcpdump incorrectly handled printing certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause tcpdump to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the tcpdump AppArmor profile.

bb504ccc2dd601036b3c88b5ed4c24bfac87e303.title: USN-2792-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
bb504ccc2dd601036b3c88b5ed4c24bfac87e303.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel did not check if a new IPv6 MTU set by a user space application was valid. A remote attacker could forge a route advertisement with an invalid MTU that a user space daemon like NetworkManager would honor and apply to the kernel, causing a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0272)

448de63cf1df4038edf7c70e321964d12b3ffc0c.title: USN-2537-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
448de63cf1df4038edf7c70e321964d12b3ffc0c.body: Robert Dugal and David Ramos discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled decoding Base64 encoded data. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-0292)

e1333945e0dd62dbfd34a6f715e67cb057ebe08b.title: USN-2537-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
e1333945e0dd62dbfd34a6f715e67cb057ebe08b.body: Sean Burford and Emilia Käsper discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled specially crafted SSLv2 CLIENT-MASTER-KEY messages. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0293)

0b78cc79581dc2a3c37d9c605b9292ad87ca04a8.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
0b78cc79581dc2a3c37d9c605b9292ad87ca04a8.body: Fabian Vogt discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed BMP images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted BMP image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0295)

badc6876f831ca9aae4fff781dfb5d9b3e04b31c.title: USN-2557-1: Firefox vulnerability
badc6876f831ca9aae4fff781dfb5d9b3e04b31c.body: Muneaki Nishimura discovered a flaw in Mozilla's HTTP Alternative Services implementation which meant SSL certificate verification could be bypassed in some circumstances. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct a man in the middle attack. (CVE-2015-0799)

d2a22b7bf292b947245f2315b3a3ac4b1393a5c1.title: USN-2552-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
d2a22b7bf292b947245f2315b3a3ac4b1393a5c1.body: Olli Pettay and Boris Zbarsky discovered an issue during anchor navigations in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same-origin policy restrictions. (CVE-2015-0801)

29c6dc593835a3251d7a416b2e96091bc3ae030a.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
29c6dc593835a3251d7a416b2e96091bc3ae030a.body: Olli Pettay and Boris Zbarsky discovered an issue during anchor navigations in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same-origin policy restrictions. (CVE-2015-0801)

b65ad49d666d69c88e115775e6e80bfed5c76e7e.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
b65ad49d666d69c88e115775e6e80bfed5c76e7e.body: Bobby Holley discovered that windows created to hold privileged UI content retained access to privileged internal methods if navigated to unprivileged content. An attacker could potentially exploit this in combination with another flaw, in order to execute arbitrary script in a privileged context. (CVE-2015-0802)

35336d5fc19f43f7a486be842255a03c616c6214.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
35336d5fc19f43f7a486be842255a03c616c6214.body: Several type confusion issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-0803, CVE-2015-0804)

5705e2c0433882b8c8ea09f2c3958b91dd3d7f33.title: USN-2552-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
5705e2c0433882b8c8ea09f2c3958b91dd3d7f33.body: Christoph Kerschbaumer discovered that CORS requests from navigator.sendBeacon() followed 30x redirections after preflight. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site request forgery (XSRF) attacks. (CVE-2015-0807)

d236439bde31a9835a5f5b44a5512fa7e08c8307.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d236439bde31a9835a5f5b44a5512fa7e08c8307.body: Christoph Kerschbaumer discovered that CORS requests from navigator.sendBeacon() followed 30x redirections after preflight. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site request forgery (XSRF) attacks. (CVE-2015-0807)

6a5d818432ba03088b751c2d115b024c9945b311.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
6a5d818432ba03088b751c2d115b024c9945b311.body: Felix Gröbert discovered an out-of-bounds read in the QCMS colour management library. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0811)

942a2e43e3703f11a4f9a7ac21b695114a47f2c1.title: USN-2552-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
942a2e43e3703f11a4f9a7ac21b695114a47f2c1.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that documents loaded via resource: URLs (such as PDF.js) could load privileged chrome pages. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this in combination with another flaw, in order to execute arbitrary script in a privileged context. (CVE-2015-0816)

cf3de135ae81060d4c391f3a04cf938fcc7f1c02.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
cf3de135ae81060d4c391f3a04cf938fcc7f1c02.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that documents loaded via resource: URLs (such as PDF.js) could load privileged chrome pages. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this in combination with another flaw, in order to execute arbitrary script in a privileged context. (CVE-2015-0816)

7d4df7d1cc36887afb1aa369e2df4fa08d76617f.title: USN-2538-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
7d4df7d1cc36887afb1aa369e2df4fa08d76617f.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered a flaw in the processing of SVG format content navigation. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could exploit this to run arbitrary script in a privileged context. (CVE-2015-0818)

5547bb0b3a9134b551f8179954eb2ac6837b8454.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
5547bb0b3a9134b551f8179954eb2ac6837b8454.body: Armin Razmdjou discovered that opening hyperlinks with specific mouse and key combinations could allow a Chrome privileged URL to be opened without context restrictions being preserved. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass security restrictions. (CVE-2015-0821)

26245e41bb6cdb86e1c39ca81f67b30fe27dbdb8.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
26245e41bb6cdb86e1c39ca81f67b30fe27dbdb8.body: Armin Razmdjou discovered that contents of locally readable files could be made available via manipulation of form autocomplete in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0822)

fdf734f0feef66c5bae60aba3aee89f89a9d85ea.title: USN-2506-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
fdf734f0feef66c5bae60aba3aee89f89a9d85ea.body: Armin Razmdjou discovered that contents of locally readable files could be made available via manipulation of form autocomplete in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0822)

a8381c47b7df3d9b6693fe94d844d9c9b87b3213.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a8381c47b7df3d9b6693fe94d844d9c9b87b3213.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a crash when drawing images using Cairo in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0824)

7f09715cf6522aa2a897b044e204d4b4d84810de.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
7f09715cf6522aa2a897b044e204d4b4d84810de.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer underflow during playback of MP3 files in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0825)

cbd3d4aae0083d537435898dc850e2275f35bb91.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
cbd3d4aae0083d537435898dc850e2275f35bb91.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer overflow during CSS restyling in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-0826)

0fc99107d0ea526feedecdc6a12e7473a4d4fb25.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
0fc99107d0ea526feedecdc6a12e7473a4d4fb25.body: Abhishek Arya discovered an out-of-bounds read and write when rendering SVG content in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0827)

f926a08f011f9e00ba1adab7b199386d92516761.title: USN-2506-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
f926a08f011f9e00ba1adab7b199386d92516761.body: Abhishek Arya discovered an out-of-bounds read and write when rendering SVG content in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0827)

83983580a95dfe0f420fbd5958363f43ee4862b2.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
83983580a95dfe0f420fbd5958363f43ee4862b2.body: A buffer overflow was discovered in libstagefright during video playback in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-0829)

09529073e1e18d5f326f8f90b51d3e78e80368c7.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
09529073e1e18d5f326f8f90b51d3e78e80368c7.body: Daniele Di Proietto discovered that WebGL could cause a crash in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0830)

3fe569f548019d467c4e04528765b1d2b28e2c54.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
3fe569f548019d467c4e04528765b1d2b28e2c54.body: Alexander Kolesnik discovered that Firefox would attempt plaintext connections to servers when handling turns: and stuns: URIs. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this by conducting a Man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack in order to obtain credentials. (CVE-2015-0834)

a38a0398a5bfc612cfa96ba50fef590d7fe5985b.title: USN-2670-1: libwmf vulnerabilities
a38a0398a5bfc612cfa96ba50fef590d7fe5985b.body: Fernando Muñoz and Stefan Cornelius discovered that libwmf incorrectly handled certain malformed images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted image file, an attacker could cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking the program.

2b174eb2c6e09204f0c07e9a5d55a81bd302e9f4.title: USN-2820-1: dpkg vulnerability
2b174eb2c6e09204f0c07e9a5d55a81bd302e9f4.body: Hanno Boeck discovered that the dpkg-deb tool incorrectly handled certain old style Debian binary packages. If a user or an automated system were tricked into unpacking a specially crafted binary package, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

a45a50429227dba72b96905c71a7778716a34b7f.title: USN-2937-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerabilities
a45a50429227dba72b96905c71a7778716a34b7f.body: A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

e593fcf93b8f3da690ed834ba2a6e76b3fb6d786.title: USN-2629-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
e593fcf93b8f3da690ed834ba2a6e76b3fb6d786.body: It was discovered that the CUPS templating engine contained a cross-site scripting issue. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass default configuration settings. (CVE-2015-1159)

d87cb1837f78b746f45e05bddb2e7438e376576f.title: USN-2495-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
d87cb1837f78b746f45e05bddb2e7438e376576f.body: A use-after-free bug was discovered in the DOM implementation in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2015-1209)

bb39eb033ef0e777b3769cfd7c19a886f46ad6ef.title: USN-2521-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
bb39eb033ef0e777b3769cfd7c19a886f46ad6ef.body: Several out-of-bounds write bugs were discovered in Skia. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1213, CVE-2015-1214, CVE-2015-1215)

8c02bd27fad11604da4920966c0fd206373a1a74.title: USN-2521-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
8c02bd27fad11604da4920966c0fd206373a1a74.body: An integer overflow was discovered in Skia. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1219)

dba23b56878200da8fe0050942ca644c6483a903.title: USN-2521-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
dba23b56878200da8fe0050942ca644c6483a903.body: It was discovered that Blink did not initialize memory for image drawing in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to read uninitialized memory. (CVE-2015-1227)

e8a6263cff6b07ae4271337bc86e32602fcd961d.title: USN-2521-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
e8a6263cff6b07ae4271337bc86e32602fcd961d.body: It was discovered that Blink did not initialize memory for a data structure in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2015-1228)

acbe4b4fc161600f2e38633b5c88d2c2f49fdea1.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
acbe4b4fc161600f2e38633b5c88d2c2f49fdea1.body: An issue was discovered in the HTML parser in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same-origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-1235)

df84b9d5e3c8bd05818b137df145498cf4525aba.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
df84b9d5e3c8bd05818b137df145498cf4525aba.body: An issue was discovered in the Web Audio API implementation in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same-origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-1236)

e354526cfc1c15773cae600b8e2338d61eda414a.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
e354526cfc1c15773cae600b8e2338d61eda414a.body: An out-of-bounds write was discovered in Skia. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1238)

f8df4457a26bf6676aa6711029c3d347d05393d9.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
f8df4457a26bf6676aa6711029c3d347d05393d9.body: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in the WebGL implementation. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-1240)

192fd2b49d57492102ad50ab96d76fa51b510df1.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
192fd2b49d57492102ad50ab96d76fa51b510df1.body: An issue was discovered with the interaction of page navigation and touch event handling. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct "tap jacking" attacks. (CVE-2015-1241)

08a4108de36b252ca8c9cffe675b4ed5830633f4.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
08a4108de36b252ca8c9cffe675b4ed5830633f4.body: It was discovered that websocket connections were not upgraded whenever a HSTS policy is active. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct a man in the middle (MITM) attack. (CVE-2015-1244)

e1f2f19ca5a48d1b5d3737e155971d061fa5cae4.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
e1f2f19ca5a48d1b5d3737e155971d061fa5cae4.body: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-1246)

e31145917fa13e8b97540820cccb336b703f4415.title: USN-2726-1: Expat vulnerability
e31145917fa13e8b97540820cccb336b703f4415.body: It was discovered that Expat incorrectly handled malformed XML data. If a user or application linked against Expat were tricked into opening a crafted XML file, an attacker could cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

c13d1f883066165c1b739218b23cb36f104bdb6e.title: USN-2757-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
c13d1f883066165c1b739218b23cb36f104bdb6e.body: Two security issues were discovered in Blink and V8. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to bypass same-origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-1303, CVE-2015-1304)

6628ff39aa2efd49dd4c4efc0b826505b3a9d9d9.title: USN-2502-1: unzip vulnerabilities
6628ff39aa2efd49dd4c4efc0b826505b3a9d9d9.body: William Robinet discovered that unzip incorrectly handled certain malformed zip archives. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted zip archive, an attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code.

e0956bbb78c1ef08a8fe82ddd4d3135efd2eba26.title: USN-2569-1: Apport vulnerability
e0956bbb78c1ef08a8fe82ddd4d3135efd2eba26.body: Stéphane Graber and Tavis Ormandy independently discovered that Apport incorrectly handled the crash reporting feature. A local attacker could use this issue to gain elevated privileges.

be1fb697a35628661e0375e61cdd3fb6d5e24748.title: USN-2741-1: Unity Settings Daemon vulnerability
be1fb697a35628661e0375e61cdd3fb6d5e24748.body: It was discovered that the Unity Settings Daemon incorrectly allowed removable media to be mounted when the screen is locked. If a vulnerability were discovered in some other desktop component, such as an image library, a local attacker could possibly use this issue to gain access to the session.

0215f1ed463903cc3947b46f2189f3432afe4c5b.title: USN-2581-1: NetworkManager vulnerability
0215f1ed463903cc3947b46f2189f3432afe4c5b.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that NetworkManager incorrectly filtered paths when requested to read modem device contexts. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass privileges and manipulate modem device configuration or read arbitrary files.

400ce09b2c3e574b11aa6be4765ed3d8f363cdd7.title: USN-2648-1: Aptdaemon vulnerability
400ce09b2c3e574b11aa6be4765ed3d8f363cdd7.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that Aptdeamon incorrectly handled the simulate dbus method. A local attacker could use this issue to possibly expose sensitive information, or perform other file access as the root user.

8a59b899bdae013c9b4c85b73488aea0c108030c.title: USN-2609-1: Apport vulnerabilities
8a59b899bdae013c9b4c85b73488aea0c108030c.body: Sander Bos discovered that Apport incorrectly handled permissions when the system was configured to generate core dumps for setuid binaries. A local attacker could use this issue to gain elevated privileges. (CVE-2015-1324)

0511d1d26d3df0527a98ac9997730bb63082b555.title: USN-2677-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
0511d1d26d3df0527a98ac9997730bb63082b555.body: A use-after-free was discovered in oxide::qt::URLRequestDelegatedJob in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1329)

5d8a015571831f00b687528e5447f71e720cb7a5.title: USN-2657-1: unattended-upgrades vulnerability
5d8a015571831f00b687528e5447f71e720cb7a5.body: It was discovered that unattended-upgrades incorrectly performed authentication checks in certain configurations. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could potentially be used to install altered packages.

8e5cc4046193bee2a06255694141a44ab9fad1e8.title: USN-2735-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
8e5cc4046193bee2a06255694141a44ab9fad1e8.body: A heap corruption issue was discovered in oxide::JavaScriptDialogManager. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1332)

0ef2f72a6b247e22b797f97f16ddf098753930dd.title: USN-2691-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
0ef2f72a6b247e22b797f97f16ddf098753930dd.body: Colin King discovered a flaw in the add_key function of the Linux kernel's keyring subsystem. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion). (CVE-2015-1333)

ca3fc1eefb806074b25f5c4e366c1fac98522428.title: USN-2690-1: Linux kernel (Vivid HWE) vulnerabilities
ca3fc1eefb806074b25f5c4e366c1fac98522428.body: Colin King discovered a flaw in the add_key function of the Linux kernel's keyring subsystem. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion). (CVE-2015-1333)

514e710ac2c1658ba7297d36602cb14cdffa2d92.title: USN-2689-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
514e710ac2c1658ba7297d36602cb14cdffa2d92.body: Colin King discovered a flaw in the add_key function of the Linux kernel's keyring subsystem. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion). (CVE-2015-1333)

989bcbf34e6fc0adcf3a4bb952cc786601f4094a.title: USN-2688-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
989bcbf34e6fc0adcf3a4bb952cc786601f4094a.body: Colin King discovered a flaw in the add_key function of the Linux kernel's keyring subsystem. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion). (CVE-2015-1333)

0741335843dd8a56516c09aff06e53ad1125cd9b.title: USN-2687-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
0741335843dd8a56516c09aff06e53ad1125cd9b.body: Colin King discovered a flaw in the add_key function of the Linux kernel's keyring subsystem. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion). (CVE-2015-1333)

f4296715b6419dbf78f0270fff3d70918b4e15c8.title: USN-2746-1: Simple Streams vulnerability
f4296715b6419dbf78f0270fff3d70918b4e15c8.body: It was discovered that Simple Streams did not properly perform gpg verification in some situations. A remote attacker could use this to perform a man-in-the-middle attack and inject malicious content into the stream.

0fdee0f7dbbc01e624f758136475834ca68f641c.title: USN-2746-2: Simple Streams regression
0fdee0f7dbbc01e624f758136475834ca68f641c.body: USN-2746-1 fixed a vulnerability in Simple Streams. The update caused a regression preventing MAAS from downloading PXE images. This update fixes the problem. We apologize for the inconvenience. Original advisory details: It was discovered that Simple Streams did not properly perform gpg verification in some situations. A remote attacker could use this to perform a man-in-the-middle attack and inject malicious content into the stream.

589b0f3fb7656252b6dfc88467519c368ab0ba05.title: USN-2813-1: LXCFS vulnerabilities
589b0f3fb7656252b6dfc88467519c368ab0ba05.body: It was discovered that LXCFS incorrectly enforced directory escapes. A local attacker could use this issue to possibly escalate privileges. (CVE-2015-1342)

92809d257c2a1a0b1fc27ddcf456ae8b55ee14c4.title: USN-2813-1: LXCFS vulnerabilities
92809d257c2a1a0b1fc27ddcf456ae8b55ee14c4.body: It was discovered that LXCFS incorrectly checked certain permissions. A local attacker could use this issue t possibly escalate privileges. (CVE-2015-1344)

08ad351a4a5aafaeee6fbd850b6980022bf271dd.title: USN-2503-1: Bind vulnerability
08ad351a4a5aafaeee6fbd850b6980022bf271dd.body: Jan-Piet Mens discovered that Bind incorrectly handled Trust Anchor Management. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause bind to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

71a35801fec6ea281fd3103e304c9979b4b716b8.title: USN-2651-1: GNU patch vulnerabilities
71a35801fec6ea281fd3103e304c9979b4b716b8.body: Jakub Wilk discovered that GNU patch did not correctly handle file renames in git style patch files. An attacker could specially craft a patch file that could overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user invoking the program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-1395)

c3d4d5d8e407c8520921b837397e8e18a2acde96.title: USN-2651-1: GNU patch vulnerabilities
c3d4d5d8e407c8520921b837397e8e18a2acde96.body: Jakub Wilk discovered the fix for CVE-2015-1196 was incomplete for GNU patch. An attacker could specially craft a patch file that could overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user invoking the program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-1396)

51af0295969195b1a6a857e19fab99be696bfe77.title: USN-2519-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
51af0295969195b1a6a857e19fab99be696bfe77.body: Joseph Myers discovered that the GNU C Library wscanf function incorrectly handled memory. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the GNU C Library to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-1472, CVE-2015-1473)

9aab64d345c720d3cbc86f2a19e3e009377d3761.title: USN-2565-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9aab64d345c720d3cbc86f2a19e3e009377d3761.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

b21b7e1173f1c46c25d5d3c28e77621a500192cc.title: USN-2564-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
b21b7e1173f1c46c25d5d3c28e77621a500192cc.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

730c0b076fb54fc0c02be21f304ca1d399d2f581.title: USN-2563-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
730c0b076fb54fc0c02be21f304ca1d399d2f581.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

b9ccf43d5d43aa2967652c391389cb572e495e7a.title: USN-2562-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
b9ccf43d5d43aa2967652c391389cb572e495e7a.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

fd824f0c662472de76863e88bfc6fcb3792c6c3a.title: USN-2561-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
fd824f0c662472de76863e88bfc6fcb3792c6c3a.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

764c4d43ad32952ac21b3c13f7560ffbd32472b8.title: USN-2560-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
764c4d43ad32952ac21b3c13f7560ffbd32472b8.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

bc219d69d0fc5dbf9a1b405885a9ff68318b6ff4.title: USN-2554-1: GnuPG vulnerabilities
bc219d69d0fc5dbf9a1b405885a9ff68318b6ff4.body: Hanno Böck discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled certain malformed keyrings. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a malformed keyring, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause GnuPG to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1606, CVE-2015-1607)

8cb3105748ada4648e0ac2099eaa9b06b7453eb2.title: USN-2578-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
8cb3105748ada4648e0ac2099eaa9b06b7453eb2.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled certain HWP files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted HWP document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1774)

fac0bd3f626638a9799b5f62712b631462f04ac7.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
fac0bd3f626638a9799b5f62712b631462f04ac7.body: Arjun Shankar discovered that in certain situations the nss_dns code in the GNU C Library did not properly account buffer sizes when passed an unaligned buffer. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1781)

a530681203699e7d2b66f7fe28d5e8ddc31c7087.title: USN-2985-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
a530681203699e7d2b66f7fe28d5e8ddc31c7087.body: Arjun Shankar discovered that in certain situations the nss_dns code in the GNU C Library did not properly account buffer sizes when passed an unaligned buffer. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1781)

4d7698825d7b856b4fd505e6643a69054c026165.title: USN-2639-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
4d7698825d7b856b4fd505e6643a69054c026165.body: Joseph Barr-Pixton discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled malformed ECParameters structures. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to hang, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-1788)

d4af98eafed77ceb3fae8e38fa5d7d8208a26a95.title: USN-2639-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
d4af98eafed77ceb3fae8e38fa5d7d8208a26a95.body: Robert Swiecki and Hanno Böck discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled certain ASN1_TIME strings. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-1789)

df5d7dc8cc50f12e66147ccc6cc283d9316c901f.title: USN-2639-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
df5d7dc8cc50f12e66147ccc6cc283d9316c901f.body: Johannes Bauer discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled verifying signedData messages using the CMS code. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to hang, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-1792)

c2158aacc3c29584667ce735be40608d6b4f46d2.title: USN-2830-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
c2158aacc3c29584667ce735be40608d6b4f46d2.body: Guy Leaver discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled a ServerKeyExchange for an anonymous DH ciphersuite with the value of p set to 0. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-1794)

d0b5208e75c22a9df36bd99cd6f9d5ae5df51b36.title: USN-2536-1: libXfont vulnerabilities
d0b5208e75c22a9df36bd99cd6f9d5ae5df51b36.body: Ilja van Sprundel, Alan Coopersmith, and William Robinet discovered that libXfont incorrectly handled malformed bdf fonts. A local attacker could use this issue to cause libXfont to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code in order to gain privileges.

bb2ff7a4795bad1d556a8b766aeee6a102872ad6.title: USN-2812-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
bb2ff7a4795bad1d556a8b766aeee6a102872ad6.body: Florian Weimer discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled certain XML data. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, an attacker could possibly cause resource consumption, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-1819)

9f308d21a4f2a073b25791943440be5c6c9e0f97.title: USN-2703-1: Cinder vulnerability
9f308d21a4f2a073b25791943440be5c6c9e0f97.body: Bastian Blank discovered that Cinder guessed image formats based on untrusted data. An attacker could use this to read arbitrary files from the Cinder host.

6bea79dbee2fe3eb53337bee14073a619042e51f.title: USN-2704-1: Swift vulnerabilities
6bea79dbee2fe3eb53337bee14073a619042e51f.body: Clay Gerrard discovered Swift allowed users to delete the latest version of object regardless of object permissions when allow_version is configured. An attacker could use this issue to delete objects. (CVE-2015-1856)

ddb975d4f87aad95c02b90d43f054e7d0f3374b9.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
ddb975d4f87aad95c02b90d43f054e7d0f3374b9.body: Richard Moore and Fabian Vogt discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed BMP images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted BMP image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1858)

3776ababab4a4621d71d155c0b7d8c55f8b890dc.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
3776ababab4a4621d71d155c0b7d8c55f8b890dc.body: Richard Moore and Fabian Vogt discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed ICO images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted ICO image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1859)

83b48f3cdbc0b8b00718abf1dfef8e47fe1c8601.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
83b48f3cdbc0b8b00718abf1dfef8e47fe1c8601.body: Richard Moore and Fabian Vogt discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed GIF images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted GIF image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1860)

195de7405cba80ecad8d4e2e6bf1dbb4209998b2.title: USN-2577-1: wpa_supplicant vulnerability
195de7405cba80ecad8d4e2e6bf1dbb4209998b2.body: It was discovered that wpa_supplicant incorrectly handled SSID information when creating or updating P2P peer entries. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause wpa_supplicant to crash, resulting in a denial of service, expose memory contents, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

35c7847db8b0c4a5d12619de739d2534c039cc3c.title: USN-3068-1: Libidn vulnerabilities
35c7847db8b0c4a5d12619de739d2534c039cc3c.body: Thijs Alkemade, Gustavo Grieco, Daniel Stenberg, and Nikos Mavrogiannopoulos discovered that Libidn incorrectly handled invalid UTF-8 characters. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Libidn to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly disclose sensitive memory. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2015-2059)

6e1fe4c4243a62e89f200ad6f8b483462ecfefd2.title: USN-2632-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
6e1fe4c4243a62e89f200ad6f8b483462ecfefd2.body: Jan Beulich discovered the Xen virtual machine subsystem of the Linux kernel did not properly restrict access to PCI command registers. A local guest user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (host crash). (CVE-2015-2150)

9897ebb6b3e4535cd0b3176b5a01f001da725190.title: USN-2631-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
9897ebb6b3e4535cd0b3176b5a01f001da725190.body: Jan Beulich discovered the Xen virtual machine subsystem of the Linux kernel did not properly restrict access to PCI command registers. A local guest user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (host crash). (CVE-2015-2150)

2da0aca75fe9f7b23b767bf2dafe13d6019ab472.title: USN-2594-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
2da0aca75fe9f7b23b767bf2dafe13d6019ab472.body: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled certain malformed files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the ClamAV AppArmor profile.

e5eddd31fc74b9fee9fae73123dd9806cb0e168f.title: USN-2549-1: libarchive vulnerabilities
e5eddd31fc74b9fee9fae73123dd9806cb0e168f.body: It was discovered that the libarchive bsdcpio utility extracted absolute paths by default without using the --insecure flag, contrary to expectations. If a user or automated system were tricked into extracting cpio archives containing absolute paths, a remote attacker may be able to write to arbitrary files. (CVE-2015-2304)

c7e76d4da3d1f5e9d782db609831871478bcc2cd.title: USN-2594-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
c7e76d4da3d1f5e9d782db609831871478bcc2cd.body: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled certain malformed files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the ClamAV AppArmor profile.

375b4ce536279e43b521bad6cff17027172247c3.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
375b4ce536279e43b521bad6cff17027172247c3.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled regular expressions. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-2305)

b2eb253b068d397a1aa4034ed17b2037e27f9e25.title: USN-2539-1: Django vulnerabilities
b2eb253b068d397a1aa4034ed17b2037e27f9e25.body: Andrey Babak discovered that Django incorrectly handled strip_tags. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Django to enter an infinite loop, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-2316)

3a8bef508161d96d7f066b14d15c6b9a7fe0e69c.title: USN-2539-1: Django vulnerabilities
3a8bef508161d96d7f066b14d15c6b9a7fe0e69c.body: Daniel Chatfield discovered that Django incorrectly handled user-supplied redirect URLs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a cross-site scripting attack. (CVE-2015-2317)

3a71a07e4c1142314856ddc0b55d237bc66aff35.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
3a71a07e4c1142314856ddc0b55d237bc66aff35.body: Paulos Yibelo discovered that PHP incorrectly handled moving files when a pathname contained a null character. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly bypass filename restrictions. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-2348)

7fd4297d46cb7d7cbed79846cee5e77c8bb1a5ee.title: USN-2810-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
7fd4297d46cb7d7cbed79846cee5e77c8bb1a5ee.body: It was discovered that the Kerberos kdcpreauth modules incorrectly tracked certain client requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass intended preauthentication requirements. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-2694)

8be2273fa3e2c730f7d2a763b9ce415015aae0fa.title: USN-2810-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
8be2273fa3e2c730f7d2a763b9ce415015aae0fa.body: It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled certain TGS requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-2697)

6a0fe1f7179e2e814931686cd1262cc19286640a.title: USN-2810-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
6a0fe1f7179e2e814931686cd1262cc19286640a.body: It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled certain IAKERB packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-2696, CVE-2015-2698)

fed07c9d26902e4d1003b0e8394f34323d6c15c8.title: USN-2603-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
fed07c9d26902e4d1003b0e8394f34323d6c15c8.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer overflow during the rendering of SVG content with certain CSS properties in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2015-2710)

dfad8fb98e1adee94904b2996ffc660682a4794c.title: USN-2602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
dfad8fb98e1adee94904b2996ffc660682a4794c.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer overflow during the rendering of SVG content with certain CSS properties in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-2710)

70b5dede7e502d91d4f67bba6436a12985031c8b.title: USN-2602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
70b5dede7e502d91d4f67bba6436a12985031c8b.body: Alex Verstak discovered that is ignored in some circumstances. (CVE-2015-2711)

7dc99d624698cd7a9e2ad837b1723db20d4c2ca9.title: USN-2602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
7dc99d624698cd7a9e2ad837b1723db20d4c2ca9.body: Dougall Johnson discovered an out of bounds read and write in asm.js. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information, cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-2712)

fd81a709ba62ff76da78a5d9490fe26ddeef821b.title: USN-2603-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
fd81a709ba62ff76da78a5d9490fe26ddeef821b.body: Ucha Gobejishvili discovered a buffer overflow when parsing compressed XML content. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2015-2716)

3a705d54cc27838b6a27f09e9e13a3c016eae737.title: USN-2602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
3a705d54cc27838b6a27f09e9e13a3c016eae737.body: Ucha Gobejishvili discovered a buffer overflow when parsing compressed XML content. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-2716)

916ce02996c9a90c646e58cf7c941c7b7045f9fa.title: USN-2602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
916ce02996c9a90c646e58cf7c941c7b7045f9fa.body: A buffer overflow and out-of-bounds read were discovered when parsing metadata in MP4 files in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-2717)

d99fbcc68450b2398171f828fcbda6b6f9438e9f.title: USN-2602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d99fbcc68450b2398171f828fcbda6b6f9438e9f.body: Mark Hammond discovered that when a trusted page is hosted within an iframe in an untrusted page, the untrusted page can intercept webchannel responses meant for the trusted page in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could exploit this to bypass origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-2718)

53aa0326ae02f29a6fd93f8ecd090b7b2adba44b.title: USN-2673-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
53aa0326ae02f29a6fd93f8ecd090b7b2adba44b.body: Karthikeyan Bhargavan discovered that NSS incorrectly handled state transitions for the TLS state machine. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to skip the ServerKeyExchange message and remove the forward-secrecy property. (CVE-2015-2721)

23394a084c43193f715615c4375a3c3ac715eed6.title: USN-2672-1: NSS vulnerabilities
23394a084c43193f715615c4375a3c3ac715eed6.body: Karthikeyan Bhargavan discovered that NSS incorrectly handled state transitions for the TLS state machine. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to skip the ServerKeyExchange message and remove the forward-secrecy property. (CVE-2015-2721)

35efc2f5c8d5177bcb985cbae1f2292368abc0e5.title: USN-2656-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
35efc2f5c8d5177bcb985cbae1f2292368abc0e5.body: Karthikeyan Bhargavan discovered that NSS incorrectly handled state transitions for the TLS state machine. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to skip the ServerKeyExchange message and remove the forward-secrecy property. (CVE-2015-2721)

dbaa56064ba3f75fb348e815eedabfd74c85069d.title: USN-2656-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
dbaa56064ba3f75fb348e815eedabfd74c85069d.body: Karthikeyan Bhargavan discovered that NSS incorrectly handled state transitions for the TLS state machine. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to skip the ServerKeyExchange message and remove the forward-secrecy property. (CVE-2015-2721)

8a86a0434fe8b90cc2baf66d8141add210ecf58c.title: USN-2673-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
8a86a0434fe8b90cc2baf66d8141add210ecf58c.body: Bob Clary, Christian Holler, Bobby Holley, and Andrew McCreight discovered multiple memory safety issues in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2015-2724)

6cb25558ac6765b4a214459bc16253e2c11bf72c.title: USN-2656-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
6cb25558ac6765b4a214459bc16253e2c11bf72c.body: Bob Clary, Christian Holler, Bobby Holley, Andrew McCreight, Terrence Cole, Steve Fink, Mats Palmgren, Wes Kocher, Andreas Pehrson, Tooru Fujisawa, Andrew Sutherland, and Gary Kwong discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-2724, CVE-2015-2725, CVE-2015-2726)

6e45a8690889587cec53ac2b331ba7c613755e30.title: USN-2656-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
6e45a8690889587cec53ac2b331ba7c613755e30.body: Bob Clary, Christian Holler, Bobby Holley, Andrew McCreight, Terrence Cole, Steve Fink, Mats Palmgren, Wes Kocher, Andreas Pehrson, Tooru Fujisawa, Andrew Sutherland, and Gary Kwong discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-2724, CVE-2015-2725, CVE-2015-2726)

8251eed66794e9f048b6ea643d3e7ff97d8d8f43.title: USN-2656-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
8251eed66794e9f048b6ea643d3e7ff97d8d8f43.body: Armin Razmdjou discovered that opening hyperlinks with specific mouse and key combinations could allow a Chrome privileged URL to be opened without context restrictions being preserved. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass security restrictions. (CVE-2015-2727)

9dcf31742d76b19215efed135192406635e56d59.title: USN-2656-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
9dcf31742d76b19215efed135192406635e56d59.body: Armin Razmdjou discovered that opening hyperlinks with specific mouse and key combinations could allow a Chrome privileged URL to be opened without context restrictions being preserved. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass security restrictions. (CVE-2015-2727)

305e8f70cde3401a664f933dc6347567de60e126.title: USN-2656-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
305e8f70cde3401a664f933dc6347567de60e126.body: Holger Fuhrmannek discovered an out-of-bounds read in Web Audio. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-2729)

770925094a8921aaac9eb6ae0e94225873aa61b7.title: USN-2656-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
770925094a8921aaac9eb6ae0e94225873aa61b7.body: Holger Fuhrmannek discovered an out-of-bounds read in Web Audio. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-2729)

7c05ee48305898628401997d40b5ca3b57913234.title: USN-2672-1: NSS vulnerabilities
7c05ee48305898628401997d40b5ca3b57913234.body: Watson Ladd discovered that NSS incorrectly handled Elliptical Curve Cryptography (ECC) multiplication. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to spoof ECDSA signatures. (CVE-2015-2730)

9b07acbd72301fbda87702cc45a670613d6c3c4f.title: USN-2656-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
9b07acbd72301fbda87702cc45a670613d6c3c4f.body: Watson Ladd discovered that NSS incorrectly handled Elliptical Curve Cryptography (ECC) multiplication. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to spoof ECDSA signatures. (CVE-2015-2730)

8fe18b4ed49920eaee5243e3f868f864b012b41d.title: USN-2656-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
8fe18b4ed49920eaee5243e3f868f864b012b41d.body: Watson Ladd discovered that NSS incorrectly handled Elliptical Curve Cryptography (ECC) multiplication. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to spoof ECDSA signatures. (CVE-2015-2730)

9015b1251071f1007431280fa9aaa20dc98c59c8.title: USN-2673-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
9015b1251071f1007431280fa9aaa20dc98c59c8.body: Ronald Crane discovered multiple security vulnerabilities. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2015-2734, CVE-2015-2735, CVE-2015-2736, CVE-2015-2737, CVE-2015-2738, CVE-2015-2739, CVE-2015-2740)

012ca19280180de94a672ffdc12b96fafc63ee43.title: USN-2656-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
012ca19280180de94a672ffdc12b96fafc63ee43.body: Ronald Crane discovered multiple security vulnerabilities. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-2734, CVE-2015-2735, CVE-2015-2736, CVE-2015-2737, CVE-2015-2738, CVE-2015-2739, CVE-2015-2740)

c1e555abad2f839a2ef1b57618c32fb55beab744.title: USN-2656-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
c1e555abad2f839a2ef1b57618c32fb55beab744.body: Ronald Crane discovered multiple security vulnerabilities. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-2734, CVE-2015-2735, CVE-2015-2736, CVE-2015-2737, CVE-2015-2738, CVE-2015-2739, CVE-2015-2740)

4ffab0dd640010bc4aca3d8302f9fd61baeda4fe.title: USN-2656-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
4ffab0dd640010bc4aca3d8302f9fd61baeda4fe.body: David Keeler discovered that key pinning checks can be skipped when an overridable certificate error occurs. This allows a user to manually override an error for a fake certificate, but cannot be exploited on its own. (CVE-2015-2741)

f55d4e46ec4e6525102bd406e62f4acbecefdaf5.title: USN-2656-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
f55d4e46ec4e6525102bd406e62f4acbecefdaf5.body: David Keeler discovered that key pinning checks can be skipped when an overridable certificate error occurs. This allows a user to manually override an error for a fake certificate, but cannot be exploited on its own. (CVE-2015-2741)

faa5b89717cbfa54df8a6a9d025c13a5ad1e25ba.title: USN-2608-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
faa5b89717cbfa54df8a6a9d025c13a5ad1e25ba.body: Jan Beulich discovered that QEMU, when used with Xen, didn't properly restrict access to PCI command registers. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-2756)

9eeebeed87031d5981e927ab458cc3fb712a7470.title: USN-2558-1: Mailman vulnerability
9eeebeed87031d5981e927ab458cc3fb712a7470.body: It was discovered that Mailman incorrectly handled special characters in list names. A local attacker could use this issue to perform a path traversal attack and execute arbitrary code as the Mailman user.

d84d70c71d6f2491d57209d90039618573c821e5.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
d84d70c71d6f2491d57209d90039618573c821e5.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled unserializing PHAR files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2015-2783)

b450bed459e3adfca8cb93ab4310728e055e9137.title: USN-2559-1: Libtasn1 vulnerability
b450bed459e3adfca8cb93ab4310728e055e9137.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Libtasn1 incorrectly handled certain ASN.1 data. A remote attacker could possibly exploit this with specially crafted ASN.1 data and cause applications using Libtasn1 to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

1ca72b6bfe86277ca15027771aca97b41e49cb45.title: USN-2631-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
1ca72b6bfe86277ca15027771aca97b41e49cb45.body: A privilege escalation was discovered in the fork syscall via the int80 entry on 64 bit kernels with 32 bit emulation support. An unprivileged local attacker could exploit this flaw to increase their privileges on the system. (CVE-2015-2830)

f8ad485429926bbb34f8b12533f539428bb8dc74.title: USN-2632-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
f8ad485429926bbb34f8b12533f539428bb8dc74.body: A privilege escalation was discovered in the fork syscall via the int80 entry on 64 bit kernels with 32 bit emulation support. An unprivileged local attacker could exploit this flaw to increase their privileges on the system. (CVE-2015-2830)

e0a87f945594b0c791f52027fbdad579221ac9e7.title: USN-2591-1: curl vulnerabilities
e0a87f945594b0c791f52027fbdad579221ac9e7.body: Paras Sethia discovered that curl could incorrectly re-use NTLM HTTP credentials when subsequently connecting to the same host over HTTP. (CVE-2015-3143)

cec73f945e72fa45047f18ea0f1836ac10596e38.title: USN-2591-1: curl vulnerabilities
cec73f945e72fa45047f18ea0f1836ac10596e38.body: Hanno Böck discovered that curl incorrectly handled zero-length host names. If a user or automated system were tricked into using a specially crafted host name, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause curl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3144)

dccafd5cf8324ef64eb4ef044227855517cc9d14.title: USN-2591-1: curl vulnerabilities
dccafd5cf8324ef64eb4ef044227855517cc9d14.body: Hanno Böck discovered that curl incorrectly handled cookie path elements. If a user or automated system were tricked into parsing a specially crafted cookie, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause curl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3145)

a7f7522f8224e874646c5be28dd30a876ebdd890.title: USN-2591-1: curl vulnerabilities
a7f7522f8224e874646c5be28dd30a876ebdd890.body: Yehezkel Horowitz and Oren Souroujon discovered that curl sent HTTP headers both to servers and proxies by default, contrary to expectations. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3153)

39735f35a286749f6ebb0345a6018e61f7130ccd.title: USN-2621-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
39735f35a286749f6ebb0345a6018e61f7130ccd.body: Noah Misch discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain standard library function return values, possibly leading to security issues. (CVE-2015-3166)

00d015ff2c19c288ed039b661fcbd28043009423.title: USN-2621-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
00d015ff2c19c288ed039b661fcbd28043009423.body: Noah Misch discovered that the pgcrypto function could return different error messages when decrypting using an incorrect key, possibly leading to a security issue. (CVE-2015-3167)

8a5786a28d406d472642a141270ac1a9f55733ce.title: USN-2686-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
8a5786a28d406d472642a141270ac1a9f55733ce.body: It was discovered that the Apache HTTP Server incorrectly parsed chunk headers. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform HTTP request smuggling attacks. (CVE-2015-3183)

17cc4db5b6777d4ea646db614782fd21bfb3bb87.title: USN-2721-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
17cc4db5b6777d4ea646db614782fd21bfb3bb87.body: C. Michael Pilato discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module incorrectly restricted anonymous access. A remote attacker could use this issue to read hidden files via the path name. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3184)

23ded8aaf243561a63c3b218c256d432053b8906.title: USN-2686-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
23ded8aaf243561a63c3b218c256d432053b8906.body: It was discovered that the Apache HTTP Server incorrectly handled the ap_some_auth_required API. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass intended access restrictions. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3185)

6d276954dd11fd05addfaeb93c6fa7384400d145.title: USN-2721-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
6d276954dd11fd05addfaeb93c6fa7384400d145.body: C. Michael Pilato discovered that Subversion incorrectly handled path-based authorization. A remote attacker could use this issue to obtain sensitive path information. (CVE-2015-3187)

33dcdc5b247d53a5fa2d91bd84c37843829609cf.title: USN-2830-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
33dcdc5b247d53a5fa2d91bd84c37843829609cf.body: Hanno Böck discovered that the OpenSSL Montgomery squaring procedure algorithm may produce incorrect results when being used on x86_64. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to break encryption. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-3193)

882b880f7628ff86addba0ef84029e04017476af.title: USN-2830-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
882b880f7628ff86addba0ef84029e04017476af.body: Adam Langley discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled malformed X509_ATTRIBUTE structures. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-3195)

5482758be786a47167cefda5531311284673ef39.title: USN-2617-3: NTFS-3G vulnerability
5482758be786a47167cefda5531311284673ef39.body: USN-2617-1 fixed a vulnerability in NTFS-3G. The original patch did not completely address the issue. This update fixes the problem. Original advisory details: Tavis Ormandy discovered that FUSE incorrectly filtered environment variables. A local attacker could use this issue to gain administrative privileges.

49cdadf452f0819ee7fce0a31eeb6cf1bda4418c.title: USN-2617-1: FUSE vulnerability
49cdadf452f0819ee7fce0a31eeb6cf1bda4418c.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that FUSE incorrectly filtered environment variables. A local attacker could use this issue to gain administrative privileges.

3366f6fdb611cfdafbbc85a6e6673666fced10ff.title: USN-2617-2: NTFS-3G vulnerability
3366f6fdb611cfdafbbc85a6e6673666fced10ff.body: USN-2617-1 fixed a vulnerability in FUSE. This update provides the corresponding fix for the embedded FUSE copy in NTFS-3G. Original advisory details: Tavis Ormandy discovered that FUSE incorrectly filtered environment variables. A local attacker could use this issue to gain administrative privileges.

82ccaabbfd160656f6ced5c679317e961e41c9f7.title: USN-2630-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
82ccaabbfd160656f6ced5c679317e961e41c9f7.body: Matt Tait discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled the virtual PCNET driver. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host as the user running the QEMU process. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile. (CVE-2015-3209)

4ed41370fbc69bfb53b459615ca2c310e2cd281f.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
4ed41370fbc69bfb53b459615ca2c310e2cd281f.body: Thilo Uttendorfer discovered that the Samba LDAP server incorrectly handled certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the LDAP server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 15.04 and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-3223)

bc064e9613158fb7eb48f37fe0afc2a92312e723.title: USN-2855-1: Samba vulnerabilities
bc064e9613158fb7eb48f37fe0afc2a92312e723.body: Thilo Uttendorfer discovered that the Samba LDAP server incorrectly handled certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the LDAP server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 15.04 and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-3223)

ca07c14fd2b6a998d625c60663d83f3207ff5dd5.title: USN-2856-1: ldb vulnerabilities
ca07c14fd2b6a998d625c60663d83f3207ff5dd5.body: Thilo Uttendorfer discovered that the ldb incorrectly handled certain zero values. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause applications using ldb, such as Samba, to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-3223)

e22c0e43833581578104c486baa4f72bf78d84f1.title: USN-2697-1: Ghostscript vulnerability
e22c0e43833581578104c486baa4f72bf78d84f1.body: William Robinet and Stefan Cornelius discovered that Ghostscript did not correctly handle certain Postscript files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

8183864b81a4ff59d600b5e26a597f91358d2621.title: USN-2935-3: PAM regression
8183864b81a4ff59d600b5e26a597f91358d2621.body: Sebastien Macke discovered that the PAM pam_unix module incorrectly handled large passwords. A local attacker could possibly use this issue in certain environments to enumerate usernames or cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-3238)

8a71ea4dc1611614aff8d67a84e50c54d770a8fc.title: USN-2935-1: PAM vulnerabilities
8a71ea4dc1611614aff8d67a84e50c54d770a8fc.body: Sebastien Macke discovered that the PAM pam_unix module incorrectly handled large passwords. A local attacker could possibly use this issue in certain environments to enumerate usernames or cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-3238)

7ae9aa89c89d3873ec5d998257f00660067653f9.title: USN-2935-2: PAM regression
7ae9aa89c89d3873ec5d998257f00660067653f9.body: Sebastien Macke discovered that the PAM pam_unix module incorrectly handled large passwords. A local attacker could possibly use this issue in certain environments to enumerate usernames or cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-3238)

35ba00f33d81a65ba8194311f227dae3a3076395.title: USN-2736-1: Spice vulnerability
35ba00f33d81a65ba8194311f227dae3a3076395.body: Frediano Ziglio discovered that Spice incorrectly handled monitor configs. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host as the user running the QEMU process. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile.

f78311e078f3eea7527e407d38ad572060903241.title: USN-2659-1: cups-filters vulnerabilities
f78311e078f3eea7527e407d38ad572060903241.body: Petr Sklenar discovered that the cups-filters texttopdf filter incorrectly handled line sizes. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code as the lp user. (CVE-2015-3258, CVE-2015-3279)

1cf7bc43a7542577d4b7050cdd4552b3cea86223.title: USN-2668-1: HAProxy vulnerability
1cf7bc43a7542577d4b7050cdd4552b3cea86223.body: It was discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled certain buffers. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information belonging to previous requests.

4f95c14c998554a35acb9d5e8ca3274b763afea4.title: USN-2691-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4f95c14c998554a35acb9d5e8ca3274b763afea4.body: Andy Lutomirski discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of nested NMIs (non-maskable interrupts). An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially escalate their privileges. (CVE-2015-3290)

94df686d97932b66a67e22eb8fa6c4c4d84e06a8.title: USN-2690-1: Linux kernel (Vivid HWE) vulnerabilities

0674ab20c1302eceff87e5988e274acec2d4b715.body: Andy Lutomirski discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of nested NMIs (non-maskable interrupts).
