0de08c547f7623bca4c123be79cd4d75e53316e6.title: USN-2595-1: ppp vulnerability
0de08c547f7623bca4c123be79cd4d75e53316e6.body: It was discovered that ppp incorrectly handled large PIDs. When pppd is used with a RADIUS server, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause it to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

e1aa78fc8261294d69a1a79404c9de841e6099e1.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
e1aa78fc8261294d69a1a79404c9de841e6099e1.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled opening tar, zip or phar archives through the PHAR extension. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-3329)

9c12f8ebe7a60aeb7e6d3929f6148bc3a508c769.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
9c12f8ebe7a60aeb7e6d3929f6148bc3a508c769.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled cleanup when used with Apache 2.4. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-3330)

134e7942a339741329541d362214c8c889d4b7d0.title: USN-2631-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
134e7942a339741329541d362214c8c889d4b7d0.body: A memory corruption issue was discovered in AES decryption when using the Intel AES-NI accelerated code path. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially escalate privileges on Intel base machines with AEC-GCM mode IPSec security association. (CVE-2015-3331)

246a1465520540a7987912c6085fb399819f4ff8.title: USN-2632-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
246a1465520540a7987912c6085fb399819f4ff8.body: A memory corruption issue was discovered in AES decryption when using the Intel AES-NI accelerated code path. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially escalate privileges on Intel base machines with AEC-GCM mode IPSec security association. (CVE-2015-3331)

808b1d81777d908280391e8bde8f0c287bf22145.title: USN-2698-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
808b1d81777d908280391e8bde8f0c287bf22145.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled dequoting of collation-sequence names. An attacker could use this issue to cause applications using SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3414)

48e56a34067c69d32943f9ec709bb45146237c64.title: USN-2698-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
48e56a34067c69d32943f9ec709bb45146237c64.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that SQLite incorrectly implemented comparison operators. An attacker could use this issue to cause applications using SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3415)

3af46aee6b41968c8f2b506cf58eecb464feff21.title: USN-2698-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
3af46aee6b41968c8f2b506cf58eecb464feff21.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that SQLite incorrectly handle printf precision and width values during floating-point conversions. An attacker could use this issue to cause applications using SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-3416)

2e062941110551dc4b8f22ea68968e66442f1cd4.title: USN-2608-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
2e062941110551dc4b8f22ea68968e66442f1cd4.body: Jason Geffner discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled the virtual floppy driver. This issue is known as VENOM. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host as the user running the QEMU process. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile. (CVE-2015-3456)

7001d6dd305b01c1e8c4241e8d406df6ffc99380.title: USN-2604-1: Libtasn1 vulnerability
7001d6dd305b01c1e8c4241e8d406df6ffc99380.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Libtasn1 incorrectly handled certain ASN.1 data. A remote attacker could possibly exploit this with specially crafted ASN.1 data and cause applications using Libtasn1 to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

b76cef1187453c81219b964a46fd90dde55bccd2.title: USN-2627-1: t1utils vulnerability
b76cef1187453c81219b964a46fd90dde55bccd2.body: Jakub Wilk discovered that t1utils incorrectly handled certain malformed fonts. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted font, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

94a029e3106cbe44429f36f388a6ceaea03283e2.title: USN-2673-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
94a029e3106cbe44429f36f388a6ceaea03283e2.body: Matthew Green discovered a DHE key processing issue in NSS where a MITM could force a server to downgrade TLS connections to 512-bit export-grade cryptography. An attacker could potentially exploit this to impersonate the server. (CVE-2015-4000)

982bc4e7eeb579fd68eee2871c0f38aa53cd1402.title: USN-2706-1: OpenJDK 6 vulnerabilities
982bc4e7eeb579fd68eee2871c0f38aa53cd1402.body: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in the cryptographic components of the OpenJDK JRE. An attacker could exploit these to expose sensitive data over the network. (CVE-2015-2601, CVE-2015-2808, CVE-2015-4000, CVE-2015-2625, CVE-2015-2613)

742ffbecb4dd00c4d58a99b7d54e7cca0cd6fbf1.title: USN-2696-1: OpenJDK 7 vulnerabilities
742ffbecb4dd00c4d58a99b7d54e7cca0cd6fbf1.body: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in the cryptographic components of the OpenJDK JRE. An attacker could exploit these to expose sensitive data over the network. (CVE-2015-2601, CVE-2015-2808, CVE-2015-4000, CVE-2015-2625, CVE-2015-2613)

9ae234039fdf9f8e5a9d90af9e16bde365b2cd01.body: A underflow error was discovered in the Linux kernel's Ozmo Devices USB over WiFi host controller driver. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted packet. (CVE-2015-4001)

4048e79456a26a642eabc94859178b407bdbccc0.body: A memory corruption flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's scsi subsystem. A local attacker could potentially exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2015-4036)

f2a98d2323d5828d0a9f87822aff34cbe9c44f4e.title: USN-2633-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities

52e664f4662991bbca66dc76a395330269313794.title: USN-2623-1: ipsec-tools vulnerability
52e664f4662991bbca66dc76a395330269313794.body: It was discovered that racoon, the ipsec-tools IKE daemon, incorrectly handled certain UDP packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause racoon to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

ed358d2d0fe9fcc705e27ebb402890e1b41a45cb.title: USN-2630-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
ed358d2d0fe9fcc705e27ebb402890e1b41a45cb.body: Jan Beulich discovered that the QEMU Xen code incorrectly restricted write access to the host MSI message data field. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-4103)

3938c3c6608a9e1a3607a63b8a37c93a98ac276c.title: USN-2630-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
3938c3c6608a9e1a3607a63b8a37c93a98ac276c.body: Jan Beulich discovered that the QEMU Xen code incorrectly restricted access to the PCI MSI mask bits. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-4104)

7d657808a6fb21db330d3dc0b6d8e8984946243a.title: USN-2630-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
7d657808a6fb21db330d3dc0b6d8e8984946243a.body: Jan Beulich discovered that the QEMU Xen code incorrectly handled MSI-X error messages. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-4105)

866b29e2a130c9a43206be8861f550525056775a.title: USN-2650-1: wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerabilities
866b29e2a130c9a43206be8861f550525056775a.body: Kostya Kortchinsky discovered multiple flaws in wpa_supplicant and hostapd. A remote attacker could use these issues to cause wpa_supplicant or hostapd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-4141, CVE-2015-4142, CVE-2015-4143, CVE-2015-4144, CVE-2015-4145, CVE-2015-4146)

2fb8904cee11f2b8d9bace2d2b34be68bd7990fd.title: USN-2631-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
2fb8904cee11f2b8d9bace2d2b34be68bd7990fd.body: Carl H Lunde discovered missing sanity checks in the Linux kernel's UDF file system (CONFIG_UDF_FS). A local attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) by using a corrupted file system image. (CVE-2015-4167)

3b1fc47fca8da5c8bf8dd09ea76d3e7366fbaf07.title: USN-2632-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
3b1fc47fca8da5c8bf8dd09ea76d3e7366fbaf07.body: Carl H Lunde discovered missing sanity checks in the Linux kernel's UDF file system (CONFIG_UDF_FS). A local attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) by using a corrupted file system image. (CVE-2015-4167)

e6d69caaea38cd0d19f98373724101674bf2783a.title: USN-2628-1: strongSwan vulnerability
e6d69caaea38cd0d19f98373724101674bf2783a.body: Alexander E. Patrakov discovered that strongSwan incorrectly handled certain IKEv2 setups. A malicious server could possibly use this issue to obtain user credentials.

cb06171d57529da3e7500a0f855cd8e40e493627.title: USN-2702-2: Ubufox update
cb06171d57529da3e7500a0f855cd8e40e493627.body: Gary Kwong, Christian Holler, Byron Campen, Tyson Smith, Bobby Holley, Chris Coulson, and Eric Rahm discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-4473, CVE-2015-4474)

If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-4479, CVE-2015-4480, CVE-2015-4493)

d7f61c75d8b313a12aaa388d606ed2293237a915.body: Jukka Jylänki discovered a crash that occurs because javascript does not properly gate access to Atomics or SharedArrayBuffers in some circumstances. b251f18336a1c13b0ff396fce2056ca14acd1eb2.body: Gustavo Grieco discovered that GDK-PixBuf incorrectly handled scaling bitmap images. 99cb5095b24d7033ecc0535030fdd789f7719cec.body: Eric Peterson and Lin Hua Cheng discovered that Django incorrectly handled session records. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5143)

dba91b8e503e17e8ec6507886edf7f5152758abf.title: USN-2671-1: Django vulnerabilities
dba91b8e503e17e8ec6507886edf7f5152758abf.body: Sjoerd Job Postmus discovered that DJango incorrectly handled newline characters when performing validation. A remote attacker could use this issue to perform header injection attacks. (CVE-2015-5144)

7d2a19d34677b43cae0a1ee86f62061a4051dec0.title: USN-2777-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
7d2a19d34677b43cae0a1ee86f62061a4051dec0.body: It was discovered that virtio networking in the Linux kernel did not handle fragments correctly, leading to kernel memory corruption. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute code with administrative privileges. (CVE-2015-5156)

56c5c8e480ebf64e2d764f8eb30f294cc32beaa7.title: USN-2774-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
56c5c8e480ebf64e2d764f8eb30f294cc32beaa7.body: It was discovered that virtio networking in the Linux kernel did not handle fragments correctly, leading to kernel memory corruption. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute code with administrative privileges. (CVE-2015-5156)

2e71f54de90d64bb0f8b3de44331f48638378b7a.title: USN-2773-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
2e71f54de90d64bb0f8b3de44331f48638378b7a.body: It was discovered that virtio networking in the Linux kernel did not handle fragments correctly, leading to kernel memory corruption. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute code with administrative privileges. (CVE-2015-5156)

cfad66d4a296c45d262e760004e4fd2adf4b3594.title: USN-2691-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
cfad66d4a296c45d262e760004e4fd2adf4b3594.body: Andy Lutomirski and Petr Matousek discovered that an NMI (non-maskable interrupt) that interrupts userspace and encounters an IRET fault is incorrectly handled by the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel OOPs), corruption, or potentially escalate privileges on the system. (CVE-2015-5157)

6f5ff9070e675a72ac8b6c4abd38d7ffdbae86af.body: Andy Lutomirski and Petr Matousek discovered that an NMI (non-maskable interrupt) that interrupts userspace and encounters an IRET fault is incorrectly handled by the Linux kernel. e52db3220953f30be6aa162d5e77026bd91feabd.title: USN-2687-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
e52db3220953f30be6aa162d5e77026bd91feabd.body: Andy Lutomirski and Petr Matousek discovered that an NMI (non-maskable interrupt) that interrupts userspace and encounters an IRET fault is incorrectly handled by the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel OOPs), corruption, or potentially escalate privileges on the system. (CVE-2015-5157)

f92d055861e09cab318deb5be722c39a0df60324.title: USN-3024-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
f92d055861e09cab318deb5be722c39a0df60324.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled pathnames used by web applications in a getResource, getResourceAsStream, or getResourcePaths call. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly list a parent directory . This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-5174)

fe50a9da86f13b1eb12f68e8ab2a3905215c7196.title: USN-3239-2: GNU C Library Regression
fe50a9da86f13b1eb12f68e8ab2a3905215c7196.body: USN-3239-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the GNU C Library. Unfortunately, the fix for CVE-2015-5180 introduced an internal ABI change within the resolver library. This update reverts the change. We apologize for the inconvenience.

4d001be19c4dd0e8c8f5a20de5243bea994655bc.title: USN-3239-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
4d001be19c4dd0e8c8f5a20de5243bea994655bc.body: Florian Weimer discovered a NULL pointer dereference in the DNS resolver of the GNU C Library. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5180)

b8c6a0eb37d78f779b03804208569f1ef3e28513.title: USN-2783-1: NTP vulnerabilities
b8c6a0eb37d78f779b03804208569f1ef3e28513.body: Miroslav Lichvar discovered that NTP incorrectly handled logconfig directives. In a non-default configuration, a remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause NTP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5194)

51b141ad4725dfe919ee6f838b9e17140b912e14.title: USN-2783-1: NTP vulnerabilities
51b141ad4725dfe919ee6f838b9e17140b912e14.body: Miroslav Lichvar discovered that NTP incorrectly handled certain statistics types. In a non-default configuration, a remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause NTP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5195)

4763a66f8992f8c20b6cfe70eb48a9988f44408f.title: USN-2729-1: libvdpau vulnerabilities
4763a66f8992f8c20b6cfe70eb48a9988f44408f.body: Florian Weimer discovered that libvdpau incorrectly handled certain environment variables. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to gain privileges.

46b1b500e62a3af7ffa87e7abd2cfc4fad0d4db1.title: USN-2793-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
46b1b500e62a3af7ffa87e7abd2cfc4fad0d4db1.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled PrinterSetup data stored in ODF files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted ODF document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5212)

5d8daa8c9b4513db36805895769d2541b0bbe15a.title: USN-2793-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
5d8daa8c9b4513db36805895769d2541b0bbe15a.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled the number of pieces in DOC files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted DOC document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5213)

7ffdcd514283a796d9f3af16f9729e5ab0e1ed30.title: USN-2793-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
7ffdcd514283a796d9f3af16f9729e5ab0e1ed30.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled bookmarks in DOC files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted DOC document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5214)

c2d954e8cc135377b9707b8c4c7a2464b0870bcb.title: USN-2817-1: IcedTea Web vulnerabilities
c2d954e8cc135377b9707b8c4c7a2464b0870bcb.body: It was discovered that IcedTea Web incorrectly handled applet URLs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to inject applets into the .appletTrustSettings configuration file and bypass user approval. (CVE-2015-5234)

7fba2c0f5754b6614c1e4677625388b3764fa703.title: USN-2817-1: IcedTea Web vulnerabilities
7fba2c0f5754b6614c1e4677625388b3764fa703.body: Andrea Palazzo discovered that IcedTea Web incorrectly determined the origin of unsigned applets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass user approval, or to trick the user into approving applet execution. (CVE-2015-5235)

aec7084dd932256795df3d6a253477888f968add.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
aec7084dd932256795df3d6a253477888f968add.body: USN-2855-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Samba. The upstream fix for CVE-2015-5252 introduced a regression in certain specific environments. This update fixes the problem.

93a6f52faff57f9ad9ba45a574b137c2527071d1.title: USN-2855-1: Samba vulnerabilities
93a6f52faff57f9ad9ba45a574b137c2527071d1.body: Jan Kasprzak discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain symlinks. A remote attacker could use this issue to access files outside the exported share path. (CVE-2015-5252)

53de8bdc74b554341c683c39e3c20757600f665f.title: USN-2766-1: Spice vulnerabilities
53de8bdc74b554341c683c39e3c20757600f665f.body: Frediano Ziglio discovered multiple buffer overflows, undefined behavior signed integer operations, race conditions, memory leaks, and denial of service issues in Spice. A malicious guest operating system could potentially exploit these issues to escape virtualization. (CVE-2015-5260, CVE-2015-5261)

a88267f3d737183d4d380b9fa0059933726b438f.title: USN-2769-1: Apache Commons HttpClient vulnerabilities
a88267f3d737183d4d380b9fa0059933726b438f.body: It was discovered that Apache Commons HttpClient did not properly handle read timeouts during HTTPS handshakes. A remote attacker could trigger this flaw to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5262)

90f3d4a47ec0283cf657663171f852d3cd5b2319.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
90f3d4a47ec0283cf657663171f852d3cd5b2319.body: Sumit Bose and Lukas Slebodnik discovered that the Name Service Switch (NSS) implementation in the GNU C Library did not handle long lines in the files databases correctly. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5277)

20ea86cb1c429d23199c062c165c114becdb3657.title: USN-2985-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
20ea86cb1c429d23199c062c165c114becdb3657.body: Sumit Bose and Lukas Slebodnik discovered that the Name Service Switch (NSS) implementation in the GNU C Library did not handle long lines in the files databases correctly. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5277)

33351813bc55b5382a6aa8d9406ccf6b51ca9a4d.body: It was discovered that the SCTP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel performed an incorrect sequence of protocol-initialization steps. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2015-5283)

170ce4dfacc56e88443fa1c1ea6bd07189b6ff33.body: It was discovered that the SCTP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel performed an incorrect sequence of protocol-initialization steps. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2015-5283)

1e7498722543d5edd0a77ac512d4cad458fee620.body: It was discovered that the SCTP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel performed an incorrect sequence of protocol-initialization steps. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2015-5283)

3361b1a6323f129e401b7b12e584b4e310d50ce5.body: It was discovered that the SCTP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel performed an incorrect sequence of protocol-initialization steps. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2015-5283)

5fdc6bff9ca82df6f7c7e570d18a45cf7b3a74e3.title: USN-2772-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
5fdc6bff9ca82df6f7c7e570d18a45cf7b3a74e3.body: Josh Kupershmidt discovered the pgCrypto extension could expose several bytes of server memory if the crypt() function was provided a too-short salt. An attacker could use this flaw to read private data. (CVE-2015-5288)

08874cf0a8e318d32f16c4f8bf0018e40dbb2f63.title: USN-2772-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
08874cf0a8e318d32f16c4f8bf0018e40dbb2f63.body: Oskari Saarenmaa discovered that the json and jsonb handlers could exhaust available stack space. An attacker could use this flaw to perform a denial of service attack. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-5289)

78575894817cdbf43c35f7d5b4ef1091921d2e1a.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
78575894817cdbf43c35f7d5b4ef1091921d2e1a.body: Stefan Metzmacher discovered that Samba did not enforce signing when creating encrypted connections. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to view sensitive information. (CVE-2015-5296)

cb1e11c0824fc15fd6677bb4b8f0c2af03373a93.title: USN-2855-1: Samba vulnerabilities
cb1e11c0824fc15fd6677bb4b8f0c2af03373a93.body: Stefan Metzmacher discovered that Samba did not enforce signing when creating encrypted connections. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to view sensitive information. (CVE-2015-5296)

283b10a061a4fa0be18b55bbd88b7383d56d4c04.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
283b10a061a4fa0be18b55bbd88b7383d56d4c04.body: It was discovered that Samba incorrectly performed access control when using the VFS shadow_copy2 module. A remote attacker could use this issue to access snapshots, contrary to intended permissions. (CVE-2015-5299)

d41a1a98c0de81334e64ebf154c741ed9b371535.title: USN-2855-1: Samba vulnerabilities
d41a1a98c0de81334e64ebf154c741ed9b371535.body: It was discovered that Samba incorrectly performed access control when using the VFS shadow_copy2 module. A remote attacker could use this issue to access snapshots, contrary to intended permissions. (CVE-2015-5299)

92188d7e6dfde3e05978c4b359fd33ce3f308b36.title: USN-2805-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerability
92188d7e6dfde3e05978c4b359fd33ce3f308b36.body: Ben Serebrin discovered that the KVM hypervisor implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly catch Alignment Check exceptions. An attacker in a guest virtual machine could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) in the host OS.

f50ac0ae1bd1c05bd928169a58be0053ea77c496.body: Ben Serebrin discovered that the KVM hypervisor implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly catch Alignment Check exceptions. An attacker in a guest virtual machine could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) in the host OS.

2b10b151d966f67509f6b605e40f7cbb3c8dffad.title: USN-2803-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
2b10b151d966f67509f6b605e40f7cbb3c8dffad.body: Ben Serebrin discovered that the KVM hypervisor implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly catch Alignment Check exceptions. An attacker in a guest virtual machine could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) in the host OS.

b7e9df5c7ec0964801e2209d68d6b44c9203457e.title: USN-2808-1: wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerabilities
b7e9df5c7ec0964801e2209d68d6b44c9203457e.body: It was discovered that wpa_supplicant incorrectly handled WMM Sleep Mode Response frame processing. A remote attacker could use this issue to perform broadcast/multicast packet injections, or cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5310)

5440f157e633fb5065fe9c4aa46f2bb49d26d3ee.title: USN-2834-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
5440f157e633fb5065fe9c4aa46f2bb49d26d3ee.body: Kostya Serebryany discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled certain malformed documents. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, an attacker could possibly cause libxml2 to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5312, CVE-2015-7497, CVE-2015-7498, CVE-2015-7499,CVE-2015-7500)

829794faab1066eb2926e8534708efea926b6323.title: USN-2808-1: wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerabilities
829794faab1066eb2926e8534708efea926b6323.body: It was discovered that wpa_supplicant and hostapd incorrectly handled certain EAP-pwd messages. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5314, CVE-2015-5315)

e1f45ec570f533e036b3bd106bde03ddf710ce2f.title: USN-2808-1: wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerabilities
e1f45ec570f533e036b3bd106bde03ddf710ce2f.body: It was discovered that wpa_supplicant incorrectly handled certain EAP-pwd Confirm messages. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-5316)

40200fbfe7a7b67973034ce472228a7da75a64d6.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
40200fbfe7a7b67973034ce472228a7da75a64d6.body: Douglas Bagnall discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain string lengths. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly access sensitive information. (CVE-2015-5330)

c5144a93c102637bea753f9d88614daad9240157.title: USN-2855-1: Samba vulnerabilities
c5144a93c102637bea753f9d88614daad9240157.body: Douglas Bagnall discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain string lengths. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly access sensitive information. (CVE-2015-5330)

8abe1536303a4aa889c1ae08116037efff33f644.title: USN-2856-1: ldb vulnerabilities
8abe1536303a4aa889c1ae08116037efff33f644.body: Douglas Bagnall discovered that ldb incorrectly handled certain string lengths. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly access sensitive information from memory of applications using ldb, such as Samba. (CVE-2015-5330)

4c7233a6bea287fb32d5ecd12c52a624eb52a938.title: USN-3024-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
4c7233a6bea287fb32d5ecd12c52a624eb52a938.body: It was discovered that the Tomcat mapper component incorrectly handled redirects. A remote attacker could use this issue to determine the existence of a directory. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-5345)

3b2184fa046295e86f5dae574c83d873bc67d241.title: USN-3024-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
3b2184fa046295e86f5dae574c83d873bc67d241.body: It was discovered that the Tomcat Manager and Host Manager applications incorrectly handled new requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass CSRF protection mechanisms. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-5351)

b0c6c1efac7b9d95a2562f03be1c5a6d80da3cb1.title: USN-2710-2: OpenSSH regression
b0c6c1efac7b9d95a2562f03be1c5a6d80da3cb1.body: Jann Horn discovered that OpenSSH incorrectly handled time windows for X connections. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass certain access restrictions. (CVE-2015-5352)

818e0e9a3c9e61fb4730f710fb6a5e3b3d3be73d.title: USN-2710-1: OpenSSH vulnerabilities
818e0e9a3c9e61fb4730f710fb6a5e3b3d3be73d.body: Jann Horn discovered that OpenSSH incorrectly handled time windows for X connections. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass certain access restrictions. (CVE-2015-5352)

ed053723a6cfdca84c782320b9a1d7ece20a75c1.body: A flaw was discovered in how the Linux kernel handles invalid UDP checksums. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service using a flood of UDP packets with invalid checksums. (CVE-2015-5364)

998a20358d835e10434067515874e66c2ab6ed88.body: A flaw was discovered in how the Linux kernel handles invalid UDP checksums. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service using a flood of UDP packets with invalid checksums. (CVE-2015-5364)

b368d14562628c854aa954b3929f011917abfae5.title: USN-2714-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
b368d14562628c854aa954b3929f011917abfae5.body: A flaw was discovered in how the Linux kernel handles invalid UDP checksums. A remote attacker can cause a denial of service against applications that use epoll by injecting a single packet with an invalid checksum. (CVE-2015-5366)

a3648f986a9bb32fc6470269c1ad16d7b571ba0c.body: Fernando Muñoz discovered that HTML Tidy incorrectly handled memory. 85162efa6fa9fdc9ebd6ac2e1d54b3bb343e6833.title: USN-2710-2: OpenSSH regression
85162efa6fa9fdc9ebd6ac2e1d54b3bb343e6833.body: USN-2710-1 fixed vulnerabilities in OpenSSH. The upstream fix for CVE-2015-5600 caused a regression resulting in random authentication failures in non-default configurations. This update fixes the problem.

c475f5941a6f08b1031850a5c07b2885899a0c61.title: USN-2710-1: OpenSSH vulnerabilities
c475f5941a6f08b1031850a5c07b2885899a0c61.body: It was discovered that OpenSSH incorrectly handled keyboard-interactive authentication. In a non-default configuration, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a brute-force password attack. (CVE-2015-5600)

8368cdf3a8da1dd104b3a6aa47b143e1a436e1d4.body: Benjamin Randazzo discovered an information leak in the md (multiple device) driver when the bitmap_info.file is disabled. A local privileged attacker could use this to obtain sensitive information from the kernel. (CVE-2015-5697)

e80f00cd4111f362b034d824bf8a6bd593b23db3.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow error existed in the SCSI generic (sg) driver in the Linux kernel. 66870ba9b027cba77354838fefd6edff759ce4d6.title: USN-2728-1: Bind vulnerability
66870ba9b027cba77354838fefd6edff759ce4d6.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Bind incorrectly handled certain malformed keys when configured to perform DNSSEC validation. A remote attacker could use this issue with specially crafted zone data to cause Bind to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

58d3c74616227b8fb142ac76fcbfe3bc085522d4.title: USN-2747-1: NVIDIA graphics drivers vulnerability
58d3c74616227b8fb142ac76fcbfe3bc085522d4.body: Dario Weisser discovered that the NVIDIA graphics drivers incorrectly handled certain IOCTL writes. A local attacker could use this issue to possibly gain root privileges.

82b28e8ae0ac309ae46e7b3bcc3ef08b787869c8.title: USN-2720-1: Django vulnerability
82b28e8ae0ac309ae46e7b3bcc3ef08b787869c8.body: Lin Hua Cheng discovered that Django incorrectly handled the session store. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the session store to fill up, resulting in a denial of service.

3c85cb12043129492fe044fc7990d671b8ee67ad.title: USN-2780-2: MiniUPnP vulnerability
3c85cb12043129492fe044fc7990d671b8ee67ad.body: USN-2780-1 fixed a vulnerability in the MiniUPnP library in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 15.04. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 15.10. Original advisory details: Aleksandar Nikolic discovered a buffer overflow vulnerability in the XML parser functionality of the MiniUPnP library. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user running an application that uses the MiniUPnP library.

d203f0c1898f8b5c03dd61a8126c6345c34e35f1.body: Aleksandar Nikolic discovered a buffer overflow vulnerability in the XML parser functionality of the MiniUPnP library. 4f13ce21193efc6cd8c54fd254b3f4e2fb890f7f.body: Marc-André Lureau discovered that the vhost driver did not properly release the userspace provided log file descriptor. A privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion). (CVE-2015-6252)

0ed15cc90961efce51f7248b29528a9ac3086b65.title: USN-2725-1: cups-filters vulnerability
0ed15cc90961efce51f7248b29528a9ac3086b65.body: Seth Arnold discovered that ippusbxd in the cups-filters package would incorrectly listen to all configured network interfaces. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly access locally-connected printers.

abfe513f0c3a1a5bc39c166b4b2a55768b8ef799.title: USN-2760-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
abfe513f0c3a1a5bc39c166b4b2a55768b8ef799.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel's perf subsystem did not bound callchain backtraces on PowerPC 64. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-6526)

f6121b5396b81992fac2c1f10b715228bd55e7a7.title: USN-2759-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f6121b5396b81992fac2c1f10b715228bd55e7a7.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel's perf subsystem did not bound callchain backtraces on PowerPC 64. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-6526)

b09206ae95775e7758135be559fbc53f79ab2891.title: USN-2770-2: Oxide vulnerabilities
b09206ae95775e7758135be559fbc53f79ab2891.body: It was discovered that ContainerNode::parserInsertBefore in Blink would incorrectly proceed with a DOM tree insertion in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6755)

2426dd3cc77014b359dab72d6afa80f2ed0c0c35.title: USN-2770-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
2426dd3cc77014b359dab72d6afa80f2ed0c0c35.body: It was discovered that ContainerNode::parserInsertBefore in Blink would incorrectly proceed with a DOM tree insertion in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6755)

e6fe6b16fc636b8fd841ed40104a40ff1917373f.title: USN-2770-2: Oxide vulnerabilities
e6fe6b16fc636b8fd841ed40104a40ff1917373f.body: It was discovered that Blink did not ensure that the origin of LocalStorage resources are considered unique. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-6759)

285b48f523da371294d067581f1dc6dd716f1b1f.title: USN-2770-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
285b48f523da371294d067581f1dc6dd716f1b1f.body: It was discovered that Blink did not ensure that the origin of LocalStorage resources are considered unique. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-6759)

0b436e2e516123cb6e2a9a50e5618887c87a5b1e.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
0b436e2e516123cb6e2a9a50e5618887c87a5b1e.body: Several security issues were discovered in the DOM implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6768, CVE-2015-6770)

85d6086d27c33e534610c51f4333ed620c067c7c.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
85d6086d27c33e534610c51f4333ed620c067c7c.body: A security issue was discovered in the provisional-load commit implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6769)

6c2f6265558905b60134ac4f7f7ff92cb3faa7c3.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
6c2f6265558905b60134ac4f7f7ff92cb3faa7c3.body: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in the array map and filter operations in V8 in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-6771)

77da91d73e0f97a7181cdf58c0162d35b8246c34.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
77da91d73e0f97a7181cdf58c0162d35b8246c34.body: It was discovered that the DOM implementation in Chromium does not prevent javascript: URL navigation while a document is being detached. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6772)

6146081084c2e80a24a77de6e7a515027b90fdb8.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
6146081084c2e80a24a77de6e7a515027b90fdb8.body: An out-of bounds read was discovered in Skia in some cirumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-6773)

98eabe86b4e734b282a8f352739030a4e06234e6.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
98eabe86b4e734b282a8f352739030a4e06234e6.body: It was discovered that the Document::open function in Chromium did not ensure that page-dismissal event handling is compatible with modal dialog blocking. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to spoof application UI content. (CVE-2015-6782)

63e9320ca2e2d60e117ddf887b0d6c0ca8a16d5f.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
63e9320ca2e2d60e117ddf887b0d6c0ca8a16d5f.body: It was discovered that the page serializer in Chromium mishandled MOTW comments for URLs in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this to inject HTML content. (CVE-2015-6784)

870495ec4de802da95d63dba867a7edfa9898180.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
870495ec4de802da95d63dba867a7edfa9898180.body: It was discovered that the Content Security Policy (CSP) implementation in Chromium accepted an x.y hostname as a match for a *.x.y pattern. An attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass intended access restrictions. (CVE-2015-6785)

dd502a5f9e53c403db06264b2ad03ebe699cc497.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
dd502a5f9e53c403db06264b2ad03ebe699cc497.body: Multiple use-after-free bugs were discovered in the application cache implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-6765, CVE-2015-6766, CVE-2015-6767) Several security issues were discovered in the DOM implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6768, CVE-2015-6770) A security issue was discovered in the provisional-load commit implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6769) An out-of-bounds read was discovered in the array map and filter operations in V8 in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-6771) It was discovered that the DOM implementation in Chromium does not prevent javascript: URL navigation while a document is being detached. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6772) An out-of bounds read was discovered in Skia in some cirumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-6773) A use-after-free was discovered in the DOM implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2015-6777) It was discovered that the Document::open function in Chromium did not ensure that page-dismissal event handling is compatible with modal dialog blocking. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to spoof application UI content. (CVE-2015-6782) It was discovered that the page serializer in Chromium mishandled MOTW comments for URLs in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this to inject HTML content. (CVE-2015-6784) It was discovered that the Content Security Policy (CSP) implementation in Chromium accepted an x.y hostname as a match for a *.x.y pattern. An attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass intended access restrictions. (CVE-2015-6785) It was discovered that the Content Security Policy (CSP) implementation in Chromium accepted blob:, data: and filesystem: URLs as a match for a pattern. An attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass intended access restrictions. (CVE-2015-6786) Multiple security issues were discovered in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to read uninitialized memory, cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-6787) Multiple security issues were discovered in V8. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to read uninitialized memory, cause a denial of service via renderer crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2015-8478)

0e1089e2f431a408e0a471a4bc341c9bdf084510.title: USN-2860-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
0e1089e2f431a408e0a471a4bc341c9bdf084510.body: An issue was discovered with the page serializer in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to inject arbitrary script or HTML. (CVE-2015-6790)

9c379afc14abaeab6c7ae8a8d10fc2fcc6a5dd1f.title: USN-2742-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
9c379afc14abaeab6c7ae8a8d10fc2fcc6a5dd1f.body: Denis Andzakovic discovered that OpenLDAP incorrectly handled certain BER data. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenLDAP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-6908)

79cd26fb851d90697fdd477eb70624442a67eab0.title: USN-2791-1: NSS vulnerabilities
79cd26fb851d90697fdd477eb70624442a67eab0.body: Tyson Smith and David Keeler discovered that NSS incorrectly handled decoding certain ASN.1 data. An remote attacker could use this issue to cause NSS to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

5d15a2c92188fd5cbcce7d196a860e59c13387e6.title: USN-2785-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
5d15a2c92188fd5cbcce7d196a860e59c13387e6.body: Tyson Smith and David Keeler discovered a use-after-poison and buffer overflow in NSS. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-7181, CVE-2015-7182)

c335b1328b3a6f58abec6d531263cd48e0a61a2f.title: USN-2819-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
c335b1328b3a6f58abec6d531263cd48e0a61a2f.body: Tyson Smith and David Keeler discovered a use-after-poison and buffer overflow in NSS. An attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. 5c30b93c72524800cb11105d4532ca1e31245781.body: Gustavo Grieco discovered that the file chooser crashed on malformed images due to flaws in the Jasper library. aed194cb53d7cabe62c9c313a778428dd4aa3568.body: Stuart Larsen discoverd two integer underflows when handling malformed HTTP/2 frames in some circumstances. 70ba3313dbb4a8393dae8ab266aa2752e6f43282.body: Gerald Squelart discovered an integer underflow in the libstagefright library when parsing MP4 format video in some circumstances. e9f7d24dcd44135eb5301c97449bdce9800127c0.body: Kris Maglione discovered a mechanism where web content could use WebExtension APIs to execute code with the privileges of a particular WebExtension. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website with a vulnerable extension installed, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information or conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2015-7223)

6a025290b61f6b8c35f1ecee0b77dc9a5d2d42c2.title: USN-2777-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
6a025290b61f6b8c35f1ecee0b77dc9a5d2d42c2.body: Ben Hutchings discovered that the Advanced Union Filesystem (aufs) for the Linux kernel did not correctly handle references of memory mapped files from an aufs mount. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code with administrative privileges. (CVE-2015-7312)

fffb59ef48ac99e9c7306657eff1bd4ce23be0da.title: USN-2896-1: Libgcrypt vulnerability
fffb59ef48ac99e9c7306657eff1bd4ce23be0da.body: Daniel Genkin, Lev Pachmanov, Itamar Pipman and Eran Tromer discovered that Libgcrypt was susceptible to an attack via physical side channels. A local attacker could use this attack to possibly recover private keys.

169bcc1d1e5b2a767951e2a13e3fdbc1a6190e2c.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
169bcc1d1e5b2a767951e2a13e3fdbc1a6190e2c.body: It was discovered that the Samba LDAP server incorrectly handled certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the LDAP server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 15.04 and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-7540)

1eb5226c77f808f16c2c0b495605528bdb286f46.title: USN-2855-1: Samba vulnerabilities
1eb5226c77f808f16c2c0b495605528bdb286f46.body: It was discovered that the Samba LDAP server incorrectly handled certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the LDAP server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 15.04 and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-7540)

5d688c319fd3e76203205a343ac7879de520eea5.title: USN-2835-1: Git vulnerability
5d688c319fd3e76203205a343ac7879de520eea5.body: Blake Burkhart discovered that the Git git-remote-ext helper incorrectly handled recursive clones of git repositories. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code by injecting commands via crafted URLs.

bf80fd4442ed298e25ed63d6d7983ab9bceede4b.title: USN-2900-1: GNU C Library vulnerability
bf80fd4442ed298e25ed63d6d7983ab9bceede4b.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled receiving responses while performing DNS resolution. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the GNU C Library to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

0291320da2587f15c5b0dec6416711f14b8f23b3.title: USN-3085-1: GDK-PixBuf vulnerabilities
0291320da2587f15c5b0dec6416711f14b8f23b3.body: It was discovered that the GDK-PixBuf library did not properly handle specially crafted bmp images, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted bmp file, a remote attacker could use this flaw to cause GDK-PixBuf to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2015-7552)

c63fd81183ec9df1e3b17421b80330e017efccda.title: USN-2767-1: GDK-PixBuf vulnerabilities
c63fd81183ec9df1e3b17421b80330e017efccda.body: Gustavo Grieco discovered that the GDK-PixBuf library did not properly handle scaling tga image files, leading to a heap overflow. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a tga image file, a remote attacker could use this flaw to cause GDK-PixBuf to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-7673)

ded8212cc6b644ac1efb0dba7b6f24af39425d37.title: USN-2767-1: GDK-PixBuf vulnerabilities
ded8212cc6b644ac1efb0dba7b6f24af39425d37.body: Gustavo Grieco discovered that the GDK-PixBuf library contained an integer overflow when handling certain GIF images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a GIF image file, a remote attacker could use this flaw to cause GDK-PixBuf to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-7674)

43ca276589dcf82de6bf0f2419fd4f74a8b222bf.body: Gustavo Grieco discovered that unzip incorrectly handled certain password protected archives. 569ac3291916cd5564dbcdc4a6cb6ef21999d798.body: Gustavo Grieco discovered that OptiPNG incorrectly handled memory. A remote attacker could use this issue with a specially crafted image file to cause OptiPNG to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-7802)

02ad7b692660dd89a9562107aa65e13f38001061.body: It was discovered that the NVIDIA graphics drivers incorrectly sanitized user mode inputs. A local attacker could use this issue to possibly gain root privileges.

4c7fb46b69a3f91c1c303259ea0ac7200fbb2c71.body: Dmitry Vyukov discovered that the Linux kernel's keyring handler attempted to garbage collect incompletely instantiated keys. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2015-7872)

f8642400f2ffcfd4a49127350a1788f0170434f0.title: USN-2812-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
f8642400f2ffcfd4a49127350a1788f0170434f0.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled certain XML data. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, an attacker could possibly cause libxml2 to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-7941)

5af68e99bb80402420909c5f6515e16a85b54f7f.title: USN-2812-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities

(CVE-2015-7942)

a4631437590d80be23d6af9458462b9b7a4b60c3.title: USN-3096-1: NTP vulnerabilities
a4631437590d80be23d6af9458462b9b7a4b60c3.body: Jonathan Gardner discovered that the NTP ntpq utility incorrectly handled memory. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ntpq to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2015-7975)

9d67304a62ecb80a6dcc549fab67787d572e0cd3.title: USN-3096-1: NTP vulnerabilities
9d67304a62ecb80a6dcc549fab67787d572e0cd3.body: Stephen Gray discovered that NTP incorrectly handled large restrict lists. An attacker could use this issue to cause NTP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-7977, CVE-2015-7978)

c512f0843ee00de38c02302292f55eb7f838947c.body: Qixue Xiao discovered that libpng incorrectly handled certain time values. (CVE-2015-7981)

b4d58d440196df159b46d0f14faf13f363b9c962.title: USN-2837-1: Bind vulnerability
b4d58d440196df159b46d0f14faf13f363b9c962.body: It was discovered that Bind incorrectly handled responses with malformed class attributes. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Bind to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

54270b98781d456312751a62896a8efcf89a98f2.body: It was discovered that the strongSwan eap-mschapv2 plugin incorrectly handled state. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass authentication.

00cadd981c69f7687c10fdc9983abf8ccfc061a3.body: It was discovered that XScreenSaver incorrectly handled unplugging an external monitor. An attacker with physical access could use this flaw to gain access to a locked session.

e7fd21f1f558c3525576d9d5bbc0121462954f40.body: Gustavo Grieco discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled certain XML data. b4dd0173b08ea77d682323f8c1529ecd694a047a.body: Jan Beulich discovered that the KVM svm hypervisor implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly catch Debug exceptions on AMD processors. 63954645e977c16d7930427a2b4dfbc9744e27dd.body: It was discovered that Bind incorrectly handled certain APL data. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Bind to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

7892e3780522a9db021b5fa98a7ebf8ece76de63.title: USN-2771-1: Click vulnerability
7892e3780522a9db021b5fa98a7ebf8ece76de63.body: It was discovered that click did not properly perform input sanitization during click package installation. If a user were tricked into installing a crafted click package, a remote attacker could exploit this to escalate privileges by tricking click into installing lenient security policy for the installed application.

5a1918ec93015fb133a8b15eeca2b10af2a5c60a.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
5a1918ec93015fb133a8b15eeca2b10af2a5c60a.body: Adam Nielsen discovered that the strftime function in the GNU C Library did not properly handle out-of-range argument data. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2015-8776)

027921f485d3363fe6c07bcfc0a301993fbbcc63.title: USN-2985-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
027921f485d3363fe6c07bcfc0a301993fbbcc63.body: Adam Nielsen discovered that the strftime function in the GNU C Library did not properly handle out-of-range argument data. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2015-8776)

3d3aea8f613d60d5f5c686a81613f2b397af51d7.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
3d3aea8f613d60d5f5c686a81613f2b397af51d7.body: Szabolcs Nagy discovered that the hcreate functions in the GNU C Library did not properly check its size argument, leading to an integer overflow. An attacker could use to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-8778)

44c31ceddd913c4478435b284e6d0a1092abe4d7.title: USN-2985-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
44c31ceddd913c4478435b284e6d0a1092abe4d7.body: Szabolcs Nagy discovered that the hcreate functions in the GNU C Library did not properly check its size argument, leading to an integer overflow. An attacker could use to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-8778)

ba51c4ee6fb82416653d9e0c11c44d579389237d.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
ba51c4ee6fb82416653d9e0c11c44d579389237d.body: Maksymilian Arciemowicz discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the catopen function in the GNU C Library when handling long catalog names. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-8779)

c5f1b1e1c3f656ad2c78b00a490ca78fcc0faa64.title: USN-2985-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
c5f1b1e1c3f656ad2c78b00a490ca78fcc0faa64.body: Maksymilian Arciemowicz discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the catopen function in the GNU C Library when handling long catalog names. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-8779)

54265a0b053fb76278832c3970db79d149cf7758.title: USN-2886-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
54265a0b053fb76278832c3970db79d149cf7758.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel's Filesystem in Userspace (FUSE) implementation did not handle initial zero length segments properly. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (unkillable task). (CVE-2015-8785)

73cfae46b6ac9e3495c9e68a101ba76f0cbc9c2b.title: USN-2897-1: Nettle vulnerabilities
73cfae46b6ac9e3495c9e68a101ba76f0cbc9c2b.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Nettle incorrectly handled carry propagation in the NIST P-256 elliptic curve. (CVE-2015-8803)

888520315f74002af5dee157bc36967219ad9520.title: USN-2897-1: Nettle vulnerabilities
888520315f74002af5dee157bc36967219ad9520.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Nettle incorrectly handled carry propagation in the NIST P-384 elliptic curve. (CVE-2015-8804)

618341838d2b05513c288e17521377cce8c81fe6.title: USN-2897-1: Nettle vulnerabilities
618341838d2b05513c288e17521377cce8c81fe6.body: Niels Moeller discovered that Nettle incorrectly handled carry propagation in the NIST P-256 elliptic curve. (CVE-2015-8805)

e3390cc1dfd9ecea2260d6e7709d22b8929ade1e.title: USN-2952-1: PHP vulnerabilities
e3390cc1dfd9ecea2260d6e7709d22b8929ade1e.body: It was discovered that the PHP Zip extension incorrectly handled directories when processing certain zip files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to create arbitrary directories. (CVE-2014-9767) It was discovered that the PHP Soap client incorrectly validated data types. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-8835, CVE-2016-3185) It was discovered that the PHP MySQL native driver incorrectly handled TLS connections to MySQL databases. A man in the middle attacker could possibly use this issue to downgrade and snoop on TLS connections. This vulnerability is known as BACKRONYM. (CVE-2015-8838) It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled the imagerotate function. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly obtain sensitive information. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2016-1903) Hans Jerry Illikainen discovered that the PHP phar extension incorrectly handled certain tar archives. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-2554) It was discovered that the PHP WDDX extension incorrectly handled certain malformed XML data. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-3141) It was discovered that the PHP phar extension incorrectly handled certain zip files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2016-3142) It was discovered that the PHP libxml_disable_entity_loader() setting was shared between threads. When running under PHP-FPM, this could result in XML external entity injection and entity expansion issues. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (No CVE number) It was discovered that the PHP openssl_random_pseudo_bytes() function did not return cryptographically strong pseudo-random bytes. (No CVE number) It was discovered that the PHP Fileinfo component incorrectly handled certain magic files. An attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE number pending) It was discovered that the PHP php_snmp_error() function incorrectly handled string formatting. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE number pending) It was discovered that the PHP rawurlencode() function incorrectly handled large strings. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE number pending) It was discovered that the PHP phar extension incorrectly handled certain filenames in archives. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE number pending) It was discovered that the PHP mb_strcut() function incorrectly handled string formatting. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE number pending)

9a455bf6f2f923bcde97d459428421feb46e6ad1.body: USN-2952-1 fixed vulnerabilities in PHP. One of the backported patches caused a regression in the PHP Soap client. This update fixes the problem. We apologize for the inconvenience. Original advisory details: It was discovered that the PHP Zip extension incorrectly handled directories when processing certain zip files.
