6b9159d011b5b512c3ff4069937ef678d40edf20.title: USN-3070-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
6b9159d011b5b512c3ff4069937ef678d40edf20.body: Kangjie Lu discovered an information leak in the Reliable Datagram Sockets (RDS) implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2016-5244)

dc6d12c66b83444a1acc19f3f469f3c9eb1e0a63.title: USN-3071-2: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
dc6d12c66b83444a1acc19f3f469f3c9eb1e0a63.body: Kangjie Lu discovered an information leak in the Reliable Datagram Sockets (RDS) implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2016-5244)

44cfc7e588cf652df3a62b0858e5591509ca6348.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
44cfc7e588cf652df3a62b0858e5591509ca6348.body: Catalin Dumitru discovered that URLs of resources loaded after a navigation start could be leaked to the following page via the Resource Timing API. An attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2016-5250)

ccb63de133f50b02a18654d6abfae808744cd260.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
ccb63de133f50b02a18654d6abfae808744cd260.body: Firas Salem discovered an issue with non-ASCII and emoji characters in data: URLs. An attacker could potentially exploit this to spoof the addressbar contents. (CVE-2016-5251)

899a7e5fd18918b8c8b89e79241e19abadabd050.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
899a7e5fd18918b8c8b89e79241e19abadabd050.body: Georg Koppen discovered a stack buffer underflow during 2D graphics rendering in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5252)

d6ed7038b6b3c0e7ede80721df716a7829c4a1c7.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
d6ed7038b6b3c0e7ede80721df716a7829c4a1c7.body: Abhishek Arya discovered a use-after-free when the alt key is used with top-level menus. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5254)

f769430b1413df189c3d003570dea3a9fdffdc3e.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
f769430b1413df189c3d003570dea3a9fdffdc3e.body: Jukka Jylänki discovered a crash during garbage collection. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5255)

e666ceafaa4b2927e513409946464e3de8249fbb.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
e666ceafaa4b2927e513409946464e3de8249fbb.body: Looben Yang discovered a use-after-free in WebRTC. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5258)

c4f666edc7672f0a7e91b3499f3618b9b5613fdb.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
c4f666edc7672f0a7e91b3499f3618b9b5613fdb.body: Looben Yang discovered a use-after-free when working with nested sync events in service workers. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5259)

2b1613da4fee4fdd9925c54f3f43855d1da4a221.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
2b1613da4fee4fdd9925c54f3f43855d1da4a221.body: Mike Kaply discovered that plain-text passwords can be stored in session restore if an input field type is changed from "password" to "text" during a session, leading to information disclosure. (CVE-2016-5260)

372c6eea5a12318461f3594afd6ae2d2a8633338.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
372c6eea5a12318461f3594afd6ae2d2a8633338.body: Samuel Groß discovered an integer overflow in WebSockets during data buffering in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5261)

be236bb4a9946120014c67b792b1827254eed9be.title: USN-3044-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
be236bb4a9946120014c67b792b1827254eed9be.body: Nikita Arykov discovered that JavaScript event handlers on a element can execute in a sandboxed iframe without the allow-scripts flag set. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2016-5262) A type confusion bug was discovered in display transformation during rendering. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5263) A use-after-free was discovered when applying effects to SVG elements in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5264) Abdulrahman Alqabandi discovered a same-origin policy violation relating to local HTML files and saved shortcut files. An attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2016-5265) Rafael Gieschke discovered an information disclosure issue related to drag and drop. An attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2016-5266) A text injection issue was discovered with about: URLs. An attacker could potentially exploit this to spoof internal error pages. (CVE-2016-5268) Update instructions The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: Ubuntu 16.04 firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1 Ubuntu 14.04 firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1 Ubuntu 12.04 firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.12.04.1 After a standard system update you need to restart Firefox to make all the necessary changes. 22aff706a11c783bc2cacf1ec28f5b85f81de954.title: USN-3163-1: NSS vulnerabilities
22aff706a11c783bc2cacf1ec28f5b85f81de954.body: It was discovered that NSS incorrectly handled certain invalid Diffie-Hellman keys. A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to cause NSS to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2016-5285)

c24a0082191615d65afbd0e16846cabeb17cea15.title: USN-3010-1: Expat vulnerabilities
c24a0082191615d65afbd0e16846cabeb17cea15.body: It was discovered that Expat incorrectly handled seeding the random number generator. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2016-5300)

847ed8c4497f72dc5b683b769c158e15fb8b6d54.title: USN-3011-1: HAProxy vulnerability
847ed8c4497f72dc5b683b769c158e15fb8b6d54.body: Falco Schmutz discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled the reqdeny filter. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause HAProxy to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

f453c3986451f296478112e35a5aac9290da870c.title: USN-3070-2: Linux kernel (Raspberry Pi 2) vulnerabilities
f453c3986451f296478112e35a5aac9290da870c.body: James Patrick-Evans discovered that the airspy USB device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle certain error conditions. An attacker with physical access could use this to cause a denial of service (memory consumption). (CVE-2016-5400)

6a785166fd04db948f30097d1acbed74e6d306ad.title: USN-3070-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
6a785166fd04db948f30097d1acbed74e6d306ad.body: James Patrick-Evans discovered that the airspy USB device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle certain error conditions. An attacker with physical access could use this to cause a denial of service (memory consumption). (CVE-2016-5400)

9d6b5b2273597b12edf126ee10e8eb3a6937737f.title: USN-3070-3: Linux kernel (Qualcomm Snapdragon) vulnerabilities
9d6b5b2273597b12edf126ee10e8eb3a6937737f.body: James Patrick-Evans discovered that the airspy USB device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle certain error conditions. An attacker with physical access could use this to cause a denial of service (memory consumption). (CVE-2016-5400)

87198eb342ed712ee619b096652613e28e846922.title: USN-3070-4: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
87198eb342ed712ee619b096652613e28e846922.body: James Patrick-Evans discovered that the airspy USB device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle certain error conditions. An attacker with physical access could use this to cause a denial of service (memory consumption). (CVE-2016-5400)

02b2553a8683390cc191b0d89395d9f0d4eddd2c.title: USN-3048-1: curl vulnerabilities
02b2553a8683390cc191b0d89395d9f0d4eddd2c.body: Bru Rom discovered that curl incorrectly handled client certificates when resuming a TLS session. (CVE-2016-5419)

d3c3f7a92945f298da7560aa40c0175a2ba1a924.title: USN-3048-1: curl vulnerabilities
d3c3f7a92945f298da7560aa40c0175a2ba1a924.body: Marcelo Echeverria and Fernando Muñoz discovered that curl incorrectly reused a connection struct, contrary to expectations. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2016-5421)

b9ed8f7b89f6a8d8e41c0faeee8903b63d1da898.title: USN-3154-1: OpenJDK 6 vulnerabilities
b9ed8f7b89f6a8d8e41c0faeee8903b63d1da898.body: It was discovered that the Hotspot component of OpenJDK did not properly check received Java Debug Wire Protocol (JDWP) packets. An attacker could use this to send debugging commands to a Java application with debugging enabled. (CVE-2016-5573)

74874839822ca6708c2cabfa0f8e9514d97b55ee.title: USN-3130-1: OpenJDK 7 vulnerabilities
74874839822ca6708c2cabfa0f8e9514d97b55ee.body: It was discovered that the Hotspot component of OpenJDK did not properly check received Java Debug Wire Protocol (JDWP) packets. An attacker could use this to send debugging commands to a Java application with debugging enabled. (CVE-2016-5573)

ae84263d272232f585fbaa99a8feb5a047a03357.title: USN-3154-1: OpenJDK 6 vulnerabilities
ae84263d272232f585fbaa99a8feb5a047a03357.body: It was discovered that OpenJDK did not properly handle HTTP proxy authentication. An attacker could use this to expose HTTPS server authentication credentials. (CVE-2016-5597)

8f099f1f716f5f27ae6155fb94f5c45d566f3c44.title: USN-3130-1: OpenJDK 7 vulnerabilities
8f099f1f716f5f27ae6155fb94f5c45d566f3c44.body: It was discovered that OpenJDK did not properly handle HTTP proxy authentication. An attacker could use this to expose HTTPS server authentication credentials. (CVE-2016-5597)

2662626d3b6f43819a1fa55e74ef590ffdb0df59.title: USN-3072-2: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
2662626d3b6f43819a1fa55e74ef590ffdb0df59.body: Yue Cao et al discovered a flaw in the TCP implementation's handling of challenge acks in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (reset connection) or inject content into an TCP stream. (CVE-2016-5696)

8aa2f288a8730e09fd160f3e2dfb1e886ef34d67.title: USN-3071-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8aa2f288a8730e09fd160f3e2dfb1e886ef34d67.body: Yue Cao et al discovered a flaw in the TCP implementation's handling of challenge acks in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (reset connection) or inject content into an TCP stream. (CVE-2016-5696)

4471886d38548e4ba0d69b604faeb4685c3e7a19.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled memory when using _gd2GetHeader(). A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5766)

639d8bb0be364130850dbabc651d32b31d5b0936.body: Cyril Bur discovered that on PowerPC platforms, the Linux kernel mishandled transactional memory state on exec(). A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-5828)

d5f3c446cd4fafb24a9f4e19d51eef550c4e866b.title: USN-3030-1: GD library vulnerabilities
d5f3c446cd4fafb24a9f4e19d51eef550c4e866b.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled certain color indexes. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 15.10 and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2016-6128)

02e76b0817e7234af69ddbb20a8bdd9a0c466a98.title: USN-3060-1: GD library vulnerabilities
02e76b0817e7234af69ddbb20a8bdd9a0c466a98.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled certain malformed TGA images. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted TGA image, an attacker could cause a denial of service. (CVE-2016-6132, CVE-2016-6214)

a2978eac6be0b596c3aae440ceceb9efb4d01110.title: USN-3030-1: GD library vulnerabilities
a2978eac6be0b596c3aae440ceceb9efb4d01110.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled memory when encoding a GIF image. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2016-6161)

fc8d6577d2aba824ce92f242685c4ed4a41bea91.title: USN-3039-1: Django vulnerability
fc8d6577d2aba824ce92f242685c4ed4a41bea91.body: It was discovered that Django incorrectly handled the admin's add/change related popup. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a cross-site scripting attack.

57ff6e851ca4a0da94c6fea10fc9bb93eb9542dd.title: USN-3070-2: Linux kernel (Raspberry Pi 2) vulnerabilities
57ff6e851ca4a0da94c6fea10fc9bb93eb9542dd.body: It was discovered that the OverlayFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly verify dentry state before proceeding with unlink and rename operations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2016-6197)

4b64f477a82d62c0f066220e63dd646ad198fcd7.title: USN-3070-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4b64f477a82d62c0f066220e63dd646ad198fcd7.body: It was discovered that the OverlayFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly verify dentry state before proceeding with unlink and rename operations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2016-6197)

9e6885a5ed36b56c79539466be2f8c4640b0e6ce.title: USN-3070-3: Linux kernel (Qualcomm Snapdragon) vulnerabilities
9e6885a5ed36b56c79539466be2f8c4640b0e6ce.body: It was discovered that the OverlayFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly verify dentry state before proceeding with unlink and rename operations. d34055291389dc1f098ccfcdde195a1eadf01847.title: USN-3070-4: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
d34055291389dc1f098ccfcdde195a1eadf01847.body: It was discovered that the OverlayFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly verify dentry state before proceeding with unlink and rename operations. a845559089a2cfe409fadb94840e51ce966a74d5.title: USN-3060-1: GD library vulnerabilities
a845559089a2cfe409fadb94840e51ce966a74d5.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled memory when using gdImageScale(). A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-6207)

2ccc4797407f442dd27eb74fdd467cc760780fd1.title: USN-3042-1: KDE-Libs vulnerability
2ccc4797407f442dd27eb74fdd467cc760780fd1.body: Andreas Cord-Landwehr discovered that KDE-Libs incorrectly handled extracting certain archives. If a user were tricked into extracting a specially-crafted archive, a remote attacker could use this issue to overwrite arbitrary files out of the extraction directory.

c4aa38fe04354c6187d7358eb0151e10af638b2e.title: USN-3059-1: xmlrpc-epi vulnerability
c4aa38fe04354c6187d7358eb0151e10af638b2e.body: It was discovered that xmlrpc-epi incorrectly handled lengths in the simplestring_addn function. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause applications using xmlrpc-epi such as PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

4699dbcd6fd5ceb4f194cc25c25e139f067754c3.title: USN-3065-1: Libgcrypt vulnerability
4699dbcd6fd5ceb4f194cc25c25e139f067754c3.body: Felix Dörre and Vladimir Klebanov discovered that Libgcrypt incorrectly handled mixing functions in the random number generator. An attacker able to obtain 4640 bits from the RNG can trivially predict the next 160 bits of output.

c06b85caaa13fdac4ba53b0620359d6475e07174.title: USN-3064-1: GnuPG vulnerability
c06b85caaa13fdac4ba53b0620359d6475e07174.body: Felix Dörre and Vladimir Klebanov discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled mixing functions in the random number generator. An attacker able to obtain 4640 bits from the RNG can trivially predict the next 160 bits of output.

6f4bd5af46c12e4bccc36a3e980449e775a75b13.title: USN-3132-1: tar vulnerability
6f4bd5af46c12e4bccc36a3e980449e775a75b13.body: Harry Sintonen discovered that tar incorrectly handled extracting files when path names are specified on the command line. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted archive, an attacker could possibly overwrite arbitrary files.

1c5f8c2995ed236799f287c820ddb9ce5d45566b.title: USN-3085-1: GDK-PixBuf vulnerabilities
1c5f8c2995ed236799f287c820ddb9ce5d45566b.body: Franco Costantini discovered that the GDK-PixBuf library contained an out-of-bounds write error when parsing an ico file. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted ico file, a remote attacker could use this flaw to cause GDK-PixBuf to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2016-6352)

bb79a0856087c7a1eeecd413303fb44d7abb2814.title: USN-3069-1: Eye of GNOME vulnerability
bb79a0856087c7a1eeecd413303fb44d7abb2814.body: It was discovered that Eye of GNOME incorrectly handled certain invalid UTF-8 strings. If a user were tricked into opening a specially-crafted image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Eye of GNOME to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

7ef1253a6f08a1a743eeb85911351bc48b27b070.title: USN-3086-1: Irssi vulnerabilities
7ef1253a6f08a1a743eeb85911351bc48b27b070.body: Gabriel Campana and Adrien Guinet discovered that the format parsing code in Irssi did not properly verify 24bit color codes. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash). (CVE-2016-7044)

014bfc58a029f7d2c9bb8f011f88d5f8dc21c5b5.title: USN-3086-1: Irssi vulnerabilities
014bfc58a029f7d2c9bb8f011f88d5f8dc21c5b5.body: Gabriel Campana and Adrien Guinet discovered that a buffer overflow existed in the format parsing code in Irssi. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash). (CVE-2016-7045)

bc652f55793619324d939f206c2d96d1accbb1c9.title: USN-3137-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
bc652f55793619324d939f206c2d96d1accbb1c9.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin did not properly sanitize certain inputs, resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain.

7d714a9848b6a4fde114ab691c2086305aec4b29.title: USN-3074-1: File Roller vulnerability
7d714a9848b6a4fde114ab691c2086305aec4b29.body: It was discovered that File Roller incorrectly handled symlinks. If a user were tricked into extracting a specially-crafted archive, an attacker could delete files outside of the extraction directory.

be8f4318d3a1afbd9314babb07b3904832d749c4.title: USN-3147-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
be8f4318d3a1afbd9314babb07b3904832d749c4.body: Marco Grassi discovered that the driver for Areca RAID Controllers in the Linux kernel did not properly validate control messages. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain privileges. (CVE-2016-7425)

1142241426b4782258625003b37c1111a26033b2.title: USN-3094-1: Systemd vulnerability
1142241426b4782258625003b37c1111a26033b2.body: Andrew Ayer discovered that Systemd improperly handled zero-length notification messages. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (init crash leading to system unavailability).

218c0a05c0bed8c6347cddd5b87828b3a93b78cb.title: USN-3152-2: Linux kernel (Raspberry Pi 2) vulnerability
218c0a05c0bed8c6347cddd5b87828b3a93b78cb.body: Philip Pettersson discovered a race condition in the af_packet implementation in the Linux kernel. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or run arbitrary code with administrative privileges.

1296bd2e5819523674c9fd007758985eee54c693.body: Philip Pettersson discovered a race condition in the af_packet implementation in the Linux kernel. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or run arbitrary code with administrative privileges.

6a71904da87da6d98dc31d70ed65584899b8c90e.title: USN-3151-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerability
6a71904da87da6d98dc31d70ed65584899b8c90e.body: USN-3151-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the Linux kernel for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. This update provides the corresponding updates for the Linux Hardware Enablement (HWE) kernel from Ubuntu 16.04 LTS for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. Philip Pettersson discovered a race condition in the af_packet implementation in the Linux kernel. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or run arbitrary code with administrative privileges.

35dead75895db12503e7e42dfdcc3dc2af8451fd.body: USN-3149-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the Linux kernel for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. This update provides the corresponding updates for the Linux Hardware Enablement (HWE) kernel from Ubuntu 14.04 LTS for Ubuntu 12.04 LTS. Philip Pettersson discovered a race condition in the af_packet implementation in the Linux kernel. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or run arbitrary code with administrative privileges.

1f87c5d16eb15d161722ff3a0c4ef440dca9fb4c.title: USN-3149-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
1f87c5d16eb15d161722ff3a0c4ef440dca9fb4c.body: Philip Pettersson discovered a race condition in the af_packet implementation in the Linux kernel. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or run arbitrary code with administrative privileges.

2d2fb559c7cdc9f1d5b68bf032d75510b9a1f267.title: USN-3146-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
2d2fb559c7cdc9f1d5b68bf032d75510b9a1f267.body: Daxing Guo discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the Broadcom IEEE802.11n FullMAC driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain privileges. (CVE-2016-8658)

b9a30641642ed8fb9838091b23449b6a824c9d8d.title: USN-3115-1: Django vulnerabilities
b9a30641642ed8fb9838091b23449b6a824c9d8d.body: Aymeric Augustin discovered that Django incorrectly validated hosts when being run with the debug setting enabled. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform DNS rebinding attacks. (CVE-2016-9014)

d524519b650d6e7c45bfc73faf8fa4bc8e5c8e77.title: USN-3138-1: python-cryptography vulnerability
d524519b650d6e7c45bfc73faf8fa4bc8e5c8e77.body: Markus Döring discovered that python-cryptography incorrectly handled certain HKDF lengths. This could result in python-cryptography returning an empty string instead of the expected derived key.

d25ee5ff7c33c62b3f9fb3a2a2525632c9f1d5ea.title: USN-3146-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
d25ee5ff7c33c62b3f9fb3a2a2525632c9f1d5ea.body: It was discovered that the __get_user_asm_ex implementation in the Linux kernel for x86/x86_64 contained extended asm statements that were incompatible with the exception table. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2016-9644)

842018c6aadc76f6759f084c8b551d0d8fbd93fe.title: USN-3146-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
842018c6aadc76f6759f084c8b551d0d8fbd93fe.body: It was discovered that the __get_user_asm_ex implementation in the Linux kernel for x86/x86_64 contained extended asm statements that were incompatible with the exception table. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2016-9644)

edc764bfddf41c726412d1568375ccf7ecbfd57b.title: USN-3177-2: Tomcat regression
edc764bfddf41c726412d1568375ccf7ecbfd57b.body: Paul Szabo discovered that the Tomcat package incorrectly handled upgrades and removals. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain root privileges. (CVE-2016-9774, CVE-2016-9775)

83985065ffeb5a71f4dbf8ddee7e279ada68c78a.title: USN-3177-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
83985065ffeb5a71f4dbf8ddee7e279ada68c78a.body: Paul Szabo discovered that the Tomcat package incorrectly handled upgrades and removals. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain root privileges. (CVE-2016-9774, CVE-2016-9775)

a79b505b3b907712f1213081197a5e03ab3a6fa6.title: USN-3157-1: Apport vulnerabilities
a79b505b3b907712f1213081197a5e03ab3a6fa6.body: Donncha O Cearbhaill discovered that the crash file parser in Apport improperly treated the CrashDB field as python code. An attacker could use this to convince a user to open a maliciously crafted crash file and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of that user. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2016-9949)

bb1d77635dce67dfbb589e76df813bd91486e284.title: USN-3157-1: Apport vulnerabilities
bb1d77635dce67dfbb589e76df813bd91486e284.body: Donncha O Cearbhaill discovered that Apport did not properly sanitize the Package and SourcePackage fields in crash files before processing package specific hooks. An attacker could use this to convince a user to open a maliciously crafted crash file and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of that user. (CVE-2016-9950)

01b1fce260a1bfd94f45794834bd1aacf8e5155e.title: USN-3311-2: libnl vulnerability
01b1fce260a1bfd94f45794834bd1aacf8e5155e.body: USN-3311-1 fixed a vulnerability in libnl. This update provides thecorresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM.Original advisory details:It was discovered that libnl incorrectly handled memory when performing certain operations. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause libnl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code.

e4316f13518b15eba38060d0cb49ad405571a6a9.title: USN-3430-2: Dnsmasq vulnerabilities
e4316f13518b15eba38060d0cb49ad405571a6a9.body: Felix Wilhelm, Fermin J. Serna, Gabriel Campana and Kevin Hamacher discovered that Dnsmasq incorrectly handled DNS requests. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Dnsmasq to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-14491)

301c86140c3e2ceaba6a7294e2c6213ee9b0f63b.body: Felix Wilhelm, Fermin J. Serna, Gabriel Campana and Kevin Hamacher discovered that Dnsmasq incorrectly handled DHCPv6 packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly obtain sensitive memory contents. (CVE-2017-14494)

3f39936fd17bf0a2dd6231c5595fcf9d464ec403.title: USN-3486-1: Samba vulnerabilities
3f39936fd17bf0a2dd6231c5595fcf9d464ec403.body: Yihan Lian and Zhibin Hu discovered that Samba incorrectly handled memorywhen processing certain SMB1 requests. A remote attacker could possibly usethis issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-14746)

1bd4311d193c981cfd6e8539b515949ece2706ad.title: USN-3486-2: Samba vulnerability
1bd4311d193c981cfd6e8539b515949ece2706ad.body: Volker Lendecke discovered that Samba incorrectly cleared memory when returning data to a client. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2017-15275)

e3125ba24439662b7b2a0685c89849cb14178835.title: USN-3486-1: Samba vulnerabilities
e3125ba24439662b7b2a0685c89849cb14178835.body: Volker Lendecke discovered that Samba incorrectly cleared memory whenreturning data to a client. A remote attacker could possibly use this issueto obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2017-15275)

bdc81e99025229886a4f71f5e3d079611df2176c.title: USN-3501-1: libxcursor vulnerability
bdc81e99025229886a4f71f5e3d079611df2176c.body: It was discovered that libxcursor incorrectly handled certain files. Anattacker could use these issues to cause libxcursor to crash, resulting ina denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

5474694e71bbb0174215da2af3e8246b6cfa4192.title: USN-3178-1: icoutils vulnerabilities
5474694e71bbb0174215da2af3e8246b6cfa4192.body: It was discovered that icoutils incorrectly handled memory when processingcertain files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening aspecially crafted file, an attacker could cause icoutils to crash,resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

7e4d1c0ea9fd23321e7fd553112fc46279047840.title: USN-3255-1: LightDM vulnerability
7e4d1c0ea9fd23321e7fd553112fc46279047840.body: It was discovered that LightDM incorrectly handled home directory creation forguest users. A local attacker could use this issue to gain ownership ofarbitrary directory paths and possibly gain administrative privileges.

4ec18c5ee3bb5d0a23c35cb486ed56d34ff40f81.title: USN-3289-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
4ec18c5ee3bb5d0a23c35cb486ed56d34ff40f81.body: Li Qiang and Jiangxin discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled the CirrusVGA device when being used with a VNC connection. A privileged attackerinside the guest could use this issue to cause QEMU to crash, resulting ina denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host. In thedefault installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would beisolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile. (CVE-2017-7980)

cd182880bb42f6e60f670d96853ded1e47910099.title: USN-3301-1: strongSwan vulnerabilities
cd182880bb42f6e60f670d96853ded1e47910099.body: It was discovered that the strongSwan gmp plugin incorrectly validated RSApublic keys. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause strongSwan tocrash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2017-9022)

69315117ea229c71cd7b11075d4a7e83bcd07da7.title: USN-4949-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
69315117ea229c71cd7b11075d4a7e83bcd07da7.body: Ryota Shiga discovered that the eBPF implementation in the Linux kernel didnot properly verify that a BPF program only reserved as much memory for aring buffer as was allocated. A local attacker could use this to cause adenial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-3489)

98e04031e45271bf0338384cddca658ae6e605d2.body: Manfred Paul discovered that the eBPF implementation in the Linux kerneldid not properly track bounds on bitwise operations. A local attacker coulduse this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrarycode. (CVE-2021-3490)

e925d6e107aed42f92a9af9ab37d139f292f0011.body: Manfred Paul discovered that the eBPF implementation in the Linux kerneldid not properly track bounds on bitwise operations. A local attacker coulduse this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrarycode. (CVE-2021-3490)

59bef71571b6e1a03a2fdc5d9a001a92dc6ab626.title: USN-4949-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
59bef71571b6e1a03a2fdc5d9a001a92dc6ab626.body: Billy Jheng Bing-Jhong discovered that the io_uring implementation of theLinux kernel did not properly enforce the MAX_RW_COUNT limit in somesituations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service(system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-3491)

01f8f3104ecb6856151cb2c517f51e64efedc133.body: Billy Jheng Bing-Jhong discovered that the io_uring implementation of theLinux kernel did not properly enforce the MAX_RW_COUNT limit in somesituations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service(system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2021-3491)

617ee266a40f5af38fb00dd7afc6b6aa73160a8d.title: USN-4917-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
617ee266a40f5af38fb00dd7afc6b6aa73160a8d.body: It was discovered that the overlayfs implementation in the Linux kernel didnot properly validate the application of file system capabilities withrespect to user namespaces. A local attacker could use this to gainelevated privileges. (CVE-2021-3493)
